Reviews.Title: “May skip the all-inclusive from now on!”
Reviews.Author: bequiagirl
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Mexico a few times and always did the all-inclusive. We decided to try a regular hotel this time and thankfully we found the best one – Luna Blue. We found it via Trip Advisor and booked through Expedia. With hotel, air, food, drink (we did not skimp on what we wanted), we ended up $200 - $400 than the other all –inclusives we had previously been to. We had a garden view deluxe room as we had 3 adults. It has a trundle bed so we all had a bed to ourselves. Room included a kitchenette with a decent size fridge, sink, stove and 4 seat table. We hit the Mega grocery store the first day and got a few things, mostly for breakfast and snacks. Bottled water is provided in the room and it was great to fill our bottles and have them cold in the fridge. Bathroom had a large storage area which was appreciated. No closet, but an armoire and side tables held the rest of our items. Another set of shelves in the main area would have been nice. Room was cleaned daily, front desk was managed by Alex who is very helpful, bar pours a great drink and there is live music some nights which stops at 11. The cats, Freddy and Oso are very friendly and visit you. Breakfast was coffee, tea and a few types of breads which we supplemented with yogurt and fruit. Then, the tough decision for the day – what beach club to go to! Luna Blue has arrangements with 4 of them and we went to all. Just ask Alex for a pass when you pick up your towels every day. Mamitas = closest, no food minimums, food was just OK, nice bathrooms. Grand Coral = taxi needed, very quiet, 2 pools, great food. Wicky’s = our favorite, bit of a walk, food minimum, nice chairs, watch where the speakers are or you can’t chat, large portions of food; Canibal Royal = bit of a walk, nice palm trees, food OK, music too loud at 10am, fun bathrooms! At night, you are ½ a block from the main restaurant and shopping street. How wonderful to have a wide choice of restaurants and bars. Playa del Carmen has really upgraded itself since we visited 2 years ago. We were highly impressed. The service, the lighting, the decorations all fit and make sense. It also has amazing Italian food – go figure! We always felt safe no matter what time of the day or night we were out. Well done, Playa! We will definitely be back to Playa and will stay for sure at the Luna Blue. I can see where all inclusives in remote areas like Tulum are still necessary, but if you are staying in Playa, book at Luna Blue, save yourself some money and enjoy!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but the beds are hard as Rock”
Reviews.Author: Devon S
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Luna Blue, this place was beautiful, the Garden's were so relaxing & the staff were amazing. We stayed at the The Treetop Terrace Rooms, they are the higher range in price, so I thought we were getting the best in comfort, until I layed down on the bed. It was like my old Futon in college, hard as Rock. It took me over an hour to fall asleep & when I woke up I had major lower back pain. The next night same deal, so I went outside, covered my self in repellent & slept on the hammock on the deck. The hammock was better, but I didn't feel to good in the morning either. This was my only complaint but to me, sleeping in comfort is a big one for me & my wife.

Reviews.Title: “All is well here...”
Reviews.Author: fmiller13
Reviews.Content: Staying at Luna Blue is like a college reunion. Many, many repeat visitors that keep in touch with each other during the year. The owners and staff are fantastic. Their advice on where to eat, drink, shop, beach, etc. are based on your needs, not because they get kickbacks. The variety of room types run the gamut from small and cozy to large with a kitchen. Just ask and they will steer you right. When I met the cats "Frankie" and "Oso" (bear) I knew I was in the right place for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Playa !”
Reviews.Author: Voyageuse4691
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Playa. Good room - we had one with a kitchenette on the third floor and we loved it. The hotel have a great garden and 3 lovely cats - one came visit us one night when we cook shrimps..... great balcony whit a hamac... what a great idea for a nap..... Staff very helpfull if you need something - they call for us at the Xel-Ha for specific information. Very great location you are 4 minutes from the beach and surround by restaurant and all. We recommand this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sunnychica
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading many many reviews on the Luna Blue I finally had the oportunity to experience it myself. I travelled with my boyfriend and another couple. This was my first time away from the all inclusive deal, and I loved it! We were only able to stay 3 nights there, it being an add on to an already booked trip to the Grand Mayan. I won't repeat what you've already heard here, just reconfirm that if you are looking for a clean, no frills, reasonably priced place to stay this is definately it! Pictures do not do the courtyard justice, it is truely beautiful. The rooms are old, but kept spotlessly clean, and how much time do you really want to spend hanging in your room anyway when you are in one of the most beautiful places in the world? The location was unbeatable (well, other than beach front, but then you are paying big bucks)with 5th ave right around the corner..There was coffee and fresh baked breads every morning available, but you had to get down there early for the cornbread..it went fast! soooo good! I did not have the privilage of meeting Cheri as she was not feeling well when we were there, but Toni was on hand with lots of good advice on where to eat and the best beach clubs( he sent us away from Mamita's to another one a 10 minute cab ride away (coral beach I believe,) that was great, with practically no one there we had the beach and the bar service to ourselves! When it was time to go I did not want to leave, and once we made the journey to the Grand Mayan( that review to follow) I found myself wishing I was back at the Luna Blue. I will return, hopefully over and over. PS The only issue I had were that the beds were really hard, but from what I understand all I had to do was request a mattress topper, which I didn't do since we were only there for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Rob E Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Robert E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 wonderful and memorable weeks at the Luna Blue this past Feb. We were both very impressed with the location of the hotel, staff, ambiance of the tropical garden design, pool and swing bar. Our room was always kept spotless and our cleaning lady always greeted us with a warm and sincere smile. Alex who managed the front desk was just super and very helpful with our many questions. Mario who worked nights made sure the property was secure and safe. Many nights he and I sat up together as I was a very light sleeper. The owners (Tony&Cheri) are super and are available night or day if any problems arise. They are definitely hands on owners who take pride in making sure each guest is relaxed, comfortable and enjoying their stay with them. Staying at the Luna Blue is all about relaxing and enjoying your holidays. Whether it's relaxing at the bar listening to the blues music provided 3 nights a week or just chilling out on your balcony watching the hotels 3 cats patrol the grounds. Being served tea, coffee and cake was a nice way to start the day. On future visits to PDC, we definitely will only stay at the Luna Blue, as my wife and I checked out many other hotels and none could even come close to what the Luna Blue offers in value. .

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Kristina K
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the negative reviews on here....ridiculous! This is a fantastic place and you can't beat the price! Sure, my bathroom sink was cracked and the dresser needs to be replaced but, honestly, how can people complain. The price for this hotel is unbelievable (in a good way!) I stayed in a place down the street from this hotel before....the sinks were granite, it had a bigger refrigerator, no ambiance, no cute bar, no pool, no onsite owners....and it cost $300 per night. You can't beat the ambiance of this place. This was the first time I traveled to Mexico by myself and I felt VERY safe at this hotel. I also mentioned the problems with my dresser and they fixed it that day. The hotel was so peaceful and quiet and I had an awesome night's sleep everynight. I plan on staying here from now on. My best friend and I used to rent a two bedroom condo down the street...we can stay at this (better) place (Luna Blue), have our own rooms and still pay 1/3 of the price

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, consistent, comfortable, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Imadrone
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from 12 memorable days and nights in and around PDC, and again had the good fortune of staying at Luna Blue, this time with 4 friends/family. Of the 7 places we have stayed at over the years, Luna is by far our favorite. The owners and staff are very helpful and friendly, and the ambiance is very pleasant and not overdone. The rooms are thoroughly cleaned and resupplied daily, the bar and new pool are excellent additions, the free beach towels and passes to multiple beach clubs a few blocks away make the room prices an very good value. We will definitely plan to stay at Luna Blue on each future visit.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: josie6081
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a short trip (4 nights) to Playa del Carmen. It was my first solo trip out of the US and I had such a great time - a lot of it was due to the staff and guests at Luna Blue. This is a really cute, reasonably priced hotel with a super staff and fun bar. I felt so welcome there - and I had a great time interacting with the other guests. The rooms were really clean, the area felt incredibly safe and the hotel courtyard and pool area was really peaceful. This is a really laid back place - I'm so glad I followed the recommendations on Tripadvisor and booked here!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: kansascity000
Reviews.Content: After sorting thru hundreds of Trip Advisor hotel reviews for inexpensive hotels, we settled on Luna Blue and it is a winner! (Actually, we spent 2 nights at an expensive hotel as Luna Blue had no openings for the week-end and it was wonderful too as it is on the beach but for funky and fun, this is a great place.) The rooms are basic but very nice--tho the beds are hard! The great tropical courtyard and the friendly bar are the highlights. (However, a few more chairs and hammocks would be nice.) The courtyard and balconies have several levels, all looking down into the bar and pool. People start gathering at the bar around 5 and some come from other hotels. Most have been coming back for years. We were there 5 nights and there was great live Blues 4 of those nights so you better like the Blues! (Stops by ll pm, tho. so you can sleep.) There was a special birthday party all Sunday aft with several groups playing so it was 5 hours of the Blues plus food. We were fortunate to have Rm 35 some of those nights and it has a great balcony overlooking everything. However, you aren't far away with any of the rooms. Just off 5th Avenue with all the shops and restaurants but toward the nicer part of the avenue. Terrific selection of beaches with free chairs and we didn't get to all of them. (If you have a car, drive down to Tulum and visit the beaches--gorgeous and few people. Try Ziggy's Beach club but it's a ways.) Our only minor complaint was that we hoped to be able to sort out some of the parks and attractions with the staff and there wasn't that opportunity. However, want to mention that Alex, who handles the front desk is just wonderful! He is very helpful--and all the staff is so cheerful! This is a great value for the money mainly for the fun atmosphere. We can't recommend any particular restaurant--they run together and all are OK but the Cuban restaurant at the north end might be one to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: opgal1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 8 days at Luna Blue. Our experience was positive. Our favorite things were the lovely tropical courtyard area, pool area, friendly English speaking staff, bar and clean rooms. Location is just a ½ block off the 5th Ave. business area and the beach is about 4 blocks away, lots of great restaurants & shopping in walking distance. We stayed in a “Tropical Hideaway” room which is at the courtyard level as the larger rooms were booked. Our room was clean, functional and made use of the space very well. The bathroom clean, the shower was great and always plenty of hot water. The hotel provides organic soaps, shampoo, cream rinse and body lotion that were very nice. There is no hair dryer (although I was told the front desk has them if needed). There was no closet, instead a functional piece of furniture that provided hanging space with plenty of hangers (one of my pet peeves) and 2 clothing drawers. The room was cleaned daily and when we returned to our room each afternoon there was some sort of lovely towel art on our bed (it is those special things that make a difference!) We had plenty of windows in our room, but since it was on the ground level we found that we kept the curtains closed all the time. Our only suggestion for those rooms would be to add some sort of sheer or blind that allows for privacy and provides natural light. Air conditioning & wireless worked great! A mini-fridge and bottled water was a nice plus. We enjoyed the bar area and nice live music 3 nights a week. It provided a nice opportunity to get to know the other hotel guests and discuss daily adventures and different restaurants to try. Jorge makes a great Margarita! The only downside to the bar was that it is closed 2 nights a week! The hotel provides passes to 3 beach clubs, the closest one being Mamita’s. We used Mamita’s twice, but found the loud techno music a little much for our 50+ ears. We loved the Grand Coral beach club which is just a short cab ride away. Very few people, lovely beach & pool area, and nice peaceful setting (Hint: get a chair farthest away from the club if you don’t want to listen to the music). We chose Luna Blue for several reasons. We are not into the all-inclusive thing, we wanted to experience more of the real Mexico, try all the different restaurants and go on different day adventures. We are glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: sueUtah
Reviews.Content: We, (three of us) had a wonderful stay at Luna Blue Feb. 2012. Lovely gardens, pool and bar on site. Wonderful breakfast breads and coffee every morning. Our room was perfect, with a double bed, single and a pull out under the single, kitchen with large table and chairs was very handy. It was a true gem very close to every thing. We loved our stay and hope to return soon. Alex was fabulous, friendly and very helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Whitgriff
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about our stay at Luna Blue. The hotel rooms were nice. Our patio was wonderful. The people who work at Luna Blue are top notch. Alex was very helpful with any questions we had. They have a bar that has live music most evenings but all is quiet by 11pm so you can get some sleep. They serve complimentary coffee and breakfast breads each morning at the front desk. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem close to the actions”
Reviews.Author: kutepanda
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has a good location as it is only a stone-throw away from the busy (and touristy) 5th Ave, and it offers free umbrella and chairs at Mamita's Beach Club, which is a short walk (5-minute at most). They have connections with other beach clubs as well, but the other ones are farther away. I love the hotel garden as it is very relaxing to sit there. The garden is lush and well-maintained. And three nights a week, there is live music at the bar area from 8 to 11pm. There is also a pool which we never had the chance to use. Free cake, tea/coffee is served in the morning as a light breakfast. We stayed in the cheapest room, which I think it's the small rooms on the ground level. Our room faces the garden and there are lawn chairs just outside our room. The room itself is clean and functional. The only minor issue is that it can get stuffy as there isn't a window - the glass door with screen functions as the window. So we can only turn on the air conditioning to keep the room cooler. I think it is probably better with the slightly more expensive rooms as they have more windows. Next time, we'll give those rooms a try. The staff and the owner are friendly, knowledgeable and provide good restaurant suggestions. We stayed away from the restaurants on 5th Ave after the first night. If you want to try out more authentic Mexican food, walk north, away from the touristy strip. You'll find cheaper and better food. Bring a small flashlight as some of the side streets aren't very well lit at night. But we felt really safe to walk around in the non-touristy parts of town.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for food and fun”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Luna four days with wife, 26 year old daughter and her ex-college sorority sister. We all were impressed with Luna's owners, staff and boutique hotel amenities. Location is perfect for partying, restaurants, beach scene and shopping. The two girls and I hiked about the area for three of the four days. Go over to the beach, turn right about 3/4 mile to Senor Frog and return by Fifth Avenue and you will walk past at least 60 restaurants and bars of every description as well as equally numerous tourist stands, silver shops and high end luxury goods. Favorite restaurant was "Capricci Latino" 80 yards away. Close second choice restaurant "Tierra Madre" 450 yards away. Daily specials and happy hour deals abound. Another hike.. again to beach..turn left.. perhaps one mile, you will leave tourist zone. Being adventurous, we headed inland on swampy, dirt path into the "less fortunate" neighborhood of Playa. At no time, during 10 plus miles by foot through Playa del Carmen did we feel threatened in any way. Wish I could say the same about my home town. May I offer a few tips to first timers? Cancun airport full of official looking greeters who delay you with time share, hotel/transportation deals or other inducements. Walk swiftly past them with a smile and a "No, gracias" until you get outside where more legitimate transportation awaits. Next tip..always confirm taxi prices before getting in cab, always. Lastly, if you decide to enter any of the street vendors shops on delightful Fifth Avenue, a useful phrase is "Sola estoy mirando, gracias". Translated as " I'm only looking, thanks." Hope you enjoy the Luna Blue and the fun, safe town of Playa as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Hideaway Extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: Bilcalden
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews of small hotels in Playa del Carmen and decided upon the Luna Blue for several reasons. I was impressed by the numerous return guests, the value , and was also pleased that the property owners were hands on individuals and former US residents in case we had any language difficulties. The residents of this community could have not been any friendlier and we could not have felt any safer if we had been in our own home town. We were greeted with smiles and "hola" at every turn. We stayed in room six during our stay and enjoyed the spaciousness of both a full size and a twin bed, a large kitchen with a dining area and the most amazing private balcony looking into trees and lush vegetation. Each morning I enjoyed hearing the garden come alive with the numerous birds that live in the tree tops and watching the resident cats at their food bowls. Such a peaceful way to start the day. I don't want to over glamorize this hotel just because I fell in love with it. The room furnishings and fixtures are not perfect and show a little wear. That being the only negative in my opinion. The positives are a tremendous location one block from La Quinta (5th Avuene) with too many restaurants to count, a warm and helpful staff who were quite fluent in English, and a lush tropical garden setting. The irony of this review is that I penned my draft while at a glamorous all inclusive resort in Playacar, about a 25 minute walk from Playa del Carmen. We decided to spend only three nights at the Luna Blue and then moved to an all inclusive for five nights. I can assure you it will not be a repeated mistake. After experiencing "real Mexico" at the Luna Blue and the vibe of the village of Playa del Carmen, we will head straight to the Luna Blue when we come back to this area and will become one of the many return guests you read about. Also, be sure and check out By the Way Spa across the street for a fabulous hour long massage for $30 and great nail services.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Juliebenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luna Blue over New Year's. Very nice property very conveniently located, steps from anything and everything you need while in Playa. The courtyard/pool area is a little slice of heaven on earth, so peaceful and relaxing. The staff was friendly and we were always greeted with a smile. Definitely wouldn't hesitate to book this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Long time listener, first time caller”
Reviews.Author: sandbarfly
Reviews.Content: Like many others, my first Playa Del Carmen vacation left quite an impression. I guess I became a bit obsessed really. I started reading online travel websites and forums constantly. That eventually led to rampant use of acronyms and even the occasional emoticon :-). My wife and I have returned at least twice a year ever since. By coincidence, this was about the same time that Luna Blue’s owners, Tony and Cheri, started their expat hotel ownership adventure. Following them online made me a fan even if I wasn’t a customer yet. As a father with young kids, Luna Blue wasn’t an option and the all-inclusive setup suited our style the best at that time. That never prevented us from exploring downtown and I had been by Luna Blue a couple of times in the past. When I finally had a chance to go to Playa by myself last October (2011), Luna Blue was the obvious choice. My original plan was to try two or three of the smaller, forum-famous, boutique hotels throughout the week. Like all of my travel plans, that changed. I ended up having a buddy of mine tag along at the last minute, and we decided to split the time between Luna Blue and one of the adults-only AIs. The hotel looks interesting and friendly when you walk by on the street. The big wooden gate and thatch roof swing bar were a welcome sight when we arrived. Cheri actually handled checking us in while Tony gave us some good tips and restaurant suggestions. It was nice to meet them in person after reading their posts and blog for the last few years. That personal touch is surely part of what has made them successful, and it went a long way with me too. I booked the Treetop Terrace room with the large balcony. The pics online are good but don’t do it justice. That room alone is enough to make sure I come back again. I love that terrace! The buildings wrap around the garden and the view of the new pool below made me smile the entire time. I accidently slept most of my first night in the hammock out there. It was such a nice evening--- the cerveza was going down easy--- and next thing I knew, I woke up at 4:30am still swinging in the breeze. The room was spotless, bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was nice. I always wondered what showering was like with one of those black cistern things on the roof :-) I felt so authentic. This place has style and owners that care. I wish I was a wordsmith and could make it sound better than that. My buddy had the room below and said it was fine but wished he had booked the other Treetop Terrace room. After many trips to AI resorts in the area, I am very glad I stayed at Luna Blue. I plan to return with my wife later this year. She will be able to put this whole Luna Blue vibe into words better than I can. I can say it was a much more personal experience than staying at an AI. I’m an overly analytical person and my mind has too many things going on to put it all into a review. If you want to ask me any questions, feel free to send me a message. I’m happy to share my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Billy V
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue last year during a vacation to Playa and I cannot recommend this hotel enough. We stayed at both the Luna Blue and a resort up the street and when we go back we'll definitely be coming back to the Luna Blue before anywhere else. The rooms and property are clean and welcoming... the staff are fun and helpful... the bar is a great hang out any time of day... walking distance to the beach... right off the main walking strip and many other great perks. We look forward to staying again soon! PS, we also got great suggestions from the owner on where to eat. Don't miss La Cueva del Chango for breakfast/lunch and Yaxche for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Playa Del Carmen and we really enjoyed the atmosphere and convenience of the Luna Blue. Large resorts don't appeal to us and we are so happy we made the right choice when selecting Luna Blue. The location is perfect, so many restaurants right outside the door. Best of all is the staff, who helped us sort out all our excursions and even offerred to ship my daughter's cellphone back to us after it got left in the shuttle back to the airport. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. We can't wait to visit again. Thank you Alex, Jorge, Tony and Cheri!

Reviews.Title: “Once Again, A Great Stay at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the Luna Blue for the sixth straight year. Our three-week stay was superb, just as we have learned to expect. The beautiful new pool is a wonderful addition. Thanks again to Tony & Cheri and their hardworking crew for providing us with another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue-is a must”
Reviews.Author: endlesssummer06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, have been to Playa many times. Have stayed in a number of boutique hotels, 20 rooms or less. The service at Luna Blue was exceptional, the employess were very friendly and knowledge. We loved the beach passes and the gym passes were great. We will definately return here next year, oh the free margarita were good too. A must visit.

Reviews.Title: “Rebooked Before We'd Even Left!”
Reviews.Author: Yaena
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the the Luna Blue from Christmas to New Years, and cannot find enough good things to say about our experience. The staff and owners are warm and friendly - willing to share information and tips (a good restaurant, where to catch a cab, the best beach club to go to) or just some good conversation over your morning coffee. Jorge the bartender makes a great margarita, and tells an even better joke. The environment is laid back and casual, yet the service and hospitality rivals anything you would receive at a high end all inclusive (except perhaps, at the Luna Blue they'll remember your name - an added bonus of the intimate nature of this hotel). The rooms are clean and safe, and housekeeping does an amazing job every day. (We were hugely impressed on the next to last day, when they created an elephant out of towel art.) We used the safe but really didn't feel we needed to - the only one sneaking into your room will be one of the friendly resort cats, to take a nap on the bed. The location of the Luna Blue itself is fantastic - just off La Quinta, but at the quieter and cheaper end (if there is such a thing as the "cheaper" end of La Quinta). We found it easy to explore from the hotel, but always enjoyed coming "home" at the end of the day. Alex and Jaime at the front were extremely helpful in assisting us with finding information and booking any type of tours or excursions. In the end, we enjoyed our time so much we canceled a holiday in Canada we had planned for February, and decided to come back to the Luna Blue that week instead. We're already counting down the days!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at”
Reviews.Author: thejedeye
Reviews.Content: Such a better stay than at the big all inclusive hotels. Great time staying at Luna Blue, all the other info about it being a good location is right. Your just a short walk to 5th Ave and to the beach. Everyone on the staff was great too, super helpful, rooms were cleaned everyday to perfection. Bartender is a creative guy.

Reviews.Title: “Peacful Easy Felling.”
Reviews.Author: BarefootSkinny
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at Luna last month and actually stayed for a 3 weeks. The room was always clean and very comforable. Never needed A/C the whole stay. The canopy of trees makes it hard to tell the time... but then who cares? Now with the addition of the new pool, I had everything I wanted. You forget thet you are a block from busy 5th Ave., cause it is sooo quite. Thanks again to Tony and Cheri and Staff for letting me have a great working... uh hum! Playing Vacation! CHEERS! TB aka Barefoot Skinny

Reviews.Title: “luna blue was ok”
Reviews.Author: renorichdiver
Reviews.Content: well located. clean. kitchen was adequate. staff was friendly,}bar tender makes nices margarita

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Donnerfairy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a solo long weekend trip to Playa del Carmen. Have stayed at several other little boutique hotels in PDC in between visits to Luna Blue, but chose to come back to my favorite. I had a treetop terrace room with my own private balcony; that was the best! The whole look and feel is quite tropical and really cute and they now have a new pool. They had a terrific Blues singer the whole weekend and a fabulous BBQ pool party on Sunday. Excellent way to end my mini vacation. It is the next best thing to being home in terms familiarity and comfort with coming and going (I was travelling alone). Loved the morning sweetbreads (coconut and banana were my favorites) sitting by the pool. The owners are terrific people and very hospitable. The staff are really great, especially Jaime and Alex who are the front desk managers. Jaime carried my piece of luggage up two flights to my tree top room and I tried to give him a little tip and he kindly refused; when does that happen in Mexico! Alex was always smiling and very friendly and helpful. I also made two friends by way of their pets Frankie and Osso; they stayed with me all night on my deck and meowed for me to come out in the morning (not too early though!). The deck - boy did I love getting to go food from the Mega Store (never knew they had preparted foods - yum and cheap) and having an awesome dinner on my patio, and a late evening snack listening to the band and lying in the hammock (accoustics are great sitting amongst the trees). Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Seventh Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LaloinMexico
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our seventh stay at Luna Blue. That alone should say alot about the place since there are literally hundreds of other places in PDC we could choose. We find everything we need and alot of other perks; our own balcony amongst the junglely treetops, tropical bar with swings for seats, beach passes to Mammitas, and live music two or three times every week we stay. And now a cool new pool. The location suits us as we love to walk Fifth Av. and discover new restaurants, shops etc then have the relative peace by being a half a block off the center of the hustle and bustle. Also, it is an easy walk to Mammitas where we use the day passes provided everyday by Luna Blue. Some people may prefer that their place be just like home, and that is cool, we like to not have neighbors absorbed by TV reruns, canned music and their own importance. Some of our best memories are connecting with the locals or talking to an adveturesome traveler who just got to town and was swinging at the bar enjoying one of Jorge's great margaritas.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Tj M
Reviews.Content: This was the best travel experience I've ever had! The Owners are some of the most down-to-earth people I've ever met! My partner and I felt so welcomed, as did the rest of my family.... Everything from the pool, the bar, the AMAZING Muffins and Coffee in the morning, to the little Towel Art every morning, was everything I could have asked for! The staff is SO helpful! I will be making my way to Playa often, and I will only stay here! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to travel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H
Reviews.Content: What can I say about Luna Blue Hotel? Its convenient location in one of my favorite destinations was my original reason for choosing to stay at Luna Blue 5 years ago, but the hotel itself is the main reason I continue to return. Over the years it has gotten better and better with each visit. From the opening of the bar several years ago, to the most recent addition of the beautiful pool, I continue to be amazed at the atmosphere of the place. The owners and staff have helped me find new places to go and more fun things to do each time I visit. I leave with new friends and great memories every time. Luna Blue Hotel and Bar – there’s no place like it on earth.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Playadise!!!”
Reviews.Author: cycledogdvm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Luna Blue numerous times over the last five years. I can say it only gets better every time. For this trip they have added a swimming pool. This is an amenity I have been hoping for for years. I always thought it would be great to hop in the pool and cool off, after a long collectivo ride. It would only figure that this trip would have the coolest weather of all my trips. Did not stop me from getting a beer from the best bar in Playa and going for a swim to cool off. The staff at the Blue is great, most of them are all the same people from my first trip 5 years ago. This only speaks to what great people the owners Tony and Cheri are. If you need sight seeing advice, or even just a restraunt tip, they are a great resource. My wife and I keep saying we need to try someplace other than Playa for vacation, but for some reason, we keep ending up at Luna Blue. As a matter of fact, we are already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Playa”
Reviews.Author: rwdsquared
Reviews.Content: First, the location is perfect. It is just far enough from the absolute center that parking on the street was not difficult, but still only about 2-3 blocks to Mamita's beach and only 1 block to the north end of the pedestrian shopping mall, i.e., fifth avenue. Lots of good restaurants within a 5-minute walk. Second, the hotel itself is lovely - nice rooms centered around a small (unheated) pool. The staff and owners are very helpful and friendly, the margaritas at the bar were superb, and, as advertised, they give you free coupons for beach chairs and umbrellas at Mamita's beach club (plus 10% discount on any food you buy at the club - also pretty good food for not much money). Third, the price is right - for the location and quality it is hard to beat $65/night for a double (plus tax). And you get exactly what they advertise - we didn't even bring a computer, but we know internet service is only where they say it is, and breakfast consists of coffee or tea and delicious chocolate and orange breads - again, exactly what they say they provide. We will absolutely return here again and again, and we find it difficult to believe that anyone would rate this wonderful spot anything less than very good-excellent. Finally, if you are considering whether or not to come to Playa del Carmen, rest assured that this is a safe, friendly, interest-filled town that is within just a few minutes from Xcaret (a must-do) and about an hour to Tulum (another must-do), with lots of other attractions within an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Birthday Made Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Rita P
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue is a great hotel! The amenities were very nice, the rooms were sweet and romantic, and the staff was incredibly helpful! We're looking forward to going back!!

Reviews.Title: “I want a permanent room at Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: saladbits
Reviews.Content: When I walk through the gates of Luna Blue a big sigh leaves my body, my shoulders drop visibly and I feel at home. I love Cheri and Tony Head, but it's the warm welcome I get from their long-time employee, Jaime, that truly make me feel that I'm home! Familiar faces make for comfort, especially for the solo-traveler. The new pool, the new pool... oh how welcome that pool is, especially after returning from a hot day on the beach. It's perfect! Down to the basics: cleanliness, rooms are spotless. Bathrooms are outfitted with organic shampoo, conditioners, lotions and soaps. Patios have outdoor seating perfect for picking up the wifi signal and catching up on the outside world (but who really needs that anyway). Several beach club options are provided (I'm partial to Mamita's as the beach there is splendid). Enjoy some cocktails at the bar with Jorge; listen to some live music. If you get hungry just walk across the street and order from La Cazuelas and they will bring the food right to you. I've stayed elsewhere in Playa but, in all honesty, I feel most comfortable with Cheri and Tony and the Luna Blue family. They know how to bring people together.

Reviews.Title: “A second great experience at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: LizR28
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Luna Blue for the second time this summer. The accommodations are comfortable and the rooms we stayed in had great balconies -- we had three rooms that included the tree house room with a big balcony and two other rooms with connecting balconies. It was perfect for having both private time for the couples and time together as a family. Best of all is the price; for the location and quality of the hotel it is an excellent value. Our big disappointment on the trip was that the bar was closed the whole week. It was one of the best memories of our previous trip -- relaxing with mojitos before venturing to a dinner spot. The bartender was sick, so it was just bad luck. I look forward to seeing the pool during my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: stacie D
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had the most amazing stay at luna blue! we would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice, clean affordable stay in playa! the location is perfect and the hospitality is amazing the owners are so warm and welcoming thank you so much we can't wait to come back!!!! and Alex on front desk was so friendly and helpful muchos gracias :-)) stacie and emma

Reviews.Title: “relaxing & low key getaway”
Reviews.Author: leenie2kailyn
Reviews.Content: Our winter getaway at the Luna Blue was just what the doctor ordered! The room was quiet, clean, and comfortable with plenty of hot water. There is plenty to do in the area; beaches, dining galore, entertainment, and shopping, all within walking distance! If you want to venture out to Tulum to see the Mayan ruins, Xel Ha, Pureto Moreles, or Akumel....they are all accesible; Tony & Cheri will help out with your every need. We always felt safe and welcome. We reccomend the Luna Blue without reservation ...as the saying goes," We will be back!" Colleen & Steve Yost

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and perfect hotel for us!”
Reviews.Author: 11kwv11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time in Playa and at the Luna Blue. The hotel is just off the main street, down on the slightly quieter section of 5th avenue. A couple of blocks to the beach, a few blocks from everything else. Perfect location. Room was excellent. We had a room with a kitchen which was great for heating up leftovers the next day for lunch. The 3rd floor balcony was an amazing private hang-out to enjoy those meals and drinks during the heat of the day. Room was very clean, kept nicely during the week, AC worked well the couple of times we did use it, but much preferred the breeze. Perfect room. The rest of the hotel was beautiful. Fun bar. (Can't wait to see the pool next time we visit!!!) The owners and staff were wonderful and very helpful. Always had great advice for getting the most out of Playa. Perfect people to run a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: trumanwaters
Reviews.Content: I just realized I hadn't submitted a review from a stay in February. We rented a car and had no problems getting to Playa from the airport. It was always easy to park within a block of the hotel. The front desk guys were always very nice and helpful. We used passes to all the different beach clubs and liked the variety. You can tell the owners care about making your stay enjoyable and relaxing. The garden makes for a perfect setting to start the day planning and ending the day reflecting. The resident cats are a trip to watch roaming and lounging in the perfect life they've been provided. The hotel has the type of heart and soul that hopefully keeps Playa a unique paradise.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy K
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Luna Blue. The hotel and garden are gorgeous and located by everything we wanted and needed during our stay in Playa del Carmen. Cheri and Toni Head recommended a great dive shop, Mexico Blue Dream, and provided a ton of local knowledge and advice which made our stay even better than we imagined. Their desk staff was also very friendly and helpful. We felt right at home during our entire stay. After a morning of SCUBA diving, it was always great to get back to the Luna Blue and relax. Our room was perfect for us. We had a kitchen and plenty of space. The hammock on our balcony was a personal favorite. We can't wait for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, another positive review!”
Reviews.Author: RogerinDallas
Reviews.Content: "One of the greatest things about travel is that you find out how many good, kind people there are" - Edith Wharton That was painted on our wall in the room during our latest stay at Luna Blue. This was our third stay in 2 years and yet again, Luna Blue did not disappoint. Each time we had a different room and each room is as wonderful as the next. Clean, comfortable, quiet, all tucked away in a tropical garden. I suppose I could go on and on about how the location is perfect, just a couple of blocks from the beach. I could give cheers to the coffee and muffins served fresh every morning. I could rant and rave about Tony and Cheri and the greatness of their staff. I could ramble on about the swing bar and how great it is to sit there and enjoy a cold Sol and forget all your worries. But I'm not going to do that...it'll make me sad....sad that I'm not there at this very moment. Stay at the Luna Blue on your next trip to Playa.....you'll understand. Thank you Tony and Cheri. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot in Playa”
Reviews.Author: latitudesbelize
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue has the absolute perfect location in Playa del Carmen. A half block off 5th Avenue, everything is walking distance from the hotel. The rooms are spacious, and the service is five star. Tony and Cheri are extremely helpful and know the area like the backs of their hands. Their staff is also always ready to help with directions, suggestions, and even some translating!! Your stay with them also gets you access to some of the best beach clubs in Playa Their new pool is near completion, and the bar always has something fun going on, live music, contests, and just all around fun!! This was our second stay with them, and being hotel owners ourselves, (with a critical eye), we cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Playa except Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Emma H
Reviews.Content: The staff and owners at Luna Blue made our stay in Mexico amazing, they helped us out with anything we needed and were very friendly. The rooms were always cleaned daily and had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. It was only a short walk to the beach and clubs and is just off 5th avenue so close to all the shopping and nightlife, we found this really good as no need for cabs or transport. Overall We couldn't have asked for a better experience in Playa Del Carmen, I would most definately stay there again and recommend it to family and friends or anyone wanting to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Prices and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: sml604
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue is an above average budget hotel and a great place to spend a few days if you're interested in a relaxed beach vacation in the heart of Playa Del Carmen's downtown core. The rooms are small and simple, but more than adequate if you're planning on an inexpensive beach holiday. Furthermore, the accommodations were fairly clean and the staff were all very friendly. If you're looking for an inexpensive hotel in the center of Playa, you can't do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: LucyE613
Reviews.Content: We were there May 7-14, 2011. We had a room with a great balcony overlooking the garden and waterfall. I was there every morning or evening reading my book. The bar at the Luna Blue is by far the best in Playa! We had a great week staying at Luna Blue. The place was very clean and Tony, Cheri and their wonderful staff go out of their way to make you feel at home. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “May 6-15th, 2011 - Wonderful Again!”
Reviews.Author: Cuffedlinks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of a return trip to this wonderful hotel. The garden courtyard was more beautiful than ever. The room was updated with new stove and fridge and the bar was such a nice place to retreat to after the day. We had the good fortune of attending two special music nights with bluesman Jay Morton and then a wonderful community event full of fun, InkFest. Tony and Cheri's staff is better than ever with new staffers at the desk and so good to also see so many familiar staffers. We're so used to a heavy turnover in staff from place to place, that this speaks volumes to Tony and Cheri that their staff remains year after year. Every guest we spoke with was having a great time and very pleased with thier stays as well. Th coffee and wonderful sweet breads each morning were a treat. And the bar has a great Tue-Thu-Sat Happy hour set of specials going on now WITH free chips and salsa on top of cold beer and the best specialty dinks ANYWHERE in Playa. The Sex on the Bar concoction is amazing. No place better to serve as a central location than The Luna Blue, in our opinion. We will return again and again as often as we can, and encourage anyone to stay at this special place, a slice of the old, slow vibe of Playa del Carmen not often found these days. We LOVE the Blue and the staff, the location, the ambience and the amenities we recieve far exceed our epectations time and time again. The Luna Blue truly delivers in every regard.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Luna Blue experience!”
Reviews.Author: omgchead
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Luna Blue several times in the past few years, and this most recent trip was delightful as usual. The service was wonderful, and Jorge the bar tender is famous for a reason: He makes good, STRONG drinks. The hotel is beautifully decorated, and because many of the rooms have patios, the enclosed outdoor area is a great place to relax or hang out. The enclosed area also includes a "grotto" with a waterfall, which is an awesome edition. While the photos of the hotel do it justice, wait until you see it lit up at night! The beach is walking distance and the Luna Blue offers coupons for free chairs and umbrellas as a local beach club (which you'd otherwise have to pay for). The hotel is right off 5th avenue, a main pedestrian walk with shops, restaurants and clubs. You could stay for a week and eat at a different, great restaurant every night, within walking distance. The free wifi in the hotel can be a little weak the further your room is from the hotel office, but there is also free wifi at Ah Cacao down the street on 5th ave., and coffee and chocolate that you shouldn't miss out on!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: ineedasol
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed one night before flying home from Cancun we really liked this place. A nice quiet place close to lots of things to see. I dont know why in the world I thought it was a good idea to book a top floor room with all of the bags I had but Jaime was glad to help me. The room was clean and comfortable and the A/C was cold. The bar was fun and we were given two free Margarita coupons when we checked in. It was nice to see that the hotel is pet friendly and Cora (I think Mikes dog) was very playful and all over the place. I guess we were fortunate enough to see Mike Grabow play for one of the last times at Luna Blue. If you are in Playa and can find him playing you will not be dissappointed. I would like to stay here again if I get the chance. PS. Is it possible to send me some chocolate and coconut muffins to NC?

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: embr
Reviews.Content: I was cautious to all the amazing reviews on this site but they are valid! Luna Blue is lovely small simple inn. Clean large rooms, cute gardens, a book sharing library and swing bar! Only a few blocks from the beach but you can get passes from them to several different beach clubs and all are worth a visit! Mamitas was closest but we also really enjoyed Wickys-great food and not as crowded. The guests at Luna Blue were incredibly nice and friendly and while we didn't see the owners much, Tony was able to give us some good touring/snorkeling advice. The hotel is also an easy walk to the grocery and to 5th ave restaurants and shops-just a perfect, very affordable, highly recommended place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Playa, the way it should be.”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_and_Beer
Reviews.Content: What a spot! When we arrived at Luna Blue it was exactly what we wished for in a Boutique Hotel in Playa Del Carmen. From the Gardens at first sight, to the smiling and helpful staff, to our great room with balcony overlooking the beautiful gardens below. It just doesn't get any better than this, then we met Cheri and Tony the owners of Luna Blue and we felt like we were among long time friends. Our room was very clean, comfortable and the balcony was the best!( we spent relaxing times on that balcony) We had the opportunity to have a night down at the bar (best bartender in Playa also) in the hotel and listen to Mike our fellow Canadian sing and play his heart out for all of us that attended. We were dancing, singing, laughing with everyone and had one or 2 tequila on that night, ( shout out to Rick and Sue). It was like we were back in the beautiful time of the older days of Playa. The staff at Luna Blue are very helpful and go that extra mile to assist you with anything you need or need to know about Playa. The location is one of the best, close to the beach, 5th avenue, great food and shopping but has the quiet that you love. Tony and Cheri, we thank you for your friendship and hospitality, and we will be back to visit our home away from home in Playa Del Carmen, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “certainly not the last time we'll stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jax_46Brighton
Reviews.Content: absolutely the best place to stay in playa... this time i booked a treetop terrace room and it was perfect!!! we weren't aware of anyone else, felt totally secluded and woke to the sound of tropical birds here in the treetop canopy! they have thought of everything anyone could want to make their holiday complete. membership to the beach clubs, with sunbeds, umbrellas and beach towels is just great... and nice to have a choice when mamitas gets too noisy haha!! thank you so much for a lovely stay...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, close to the beach, and totally worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Sarahrebeccajones
Reviews.Content: We got a lot of great tips about local places to eat from Alex at the front desk . The mamitas beach club was nice but the drink prices were outrageous- however having the nice chairs, umbrella and fresh water shower near by was convenient. The discount that we got from the hotel at Mamitas was only good for food and not for the drinks as advertised but no big deal. Because all the rooms face inward towards the patio, noise at night can be a little loud- however I liked falling asleep to a mariachi band one night (from outside the hotel, but you could hear it inside) and a guy who was singing at the bar at Luna's. The bar at Luna's was great- I would recommend trying one of the sex on the bar drinks- it was delicious. This location is great because anywhere you want to go is walkable- from the beach, ferry, bus station, collectivos, and even a grocery store. Absolutely recommend this place- not glamorous but just right.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the tropical atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Diana33184
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our time at the Luna Blue. Had a relaxing outdoor bar with music a few nights a week. Great restraunts and shopping all in walking distance. Staff was always helpful and the kitchenettes were well stocked. Enjoyed homemade Margarita's on the Lanai each evening. The lush and tropical atmosphere was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CodyJRapp
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near the busy strip of "Calle 5" and a couple blocks from the beach, this hotel is in an excellent spot. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Alex, the receptionist at the front desk is eager to assist with questions of the area or booking a trip. Great place for a couple or a few friends. Luna Blue at Playa del Carmen is a hotel that grasps the feeling of a true Mexican experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: margitte
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luna Blue for spring break with my boyfriend and our entire stay was fantastic. The staff were all so awesome, and Cheri & Tony were especially terrific hosts--they made sure we had everything we needed and answered all of our questions and even pointed us to some great restaurants and a store to buy earrings for my sisters! I've never had such quality service at a hotel before. Also, the location is great and the hotel itself is so freaking adorable and charming. Also: once you get the hang of them, the swings at the bar are really fun. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lizaaddy
Reviews.Content: A charming and well located hotel with a wonderful staff. You feel as if you are in Mexico - but have all the necessary benefits without the hassles (like a water dispenser in your room!). Hotel is within walking distance of beach and their "beach clubs" and all shopping and eating. They provide coffee and muffins in the morning. Although there is no restaurant on premises, they do have a very comfortable bar with fun drinks and music most evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of my trip!”
Reviews.Author: donutlovers
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue is right in the heart of all of the action. Just right on the corner of 5th Ave. so you can easily walk to everything worth seeing. The hotel has everything it advertises so to be honest, I did not want to leave. Truly my paradise away from home. Room service could be a little slow at times and you will hear the party outside until 3-4 am but that is a small price to pay to be so close to the beach and 5th Ave. at such an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “consistently good”
Reviews.Author: LaloinMexico
Reviews.Content: Our sixth stay at Luna Blue. When everyone else seems to be cutting corners, Tony and Cheri have maintained their standards. Maybe they do not have 600 thread count sheets or white gloved servants but, rooms are very clean, everything works, beds are comfortable, drinking water plentiful. Javier and Jaime were always friendly and helpful and Jorge is one fantastic mixologist.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with comfortable rooms and a great bar”
Reviews.Author: Honeygnome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming little place for a few days in October 2010. Our room was spacious and comfortable, with a little balcony that looked down on the garden and bar area. The room came with a refrigerator and a large dispenser of fresh water - essential in this part of the world. The bathroom had a rounded tile shower with water pressure quite up to spoiled American hotel standards, which was great. The place has a small cadre of friendly cats that live in the garden. It's also notable for its swing bar - patrons sit on rope swings while sipping their drinks, which has live music two nights a week and attracts a small but delightful crowd. The staff were really helpful to us, pointing us at some great local restaurants and attractions, and answering our questions about the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: grndmatigerlilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the tree top suite. The hotel & accomodations met my expections. They were exactly as described in Luna Blue's agreement & facebook page. The staff & owners were very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: bspike18
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue Hotel & Garden hotel was an amazing find with all the hotels in Playa. The rooms were great, the hotel bar was so much fun and don't even get me started with Tony & Cheri. The nicest owners and people. We will be back, not soon enough of course, and we will be staying at The Luna Blue. Thank you Tony & Cheri for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Another knockout 5 star stay at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: RusoandCita
Reviews.Content: First of all we are repeat offenders....of the Luna Blue that is. We have stayed several times with friends, and wouldn't think of staying elsewhere. Here's why: 10. Excellent Location 9. Great Beach passes 8. Mega power air conditioners 7. Efficient, clean rooms, comfortable beds, nice balconies, towel animals 6. You had me at Coffee and Muffins every morning 5. Hammocks 4. Staff is pleasant, and knowledgeable 3. Excellent service from Jorge the bartender, and great selection 2. Live music...wait make that GREAT live music 1. Tony and Cheri, they make all the difference, as owners they are friendly, available, and can give you advice on just about anything you might want to do, see, taste, or hear, and anything else that may catch your fancy. Luna Blue has provided us with some of the best nights, the mornings, well those are our fault! We are in our mid 30's escaping with another couple from the tediousness of parenthood for a few days each year, Luna Blue provides the perfect escape for us. We are easy going travelers, that do not need to be doted on, or have high maintainence requirements, just a couple of midwesterners looking for cervesas and sol, if Tony happens to throw down some Green Chartreuse well, I guess i'm down with that too.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Tired Hotel with Sketchy Front-Desk”
Reviews.Author: ilir11
Reviews.Content: The reason why we chose this hotel was due to the high TripAdvisor Traveler Rating. At many times during our stay we wondered how could such a poor facility get such a high number of positive reviews. We suspect that it has a lot to do with the type of customer that lands here. If the words trendy, modern, hip, comfortable, and trustworthy mean anything to you avoid this hotel at all costs. If you don't care about any of these things than you might like it. We are not confrontational people, and loved our time in Playa Del Carmen which is an amazing town, so we decided not to complain or cause any fuss during our stay, and minimized the time spent in our room to sleeping and showering only. Instead we would like to share our experience with other travelers so they can avoid a major disappointment. The complete lack of attention to detail manifested itself from the moment we arrived. My complimentary margarita was concocted out of re-used plastic bottles of dubious content and served on a chipped glass. The room (so called suite #21) was the most expensive they offered, at 110 bucks a night was the worst hotel room we had ever stayed at, and we had traveled extensively in all five continents. As soon as you walked in the room you were hit by a strong smell of mildew. They had sprayed some kind of air freshener to cover it up and it was nauseating. The light blue curtains on the windows were filthy. The walls were splattered with stains of various kinds and sizes that made us cringe. The oven did not work the one time we tried to re-heat smth. I guess there is not a lot of baking going on at the Luna Blue. Ha-ha! The furniture was gloomy and smelly. The bathroom was so old and run down, that we were wondering what exactly had been renovated in this hotel? The shower is awkward, and claustrophobic, and the water splashes everywhere making it a constant slipping hazard. The sink was cracked. For 850 pesos (less than the price of a night on this room) you could buy a beautiful Mexican style sink on 5th avenue to replace it and give it local charm. But it was apparent that the people running this hotel do not care that much. We visited about five other hotels of the same range in the area and were positively impressed as they all offered better values than Luna Blue. The Coco Rio next door at 105 dollars a night offers a much nicer suite with a modern kitchenette, impeccable bathrooms, and just as nice lush garden environment. And this is just the facilities. We had a negative experience with the two front desk staff. We trusted Luna Blue's motto from their website that "Every restaurant, tour or activity we recommend is because we like it, not because we’re getting a commission or kickback. " We quickly found out that this was a lie! Alex who I found initially helpful to book us tours to Chichen Itza and the Catamaran to Isla Mujeres, tried to take advantage of us, even though I tipped him for his "research." First, he told us that ChichenItza was 50 USD, but because we didn't have USD, he asked for 1250 Pesos (for two people). Initially he said we could pay directly Aldebaran tour agency, but then wanted us to pay him upfront. He was too fidgety when asking for the money which we didn't like. We chose to pay the agency the next day and they had no idea how much I should be paying, so when I just gave them 1200 Pesos for the tour to test them they agreed. Makes me wonder how much the Luna Blue's cut is. They take commissions on everything including restaurants. While I was inquiring for my tour a local restaurant representative dropped by his cards and started telling them about how they would get 10% commission on all the customers they sent their way. Jaime agreed that he knew how it worked, and they have been doing this for a long time. I understand Spanish perfectly and was puzzled by eavesdropping in this conversation. We never asked them for recommendations from that point on. On the morning of Wednesday the 9th of February, we had to be picked up by 8:00 AM to go to Chichen Itza, and even though on LB's website it says that breakfast is served at 7:30 there was nothing there until 8:00 so we had to start our tour on an empty stomach and no coffee. One might say that it's not a big deal, but it's just kind of continuous nuisances that showed us the lack of care or attentive service from the management. For the tour to Isla Mujeres on the Catamaran Alex asked us for 65 USD. We were already suspecting that this was not the best deal. Just across the street from Luna Blue, on calle 26, there is a tiny travel agency called Mayaluum who sold the exact same tour (again through Aldebaran) for 55 USD and accepted a better exchange rate of 12 Pesos to the dollar. Obviously, this is not about the few dollars that we saved but about the untrustworthiness of our front desk staff! Nobody likes to be taken advantage of, and we recommend that everybody be very suspicious of doing business with the Luna Blue. Shop around for better rates even if it is to go across the street at Mayaluum travel agency. Another annoyance with Luna Blue, is that even though there is a lengthy description or fine print in the reservation nowhere there it says that you can't bring you drinks to the Beach Clubs. You only find this out after you have arrived. The whole beach club cross promotion is another scheme. It only costs the hotel less than 30 Pesos to provide the access to the umbrellas, and once there you must pay extortionist prices for everything. They gave us grief for bringing our own water. It's almost better to put your beach towels on the sand (all beaches in Mexico are opened and free to the public) and not have to deal with the beach clubs. The only positives are that the cleaning ladies are quite nice and polite, and our room was quiet. The tropical garden is nice, but so is every other hotel's that we visited for comparison. The sheets were clean, which made our stay bearable. Again, we loved Playa Del Carmen, the beach, and the food at every restaurant we tried, and will definitely come back to stay at a nicer hotel for a better price. The hotels that we visited and would consider as much better values would be Hacienda Paradise (20 bucks more per night gets you a chic room with marble bathroom and a swimming pool). Hotel Aqualuna on 10th ave and Calle 14 is a very nice boutique hotel, with much nicer finishes at 70 bucks a night. If you want a very nice hotel even closer to the beach Riviera del Sol is a fantastic choice on 1st avenue and Calle 30.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue is a piece of heaven tucked away on a sidestreet in Playa...”
Reviews.Author: janiam_07
Reviews.Content: If you want an independent visit to Playa, check out Luna Blue. Built around a cool, green, terraced courtyard, it is a wonderful base to explore from. I love not being dependent on restaurants all the time, and the blender and huge fresh water jug just made it all that much better--all my favourite beverages on tap! Our balcony on the third floor was canopied and protected by foliage so the sunlight was always filtered and the temperature perfect. For sun, there's an open terrace on the 4th floor, or the beach, of course! It's just a quick walk away, with chair and umbrella rights with a beach club. For anyone who hasn't been to Playa in a few years though, beware, this is not the beach scene you may remember--it's jam-packed, and patrolled by guys on quad machines. The staff were terrific, friendly and well-spoken in English, which just makes things a little simpler. The bar is very cool, great margaritas (!) and what a treat to have a live performer, even when you're not actually at the bar! Michael Grabow (hope I have that right) made Friday night on our balcony an occasion to remember--hey, this is romance! I'm trying to think of something to complain about...no, can't. This place has heart, and soul too. It's written on the walls....

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations--Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Imadrone
Reviews.Content: We booked early to secure our favorite room with kitchenette and were fortunate to find the connecting Tree Top Terrace for our friends. Perfect setup for the four of us, and of all the places we have stayed in Playa and on Cozumel, Luna Blue is the best value. Best part of town, convenient to beach, shopping, restaurants, friendly and helpful staff, clean and spacious rooms, and now free WiFi. Luna Blue's bar is quite appealing, and draws an eclectic crowd for the good drinks and live music (which ceases promptly at 11 PM to ensure a good sleep for the guests). The staff all are very friendly and eager to be helpful, and Luna provides free beach towels daily + access to Mamita's Beach Club as well as a number of others we did not have time to experience. In short, if you are looking for a clean, quiet, reasonably priced, esthetically pleasing hotel in a good location, Luna Blue is an excellent choice. We will surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay at the Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: tykris
Reviews.Content: Arrived 1/15 for 7 nights - check in was quick and efficient and we stayed in room 6. We make multiple trips to the area each year and have just fell in love with northern playa and all the great restaurants, culture and choices that a traveler has versus staying in AI resorts. We did a good bit of research prior to booking and new exactly what to expect - No TV , no phones, no pool , NO problem! - Seems like all the negative reviewers failed to do the most important thing before booking - Research The room was spotlessly cleaned and maintained each day - Beds were quite comfortable - We had a great nights sleep each night The muffins and coffee each morning were quite nice and the staff was always working hard keeping the premises clean and tidy and quick to answer any questions we might have. The beaches were close by and IMHO the best in Playa (really enjoyed the free passes offered by the hotel) also very close was the dive shop - Mexico Blue Dreams - a top shelf dive operator who I highly recommend The garden/ common area was just spectacular and on our last night an early rain shower fell and the acoustics of the hotels gardens and structure lent itself to a nearly zen like sound Overall we would recommend this hotel without reservation Thanks Luna Blue!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay at the Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: JanuaryGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I take vacations every January to Playa Del Carmen. Since January 2007, we have stayed at the Luna Blue, so this stay would be stay #5. We love the location of the hotel. Close to all the action, but not noisy. We love the bar - we can meet some people there but it is not so rowdy that it keeps us up at night. They bring in great live music. Acoustic guys who play recognizable tunes that all folks can enjoy. We love the Mamita's free beach passes (premier beach in Playa) and the free muffins and coffee. We love all of the staff. Jorge, Mayte. Jaime. We love them all. The rooms are clean. The water is hot. The fresh water is plentiful. The kitchenette unit is a fantastic value! But most of all, we love Tony and Cheri. They are strongly commited to making sure your stay is as excellent as possible. They will provide recommendations or whatever else you need. If you are having any problems, bring them up to Tony and Cheri and they will help you out. If you want to sit around a big pool and never leave your hotel, find an all-inclusive in Cancun. Otherwise, call the Luna Blue your home base and be ready for an awesome vacation! See you guys in January 2012 for what is certain to be another awesome vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Heike123
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Luna Blue - great location, relaxing atmosphere, and super-friendly owners. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Three Enjoyable Weeks at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman36
Reviews.Content: This was the fifth consecutive year that we have stayed at the Luna Blue. We couldn't ask for a more relaxing atmosphere and better service than we get here. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: Menglert
Reviews.Content: We came here after being at a large Occidental resort in Cancun, and it was a welcome relief!! This hotel has no pool, no beach and no phone or TV. It is no frills, but has a cute "secret garden" kind of feeling, because as soon as you step in the front gate you feel like you are in a jungle. If you are wanting to see the sites of downtown Playa del Carmen, it is in a great location and close to the main street in Playa with all the shopping and restaurants. They have a cute outdoor bar, but unfortunately, we did not ever get to have a drink there. Close to the hotel is Mamitas Bach Club, where all the locals go. Great beach, beautiful water and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Smitty7
Reviews.Content: This was our second week-long stay at the Luna Blue in 2010. This time we brought our 21 and 19 year old kids. From Jaime welcoming us to Jorge at the bar, you get a feeling of being more than just a guest. The coffee and muffins at breakfast are a nice addition. Some highlights of the week included New Year's Eve Coconut Drop Party, live music at the Luna Blue Bar, and Tony giving us ideas of activities to do during the week. It's nice that the owners, Tony and Cheri Head, show a sincere interest in the quality of their guests' trips. Another great stay at the Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue - The Best Casual Comforts in Playa”
Reviews.Author: SomelkeitHot
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue has what it takes to experience the delights of casual comforts in Playa. From delightful rope swings at their bar to rooms immaculately clean and designed to a perfect Casual Mexican venue. Front desk service is over the top and really do connect you with services and people in the area. Rental cars, doctors, walking maps, restaurants etc. Owner Cheri has a very light and sincere way about her that makes all love to be around her. Cheri Thank You for all you did for us, we'll be back again and again. Location is marvelous - Picked up a little mocha at Ah Cocao on 5th continued down to Mamitas Beach used our Luna Blue ticket and got a chair and umbrella and we were set for the day. Evening time we easily went to different nite clubs and experienced 5th Ave by nite. Not once did I feel unsafe walking around Playa day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for me to have a "hub" for ten days!!!1”
Reviews.Author: ajinob
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue was my 'hub' for ten days will visiting Playa del Carmen. I have recommend this hotel to friends who want something different from the all inclusive resort scene are are not afraid to live without a TV and Phone. The owners, Tony and Cheri were welcoming and made me feel at home. In fact all of the staff were cheerful, pleasant to chat with and I couldn't have had better service. The bar, the swings, the beautiful music in the garden setting is a nice way to spend an evening after a long day in the sun. To sum it up this is the ideal budget hotel with simple amenities and a wonderful location, look no further

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel with a lot of charm”
Reviews.Author: kallileigh
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue is a cute hotel with a lot of charm. We stayed in room 5 which had two beds and a full kitchen. Having a kitchen was very nice. The room was clean and adequate. The staff, including the owners, was great. They were always there to answer our questions or offer advice. Before going in search of anything on our own we would stop and ask for their opinion. They never steered us wrong. Jorge, the bartender, treats girls in bikinis extremely well. Stop by and see him! Oh, and while you’re there, say hi to Oso the very sweet white cat who is a resident at the Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “It’s like the song "Margaritaville" come to life”
Reviews.Author: JoeJets
Reviews.Content: I couldn't walk through the jungle-lobby of this hotel without humming the Jimmy Buffet tune Margaritaville. It’s a great experience staying here and in Playa in general. The Luna Blue is sort of a “bare-bones” hotel with style. There are no TV’s, phones or pools, but that’s sort of its charm. They replace all that stuff with a lovely jungle in the middle of the hotel which serves as the lobby, and bar. Now this hotel is certainly not for everyone, and if you want things like TV’s, pools, Jacuzzi’s, or phones while you are on vacation, then there are plenty of other hotels to pick from, but if you really just want to get away on the Mayan Riviera beach and experience Playa Del Carmen, this might be the hotel for you. Service at the hotel is friendly in a sort of “let’s be friends” way, rather than the subservient sweetness you would find for service at an all-inclusive. Both receptionists were very helpful, and they helped me plan dinners, beach clubs, transportation and restaurants. Be sure to ask them for suggestions, they know their stuff. Tony and Cheri were great and full of advice for gringos on vacation. The rooms, showers, toilets, beds, A/C and fridges all worked excellently. The maid service was nothing short of outstanding. Perhaps the quickest and cleanliest maid service I’ve ever had (and that includes the all-inclusive). The morning coffee was good, and the muffins were OK (but I’m guessing fattening). The internet Wi-Fi did not work from my balcony, but that was fine by me, because it gave me an excuse to go downstairs and hang-out in the jungle-lobby while drinking my morning coffee and surfing the net on my iPhone. The “swingers” bar was a great place for a quick drink before hitting 5th Avenue. It looked like some of the guests spent a lot more time at the bar than I did, and they seemed to have fun. The hotel is not far from the beach and the best beach resort (about a 5 to 7 minute walk), but it’s not right on the beach. A couple minor complaints would be that the curtains in our room were a little difficult to close completely and there were some ants on the wall (although I think ants on the wall would be common in most hotels in the region). On a few days, the coffee and muffins were out closer to 7:45am rather than 7am; but hey, it’s Mexico and you’re on vacation, so stop looking at your watch. All in all, the Luna Blue is good value for the money, close to the beach and basically right on 5th Avenue. Close to the coffee shops, restaurants and the “little Italy” part of North Playa. I recommend it to anyone who does not plan to stay in their hotel room for their entire vacation, yet wants something a little different from a basic hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SandraL_10
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Luna Blue was excellent and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants something different from the all inclusive resort scene. The Luna Blue is located in an excellent location in Playa del Carmen, steps from 5th avenue and a 5 minute walk to the ocean. My room was equiped with a kitchen and private balcony. If you are looking for a truly restful and relaxing vacation, you are in for a treat staying at the Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin Life at Luna Blue Hotel”
Reviews.Author: la_reina_sf
Reviews.Content: What can I say returning to the Luna Blue is like coming home. We have stayed a Luna Blue on previous trips to Playa and I can't imagine ever staying anywhere else. Tony and Cheri welcome us with open arms and always make us feel at home. Entering into the gardens is a tropical paradise in itself. Of course having Jorge make us one of his "Fabulous Margaritas" at the Swing Bar kicks off the beginning of another wonderful stay at Luna Blue.
