There are many different types of rooms that provide for whatever your needs may be, all have a wonderful sitting area so you can relax read and enjoy the tropical sounds and birds and natural setting the garden provides.The rooms are spacious and very clean and the in room bottled water dispenser provided is a welcoming touch! We have also dined out at many of the local restaurant that Tony and Cheri have easily recommended going right around the corner or off the beaten path. The front desk staff ( Jaime, Maite & Mario) are equally helpful regarding any information and reservations for trips or tours and always make us special with helpful hints and tips to have a safe and wonderful experience, they truly do care about your trip to Luna Blue and work hard at it! Having music at the swing bar on certain evenings provides a fun easy going evening and they are often a benefit for the local pet shelter or fire dept as Tony and Cheri really care about Playa and it's local people as well. I highly recommend a stay at The Luna Blue you won't be disappointed !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Luna Blue is a wonderful hidden gem in the beautiful Maya Riviera”
Reviews.Author: eroge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in one of the kitchen rooms, which we highly recommend,for a little over a week! it was great walking to some of the local markets and shopping for local produce! Everything is easily accessible from the hotel. The staff at the Luna Blue is very friendly, and very helpful! Especially, the front desk! Our rooms were very comfortable and always cleaned with a very personal touch, they make art work out of your towels, very cool!!! In my op ion,one of the greatest things about Luna Blue is their grounds and gardens! We spent a lot of time on our balcony reading and enjoying the grounds,it,s like being in your own little jungle setting! Tony and Cheri were very knowledgeable about everything to do with Playa Del Carmen,and the surrounding areas.Every time we asked for any help,their advice was invaluable in making our vacation a huge success!And, when they weren't there, the front desk folks were great! The Beach is just a short walk away,and the beach clubs we had access to because of the Luna Blue were awesome! We will go back to Playa very soon,and we won"t stay anywhere but Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “A deal at twice the price”
Reviews.Author: LaloinMexico
Reviews.Content: It was our fourth time staying at Luna Blue. This year with the economy being what it is they've reduced their rates to the lowest we've ever paid anywhere in Playa. Cheri and Tony treat us as if we are old friends of course they treat everyone that way which is what makes them special. Maite (?sp) and Jaime at the front desk were always helpful and patient with an old gringo. And Jorge continues to mix the best margaritas I've had anywhere. We were joined by our friends from Virginia not knowing for sure that they would like it. On our previous trips with them we had stayed at a beach front hotel closer to the cruise pier. Not only did they like Luna Blue, they are ready to go back. Just like us.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Tropical Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: ctanzi
Reviews.Content: When the cab driver dropped us off I said to myself," This is not the doorway to a hotel lobby? He must be wrong! I walked into a three story jungle paradise hidden behind a wrought iron gate and a thatched entryway. The interior has an open-air lobby and a cozy swing bar on the right. The center is filled with lush tropical trees and plants with small seating areas and a waterfall. The lobby and garden area are paved in rough cut stone beautiful, but uneven, so walk with care especially after a few of Jorge's margaritas! Our room was a garden view with a kitchenette and private balcony. It was immaculate and full of sunshine. My husband and I started each day on the balcony drinking coffee and finishing the evening there with drinks under the reflections of the handcarved "jelly light". We loved having the five gallon jug of water, the coffee maker, and the frig. The cleaning staff were great and we looked forward each day to the different pieces of towel art on the bed. Our special thanks go to Mayte the receptionist , she is a "gem." She gave us excellent suggestions for restaurants, drew maps for us, provided taxis,gave us our daily passes to Mamitas,and made excellent coffee each morning . Mayte made our stay extra special! A friendly wave from Jorge was very welcoming as well as his great drinks. The WiFi service was excellent, the water was hot, and the room smelled great ! I must also add that we enjoyed our daily vsits from the kitties. We hope to return as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Diana1256
Reviews.Content: For the past 4 years we have been going to Mexico and stayed in all inclusives in the Cancun and Playa del Carmen area. This year we decided to try Luna Blue so we could better experience the cuisine of the area and the atmosphere of a smaller hotel. We are happy to say that we LOVED the home feeling of Luna Blue. The rooms were clean and the staff was very welcoming and friendly especially Alex. We liked sitting on the balconey listening to the birds chirping and listening to the soothing waterfall. The restaurants were in walking distance and we found a few that we really liked especially Hacienda La Herradura , IL Baretto and La Cueva del Chango. The beach clubs were about 2 blocks away and for being a guest at Luna Blue you got free chairs and umbrella. Towels were supplied by Luna Blue. To sum it all up, we liked it so much that we booked 5 days in February to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary within a week of returning home.

Reviews.Title: “Luna is everything we expected it to be”
Reviews.Author: KushLand
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Luna Blue for 5 nights in August. I did alot of research before choosing this hotel. We always try to choose a place that has everything we are looking for: good location, friendly staff, safe, clean, and reasonable price. I studied all of the negative reviews of Luna and decided that the people leaving those reviews had different expectations than what Luna has to offer. My instincts were correct, as Luna Blue was everything we expected and hoped it would be. I had alot of questions about the culture and what to expect when we got there and the owners were great at communicating with me by email before our arrival. We didnt see a whole lot of the owners after our arrival, Tony made sure everything was going well for us on a couple of occasions. The staff was extremely helpful, giving us advice on anything we needed. By the time we left, we felt that Jaime, Alex and Jorge were old friends of ours. We stayed in one of the treetop rooms, ours just happened to be on the 4th floor. If you plan on staying in one of the treetop rooms, make sure you can handle the climb, it is definitely a workout. The room was very comfortable and well decorated. We had fridge and water cooler in there, it was nice having fresh water anytime we wanted it. The balcony was very private, totally relaxing and even had a hammock. Jorge the bartender makes awesome drinks, I fell in love with his pina colada. They have loud music two nights a week and its very entertaining. I read some guests complaints about the music but the party did always end at 11pm, as promised. I would have liked for it to last longer, after all, isnt that what vacation is all about. But its understandable that some people want to turn in early. We were very satisfied with our stay at Luna Blue. If we ever travel back to Playa Del Carmen, we will certainly be staying at the Luna. You have a great little place that has a wonderful reptutation after only five years. It is my dream to accomplish all that you have someday, just looking for my own little slice of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff; great location; great everything!”
Reviews.Author: MrBCID
Reviews.Content: Booking was a breeze; communication was great. The room, location, and everything else was better than expected by a mile. I wanted to go to Chichen Itza so I asked one of the staff for tips; he booked a whole day tour for me which included transportation, all you can eat buffet, swimming in a cenote, and Chichen Itza for under $50; incredible... I can't say enough nice things about the place... location can't be better.... 2-3 blocks away from the beach and only a block away from the touristy 5th ave...

Reviews.Title: “It's 5 O'Clock somewhere...”
Reviews.Author: stargazer21
Reviews.Content: ...and I wish I was at Luna Blue! What can I say? It was another epic visit! Our transportation dropped us at the gate, and we were greeted like we were old friends by Jamie and Mayte at the desk, and by Jorge at the bar. Seeing as we had only been here one time before (and that was in January), it's pretty awesome to be getting hugs at check in! We were given our keys and AC remote and before we could even catch our breath from the always stunning gardens surrounding us, our bags had been moved to our room and we were free to start living in Mexico (for 10 days)! Our beautiful room this time was one of the Tropical Hideaway rooms on the second floor. One easy flight of stairs and there you are. The room was stunning! Bright and clean, with lots of windows to let the sunshine stream in (but with curtains that could block it out if you wanna day sleep). There is a luggage rack to put a suitcase on, and the carved armoire had two drawers, giving plenty of room for two people with (once again) too many clothes to hang up and put away everything. For a 10 day stay, we were able to completely unpack...no living out of suitcases! The whole place was spotless and smelled clean..."for real clean", not like air freshener or Febreeze (I hate that in other hotels...what are they trying to cover?). The shower was a tile enclosed stand up shower that kinda gave me pause at first, but turned out to be awesome! There's not a door for the shower, but the shower head is angled so that water doesn't go out. Plenty of room and light while you're showing. (This came in very handy, since I left my fancy razor handle at home, and had to master shaving my legs by holding onto the razor head...) Never ran out of hot water, no matter what time of day we showered or for how long. The AC and ceiling fan kept the room very cool, even during the hottest part of the day, and we slept like bebes (bambinos!) in the comfy beds at night. Our patio overlooked the garden area, and we could see everything going on but still provided privacy. It was adjoining the patio for the room next door, but there was a 3/4 fence in between, with some potted plants finishing the separation. But seeing as how it was my sister and brother in law next door, Cheri (one of the owners) suggested we roll the plants to either side and viola! We could wander back and forth to each other's rooms and spend time together on the now one patio! We spent every morning there, scarfing the awesome coffee and muffins ( the orange muffins are to die for!) provided by Cheri and Tony, recalling the previous night and planning our adventures for the day...in a perfect setting. None of us had any problems at all with the WiFi signal when on the patio. I made several Skype call home to brag about my day and just be generally obnoxious to peeps back home, and always had a solid signal. Works better than my signal back home at work. Also, we've used the nice lady's laundry service across the street several times. Absolutely no worries. Just drop it off, and pick up in a few hours. Great prices and it all comes back smelling clean (again, not perfume-y) and folded...with a little lollipop. Have never had anything missing, shrunk or faded. (Wish I had that service here at home!) We enjoyed some great nights at the famous bar, listened to the perfect music of Barefoot Skinny and other local talents. This is not by any means a club. No thumping techno music will ever sully the speakers. This is a bar, where the locals, expats, and tourists looking to get away from the hustle of Fifth Ave come to visit each other and meet new folks. They also know that Jorge is the best bartender in Playa! Sit on a swing, enjoy a pomegranate margarita or a Salty Thong, soak in the music and visit with great peeps...life is so very good! Of course, it all shuts down at 11PM, so you can wind down your night if you're ready. If not, Fifth Avenue is half a block away (far enough that you can't hear it, but literally right around that corner at the end of the street). When you do call it a night, you can enter the now locked and secure hotel grounds through the guest only locked door (you're given a key at check in). All safe and tucked in for the night, with only the sound of an occasional gecko to remind you of your surroundings. The beach is maybe 1/4 mile walk from the hotel, and they provide you with fresh beach towels and passes to the best ones. A few of the beach clubs are further north, so you may want to cab it there but the staff can help you with all that. Tony told us all about the different appeals of the different clubs they have passes for, something for everyone. But the popular Mamitas and Kool are just a short walk away (and you can stop at PG's Sandbox to for lunch on your way!). We ended up only having a few beach days, as we decided to snorkel and explore a lot more area this time (and Tony and Cheri can point you in some good directions for that too!) When my friends ask me where they should stay when they go to Playa, this is where I tell them to look first. I do tell them it's not an all inclusive. If you want more than coffee, tea and muffins right outside your door for breakfast, you won't find that here. No bed turndown service or mints on your pillow at night. There's no swimming pool on site, but the most gorgeous swimming is a five minute walk away, and won't leave you smelling like chlorine or turn your hair green. :-) What you will find is romance, fun, being treated like family, new friends from all over the world and a feeling of being rejuvenated. When i travel, I want to feel included in the lifestyle and culture and I get that here. Tony and Cheri and their wonderful staff go above and beyond to make you feel a part of it all, and I'm forever grateful to them for giving me that. We'll be back soon! Already planning for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were still there”
Reviews.Author: harriscath
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent just 3 nights at Luna View but wished we could have stayed longer. There are a myriad of places to stay in Playa so making a decision was hard. However we didn’t regret Luna Blue. The location was perfectly balanced between being close to the action and yet nice and quiet, set in greenery. The rooms were comfortable and lovingly decorated. And finally, we enjoyed the extra amenities such as the book library and fun swing seat bar with strong margaritas! My top tip would be to check when you book for discounted prices- given the range of hotels, it seems possible to bargain a bit, especially during off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly, unique and the highlight of my stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: lululapitsky
Reviews.Content: I arrived weary and tired from volunteering in Belize 2 weeks, and the owner had upgraded me to a nicer room. I thought I died and went to heaven. I couldnt be happier. It was like a little tropical paradise sandwiched between cafes and shops. Short distance to the beach and attractions. Tony recommended Akumal, and a beachfront restaurant, where I spent my last day in Mexico and I was delighted. The kitties living at Luna Blue are friendly, and staff helpful. My room was clean, bright, cool, and very pleasant. Very nice bar, good music and pleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: cycledogdvm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our third time. Every time it gets better and better. Tony and Cheri went out of their way to make us feel at home. The live music was great. The best beach in playa is just down the road, (The main beach in town is difficult to swim at due to all the boat moorings.) and best of all Luna Blue gives you free passes for umbrella and lounge chair.

Reviews.Title: “April 2009 & 2010 - Luna Blue Amazing Again!”
Reviews.Author: Cuffedlinks
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days and 8 days in April of '09 and '10 at The Luna Blue Hotel. Such a lovely setting with the Garden (Always something new to admire and enjoy as Tony and Cheri attend to the Garden with new plants and flowers). We always try to reserve a lovely kitchen room, but we're happy with any room at the Luna Blue. As usual, after check-in and a Luna blue Margarita...travel day transforms into "It's GOOD to be home". Chill, in an instant! Each visit we were able to take advantage of Blucacao Beach Club, and were among the first this last April to enjoy their new association with Indigo Beach Club (At El Taj condos) in town to the south. Both lovely and a change of pace from Mamitas, which is still our free beach club of choice, mostly to people watch and we enjoy the short walk each day to stretch our legs...and the walk north and south from Mamita's Beach for some exercise to break up the beach/sun time. The north end has continued to grow with new dining options, and the favorites of past visits are only steps away. The Bar has Playa's finest bartender, Jorge, who mixes some of the best old Caribbean favorites, and the new Luna blue specialty drinks (Designed specifically FOR the Luna Blue by some of San Francisco's finest bar managers and proprietors). Music Nights at the Luna Blue are NOT to be missed and Papa T's specials for ladies in bikinis always seem to be very well received. NOTHING like sitting on a bar swing in the Caribbean, sipping Havana Club Rum (Cuban), listening to great live music or a "live" Jimmy Buffet concert via satellite radio and Radio Margaritaville. And the bar is decorated in a great whimsical Caribbean style. Very welcoming. We always have plenty of room for our clothes, toiletries, and the in-room safe is electronic and easy to use. Quiet and cool AC (Once we finally asked Jaime how to operate the new remote) and the fountain sends out it's waterfall song as we sit on the balcony sipping coffee in the morning, or the last of Jorge's margaritas for the day. (The House Margarita is excellent but TRY the Papa T's margarita!) Don't forget to hydrate! Drink all the water you'll ever need from the provided Water in the room (type depending?) Beds as per usual in Mexico are firm, but very comfortable. We use an extra-firm mattress and the mattress firmness in Mexico is never an issue, but if so Luna Blue can accommodate, just ASK! We've found our home at the Luna Blue. The hotel continues to be well-kept and updated...and IF there is ever an issue, the staff is always happy and quick to replace, fix, or swap out any concern. PLUS, I have seen time and again the hotel staff quick to the aid of guests who need help with snorkeling, rental-car, dining options, the hotel even has a wonderful physician available quickly (I needed that service one July when I didn't hydrate as I should have)...And we have used the day trip excursions available via the hotel and have always been more than satisfied with each trip. Always sad to go, but always good to know we have a home in Paradise to look forward to. Thanks again, Luna Blue and Staff

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue is always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: possum7
Reviews.Content: Hola- as usual this hotel does not dissapoint. everyone working there is always very nice. clean, cool rooms and the incomparable setting. close to everything i like- and not so close to everything i dont. if you want noise and all that drunk crap stay at the other end of town. if you want some sleep stay at Luna Blue. Oso will make sure your stay is satisfactory, just tell him Despereaux sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you expect more than the bare minimum”
Reviews.Author: suzyb2001
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews for this hotel, my friends and I had pretty high expectations for this place. Sadly, we were really disappointed in our stay. I realize now I should have taken the NEGATIVE reviews more seriously as they were a closer approximation of what we experienced. Here are our biggest criticisms: First, the room we were assigned was on the street and noisy. It faced a side street so you wouldn't think it would be that bad, but there was enough traffic and restaurant noise to disturb our sleep. Since we had to be up at 6am to go diving, we were not happy about this. Further, the twin bed in our room was like sleeping on plywood. I tossed and turned all night and woke up sore (again, not ideal for an early morning dive trip). My friends shared the queen bed, which was perfectly fine so clearly there is no shortage of acceptable matresses. I've stayed in a lot worse hotels in Mexico and always had a decent bed. And in fact, when the front desk kindly switched our rooms (perhaps the one saving grace of this hotel), the twin bed in the next room was leaps and bounds better (though still not great). So, if you ever stay here (and I highly suggest you do not), and you have a low tolerance for noise and/or hard beds, make sure you are not in room 5. Our other major issue was that the "free high speed internet" was extremely weak. We could only get our emails occasionally if we stood on our porch, and could NEVER get bigger downloads. We found ourselves walking to the Starbucks or Ah Cacao around the corner when we really needed to download information (tip: Ah Cacao always had a stronger signal). Since we were using our email to communicate with our dive master and coordinate plans this was particularly inconvenient. We specifically picked a hotel with wifi because we knew we were going to need internet access. And because the wifi was weak, we had to leave the hotel several times to get updates on dive plans, pick-up times, flight schedules, etc. On the hotel's website they say internet is only available in "all of the outdoor areas, including most balconies and terraces, reception area and in the bar." TAKE THEM AT THEIR WORD and do not expect internet in your room or even on your balcony. This means that you might have to stand outside in heat, humidity, rain or all of the above (as was our case a couple times) to check an email and you STILL might not actually be able to get it. If you are really going to need internet the way we did, this probably isn't the place for you. On a smaller scale of disappointment was the sad coffee and muffins on offer in the mornings. Like I said, we're divers and knew we were going to be getting up crazy early some days, so we picked a hotel with coffee and muffins so we would be able to grab some on our way out. Well, they had coffee and muffins, but they were really as minimal as you can get. First, they didn't have fresh milk or cream for the coffee (only fake creamer). I realize that it's really hot outside so maybe they're worried about spoilage, but I've stayed in plenty of hotels in Mexico where they put a little milk/cream on ice and replace it frequently. Or if that's too time-consuming, maybe they could keep it in the refrigerator and let the guests know it's available "by request." I just feel like where there's coffee there should be cream (call me crazy!), but clealy Luna Blue is not of the same mindset. So if you like cream/milk in your coffee plan on doing what we did every morning: walking to the Starbucks around the corner. The same is true for the muffins -- that's all there is so if you don't like 'em, you're on your own. My friends and I all found them to be inedible. They were dense, oily, and overly sweet. I'm guessing other guests must eat them or they would stop putting them out all together, but frankly, they made us gag. If you're like us and don't like oily, super sweet muffins, you probably won't like these and should plan on making alternate breakfast plans (tip: don't expect a good muffin from Ah Cacao around the corner because they apparently sell the same muffins there). It would have been great to see a few pieces of fruit offered to pickier people like us, but again, I get the sense that Luna Blue isn't trying to please everyone or push the limits of service. So, don't stay here if you expect: - that a quiet room with a comfortable bed will be standard (room 5 was terrible, room 6 was ok. Who knows about the other rooms) - that you will have reliable internet access. At best (standing outside) our Blackberries and iPhones had one bar of wifi. - that cream will be offered with coffee - that you will be able to grab a quick breakfast (unless you like the greasy muffins) And in general, CAREFULLY read their website. What they say is EXACTLY what's true. "Coffee, tea, and muffins" means ONLY coffee, tea, and muffins. "High speed internet in all outdoor areas" means ONLY outdoor areas and NOT in the room. If you mistakenly expect more management will be all too happy to point out why you shouldn't have.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, wonderful ambience”
Reviews.Author: annieb1111
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Playa del Carmen and stayed at Luna Blue Hotel as this hotel had been recommended to me by several friends. I am so pleased I made the decision to stay there - it was everything my friends had said and more! I was made so welcome by the staff, nothing was too much trouble. The room was cool, clean and comfortable and the coffee, tea and muffins available for free in the mornings were a welcome treat! As a solo traveler, I was made to feel safe, comfortable and cared for and it was also great to have wi-fi in my room. I'm grateful for my friend's recommendation and would not hesitate to recommend this lovely little hotel to anyone else fortunate enough to be visiting Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jasonandanna
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Luna Blue. It was our honeymoon and the staff made our stay so comfortable. The room was clean,comfortable and the morning breakfast is sooo delicious. I completely recommend Luna Blue for anyone who is interested in a clean, comfortable, reasonably priced place. It is close to the beach, shops, great bars and restaurants. The free access to the beach clubs is also really nice :) We had an emergency situation where my husband went for a swim in the ocean 1 hour before we were supposed to leave for our flight back to California with our keys in his pocket!!! He lost the keys (our wallets and passports were locked up in a safety deposit box) and Luna Blue staff was SO helpful. They had someone over right away and who was able to help us and luckily we did not miss our flight. We will be back to Luna Blue without a doubt! Enjoy Playa del Carmen it is beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeinfwtx
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days at Luna Blue. Great Rate and free coffee and muffins every morning. Plenty of resturants nearby and only 2 blooks from Mamitas Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paws55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luna Blue in a Treetop Terrace Room for 6 nights. The room was well set up and had airconditioning and a ceiling fan. Outside the room was a large terrace with seats, table and hammock. The location is 1 just 1/2 a block from 5th Avenue - where there are lots of shops, bars, restaurants etc. Staff were very helpful. The only negative about Luna Blue was that there mosquitos in the foyer area in the morning and night - a bit of a problem when accessing the wifi (signal was v low in the room and was only usable in the lobby). Some deterrant candles could have solved this. Otherwise the stay was excellent and I'd recommend it to anyone visiting Playa

Reviews.Title: “Another Solid Stay at the Luna!”
Reviews.Author: mayalovesplaya
Reviews.Content: I have visited Playa Del Carmen dozens of times and I have stayed all over 5th Avenue, a couple of years ago, I found the Luna Blue and I couldn't be happier. They are away from the noise of 5th and short walk from both the beach and the action. The bar is fantastic, the live music by Mike Grabow (spelling?) was perfect. It was over by 11pm, for those of us who are older and wanted to go to bed. The rooms are simple, clean, and comfortable. No TV's, but the AC and fridge's work great. Not sure what else anyone would need in Mexico? Jorge will take care of you at the bar, I suggest the Pina Collada or the Sarita-B-Careful (who I met once, very nice looking!). Another bonus this stay, was the free continental breaky, the muffins were delish! Anyway, it is a great easy clean place, I suggest very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: val0307_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at week at the Luna Blue Hotel. We were in Playa del Carmen for a wedding and to celebrate our 10th anniversary. Upon our arrival (9pm) we were greeted at the front desk immediately and the staff was very efficient to get us checked in quickly. Our room was up one flight of steps, tucked into a corner. Our balcony was wonderful overlooking the gardens. Each morning we went down to the front desk for the complimentary, yummy muffins and a staff person was always around able to answer any questions and change out our beach towels. Most of our days were spent either at the beach (~2 blocks away) or shopping along 5th Avenue. And each afternoon/early evening we met our friends at the Luna Blue Bar to plan our events for dinner. At the bar we enjoyed the swings, the plentiful fans to keep us cool and the bartender, Jorge, who always had quick service. A few times during our week stay they had live music at the bar which always ended early enough to not distrubute our sleep. Our room included a refrigerator, jug of water, a/c, ceiling fan, room safe, space for hanging clothes and a dresser. Our bathroom included a shower that always had hot water. The maids always did an awesome job of cleaning at convenient times each day. Overall we loved the Luna Blue Hotel for a relaxing, getaway vacation. And we cannot wait until we can come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfortable hotel, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Troyox
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Luna Blue 19 - 24th June, As we came here after a week of less than comfortable Cuba accommodation we were looking forward to relaxing. This place was perfect from the get go. Easy walk to the beach, restaurants, Supermarket (although the heat was intense). Good times were spent patting the resident cats, talking to the staff and drinking at the bar. This place isn't the nucleus in 5th street like some (whingey) people who have posted were hoping it is, but it is a super easy walk, and in fact I would rather be "on the fringe" anyway unless you want to hear drunken frat boys at 4 in the morning. The taxis are 20 peso's anywhere in the tourist zone. Awesome staff, awesome value, awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, relatively cheap, location not great”
Reviews.Author: rsg61
Reviews.Content: After an 5 hour flight delay from the UK i got to luna blue around 9pm. i have been to playa before, so when i arrived at the bus station, i asked somebody about how far this hotel was. they advised me to take a taxi........which cost $4USD. Upon arrival i managed to check in and the staff were helpful. the room was clean, although basic. it had a nice newish aircon unit which was quiet (nothing worse than a noisey fan or aircon unit). the room was quiet and on the ground floor, which led to a nice nights sleep. i think the more expensive rooms are on the above floors, which may or may not be represented in the photos of this hotel on tripadvisor. the hotel was supposed to have free wifi, but for some reason i was unable to detect the signal. although the owner tried, i was unable to get it working. seemed to be the only wifi spot i was unable to connect to in mexico. next morning i left to take a walk down 5th avenue, at which point i realised how far luna blue was from things. it is at the very very end of 5th avenue, probably too far. taking into account the heat........its not a good location at all. if your staying in playa, you want to be close to all the restaurants and beach!!! one issue i had with this hotel was some strange confusion over time. i managed to find a cheaper hotel centrally located on 5th avenue (hotel azul). after my morning walk i thought i arrived back at the hotel at 11;45am, well before the 12pm check out time. i found a note on my room door to contact the desk straight away. the owner (an american lady) said that i would be charged for another night. i informed her i will be checking out, at which point i was told it was nearly 1pm. i had the time wrong!!!. genuine mistake right!! she told me there wasnt much she could do, and that she had to turn away some guests whilst i was out.....she didnt look too impressed!! after some persuasion she agreed that i had made a genuine mistake, but it was a little touch and go there for a while. it wasnt a big deal, but left a bitter taste, especially as the digital clock in the room was on the wrong time too! overall it was quiet, relatively cheap and i guess i cant be too critical about the staff as after all they did help me.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CubsFan5851
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Luna Blue Hotel - great visit! Jorge, the bartender, is excellent. Management, Tony and Sherri, were present several times during my five day stay and did an outstanding job of hosting! Can't say enough about this hotel, great location and friendly staff - thank you Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BadgerFan51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna in May and found it to be everything they claim it to be. Alex and Jaimie were very helpful with dining and other suggestions. Jorge was terrific handling the bar which is a wonderful small swinging chair bar in the hotel courtyard. They had live music one night and it was really fun. The Luna is not the Marriott or the Ritz but if you are looking for nice comfortable room close to the action this is the place. It is less than a block from 5th Ave where tons of shops and restaurants are located. The hotel also has an agreement with several beach clubs that you can use there umbrellas and lounge chairs for free. We went to Mamitas and found it to be very nice with excellent food. I would highly recommend the Luna Blue. I met the owners and anyone who would refer to them as aloof is nuts. Also the hotel is not a dump at all. If you make sure to understand what they are trying to be and your expectations match what they offer you will love the place. Thanks Tony for the free shot and to both Tony and Cheri for a great little place to experience Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue Complete Review from May 2010 - Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: LatitudeDiver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Luna Blue in May 2010. Overall I have to say a positive experience, and I would recommend this hotel. It wasn't a Hilton or Marriott, but you aren't paying Hilton and Marriott prices either. It does have a nice, small hotel feel to it. Likes - 1) Free Wi Fi! I am a big advocate for Wi Fi, and I think every hotel should offer it free. I travel A LOT for dive trips and work, and Wi Fi is simply a must. You need to be able to quickly connect to friends, family, work for "quick" updates (or just to check your local news) thus spending time finding a WI FI spot is not an option for me (which I spent 2 hours one time in Cancun trying to just find a WI FI spot), and paying high prices for it is not acceptable either. (See a dislike as well regarding Wi Fi). I am glad that Luna Blue recognizes that it is important for travelers. 2) Friendly Staff - Alex was really helpful and everyone was very nice. 3) Hotel transportation - the hotel arranged for our pick up in Cancun and our return trip. They were on time, they were nice, weren't over priced, etc. I usually drive, but I was concerned about the parking situation in Playa Del Carmen (since Luna Blue does not have their own parking garage). However, you really don’t need to drive in Playa Del Carmen. 4) Spacious rooms with kitchens. I wish I had used the kitchen more. Plus they had "bottled" water (not individual bottles) for you so you always had fresh, clean water. Big fridge in the rooms for anything you buy at the store. 5) Surprisingly soft beds (not overly soft or plush). The beds were more comfortable than I am use to when traveling to small hotels in places like Mexico. Last trip to Isla Mejures my bed was so hard; I didn't sleep for any of the 5 nights I was there. These beds felt like they have been changed out and not used for the past 50 years. I think a good night's sleep is a must - especially when I have a big day of diving the next day. Point is the bed wasn’t hard (and if you have stayed in other places in Mexico, you know what I mean). 6) Location. You are just minutes (and I mean short minutes) from the main strip, but you are far enough off of it that you aren't in the middle of the crowds and the noise. Also, most of the main strip doesn't allow traffic on it, so I am unsure how some people get to their hotel (without walking through the streets with their luggage in the heat - which would really suck) for hotels that are actually on the main street (which I think the main street is called 5th Ave). 7) They offer muffins and coffee in the morning. I think it is a nice touch to offer something for people on their way out the door needing a quick snack. They aren't gourmet, but they are good enough. I don't drink coffee, so I wish they had offered some type of juice, but just to have something quick to eat was nice. I am usually running late, and have somewhere to get to (like a dive shop for a morning dive), so having something to eat is great. 8) Cool little bar set up. Swinging chairs and very intimate (not a big Carlos and Charlie’s Bar – a nice small one that you actually will be forced to mingle with other people). 9) Seemed to attract a good quality group of guests while I was there. Overall for the price and the location, I don't think you can beat this hotel. Dislikes - 1) The Wi FI doesn't necessarily pick up in your room. Normally not a big deal, as I like to go outside anyway (and the WI FI worked great right outside my door, in the lobby, etc). However, the mosquitoes can be vicious at certain times, thus it makes it tough to go outside during these times. I think the walls of your room are so thick that the signal has trouble getting in. 2) Bigger safe for your laptop. However, this is just being nit picky. I have found very few hotels that have a safe big enough to accommodate laptops. You can always check them at the front desk. Everyone travels with their laptop nowadays, and the need to secure them is important. 3) No pool. Hey, but it isn't the Marriott or Hilton, you aren't paying those prices either. 4) Not on the beach. However, they (Luna Blue management) have several properties that you can get towels and chairs (for free) at and they it is only about a 7 minute walk to the beach. Actually we discovered several places that if you ate lunch at their establishment on the beach, that they gave you a chair and towel for the day as well. We knew there wasn't a beach when I booked the room, so it wasn't anything upsetting. Once again, my “dislikes” were just that – dislikes (being nit picky). But it wasn’t anything I didn’t expect or prepared for. I love that they don’t have TVs in the room (I am on vacation, don’t need to watch the tube, I can catch the news on my computer). I think this is a nice hotel and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Birthday Trip!”
Reviews.Author: npala2001
Reviews.Content: I spent my birthday at Luna Blue and it was amazing! A block away from the beach and a quick walk to the clubs. I will be going back in the next couple months because you can't beat the price....plus the bar makes some crazy strong drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Landed on my feet at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: 0800andy
Reviews.Content: Read various reviews and was very happy when I arrived at Luna Blue, exactly the place I was looking for. A lovely mellow hotel in lovely surroundings. No need for a pool as the beach was within a stones throw, plus free beach club vouchers everyday...nice touch. As were the morning muffins! I'm planning on a few more nights on the swing bar on my way back through in a few weeks, and would certainly look to stay here if I find myself in Playa again. In a great spot that is both close, but tucked away from the hustle and bustle, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful proprieters take care of you”
Reviews.Author: lillyth_
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here for 2 nights. Cozy and charming and well run. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the truth about luna blue”
Reviews.Author: bluegrass84
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to mexicos east and west coasts stayed in large and small hotels. luna blue has nothing to offer but high prices, no tv ,ice,loud bad music in the bar until 11;00 pm. then you have the 5 block gountlet of street venders to get to the beach. playa del carmen area restaurants are over priced $8. ice cream cones. endless blocks of street venders all trying rip you off. the truth about luna blue and playa del carmen is so over rated don't waste your time and money on ether place. Gale Reed Austin tx

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTools
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a diamond in the rough. My husband and I just started our 7 day honeymoon through the Yucatan and Belize. It was a rental car and the wide open road. We stopped in Playa and felt it was very commercial and then run into the Swing Jimmy Buffet bar which we loved. Jorge made us a mean margarita and we decided we must come back to Luna Blue to stay. Tony and Cheri were awesome and upgraded our balcony room to the suite with two balconies, with no charge. It was awesome. Such a wonderful and relaxing place to stay. Tony was very helpful with what attractions to see (skip Xcaret, and see Coba ruins and Parasisus Beach) It was so great, we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Rissanela
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Luna Blue the 3rd week of April, 2010. This is my 3rd trip to the area and my boyfriend's 2nd. All things said, we can't wait to go back to Luna Blue. PROs: What we liked best about the hotel was the staff (Jaime & Alex) and the location. The staff was always friendly and their recommendations were always spot on. We tried venturing on our own to find places to eat, and every time we were disspointed. It's really a crapshoot unless you have a recommendation. We really enjoyed the bar and the bartender Jorge. The margaritas were particularly good. The location was unbeatable. Having transportation to and from the airport was very much appreciated. We had planned to rent a car, but luckily we didn't. In the past, we've stayed on the Riviera, where we were far away from everything. Luna Blue was within walking distance or a short cabride to everywhere we wanted to go. So we only ended up renting a car 1 day, and we did it through the hotel. No $1,000 deposit needed. They dropped off the car at the hotel and picked it up from there too. Normally renting a car in Mexico is pretty stressful because they put a $1,000 hold on your car, you have to take them at their word that they will not charge it and you worry about tons of other things. Since the owners of Luna Blue have a personal relationship with the car rental place, it made me feel much more comfortable about the whole process, and enabled us to continue on "vacation mode." Not having TV was great. My boyfriend actually read a book for the first time in a while. We both found great books in their library. Having purified drinking water & a fridge saved us a lot of money & hassle of always buying bottles of water & we were able to keep some thing in the fridge for breakfast & snacks. I loved having the 2 pet cats around, they made me feel more at home. The beds & pillows were the most comfortable I've had in Mexico. CON's: When we first arrived, we were a bit surprised by how small the room was. The next day I told one of the guys at the front desk and he walked me around to some of the other rooms. Except for the rooms with kitchens, they were all pretty small. Not having a "solid" door to the bathroom was our biggest complaint. It's a real door, but it has "slats" like a dressing room door. I don't want to get too detailed, but we would have preffered not hear hear each other's business in the bathroom. If you and your partner don't have those kinds of reservations-- maybe you do your business with the door open, then this likely won't bother you. The maids keep the doors of the rooms open when cleaning. This allows mosquitos to come in. One night we got several mosquito bites in the room, and could not understand how they got in. I am very sensitive to bites, and whever I would leave the room I'd put on lots of insect repellant and wear long linen pants & shirt. Mosquitoes don't seem to bother locals that much, but I hope the staff would be more sensitive about that in the future. We solved the problem by spraying Raid in the room, and leaving for a few hours. TIP: Don't get a room on the ground floor. You won't be able to open the curtains unless you want everybody to be able to see you and your room. Having the curtains closed all the time made the room feel dark & even smaller. All in all, the good far outweighs the bad at Luna Blue. We wouldn't stay anywhere else and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “It gets better every time!!”
Reviews.Author: christine_wla
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time at Luna Blue Hotel and I love it more and more every time. It just this great rustic charm that reminds me of why I love coming to Playa Del Carmen. The city has definitely gotten bigger and busier but Luna Blue reminds me of why I came to Mexico and love it so much. The location is still one of my favorite reasons for staying here as well as the friendly, helpful staff and the hospitality of the owners. I emailed Cheri regarding the dates I was interested in coming and she was so accommodating and quick to respond and as you all know, planning a vacation requires a lot of time and coordination so here prompt assistance definitely made that so much easier. They've added access to several new beach clubs which I still haven't had the pleasure of visiting because my friends and I love Mamitas Beach so much but hopefully we will have the opportunity in the near future. The swing bar is in full effect and definitely adds a very fun atmosphere to the hotel. I must say that I always feel very safe and secure staying here. The rooms are very clean and we made full use of our kitchen as we stayed in a deluxe suite which we loved very much. We found the rooms very comfortable. I've been to Playa Del Carmen many times but I must say that staying at the Luna Blue has made it feel so much more personal to me. The North End of Playa is getting more restaurants and shops so the location has become even more desirable. I only have wonderful thing to say about Luna Blue Hotel and know that I will definitely be returning there again. Thank you Cheri & Tony for another wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be in the rain!”
Reviews.Author: webejeepin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights a the Luna Blue and had an excellent time! This is a great place to stay, especially during the 3 days of rain that we had. There is no better place to drink Margaritas than on a swing at the Luna Blue bar. We met some really nice people during our short stay, and Tony and Cheri were very helpful in recommending places to eat and helping with transportation. And did I mention that Jorge makes a great Margarita? I recommend trying the Chorizo and Queso appetizer at the Hacienda La Herradura and the steak at HC Monterrey. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like Home!”
Reviews.Author: zjohnsons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure to stay at the Luna Blue a couple months back. It was my turn to pick a place to stay, so I did some research and landed here. To our delight it was all or more than expected. What a fun environment! The owners were the nicest people we met during our stay. Felt like we have know them forever. Can't say we are big drinkers but their outdoor bar was very fun. I just want to say thank you Cheri and Tony for a great stay and for all the advise for hott spots during our stay. If we ever get back your way..... We will stay with you! Dave & Erika Johnson

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Second Time Visit”
Reviews.Author: DeeGee
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to the Luna Blue and again we were more than pleased with our accommodations and the quaintness of this wonderful little boutique hotel . As we were there for four weeks this year, we did cook and both Walmart and Mega were within walking distance and were great for groceries as well as alcohol. We also shopped at DAC – a smaller local store that carries mainly fruits and veggies as well as a very nice selection of spices and condiments. We would pick up beer at the local OXXO store on the corner. Tony & Cheri are wonderful hosts and were so helpful in providing suggestions for new restaurants as well as instructions on how to travel on the collectivo which we used for the first time and we took it to both Tulum and Akumul. For Valentine’s Day we splurged and went to Casa Mediterranea which Cheri recommended and it was fantastic. Most meals we ate off 5th which are so much better and definitely cheaper! Our favorite is El Fogon on Constituents for Mexican – love the tacos al pastor and beef fahitas - Yolanda was our favorite waitress. There is a very nice bakery on the corner before you get to El Fogon that had wonderful pastries we would pick up to have with our coffee in the morning. We also went to La Pesca a few times and had the cazuela de cameron (shrimp casserole) also recommended by Tony & Cheri - it is absolutely wonderful and a local favorite– but be sure and order the shrimp as one time we got the seafood casserole which is still very good but the shrimp is so much better (very large servings, we had leftovers the first time and the second time shared one). Jamie at the front desk, who we remembered from last year, was so helpful with anything we needed as was Edgar. Another restaurant recommended by a couple we met at the beach is “10”- which is around the corner from the Luna Blue north a couple of blocks on 5th. Unbelievable “Outside Skirt” steak – so tasty and tender. On our last morning, we went to La Cueva del Chango – a wonderful little restaurant on Calle 38 –we had a fantastic breakfast and wished we had gone there sooner. Luna Blue has a lovely swing up bar with music three times a week which shuts down at 11pm. Although we are not bar scene people, we did enjoy a couple of drinks at the bar and especially the Mardi Gras evening. We did thoroughly enjoy sitting on our balcony in the evenings, having a glass of wine and listening to Brent Parkin whose music we preferred to Mike Grabow. Beach passes were provided to Mamitas beach club any time we wanted to go, but you needed to go early if you wanted a Palapa or Umbrella. Chairs were usually available throughout the day but I need to have shade, so we had to get there early. We would not hesitate in recommending the Luna Blue – perfect little hotel in a fantastic location with wonderful owners.

Reviews.Title: “back for third time, better than ever”
Reviews.Author: timmind
Reviews.Content: Out of the hundreds of little hotels in Playa, and we have stayed in several others, Luna Blue is the place we now choose. And this time it's better than ever, with free wi fi (which can be accessed from your room, or better yet, the pretty tropical courtyard), a continental breakfast in the morning with excellent coffee, choice of teas, and MASSIVE, DELICIOUS muffins (the same ones sold at the tony Ah Cacao cafe), excellent security, friendly helpful staff, convenient to the best neighborhood for dozens of excellent restaurants, bars, and shops; laundry across the street, OXXO on the corner, easy to catch a taxi, passes to your choice of 3 beach clubs: Wicky's (right in town), Mamita's (close by, more of a party beach) and Blue Cacao (amazing, decadent, good food, on an empty stretch of beach), nice little bar with top shelf drinks, rooms all have cute balconies for lounging...and last but not least, proprietors Tony and Cherie and their staff, always ready with great, honest recommendations for things to see and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gardens, waterfalls, privacy and complete relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: HotMamaGee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Playa on several occassions, staying in AI's and renting condos. No complaints about the AI's or the condos, they were wonderful as well, and we certainly enjoyed our visits! This time we were ready for another adventure, and we are extremely glad we chose the Luna Blue Hotel and Garden. We read many reviews on Tripadvisor and looked the hotel up on Google earth, and went to the website often, so felt we had plenty of information. We had Sheri and Tony book our transportation, both to and from Cancun airport, we chose the shared type. The driver was right at the airport with our name on a sign, so no difficulty finding him. We shared the trip to Playa with three other couples and our return was by ourselves. Edgar greeted us in the lobby and did the remainder of the paperwork pleasantly and quickly. We paid the remainder of our hotel bill, left a deposit for the safety deposit box, all the while looking at the beautiful garden and listening to the waterfalls. Luna Blue requires a deposit on the key for the safety deposit box , which was returned our last day. We also saw the resident cats, Frankie and Oszo. Edgar carried our luggage up the two outdoor stairways, to our room, which was a Tropical Hideaway. Just to mention, even in most AI's, you don't have elevators, unless they are highrises. The room was spotless, white tiles on the floor, blue curtains with backing for all of the windows and sliding glass door. There was a queen bed, two night tables with a drawer and closed cupboard in them, a two lighted lamp on both tables, and a wicker chair. The wardrobe had two bottom drawers, a place to hang clothes, with plenty of hangers, another shelf, with the safe securely attached to the wall. There was plently of room in the safe for passports, wallets, cell phones, cameras and a notebook, ( small laptop). There was a bar frig, it had plenty of room for cervazas, wine, pop, juice, fruit etc, and a storage shelf over the frig. The water bottle, full sized sat in a dispenser onto of the frig.The bathroom, had a counter around the sink and another smaller shelf to put toiletries on. The shower had a small opening, but would accomodate two, it had a built in shelf as well. I really liked the unique towel rack and tissue holder! We had a private balcony, with two chairs, a table with a candle on it. We were right up amongst beautiful flowering trees and had three chirping geckos to keep us company! We saw many beautiful birds, while sitting on our balconey, even saw some humming birds! We were able to get beach passes everyday, there were three choices of beaches. We didn't go to Wickys at all and went once to Blucacao. The day we went to Blucacao, we took a cab, there and arranged to have our driver return at a given time to take us back. The beach there is beautiful and the facilities were very nice, with a water wall in the eating area and an infinity pool. They supplied our towels and we were able to get drinks and snacks/meals there. It would be roughly a 40 min walk from Mamitas beach, along the beach to Blucacao. We spent the rest of our beach time at Mamitas, a short walk from Luna Blue. You could also have drinks, snacks/meals there. Each day Edgar or Jamie would give us beach passes, for two loungers and an umbrella. We would also get fresh beach towels in the morning, return them in the afternoon and get towel cards. There was 100 peso deposit for each towel and that was returned on our last day. Our room was cleaned each and every day, while we were gone. The maids left towel animals on our bed, we received, two bath towels, two washcloths, a hand towel and bath mat each day. The bar was open each day, we enjoyed drinks there with friends.Jorge does make an excellent margarita, as well as various other drinks. There was live enterment Tues, Wed and Friday evenings, but at eleven PM, the bar closed. We enjoyed sitting on our balconey, with a glass of wine and listening to the live music. It wasn't open on Sundays at all. Liquor is only sold between 10 and 5 on Sundays, but you can order it in restaurants. There were coupons in the lobby to a variety of restaurants. Sheri and Tony had great ideas for different types of restaurants. La Pesca, Babe's Noodles, La Divina Comida, La Vagabunda, Karen's, Los Comolos, and Cafe Sasta, were a few we enjoyed. There is a wine store just east on Calle 26, called On the Vine, we sat there one evening with friends. We also bought our wine there, they would open the cork for us, then recork it for us to bring back, I forgot to bring a corkscrew. There is Mega, Super Walmart to buy groceries, but we used the Oxxo and local stores to buy our drinks and food. We brought an iphone with us for texts and emails. We were able to pick up the WiFi best in the bar. There was also a gym around the corner and my husband bought a pass to use during our stay, very reasonable. The Luna Blue is quiet, clean, friendly and a wonderful place to get away from the hectic day to day world. We really enjoyed our stay, we were able to relax, do what we wanted to do, when we wanted to, no schedules! We had the privacy we wanted, in beautiful surroundings for a very reasonable price! We would recommend the Luna Blue to travellers, who want to get away from it all! On a note, our friends staying at an AI were able to visit us and come up to our room and balcony. We were only allowed at their AI in the lobby, after explaining to the guard why we wanted to visit, although we do understand this for security reasons. Thank you Sheri, Tony, Edgar, Jamie, Jorge, and the ladies for a wonderful visit. Until next time......

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a second home....but in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Maddison1002
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue is exceptional in quality, price and comfort. The owners, Tony and Cheri, go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and a guest and as part of the Luna Blue family. The hotel is of 18 rooms, so cozy and quaint with a beautiful courtyard and bar with swings and the famous bartender Jorge. All the staff at this hotel go out of their way to make you feel so welcome. If you ever need dinner recommendations, directions, advice on shopping, the staff will gladly help with all of this. I have stayed here twice and have two more trips booked at the Luna Blue. Why go looking elsewhere when you've found all you could hope for in a hotel? Love it and love the staff. Highly highly recommend this affordable hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Gabi2010
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel right in the heart of Playa del Carmen. We stayed in one of the smaller rooms on the main floor and it was just perfect. There was a bit of street noise and noisy birds at night, but they certainly didn[t keep me from a good night{s sleep. The outdoor garden/patio is just lovely, as is the bar with the swinging chairs. Luna Blue is in a great location, just off 5th Ave. We loved staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful "hidden gem" in Playa”
Reviews.Author: grhorton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided we wanted a little different experience than the big resort - all inclusive vacation and so glad we did. Many good things have been said about Luna Blue and I won't repeat. Just a few things that stuck out for us. Location was just right - not at the busy end of things on the strip, but nice and close to everything still. Walking to good restaurants and beach a short walk. Mamita's beach club worked out very well for us though you need to reserve a chair with towel by 9:30am or so as it was crowded. The hotel was exactly what we wanted. Nice clean room with great view of the reception and garden area. We had terrace room and enjoyed being up, but some might not want the steps. The swing bar was open till around 11pm, so if you like to go to bed a little early, you will be a part of the party for a while, but not a problem for us. We found the front desk people helpful, but you need to ask if you have questions. Wireless internet was fine in the reception and garden areas and sometimes around our room. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at Luna Blue and look forward to going back. Couple quick tips - Beach - They have agreement with another beach club called Blucacau (sp?) and we enjoyed going an afternoon there. You can walk as we did, but be ready for a good 45min or more walk though along the beach one way. Eating - We enjoyed going to several local eating spots for both lunch and dinner. One special dinner was ALUX which is in a cavern. It has a bar area and dinner area. Take a taxi though as area around it is not so good, but only about 10 min from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay, this time with Friends”
Reviews.Author: snowtoosun
Reviews.Content: Better late than never, considering we’ve been going to Playa for more than 13 years and have yet to take the time to do write a trip report. This was our second stay at Luna Blue and again it was everything we expected. This time we brought 3 other couples with us. This happened to be the first trip to Play for the other couples. They have however traveled to many other parts of Mexico and the Caribbean. Like us they have spent most of there travels in big resorts and All-inclusive so before we left I described in great detail that the hotel was small quaint and very modest compared to the big resorts they have been accustomed to. They loved it!! They felt their rooms met all their needs and were always clean. They along with us loved the feeling of being in my honest opinion the heart of the best part of Playa which is the north side. Any time we needed any advice on places to eat off the beaten path Cheri always had a great idea and seemed to be very happy to share her knowledge of the area. We spent most of our Beach time at Mamittas which is just a short walk to the beach. On one of our days we took a cab to Bluecacao. I loved this place it had a great infinity pool and the wait staff was 3 to 1 so we felt completely pampered. The beach was beautiful and practically deserted. I wish we would have tried that beach club sooner as I would have spent another day there. Oh well we always have next year. It was really nice to have a bar at the hotel to either start our night out or end it with having a night cap. The live entertainment was really quite good. All in all this hotel is very quaint, comfortable and clean I would never hesitate to recommend this establishment to anyone. Thanks Luna Blue for another great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Take me back to Luna Blue!!!”
Reviews.Author: cgfetch
Reviews.Content: We returned last night from 6 nights at Luna Blue. It was a pretty darn near perfect vacation. The staff was always available and responded pronto to anything we needed. Though being able to walk 10 or 15 steps to coffee in the morning would have been ideal, the market on the corner (50 steps?) had delicious coffee for about $1 for a tall. Sitting out on our patio listening to the birds, feeling the breeze, saying hello to our Luna-mates, drinking coffee.....sweet! We were traveling with our 17 year old daughter and her 18 year old girl friend. Spring break in Playa is a world of difference than spring break in Cancun (been there; done that!) We were very comfortable with them coming and going as they pleased (curfew in place.) We previewed the local clubs and felt (after long talks about don't do this, don't do that) they were safe on their own. They met a lot of other kids from all over the world some of whom we had the opportunity to meet on the beach later. I can safely say the girls loved their trip! and have lots of stories to tell their friends back home. Back to Luna Blue.... having entertainment 3 nights a week was a bonus. The bar scene just lively enough and closes up early (11 pm). Knowing the outside gates are locked at 11pm also a plus. (Truly, the place begins to feel like home away from home and in the tropics!) We were in a ground floor unit facing the courtyard. It was cool enough 4 out of 6 nights we slept with our door and windows open. We love that there is NO TV and hope that never changes! I like that there are purified water dispensers in the rooms instead of using disposable bottles. The rooms are squeaky clean and refreshed daily. Beds comfortable, good pillows. Plenty of hot water. The water pressure in our daughter's room was low; something to do with the cistern. Wicky's was the perfect place to spend the day. Good food (fish tacos to die for!), good service, good music. We thought we would have access to the swimming pool but that was not to be. It's an easy taxi ride to Blue Cacao and we spent one day there. It's quiet, the swimming pool is refreshing and the food is very good (Yellow Fin Tuna Tostada best thing I've ever eaten.) We will definitely return to Playa and Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Atmosphere And Service”
Reviews.Author: rpstinso
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue was our choice based on previous Trip Advisor reviews and it did not disappoint. The staff was great, they even helped us with a little inconvinience that we had on Cozumel. The atmoshpere and location were great.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip back”
Reviews.Author: ehy2kBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Imagine returning to a place you had had one of your most relaxing vacations ever. You would hope that the expectations would at least meet your previous experience. This return did, and more. Our room was exactly as we expected: clean, well-appointed with what we needed, and quiet. The "more" happened when we were greeted by Jaime, who was so gracious, warm, and welcoming, that we were immediately put at ease after a long journey. Later on, when the bar opened, we headed over to say hi to Jorge, who remembered us, and extending his hand said, "Welcome home". Wow. :) We choose a garden deluxe room again, which offers a nice kitchenette, fully equipped with pots, pans, utensils, even a toaster, coffee maker, and blender. Our room was tucked away in the deepest corner of the hotel, a cozy nook where the trees formed a beautiful natural screen allowing us to look out toward the courtyard, but allowing for privacy. Really, this room had everything you could want for a what we now call our "home away from home". Mornings started with a cup of coffee on our private patio, which had a bistro set with two chairs. Tropical birds, the sound of the waterfall around the bend replaced our normal morning background sound of the TV, which (thankfully!) this room does not have. I mean, who watches TV in Playa del Carmen? There are plenty of reviews here about Luna Blue, most of which will outline what's available, the rooms, location, and all the things that people take into consideration when making a reservation. For those people, I will say that The Luna Blue has clean, well-maintained rooms with very good, basic amenities, plus a little more. But, please consider this, if you're after the more "all inclusive" resort experience, there might be other places for you. The Luna Blue is a place to "drop out" from the everyday mundane life and to allow yourself clear your head. The desk staff are amazing: they can give you plenty of suggestions of places to explore Playa and the surrounding area, but also know that many of us like to make our own way, and so are not in the least bit overbearing. The other thing people need to keep in mind is that when you travel to Playa del Carmen, you need to be open to the fact that you are not in the US, or where ever else you live, and that there are immutable facts that come with this spot on the planet: It's on the edge of a jungle, so that means there is wildlife such as birds who like to sing rather vigorously in the AM (although I see more animals in my suburban neighbourhood in New England); various aspects of the town's infrastructure may not meet your expectations, either, such as water-pressure, which seems to surprise many visitors. Also, Spanish is the first language of nearly all the people in Playa del Carmen, so it would help to be more patient when communicating, as well as encountering another's cultural perspective. To close this, let me say that we are planning our next trip back. We come here because it allows us to make our own party, so to speak. Each night at the swing bar in the courtyard, we met people from all over, no crowds of spring-break students, and above all, the village atmosphere that needs to kept in a town that at times, seems to be bursting at the seams. Luna Blue, stay your wonderful, tranquil self, and we'll see you next spring.

Reviews.Title: “perfect little getaway spot”
Reviews.Author: laurelann
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue was everything I could have hoped for and more! I had a feeling that it would be my kind of place, but I really feel like I've found a new home away from home. I wound up on my own this trip, so my Garden View Deluxe room was huge - would be great for a couple and would easily sleep three or four. The kitchen and bathroom were immaculate, and the fresh water was a real treat - some hotels will provide drinking water in the lobby which is a pain when you need to brush your teeth and forgot to refill the night before! I liked the cool, minimal decor and the comfy hammock. Shower had great water pressure and hot water when I was there. Housekeeping was attentive and thorough, and towel art is always enjoyable :-) The staff was great - Jaime at the front desk helped my friend find his hotel, then provided me with a flashlight, candle and matches when the power went out just minutes after my arrival. Tony was my lifesaver when my flight home was canceled - he helped me call my airline, and then arranged for a discounted room at another hotel since the Luna Blue was (sadly!) fully booked. And with that I was able to relax and enjoy my bonus day at the beach! Wifi was strong on my patio and in all the outdoor areas I used it in. The bar is a really fun hangout with a strong expat clientele and Jorge's reputation as a fantastic bartender is well deserved :-) The live music was great - rock & blues - and ended at 11pm each evening. The Luna Blue provides passes and/or discounts to four beach clubs, which is more than I've seen from any other hotel (I highly recommend their newest addition, the Canibal Royal) and will help provide any transportation you might need. Tony & Cheri work hard to provide a fun and laid back environment. They go to great lengths on their website and in emails to clarify what kind of place they are - and more importantly, what they are not. If you have trouble with stairs, if you feel you must have a TV in your room, if you need absolute quiet - this probably isn't the place for you. However, it will be the perfect place for outgoing, fun-seeking folks who want to make new friends and experience a place with a little bit of a local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Tropical Paradise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thrumyeyes
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Playa del Carmen and we spent alot of time on the internet researching accommodations (by a lot I mean 11 hours). We decided to book a hotel as opposed to a resort because we planned on renting a car so we could travel and take in the sites of Mexico. We found this small quaint hotel on the tripadvisor website that was located in the heart of Playa del Carmen that ranked 18 out of 181 hotels at a very affordable price. It looked like an absolute tropical paradise. After reading the reviews and viewing the video and pictures of the hotel we decided this was the place to be. Upon our arrival, we were greeted at the front desk by their friendly and courteous staff. We had the opportunity to stay in three different rooms at the hotel all of which were amazing and very clean. Our favourite is the treetop (#36). We were in paradise the moment we walked in and it has the most incredible balcony. No tvs in these rooms and trust me when I say none are required. The rooms all have a small bar fridge which was very handy and unlimited bottled water. Next there’s the Luna Blue bar. We enjoyed many nights sitting on the bar swings enjoying the entertainment. Jorge the bartender always makes sure everyone is having a good time. It’s called “tequila”. Need I say more. My favorite drink however is the Playa Coloda. I’ve had plenty of pina coladas in my day and this is by far my favorite. We were also fortunate enough to hear Mike Grabow play while we were there and he was awesome. Lenny the dog also did a great job entertaining the crowd. The bar closes at 11:00 pm so none of the guests are inconvenienced by noise. There are fantastic restaurants, a beach and great shopping all within walking distance of the hotel. The staff were very helpful in recommending choice locations. No disappointments! We just can’t say enough about the Luna Blue. We loved it so much we are planning a trip back in a few months. To close this review we just want to say “thank you” to Cheri and Tony (the owners) for their hospitality and to all the wonderful staff at the Luna Blue for making our vacation such a memorable one. We hope to see you all very soon.

Reviews.Title: “VACATION PERFECTION!”
Reviews.Author: VaporTrailOne
Reviews.Content: Tony & Cheri and the staff at the Luna Blue have provided the perfect vacation destination for adult couples to enjoy. The entire athmosphere is tranquil yet festive. The rooms are clean, comfortable and cozy. The location is excellent. The service is outstanding. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, but highly overrated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bishopsRobes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights here after seeing the Trip Advisor ratings and photos of this hotel. To our disappointment, we found the Luna Blue to be average in every regard except price, which was expensive for the area and for the quality of the room and service. We booked a Treetop Terrace with a private balcony. If you decide to stay here, don't bother with the Treetop Terrace. Your balcony view is meager and nearby construction is loud and constant. Plus, the stairs to your room are many and steep -- we're in our early 30's and very athletic; I can't imagine an older (or out-of-shape) couple hiking these steps multiple times a day. The room itself had a hard bed and several hangers in an small, open wardrobe, which was infested with termites or small ants. The safe was tiny, and the lock on the room's door was not going to keep anyone but the mosquitoes out. Bring earplugs if you like to sleep-in, because construction is on-going. The bathroom was minimalist, which is fine, but the water pressure was weak and shower curtain too small -- we mopped up puddles after each shower. The free water is from a 5-gallon jug, so be sure you have your own water bottles to fill for the beach. The air conditioner was small and loud, but it worked. The artwork in the room was just plain creepy. I know the owners defend it as local artwork, but we didn't appreciate how the eyes of the freaky looking lady followed us throughout the room. Luna Blue does have pretty "oasis" grounds. Though when I sat in the garden with my laptop, since the free wi-fi signal didn't reach our room, I quickly left due to the abundance of mosquitoes. The shady, wet "oasis" area is an obvious breeding ground. The swing bar in the lobby is cute, but drinks are over-priced and seating is limited. We enjoyed the novelty of it, but there are many better bar options nearby. Maid service was good, so no complaints there. Front desk service was not helpful nor interested, but they did offer basic information when we asked. The Mamitas beach club was crowded, even though our visit was during the off season. Beach chairs were limited, and we found the people there to be largely unhelpful -- even though we had the Luna Blue partner coupons. Overall, the Luna Blue is an average hotel in every way, and I'm amazed it gets such high marks on Trip Advisor. There are MANY other options nearby that are just as good, if not better, and much cheaper. Based on our experience, I do not recommend the Luna Blue to folks visiting Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis in the heart of Playa”
Reviews.Author: zoecatva
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we chose the Luna Blue for our first visit to Playa del Carmen. The hotel has a great location. It is at the end of 5th Avenue, but that just gave us an excuse to get exercise and have to walk a few blocks to get anywhere. It was not a problem at all. Plus, it is at the quieter end of the action which is nice. Also, very easy walk to the beach. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially when hauling my suitcase up to one of the treetop rooms. Our room was basic and just fine for our stay. It was great having a fridge and water. I loved the open shower too. We also enjoyed the balcony and the view of all of the trees and birds. Very relaxing to sit and play cards. The room was very clean and neat. Yes, the beds were hard, but I actually liked that and after a long day, i hardly noticed. Also, the AC and the fan kept the room very cool. The only thing I wished is that there was more room to store clothes. Maybe we just packed too much! The grounds of the Luna Blue are quite lovely and very well kept. If you like cats, there are a couple of very cute ones hanging around and they don't bother you at all. The bar was always a happening place and had live music two of the nights we stayed there which was a great addition. There are tons of restaurants around the the hotel, with about every type of food you could imagine. Also, convenience stores are nearby and it is not a far walk up to the Walmart or bigger grocery store if you need supplies. There are always taxis available right near the hotel if you need transportation. A couple of recommendations, we loved 100% natural for breakfast and I picked up a business card of Yaxche at the hotel and it was wonderful, one of the best meals we had and we got free margaritas. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. I thought for the price it was a great value, especially if you are not into the all inclusive resorts, which we are not.

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never!”
Reviews.Author: crossmen1021
Reviews.Content: Snowing here in New Jersey so finally, Cherie, writing a review. Luna Blue was an absolutely wonderful place to stay; convenient to everything.
