The staff was courteous and helpful, amazing bartender and drinks, and the owners made my partner and I feel right at home. The courtyard/gardens are absolutely beautiful and serene to look at and or sit in. The rooms and grounds are immaculately kept. Room rates are very reasonable for a boutique hotel of this type. Many good places to eat within walking distance, especially right across the street where there is a wonderful little restaurant serving tapas and larger plates for a very reasonable price - the owner and servers of this restaurant couldnt do enough for us. But , back to Luna Blue--if you want a peaceful, restful place to stay, that has a great bar, and provides beach passes to Mamitas, one half block off the main drag but north enough to not be in the heart of the "tourist" area, then we highly recoomend this hotel - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sivan_br
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue Hotel & Garden is a little oasis in wonderful Playa Del Carmen. This hotel is ideal because it is tucked away on the quieter end of 5th Avenue, so you don't have the madness, the noise, the swarms of tourists, and the inability to find good cheap food outside your door. At the same time, it is right on 5th Avenue (the quieter / better end), so you have plenty of places to eat, drink, shop, and relax right nearby, and within a 5-10 minute walk you are in the heart of the bustling, touristy part of 5th Avenue. After exploring much of downtown Playa, including the cheap eats off the beaten path, all parts of 5th Avenue, most of the highest rated restaurants on TripAdvisor, a snorkeling trip, the Playa beaches, and a day trip to Tulum, my boyfriend and I were in total agreement that we had lucked out and chosen THE best place to stay in Playa. As for the hotel itself, it is small and quaint. You must arrive expecting a little bungalow environment - a small but totally adequate room with a small but totally adequate bathroom, a lovely and relaxing balcony overlooking a green lush garden, and a purified water bottle in your room so you always have free drinking water (and face-washing water, and tooth brushing water, and hand-washing water, if you're paranoid about the local water like we were!). There is no TV, but why would you want to spoil a tropical vacation in paradise with a TV? Luna Blue does offer free wi-fi if you bring your laptop. We did, and we got a lot of use out of it, though the reception in our room was pretty poor so we did most of our internet surfing on the balcony. While we did this we enjoyed the beautiful garden, the sound of running water in the little pond, we watched bats fly through the trees at dusk, and we heard birds nesting and chirping in the thatch roof above our heads. As for the birds, they're loud. I don't think this is unique to Luna Blue, but since there is a garden with tons of trees, you also get tons of birds. BRING EARPLUGS if you want to sleep in quietly in the morning! You may also consider a sleep mask if you like it dark in the morning. Still, the sound of birds is a lot better than the sound of techno music and drunken tourists, which is what you'll get if you stay anywhere near the main part of the strip. Oh, and Luna Blue also has a few of its own local cats cutely sleeping at reception. The owners are cat lovers and are helping to support local strays. We loved it. The hotel staff were great. The maids came every day, but never before 11:00 a.m., cleaned the place well, and left fun and lovely sculptures made of clean towels on our bed. Edgar at the front desk was extremely helpful and sent us in the right direction for good cheap food, good cheap international calling, and just about everything else we asked him about. The other front desk man was not quite as helpful - he didn't speak English as well and he didn't know any of the places we asked him about - but Edgar was at the front desk most of the time. With your stay at Luna Blue you get two-for-one margaritas at the Luna Blue bar and free access (including chairs and umbrellas) to two nearby beaches. One beach - Mamitas, I believe, is right near the hotel, and is lovely. However, on the weekends you must get there before 10:00 a.m. if you want an umbrella. We did not, so we sat at the restaurant instead. We are too white for total sun exposure! We cannot recommend Luna Blue Hotel enough. The value, the location, the staff, the atmosphere - we couldn't have had a better experience. If you do take advantage of this great spot, let us recommend our favorite nearby eateries: Nativo (good, cheap, authentic, lots of vegetarian options), El Fogon (good, cheap, authentic, but you have to speak Spanish or have a good dictionary to order food here), La Cueva Del Chango (great atmosphere, decent prices, good-to-great food, vegetarian options), 100% Natural (decent prices, great food, tons of options, lots of vegetarian options), and Las Cazuelas De Espana (right across from Luna Blue, with one of the best Spanish Tortilla / omelets I've ever had). May we also recommend an amazing dive shop: Mexico Blue Dream, located a few short blocks from Luna Blue. Ask for Elliot, he's a great guide. OK, we hope you take our advice, avoid tourist pitfalls, and enjoy Luna Blue Hotel and Garden as much as we did!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just as billed...a tropical garden paradise steps off 5th Ave...fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Cyclepei
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in a Garden View Deluxe room from Jan. 13-27, 2010. We did not want an all-inclusive resort and Luna Blue fit the bill perfectly. Our room had a kitchenette and we discovered the Mega store on 30th Ave. and stocked the fridge and freezer. The Mega has a fabulous bakery dept. and with the coffee maker in the room (we brought our own coffee) we had wonderful breakfasts each morning on our deck. The garden is beautiful and it is so peaceful it is hard to believe that the Luna Blue is just steps off 5th Ave. There were so many restaurants we wanted to try, but we ran out of time. Our favourite lunch was at La Route des Vines, just a block away. The best brushetta we had was at the little lasagna place around the corner on 10th Ave, and the best authentic Mexican we had was across the street from the Mega, next door to HC Monterrey Steak House (where we also had a fabulous steak dinner). Our room was very comfortable and exceptionally clean. There was plenty of hot water and water pressure in the shower. There is no phone, no TV, and no swimming pool. This suited us perfectly as we were on vacation and wanted none of the above. Apparently there is Internet access (but not in the rooms), but we did not need it as we left the laptop at home. Each day we were given vouchers for a beach chair each and a palapa umbrella for Mamita's Beach Club. We also took advantage of the beach towels available from the hotel for a $10 deposit. The beach was wonderful for swimming although we had a few windy days when it got a little rough. The highlight of our trip was taking the taxi and going to the Blu Cacao Beach Club. Mamita's was busy and quite crowded, but we virtually had the Blu Cacao to ourselves. Lying on a big beach bed staring out at the Caribbean Sea with a beach in front of us with no one on it - we had to pinch ourselves to make sure we were not dreaming. If you like peace and quiet this is the place to go. Food and drink a little more expensive than Mamita's, and of course there is the cost of the taxi, but well worth it in our opinion. There is live music at the bar about 4 nights a week. Sometimes we chose to enjoy the entertainment, but on nights we chose not to, we found that the sound of the air conditioner muffled it, and as it only lasted til 11 p.m. this was not an issue for us. The staff was very helpful in suggesting restaurants and helping us with anything we asked for or about. If you are looking for a reasonable hotel, close to the action and the beach this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “So Quaint - must I wait? (to go back)”
Reviews.Author: DynamoDenver
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue is a small, charming hotel with a beautiful garden and a great bar. If you want to experience Playa del Carmen in a quaint environment, I would recommend it. We found it convenient, clean, pretty, and very friendly workers. Would not hesitate to return or to recommend it to anyone. Beautiful, peaceful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, peaceful garden, friendly staff, and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: happybeacher
Reviews.Content: We've been to Playa del Carmen a few times, and every time we find more to love. On this trip we loved every minute of our 10 day stay at the Luna Blue Hotel: Charming, clean, comfortable, functional room with fridge and water dispenser. Quiet upper balcony with thatched roof overlooking the beautiful gardens was the perfect start and end to each day. Owners and staff are very friendly and helpful. Wonderful neighborhood, convenient location for exploring Playa del Carmen. Oxxo on the corner, numerous dining options for any budget within strolling distance. Easy walk to everything: Mega, collectivos, ferry, all the beaches - central or N end. Beach Clubs: we used their passes a few times for Mamitas and Blue Cacao. Mamitas - busy, fun, convenient. Blue Cacao - quiet and relaxing, great service. We loved the walk to and from along the beach (approx 40 min leisurely stroll). Other beaches: Central beach: Lunch at Wicky's and the afternoon at the beach club (free use of their chairs) Collectivo to Akumal Beach Collectivo to Tulum, then taxi to El Paraiso Beach - this is beach lover's heaven. The Luna Blue website is very representative of what type of accommodation they provide, and for us, it was perfect! We spent many mornings exploring the neighborhoods and beaches in Playa del Carmen, and the Luna Blue Hotel is a great location for wanderers! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Basic Playa del Carmen Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YupiYey
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty Basic hotel. It didn't have many of the things we are used in an hotel room, like a TV. But honestly, being in Playa del Carmen, Who needs a TV set on the room, when you can go out and enjoy the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Where I want to be...”
Reviews.Author: stargazer21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our first trip to Playa, and we stayed at the Luna Blue on the recommendation of my sister and brother in law, who were traveling with us and had stayed in this little slice of paradise before. They had promised us for months that no amount of pics and talking could really make us understand the charm of Luna Blue, and they were right. We spent a week, and we felt like we were home within the first minutes of stepping through the gate. The wonderful staff at the desk (and I feel awful for forgetting his name!), greeted our taxis when we pulled up, and helped us with a quick check in and getting our luggage upstairs (that we brought way too much of! Thanks guys!). We stayed in room 9, the Treetop room and were immediately smiling when we saw the place. Bright colours, spotless, full water jug and a stunning view of the gardens (with real coconuts in the tree right off the balcony!). We had a full bath, complete with a huge tub where you could look out at the Caribbean sky while showering, yet had total privacy. The room was kept very clean and fresh the entire time, by the friendly cleaning staff that went about their jobs quietly (a problem we've had at lots of other places is housekeeping staff making a lot of noise in the wee hours). I saw maybe 2 ants the entire week and not a single flying critter...pretty good for a tiny jungle! Our bed was very comfy, and for what was supposed to be a smaller room, it was plenty big for the two of us. The front desk staff was great, and helped us with transportation and taught us what taxis should cost us, supplied us with fresh beach towels and helped us with our Spanish...always with a great attitude and a smile. Cheri told us about a great snorkeling spot that, in spite of all our research, had never heard of...and we were blown away! Her and Tony are great hosts! We were greeted and treated like family. And then there's the famous (infamous?) Jorge and the Luna Blue Bar. What can I say...sitting on a swing in that place, sipping a Sarita B Careful, listening to Jimmy Buffett quietly in the background while visiting with new and not so new friends was paradise in and of itself. We were fortunate enough to be there on a night where Mike Grabrow was performing, and had the time of our lives! A party that I'm sure won't be forgotten by anyone in attendance for a long time! But lest anyone be worried about the revelry going on too late...true to their words, we shut it down around 11ish and transformed back to a quiet little jungle. Jorge makes sure that everyone is happy and loving life as much as he does. We felt safe and totally taken care of during our stay. Gates are locked at night, with only guests having a key to the little "mouse door" to come in late and leave early. We would get up early, take a quick walk to Starbucks (yeah, I know. There's better coffee to be had. What can I say? I'm an addict.) and sit in the garden in the morning, planning our day and updating our Facebook pages to drive all our cold friends back home insane. The gorgeous beach is only a short walk away, and the Mamitas passes were well used during our trip (and it's a very cool beach club, btw....we loved it and we tried a lot of different ones during our stay!). 5th Ave is a block away fro shopping and great food and bars. There are only two things I would alert other folks about. There is some construction going on next door, but they seem to start pretty late (like after 9 or so). We only heard them once, when we had slept in (probably the day after the Mike Grabow concert), so you may wish to bring earplugs if you sleep late. We never did hear the construction while we were in the garden. It's just a part of PDC life right now. Also, as awesome as our room was, I wouldn't recommend it for anyone with mobility issues. See, it's the Treetop Room...meaning it's up high, above the trees. That last flight of stairs was a beast some nights, seeing as we are actually older than we think we are. But there are plenty of ground level rooms that we can't wait to try next time! All in all...I would say we liked it. :-) Tony and Cheri have a great, simple little place that allows you to rediscover yourself. You may not have a 5 star buffet at your beck and call...but your soul will be fed. And in my opinion, that's the most important meal. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place But Disappointed In Service”
Reviews.Author: Lindy_Rig_10
Reviews.Content: After a very long day of travel my wife and I were both relieved and excited when we finally reached Luna Blue. As we approached the front desk, Hieme slowly got up front the back room and made his way to us. After a moment of looking at us, he asked "Yes??" As if two people coming in off the street with suitcases wasn't a tip-off. A simple Hello, or Hola, or maybe even a Welcome would have gone a long way. I told him we were here to check in and he proceeded to find our keys and show us our room in a very uninterested manner. I thought maybe he was having a bad night and gave him the benefit of doubt. The next day and basically the whole week was more of the same. In general the staff seemed kind of burnt out and it felt like you were bugging them to ask a question or get your beach passes. The one rare time when the owner Tony was around, Hiemi perked up a little and made some dinner recommendations. The maid service was very nice and kept the rooms very clean. We also thought Mike was fun and his live music was good. Also, Rick and his dog Lenny were great. In general we liked the place and would even like to come back if the vibe from the staff improved. This is a quote from a Luna Blue email correspondence: "We are American owned and family operated. As the on-site owners, we and our staff personally see to your comfort and enjoyment, providing a level of service and care that is not found in larger hotels. We also love to assist newcomers in the adventure of exploring Playa del Carmen with its many varied and interesting activities, restaurants, clubs and bars. We can tell you where the best tamales, burgers and steaks can be had for a song. " I guess we just didn't see this at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for a non-all inclusive oasis”
Reviews.Author: adanac55
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a non-all inclusive hotel in a tropical destination. It was a wonderful experience and we were so glad we found the Luna Blue on this site. Location - It's on a quiet street just off 5th avenue so we were close to all the action (restaurants, bars, shopping, beach) but away from all the noise. Totally safe area. We always felt comfortable. Perfect spot to be for a home base for the week. It really did feel like our tropical home. Management and Staff - The owners are from the U.S and introduced themselves to us. We liked the personal touch and had never had that happen in our past traveling experiences. They were very helpful about directing us to places we wanted to see. The staff that work for them at the hotel are a dedicated group and friendly. Room - We had a Tropical Hideaway room on the first floor. Our balcony was spacious and we spent many romantic evenings by candle light sitting and enjoying a drink while viewing the wonderful garden. We could hear the waterfall in the distance and we felt like we had found paradise in Playa Del Carmen. Often we chatted with our neighbors who have been to the hotel multiple times. We can see why they keep returning! The room was bigger than I imagined and had lots of natural light. It was always clean and we enjoyed the natural decor of wooden towel racks and a rope type toilet paper holder. They even had luxury toilet paper we have not seen even in a 5 star hotel. Nice touch. Great big shower and irregular shape with cool tiles and it had good water pressure with nice hot water when ever we used it. Towels were plush and big and the bedding was comfortable. We used the water cooler and fridge and kept snacks and drinks in our room that we purchased from the store across the road or the big Mega grocery store a few blocks away. We had no trouble making ice for our drinks too. It was a good size and held large tall bottles on wine etc. Just remember to bring your own plastic cups or what ever you need to eat off or drink in. The maid did a great job keeping the room clean. Air conditioning ran perfectly and there was a ceiling fan too. You can open the windows too if you want when the air is off. We hardly used the air conditioner. It had a remote that worked quite well. We were so glad there was no T.V or phone. There was a digital clock on the bedside table. We did use our laptop computer and made use of the free WiFi. No problems with connection as long as we stayed near the deck but our room was near the lobby. We had no bugs in our room. We did have the odd mosquito that flew in when we left our door open but keep in mind it is a garden setting and we only saw 2 the whole week and they are very small. If you want to see big mosquitoes then come to cottage country in the Muskoka area of Ontario, Canada and I'll show you mossies that could consume a large cat. I have no idea why someone would complain about mossies at Luna Blue. Take it from someone who has traveled a lot...there is no problem at this hotel with insects that would bother you here. Hotel Layout and Grounds - This place looks so much nicer in real life than in the photos. It is a whole experience of sound, colour, texture and beauty. All the rooms seem to view towards the garden setting. The bar and lobby are all facing this area too. Everything is so convenient and handy. We loved hearing the birds in the morning singing outside in the garden. We also enjoyed listening to the live music that played a couple of nights. The music ended sharply at eleven. The bar has a regular crowd but they are all gone by 11 too. You will get a good nights sleep here so no worries. Value - we are always looking for spots that have the best value for our hard earned dollars. We searched Playa for another place that might have better value for what is important to us and had no luck. I am torn about telling people that this is the best deal in Playa because I want there to be a room available for us next time we go and it is not sold out because I am telling others about it. One of the reasons they can offer the price as low as they do is because they don't go through large booking sites. You deal directly with them so it cuts out the middle man. I like that. They also give you free beach passes for Blucacao (absolutely gorgeous quiet but chic experience) and Mamitias (hip place but was busy the holiday week we were there). We heard that Wicky's beach club was being added too. The beaches in Playa just got re-done and the photos we have seen this past week look amazing so hit the beach for sure! All in all we were thrilled to have Luna Blue as our first non-all inclusive hotel. We loved the flexibility to do what we wanted, when and where to go. We took collectivos (local buses) to our day trip spots - Akumal, Tulum and Xpu-Ha. We had bought maps from mapchick.com and had no trouble getting around. The hotel has maps too. We loved eating out at local restaurants within walking distance of Luna Blue such as Babes Noodle House (big portions and tasty) , Vagabunda and La Cueva Del Chango (breakfast places), Fusion (great romantic beach front low tables and chairs in the sand dinner and chilling music) , Sur (elegant and to die for chocolate bomb desert) , Wicky's (brand new place on the beach and very nice) , El Bistro (lovely romantic setting but good prices) , Au Cacao (chocolate treats and coffee). We also treated ourselves by cab ride to Al Ceilo restaurant at Xpu-Ha beach and had the tastiest food with the best sunset view. Pricey but good. We figured we spent about $100 a day on everything for the two of us (drinks, groceries, restaurant meals, taxes and tips) We ate well and felt this was very good value. We loved not having to do the big buffets and waiting in long line-ups for al a cart reservations at the big all inclusives. Eating out on our own in Playa was a real treat. We used the forum to ask questions about our trip and everyone on that forum was so helpful. Thanks especially to Oldtraveler, Candylady and Coloradowanderer who gave us endless amounts of advice. I encourage everyone to take the time and ask questions before your trip to prepare and know what you are getting into first. We will be telling friends and family about Luna Blue and we would be more than happy to answer questions but shshsh keep this place a secret so we can all get a room in the future. Just between you and I! Thank you Tony and Cheri for our memorable stay. We are feeling Luna Blue already. Will be back.....maybe for the wedding???? lol You guys are great!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: JesseIllinois
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue is the perfect place for a fun and relaxing vacation. My daughters and I traveled to Playa as a respite from the Midwest winter, and the Owners and staff of the Luna Blue made the trip thoroughly enjoyable. We requested Toni and Cheri's help re transportation from the Cancun airport. We were delighted to have the driver waiting for us when we arrived. After arriving at the Luna Blue, the staff carried our bags (Scuba equipment isn't light) up to our room. The whole experience was hassle free. Any trepidation about traveling Mexico?, then stay at the Luna Blue. The room was very comfortable. And most important, the room was very clean. The Hotel bar was a lot of fun, and the staff went out of their way to may our trip enjoyable. The hotel is in a terrific location, less than one block off fifth avenue. It is close to everything you want to do in Playa. The best part of the trips were the Owners and the staff. They arranged for rental cars, their restaurant recommendations were spot-on, their advice of what to do and where to go were very helpful. The people were simply great. Every time we returned to the hotel it was a warm smile from the staff. The Luna Blue is much, much more than hotel. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue Welcoming Warm Friendly & Fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: la_reina_sf
Reviews.Content: Where do we begin Luna Blue Hotel & Garden is a true find in Playa. We have stayed at Luna Blue on several occasions and we love it . Jaime at the front desk is the sweetest always a big smile. We never fail to begin with a pomegranate margarita at the Luna Blue bar , and we know our way around a margarita ! The rooms are warm,cozy &clean and I love looking over the garden courtyard seeing all trees and birds. Tony and Cheri are very "in the know" about the best beach clubs and always point us in the right direction for a great meal in Playa . They totally have their guest best interest at heart if you are just there to chill or want adventures They will hook you up! I highly recommend Luna Blue , you won't want to leave it is a home away from home. Cheers!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: PlayadelSoul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in Playa. On occassion, we like to get away from the daily grind, put the kids with my mother-in-law and spend a night or two in a local hotel. Recently, we decided to really unwind and spend some time at the Luna Blue. We are very familiar with the Blue, having spent a lot of time at the bar, during one of Tony and Cheri's many charity events, but never stayed the night. We had always wanted to and the price was within our budget. In the past, we have spent weekends in Barcelo Maya, Iberostar Linda, and other AIs, but wanted to do the a la carte version of tourist, this time. Our room was awesome, as the view was pure color. The flowers and garden/jungle atmosphere provided the perfect setting to just sit and be comfortable. No disturbances, other than the sounds of birds and the little waterfall. After a bit, we went down to the bar and had a couple of sodas, and chatted with Jorge. Then, it was off to dinner at the Italian place, around the corner, on 5th (Atica?), which was awesome. When we returned, Tony and Cheri were there, so we chatted a bit and then headed up to enjoy some more alone time. Comfortable bed, I might add. ;) Woke up early, strolled over to Oxxo for some coffee and then sat around just taking it all in. Wife woke up and we went to La Vagabundo for breakfast. Later, we hit the beach (we had passes included with the room) and enjoyed the beautiful sea. Living here is not like vacationing here. However, we make a point of being "tourists" every once in a while and the Luna Blue is now at the top of the list of places to stay. AIs are nice, when we want to be pampered, but I prefer the freedom of just doing what we want when we want. And, if you are looking for romantic, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: JanuaryGuy
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to the Luna Blue and as always, we loved it. The hotel is very clean, the service is very friendly, particularly if you meet the owners Tony and Cheri. They are the most helpful people you will ever meet. I love the location in Playa's north end, still close to many fun activities and the beach but away from the craziness and more touristy areas further south in Playa. The bar is a good place to hang out for happy hour and a must stop when they have live music (usually on Tuesdays and Fridays). When discussing this hotel with people, I usually say that if you are the type that likes to stay at your hotel and just lounge in your room or by the pool all day, this hotel is not for you, as there is no pool and the rooms are basic. But, if you are that type of person, you should probably be looking at Cancun or one of Playa's big resorts. But, if you love clean rooms at a great value, friendly and helpful service, and if you plan to explore Playa quite a bit, the Luna Blue would be a great home base. Thanks for another great stay Tony and Cheri!

Reviews.Title: “terrible place, worse than some of the hostels I stayed”
Reviews.Author: kailasanata
Reviews.Content: The place is terrible. We were assigned to a room right by the street and by the door which is used for guests who returned to the hotel after 11pm. Tried to move to another room, and was rejected. So we had to stick to that room. The room was left in a state of bare minimal. There's no TV, no dresser, no place to put your stuff other than on the tiled floor which gives you a sense as if you're sleeping in a bathroom. In addition, there's no decor to speak of, which only makes a comparison with hostels appropriate. But honestly, we've stayed at hostels in Yucatan during previous days which are much better than Luna Blue. The most terrible thing about the place is that the room was filled with mosquitoes, and even after we killed quite a few, we still got bit over the night. We were trying to turn down the room temperature and make it drier so that mosquitoes won't bite as fiercely, but the Mexican guy at the front desk was very reluctant to give us the remote. Yes, there's no remote in the room and you can get one only if you ask. The problem, as it turned out, was that one of the windows was loose and there was a huge gap for the mosquitoes to come in. Terrible management, is the only reason we can think of. So, if you're looking for some place that will give you a feeling that you're camping indoors, this is the place. If you require a level of comfort, even if low, you better stay off this terrible place. You're forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: LakeLuvvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took our second trip to Playa Del Carmen. The last time we stayed at an all inclusive. This time we decided we wanted to be in town and stayed at the Luna Blue. We were happy with our choice. The hotel is quiet with a pretty garden. The rooms are small and a bit on the sparse side but the place was very clean and comfortable. Our room had a balcony where we could sit and look out over the garden. They have a cute bar with swings where we met some of the other guests and had the best margaritas at ever! The staff was helpful and spoke excellent English which was a relief for us. We met the owners a couple of times and they helped us with suggestions on places to eat. We were very satisfied and would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: aagej1984
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our third trip to the Luna Blue. As we have come expect it was once again a perfect place to stay. Tony &Cheri and there staff are the best. Our room was always clean. The front desk staff very helpful and there excellent bartender always ready with a cold drink. Anyone wanting a clean quiet place to stay this is it.Not to mention the great New Years Eve party!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue for 3 days”
Reviews.Author: hyouzwak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luna Blue in October for 3 nights before heading down to Akumal for a month. We wanted to be in the town so we could do some grocery shopping and relax before we went to our condo. We were greeted at the front desk and told we were upgraded to a bigger room. The room was large and clean. The beds comfortable. Luna is a small hotel perhaps 16 rooms. We had a chance to meet the owners who were very nice to us and help with suggestions about where to dine. We had kitchen facilities that made it convenient for us to store our refrigerated items. We were given passes to Mamitas Beach Club that we used every day. Luna Blue doesn't have a pool. There is a small bar in the lobby that is frequented by local Americans who get together in the evening to chat. We loved the location. We were at the north end of Playa but a few steps away from 5th Avenue and about a 5 minute walk to the beach. We were close to everything. Yet is was quite at night. Noise was not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Bravissimi!”
Reviews.Author: DhivehiDiver
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Luna Blue. All the staff is very helpful and nice, as owners Tony and Cherie are. I spent more than two weeks at Luna Blue and I really appreciate my time there. My plan was to go cave diving but I couldn't because of a persistent backache, so I had the opportunity of using Mamita's pass to relax at the beach where I had great time and where I always felt welcome. Luna Blue's central position is just fantastic and rooms are spotlessly clean. I myself work in the tourism industry and I can say that Tony, Cherie, and all their staff do a great job in providing an excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular little gem!”
Reviews.Author: briana1969
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just got back from a 6-day trip to Playa Del Carmen and had such a wonderful time! We have always stayed at all-inclusives and wanted to try something new that was right in town. We found this place on Tripadvisor and could not have been more pleased. The location was so convenient to everything, our room was fabulous with the balcony and kitchen, and most of all, the staff/other guests were just wonderful. Everyone was so friendly and the customer service was over the top. We so appreciated everyone and everything and a huge shout out to Edgar and Jorge, you guys are the best! Take care of Oso and Frankie :)

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in Playa!!”
Reviews.Author: buckeyenut3
Reviews.Content: Once again Tony and Cheri have made our stay fantastic. This is probably our 4th or fifth stay at Luna Blue and we have found it to be the nicest and "most consistant" of all of the small hotels we have visited in Mexico. Every year there is something new. Luna is a very quaint and clean and run by two of the most helpful people that we have met in all of our travels. Thanks T & C. For what it is worth, you dont need a pool!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: dglee
Reviews.Content: Not wanting to repeat what has already been said about the Luna Blue (which overall was great value for money and we would recommend to other travellers), the only thing I want to add is that the live music (if my recollection is correct) was on Tues, Weds and Friday during our stay and we found the sound level to be pretty loud despite what has been said in previous posts. We stayed in one of the rooftop rooms (so probably furthest away from the bar) and still had to use ear plugs to sleep. It's great that there's live music but it's a little too noisy if you've chosen to have a quiet/early night. I would have found it helpful to have seen this advertised in the reception area to help us plan our evenings better (we didn't know until it was too late, and we didn't want to spoil the enjoyment of others who were sat at the bar by asking for the music to be turned down - then it took us by surprise and happened again the following night - by chance, we found out there was live music again later in the week). It's just worth mentioning that we are in our early 30s (just in case anyone thinks we are grumpy pensioners) and did enjoy spending our last evening at the bar, listening to the music (though song choice could have been a little more international i.e British/European) and sitting amongst the locals and other guests. However, I think the music level either needs to be turned down a notch, or guests should be advised to bring ear plugs if they plan to be in their room before 11pm. One last thing; wireless worked and was pretty fast though didn't work in our room or balcony (settings were fine and I have a Macbook). The management is probably going to respond to my post so I just want to take this last opportunity to say that I am merely providing my personal feedback and there will be others who hold different opinions, or would have done things differently. Overall, nice stay and in a good location at the better end of 5th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't like finding cockroaches in your room, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: anontrav09
Reviews.Content: The place is super cute and the staff is very nice and accomodating, but the rooms are VERY barebones. On 2 nights we were there, we woke up with a cockroach in our room. We had stayed at a four-star resort just prior (and about 20 mins. from Playa) and it was cheaper, had better ammenities, and no cockroaches. Also, the internet barely worked at the hotel (contrary to the "free wifi" that is advertised). THere are a TON of hotels down the main strip (calle 5) so i would suggest you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character, clean, but free wireless internet is not reliable”
Reviews.Author: Aerocaiman
Reviews.Content: The staff at Luna Blue Hotel was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean and the location was great. Overall, I had a good experience, as did my travel-mates. We were disappointed that the wireless internet did not work unless you were outside the room, and even then it was not reliable. This was a frustration, as email was the primary means of communication with other friends in the travel group, and we counted on using the internet at the hotel. The owner, Cheri, was very outgoing and provided personalized tips for local attractions and restaurants, etc. In a nutshell: Pros: Location, Value, Cleanliness, Uniqueness, Fun bar with live music on weekends, VERY close to the beach and other attractions Cons: "Rainforest" environment = lots of mosquitoes & slippery staircase, wireless internet was unreliable, Potentially loud live music on weekends, No phones in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa del Carmen and the Luna Blue hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AquaPenguin
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Luna Blue hotel last week in beautiful Playa del Carmen was a wonderful experience. The rooms were not lavish but they had everything we were looking for as travelers on a budget. They were clean, had free purified drinking water, a room safe to store our valuables and the housekeeping staff even made us cute towel art every day. Also we had a nice balcony area and a hammock to relax in. All of the hotel staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. They gave us some great suggestions on how to spend our time while we were there, and we had an amazing week. We loved the two beach clubs that we had free passes to as Luna Blue hotel guests. Mamita's was great because it was so close to the hotel. Blue Cacao was further away, but it was just gorgeous and well worth the trip. Also, the food, drinks, and service were amazing. Another thing we loved was the swing bar. The swing bar at the Luna Blue was so much fun to sit at and have a drink before we went out, or after we came home before we went to bed. Jorge the bartender was such a nice guy and he was great to chat with while we enjoyed some tasty drinks. We would love it if the Luna Blue would put in a jacuzzi or hot tub, that would be a really nice addition. The location of this hotel is perfect, it is close to tons of great restaurants, the shops on 5th avenue, and the beach. We can't wait to return to Playa del Carmen, and the Luna Blue is a great central base to explore from and a great value. We'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, location, and price!”
Reviews.Author: Seeker_Finder
Reviews.Content: All 4 people in our group had a blast in Playa and we were blown away at the great service at The Luna Blue! Tony, Cheri, Edgar, Jorge (World's Coolest Bartender), and the all the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our week long stay. They gave our friends a free room upgrade after we dealt with our stressful Hurricane Ida delay. More notable pros: The hotel location is great for getting around between Cancun and Tulum! It's on the north side of playa's 5th Ave shopping and also very close to Mamitas Beach Club. The free access to 2 beach clubs is a real plus and if you like relaxing and being pampered at a private beach resort just get a free pass at the front desk and take a cab to the amazing Blue Cacao! Our garden terrace, tropical garden ambiance and nighttime atmosphere were also highlights. Added to this is the low price for such a good experience! The cons: As mentioned in the last review the mattress was firm with minimal bedding, and the floor in room #36 was frequently slippery and wet after doing nothing cause it. Still, you really should stay at Luna Blue! There really isn't any good reason to stay anywhere else but Luna, unless you just absolutely need to have a T.V. in your room. We will return asap!

Reviews.Title: “Wow'd us!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingkimby
Reviews.Content: We were traveling through the area for a just for a few nights and this place wow'd us!! In the right location, for the right price and the staff are great. Walking distance to all the night life. Great swinging bar chairs and the rooms are just so cute. We pulled up and thought - "how can there be a hotel here". Much to our surprise it's tucked away like a little bit of Caribbean and little jungle. We loved it - would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue Review”
Reviews.Author: getawayfromhere
Reviews.Content: Walking up to the Luna Blue it looked just like the pictures. A tropical paradise. Our room was #34 in the round tower. Plain but nice. We had arrived Monday the 2nd of November. That night it started raining. Every morning our floor was pretty wet. It wasn't that big of a deal we just wiped it up. The beds are really hard which I understand is pretty typical for Mexico. We bought a thick blanket ( kind of like a puffy sleeping bag) at the Mega store in Cozumel and put that on top of the mattress, then we were fine. O.k, enough of the down side. The up side was every one we met that worked at the hotel from Jaime and Edgar at the front desk to Jorge and Cheri could not have been more kind and helpful. The location and price was great. We would stay there again. Thanks guys for everything. Robyn and Frank

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in PDC.”
Reviews.Author: eatstaylove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first night of our honeymoon at Luna Blue, en route to Tulum and Punta Allen. Thank god for the hotel and the little restaurant directly across the street from the entrance. Other than those two experiences, we found little to love about PDC. In fairness, we were only there a day and I'm sure we barely scratched the surface, but it seems that the main draws to PDC are fancy restaurants, (most serving everything BUT authentic Mexican), American-style shopping and beach/dance clubs--and that's just not our scene. If we do return for any reason, Luna Blue will be the hotel. A friendly, clean, well-located oasis at a great price, with a truly memorable jungle courtyard surrounding the rooms. Only regret is that we never got to check out the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not planned but great experience”
Reviews.Author: rasvideo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased a home in Playacar after many trips. When we arrived to close there were some issues that delayed the closing for two days and unfortunately we couldn't stay in our home the first two nights. Our real estate agent took us to Luna Blue based on our request to be in town, in a reasonably priced, clean hotel. We had a very nice room, enjoyed the beautiful courtyard and were steps to restaurants, Starbucks, and all of the charm of the area. In addition, the owners and staff were more than fair and accommodating on or situation and requests. This is a perfect Playa Del Carmen value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back to stay at the Luna Blue.”
Reviews.Author: CITA01
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue was near enough to all of the action of Fifth Avenue and the beach, but far away enough from the big crowds and noise. We were greeted with friendly faces and were given everything requested on our stay. If you want quaint and private, this is the place for you. Kudos to Jorge the bartender; he welcomed us in Mexican style.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive and misleading reservation process”
Reviews.Author: cindyinBham
Reviews.Content: I emailed Luna Blue to see if there were any available rooms for our upcoming trip to Playa. They responded that, yes, there were 2 rooms available and that we needed to go to their site and enter our VISA to confirm. I entered my VISA information the next morning, thinking I had the room I had requested. Two days later, I received an email back saying they were sorry, but they had no rooms available for the days we requested. I was disappointed, but mostly confused. During those 3 days, I had not contacted any other hotel, thinking I had no need to since I had secured a place to stay. So, the places that had said they also had availability were possibly now booked. I emailed back and said I that I had responded with my credit card within 24 hours of an email from Luna Blue directly, saying they had availability. I wanted to know what had happened....maybe, there was a misunderstanding? The owners responded to my complaint by defending their reservation system, writing, "it has worked quite well for us for the past several years." Also, they pointed out that in the "fine print" of the reservation page, it clearly says that entering my credit card does not guarantee a reservation. Call me old fashioned....but, a hotel with this sort of excellent reputation would be expected to do a 24 hour courtesy hold on an available room AFTER responding that the room was available. No? This seems unreasonable and just plain greedy. And, I can't think of a time I've had to enter my credit card information over the internet just to find out (2 days later by email!!) if there is an available room or not. Good customer service starts with the first contact with a client. I can understand that some people say they will pay for a room, and then never show up. That's why a highly desirable hotel like Luna Blue can (and does) demand the full payment in advance! A 24 hold courtesy hold is the norm for every other wonderful little hotel we've ever visited throughout Mexico, and Europe, as well. I am relieved we will be staying elsewhere in Playa during our upcoming trip in January.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven On Earth”
Reviews.Author: Mirjana99
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at Luna Blue and we absolutely LOVED IT! We travelled in a group of 5 from Australia and stayed in the top garden deluxe room which was very spacious. The rooms were super clean, the location was fantastic (just a 2 min walk to Mamitas Beach Club) and the staff were great!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! They have a great bar, and fantastic cocktails...and an awesome bartender!! Its located just off 5th Avenue (main street) and as you walk down the main street you can feel the PLAYA buzz everywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: riverken
Reviews.Content: Add me to the list of folks who love this place! Clean, comfortable, friendly and a great value. I can't wait to go back. Ken

Reviews.Title: “One of Many Guests Who Return Time After Time”
Reviews.Author: rhsRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at The Luna Blue Hotel several times since our first stay in January of 2006. We've had the pleasure of staying in most of the room types, and during every season of the year (Seasons for us Midwesterners at any rate). From the moment we first stepped into the Garden courtyard area we felt transported. The hotel sign in front that quotes a review from a seasoned travel writer which stated, "The Luna Blue has that 'Lost In Time Quality' not found in many Modern Resort Destinations" really rang true for us. We had been long time All-Inclusive travelers to the area but we each had never felt so relaxed and at ease so quickly as we had upon our first day at the Luna Blue. We always feel as if we're mere steps from The Happening Crowd of 5th Avenue, yet when we step into the Garden Courtyard area and hear the sound of the waterfall, and the rustling of the palm fronds and leaves of the canopy overhead, we feel welcomed and enveloped by the inner atrium of the heart of the hotel. For amenities, we've enjoyed the Kitchennette rooms, the Treetop Terrace Rooms, and others. The Free water for refills to water bottles, coffee, etc AND the Free beach passes and towels are always a plus. the rooms are airy and nice and we always find plenty of storage space. The Hotel is kept up with new paint, and cleaned inside and out every day. The staff has changed some, but the quality of our care continues. For location, a walk of but a few minutes and we're at the water's edge. Plus, we're in the North end of Playa which we prefer. This end continues to develop and has an equal amount of great restaurants, coffee shops, specialty stores, convenience stores,bars and shopping. Also, there's a nice clinic right behind the Hotel and the personal MD of the owners for Hotel guests is always just a call away. The staff and owners have always been there to give advice on daytrips, places to eat and to arrange transportation. The addition of the bar, live music on occasion and special event nights is a noted addition to our Mexico experience. We like the idea of familiarity. We travel to the area to relax and knowing what to expect helps us achieve that end much more quickly. The Value of the Hotel in our estimation is hard to beat. Besides, we just have come to appreciate the Chill Vibe and Atmosphere the Hotel gives. This brings me to this last statement. In almost every season since out first few stays we have met those fortunate travelers who come to the Playa del Carmen area several times per year. They could stay anywhere but choose the Luna Blue again and again. Often times using the hotel as their PdC base for their daytrips to Tulum, Belize, Majuahal, or the ruins or what-have-you...and sometimes they may actually stay somewhere overnight and still leave their room at the Luna Blue for when they return to PdC from an overnight jaunt elsewhere up and down the coast. We've met these folks who come from other North American homes, to European couples, from the UK, etc - several times, These are couples who value their time and money and choose to stay at the Luna Blue each time (given availability and occupancy). In fact one of these Canadian couples on our trip told us they come down every few months and always book their next stay before they return to Canada. This fact, and meeting these folks often depending on the time of year, on the front or back end of our stays has also become something we look forward to. Wondering if we'll see someone at the Hotel we've seen at other times before. That fact, that people have chosen to stay over and over again at The Luna Blue...people with a few hundred choices on places to stay, each within a few dollars of each other, each with similar amenities, etc - keep booking return stays here spoke volumes to us as we considered similar options. Choosing Playa del Carmen and the Luna Blue as our hotel is one of the smarter travel decisions we've ever made in 30 years traveling together. we would suggest you do the same. See you in Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love Playa del Carmen, but loved Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: megbayer
Reviews.Content: First of all, we were supposed to go to Playa in early May for a wedding, but cancelled our trip due to the CDC's swine flu travel advisory. If we weren't going to Playa for the wedding we weren't really that interested in going to Playa, but we had a credit at the Luna Blue and an airline credit so we figured we should go. The only other time we could go was August, which is a big part of why we didn't love Playa. We aren't really intense heat people, and boy was it hot (and humid) while we were there. We also didn't care for the very touristy Fifth Avenue scene with the aggressive sales people, and we also found the beach to be very crowded, even in the off-season. The best part of the trip was definitely staying at the Luna Blue (oh, and also snorkeling with sea turtles in Akumal which was amazing). Luna Blue is very cute and has a lot of character. Our room was very clean and very comfortable. The furnishings and decorations are unique and attractive. We loved having the air conditioning, so despite the heat we slept great. It was also very nice to have the bottled water provided. We had a really interesting shower in our bathroom and enjoyed the balcony off the room. The garden in Luna Blue is beautiful and relaxing and I loved seeing the cats find interesting little spots to relax. The staff was very nice and helpful. One person recommended a restaurant called La Cueva del Chango, which was amazing. We ate there for dinner and breakfast. Definitely the best food we had in Playa. The location of Luna Blue was also really great. It was as short walk to the beach club, a short walk to Fifth Avenue, but also in a quiet area. (I actually found Playa on a whole very easy to get around. We were able to walk every where we wanted to go, had no problems finding the places we were looking for, and when we did opt to take a cab it was very affordable.) And mostly we loved the bar and the bartender, Jorge. We went to a few other bars in Playa, but everywhere we went seemed overpriced and/or too touristy. The bar at Luna was perfect.... laid back atmosphere, great swing seats, great drinks, and great conversation with other guests and also with locals. Loved the Jimmy Buffet music, although after four nights at that bar it was getting old. But spending our evenings at that bar was great. So for anyone traveling to Playa who doesn't want the big resort experience, I highly recommend Luna Blue. I also have a couple other trip recommendations. We took the ADO bus from the airport to the Playa bus station and found that to be very easy to do and a lot less expensive than a shuttle. From the bus station it was an easy walk to Luna Blue, although on our way home we took a cab to the bus station to avoid some of the heat, and it was also a really cheap cab ride. We enjoyed Akumal and I definitely suggest taking a collectivo van down to Akumal and just going to a dive shop to rent gear. There was no need to pay for a tour because it was really easy to do ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “"Always Good to Look for the Positive"”
Reviews.Author: whaleboat
Reviews.Content: The Positive, well I really liked the complimentry drink upon registering, perhaps if the bar was opened I might have even enjoyed it. The bathroom, hey why won't a guest enjoy being treated to the use of 1 out of the 3 major bathroom components. "Beach Club" passes, I'll have to say that pass and $10.00 bucks wil get you any chair on the beach. And the owner's attitude after complaining of my difficulties in the room, (which after 1 night we decided to leave).....well that was priceless........ Should you be in search of a hotel run by professional Hoteliers.........I'd keep looking

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Anasaurus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue for 4 nights based on TripAdvisor recommendations and we really loved it. We stayed in a top end room, which was great, but next time we'll likely stay in a smaller room as they were also really nice and we were rarely at the hotel. Owners were unbelievably helpful and the staff was all very friendly. We ate at some really wonderful places recommended by the hotel and will recommend this hotel to anyone going to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “litlle bit of paradise in paradise”
Reviews.Author: SfAllieg
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fabulous! the staff members were really nice, the rooms were spacious and cozy, there was a fun bar downstairs, beach access and it was just off the beaten path enough to be a little quieter and cozier than the hotels right on the main drag.

Reviews.Title: “Beach lovers can't miss Mamita's & Blue Cacao !!”
Reviews.Author: sailordoc
Reviews.Content: when in Playa, the Luna Blue is the place to stay for quiet, convenience, friendly staff, beaches and Jorge's famous Papa's margarita.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very reasonably-priced hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: BwanaPombe
Reviews.Content: The accomodations are comfortable but basic, not luxurius (if you're looking for unfettered opulence, look elswhere). This is a great location for making the transition from being a tourist at an insulated, all-inclusive resort to being a traveler to nice small city in Mexico. It's close enough to 5th Avenue to have easy access to the tourist shops and restaurants yet also close to the other local shops and eateries where the prices are more reasonable. The hotel isn't right on the beach but the hotel provides towels and complementary access to a nearby beach club, if you're into beach lounging. The hotel staff are very friendly and are glad to make suggestions and help you plan your activities. The in-house bar is a relaxing place to hang out for guests and locals (closed on Sundays) and has great margaritas.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: fabian_m
Reviews.Content: At first glance, i was nervous about staying at this hotel, because none of the taxi drivers knew the location of the hotel, and because of the first look of the hotel from the outside, but i was confident about all the reviews read here at tripadvisor, all my doubts cleared when i met Cheri and when we get into the rooms, basically is a very very clean hotel, cozy, and very very conveniently located. It was the smarter decision made about this trip with my friends. Im looking forward to get back to Playa and stay again at the Luna Blue Hotel. Dont hesitate, great choice at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “All that we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: Travelguys100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived and were immediately greeted by the owners of the Hotel. They were very helpful and arranged for some site seeing tours for us. The room was very cute and as cozy as we pictured it. The staff was friendly and made sure we were comfy. The bar was one of the greatest parts I would say. Swings for chairs! Wow, that was a great change. The funny thing is we don't really even drink and we had a blast. The town had some interesting places to see as well as the best food places. We wish we could of stayed at the Hotel longer.... We had to get back to reality though. I hope that we can make it back again next year..

Reviews.Title: “I will return to the Luna Blue!!”
Reviews.Author: golferk9
Reviews.Content: The most relaxing, affordable and fun vacation. The Owners and staff at the Luna Blue Hotel were fabulous. They made our vacation a very pleasant experience. The hotel was clean and quite and the staff very friendly and nice. Clean rooms, a fun bar, and the location close to the beach and to 5th Ave is wonderful. We had everything at our fingertips. Thank you to Tony and Cheri for being wonderful hosts and doing the extras with us to ensure a great vacation. I highly recommend a trip to Playa Del Carmen and the Luna Blue!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: redhed65
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a treetop terrace room at the Luna Blue while on our honeymoon. We wanted something nice, but affordable. We were very happy with our choice! Passes to Mamita's beach club (only two blocks away) allowed us full access to beach chairs and umbrellas, without paying beach hotel prices. The room was clean, and the A/C worked very well. It was nice having a large bottle of water and refrigerator to use. The grounds are beautiful, and the hotel was very quiet. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor steered us to the right place..........”
Reviews.Author: dcsey
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Playa Del Carmen, so I'm not making comparisons between Luna Blue and any other hotel, but we selected Luna Blue based on tripadvisor reviews and were very pleased with the result. I felt the location was ideal, as many other reviews here state. The room was clean, the courtyard and bar were nice (and beer was 20 pesos, vs 34-40 anywhere on 5th Ave). Tony, Cheri and the rest of the staff were friendly and helpful. We met a lot of great folks at the Luna Blue bar as well. I'm not really sure what else to add; we were looking a nice place to stay that was easy on the budget. We stayed eight nights and got each fourth night free, as currently advertised on their website. Lack of a television was a plus in my opinion (even more so next time should we take our daughter, although she might not agree). In contrast to others reviews, when we left a deposit for towels, we got our money back when we returned them. Yes, we had to ask for passes to Mamita's; not sure why that would surprise anyone. For Bluecacao, you just needed to present Luna Blue's business card and tell them you were staying there. Much less crowded than Mamita's, 100 pesos via taxi, and we walked back each time (about an hour). Mamita's staff didn't make us feel unwelcome at all, but perhaps that's because we had breakfast there before hitting the beach. We were sorry we waited until the end of our stay was near before following Tony's advice on dining (La Pesca, if I remember correctly, when we asked for a good seafood place). That turned out to be the best meal we had during our entire stay at much better prices than you could find on 5th Ave. They also directed us to Mexican Blue Dream when we inquired about dive shops, whom you can also read about on tripadvisor. On the (minimal) downside, getting a hot shower was generally a crapshoot, but showering in the afternoon or evening after being outside most of the day instead of each morning after sleeping in the AC made it bearable. Interestingly enough, we were only awakened in the morning by construction on Saturday. There was quite a bit of construction going on in the general vicinity of 5th Ave., so I doubt Luna Blue is the only hotel affected by noise. Other than that, we were undisturbed by noise from 5th Ave., or even the Luna Blue bar. It would have been nice if I could have accessed the internet from inside our room, but stepping out into the courtyard was really no big deal. All in all, I think Luna Blue deserves the high rankings it gets on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: solarskier
Reviews.Content: Good location just a half block off 5th Avenue on the north end, close to restaurants & shops - an 8-10 minute walk to the beach. Very clean hotel with lush foliage that makes you feel like you're living in a tropical forest. Our room had a small but very private balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Ten Days at The Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: TonyandCheri
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 10 day stay at The Luna Blue Hotel in Playa del Carmen. It's a lovely boutique hotel which is very close to the beach, good restaurants and nightlife. Everybody is very friendly from the owners to the bar staff. The bar, which has swing chairs sees tourists and locals. The rooms are very clean, the maids do a great job and the towel art left by them each day is so cute. We were in room #9 which is on the third floor of one building, yes the stairs are steep to get there but it's worth it with a lovely deck off the bedroom and a private clothing optional deck across the way. No TV's or telephones make it an ideal place to get away from it all !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Please Learn From Our Experience”
Reviews.Author: chickagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon to Playa Del Carmen. We chose to stay at Luna Blue because we wanted something more private and unique than a big, fancy hotel could offer. We stayed for a week at Luna Blue before going to some other areas and hotel, and, unfortunately, it ended up being a week of our vacation that we wish we could go back and change. We loved Playa and really enjoyed all the experiences in the Mayan Riviera, however our experience at Luna Blue was difficult and not quite relaxing. We don't like complaining, but we feel that if someone else is headed to this hotel believing they will get a relaxing vacation it is our responsibility to share our experience. We really liked the "ambiance" and cute rooms of Luna Blue and the staff were truly very helpful in planning adventures or where to eat. However, twice during our stay the electricity went out (including the AC), which I understand was not something that the hotel had control over, but we were forced to go find a restaurant or bar where we could at least get cold drinks. Perhaps we would have felt better if those at the hotel had offered us some ice water or cold drinks, but instead we had to trek around looking for a place with either AC or something cold to drink each time. While the expense was not a lot, it was very inconvienient and uncomfortable. Another thing that was really too bad was the banging construction that started at 8:00 AM everyday directly outside the front door to our room (I'm talking ten feet!). This made our "private" patio not so private and our mornings not so peaceful. When we mentioned the noise to a worker one day he apologized. Then, later we were told by another worker that there was no one else staying in our entire building. It's unfortunate that the simple solution of switching us to a (cheaper) room that was quieter was not offered. Also, one day only boiling hot water was coming out of the shower and sink-- which was impossible to bathe in. Apparently there was a malfunction with the hot water heater. One of the workers came up and told us he would get it fixed the next day. So, again, we found ourselves too hot, but this time we couldn't clean the sweat and sand off our bodies. At the end of our week the owner asked us if we enjoyed our stay. We answered honestly. He only offered an apology and a free nights stay the next time we come visit, which will be never. We felt that some sort of financial compensation would have been appropriate, since refunds were not offered at any point during our stay. We are not picky people and we are not the type of people who only stay at five-star resorts. We do not even need a phone or daily maid service. However, for the amount that we payed Luna Blue (which was only slightly less than many similar hotels with the same amenities) we felt that it was definitely not worth it. For only a bit more, we were able to stay another hotel in the Mayan Riviera with a beautiful private beach, consistently functional electrical and AC, a welcoming and accommodating staff, and a truly relaxing environment. We hope this review is helpful to you and that you're trip to Playa is fun and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bargain and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: corvette0
Reviews.Content: I was in Playa with my wife and teenage daughter. We found the Luna Blue to be a really great little hotel with all the necessities. It was very clean, the room was large and, the staff was very helpful and friendly. It is located toward the end of Fifth Avenue so there is some walking/taxis required but the proximity to the Mamitas Beach Club was very convenient. Overall we loved our stay and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Sanctuary.”
Reviews.Author: OregonBecky
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue was a fabulous place to stay. The rooms were spotless, the staff and service was great. The air conditioning was beautiful. The garden setting was an oasis of calm within a bustling city. This is the only place to stay in Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic master bedroom in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Funktastic
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel, and we love it. It is a fabulous value. The hotel is not aimed at extravagance, so what you get is an immaculate room set in a quiet garden courtyard, and a staff that is ready to assist you with whatever you need. The hotel provides passes to go to a wonderful beach club. It's a short stroll down to the club where a giant thatched umbrella and lounger chairs make a day relaxing, playing, and snoozing on the beach so nice. The beach club also has great food, and we recommend the chicken nachos. The hotel is a just around the corner from 5 avenue, the main street for shopping and restaurants - very convenient. Tony and Cheri are very gracious hosts and a wealth of honest info on places to go and things to do. We recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a charming and romantic getaway away from the resorts that herd you around like cattle and coop you up in order to keep you and your money on their properties.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Wonderful hotel for your stay in paradise”
Reviews.Author: lucystravels
Reviews.Content: Playa del Carmen itself was wonderful, but our stay was made better by our stay in this wonderful hotel. There were only a few other guests when we were there so they upgraded our room which was brilliant. We had a lovely light, clean room, and the maids make different shapes out of the towels every day! The owners and the staff are great too - Jorge made us the best margarita at the Luna Blue Bar! Go to the Blucacao beach club they have passes for - it is DEFINITELY worth the 100 pesos taxi trip there! We were almost the only people there and it was beautiful...

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation with the best accomodations and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: voneal2000
Reviews.Content: We will definitely be back to spend our vacation with Tony & Cheri! Just left the Margarita Party at the bar!!!! Fantanstic and loads of fun! Cheri even join the bikini contest with the other young ladies. Toni & Cheri are a wonderful couple that make you feel like you are part of the family rather than guests! The staff is absolutely the best. They go out of their way to answer any questions you may have, give you adivce on activities and places to eat. The staff is the same way. Gorge is the bartender and it is obvious that he loves his job! When we asked him about different restaurants, he gave us an honest opinion which we greatly appreciated with this being our first time. Don't get pulled into the time Share promotions for reduced tickets for the activities that are available throughout the area. Everyone here has how best interest at heart! A very homey and quaint place to be. Gorge even saw us on our way to the beach and recognized us! If you want to stay at a place where everyone knows your name, STAY HERE!!! I am a Jimmy Buffet fan and loved the decor. The Luna Blue drink is wonderful!!! They also support 2 orgainizations for the safety and well being of animals. They have several cats that run the place when the staff is busy. Just ring the bell! Frankie is relaxing somewhere around in a shady spot!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place - the reviews are spot on”
Reviews.Author: flyerfan22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night in May. Usually, LB requires 3 night minimum. We checked availability the week before, and they were able to accommodate us for just one night. They even upgraded us to a nicer room. We were actually vacationing at a different Cancun resort for 7 nights, had to get there a day early using FF miles for the airline tix. Occupancy was low all over Playa due to the flu scare - didn't stop us from enjoying our stay. Rooms were clean, service was friendly, and the price is right. The bar specialty drinks were fabulous - even offered us a free tequilla shot. Yum. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “When in Playa del Carmen, pick this hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Admiral_Zheng_He
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue hotel during a weeklong Mexico vacation in 2008 and came away very pleased at our time there. An American couple ran this boutique hotel while we were there (hopefully they still do), and they were very attentive and caring for our needs. They made great suggestions about activities and where to eat (our favorite restaurant in Playa del Carmen was Yaxche), and the hotel is less than five minutes' walk from the excellent beach, and just around the corner from the main shopping area of Avenue Quinta. Our hotel room was on the first floor, clean and cozy with a nice saying/quote painted on the wall (I forget whose quote it was in our room - rm. 2), as well as a water cooler in the room that dispensed free water with which we could refill our water bottles prior to departing for our daytrips (ie. to Tulum and Xcaret). We took advantage of a roof deck for sunning and reading purposes, and enjoyed that feature of this hotel. For its room price, this hotel was great value (at least it was in early 2008 when we were there). We will stay at the Luna Blue again when we go back to Playa del Carmen in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a traveler needs”
Reviews.Author: playacoalinga
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Luna Blue. Location, location!!! It is located in a perfect spot; close to everything a traveler needs. Across the street you have a mini-mart, laundry service, great Spanish restauraunt and the famous 5th ave right on the corner. The staff and owners at the Luna Blue were great. Our AC started to give-up one evening. Toni(owner) was in our room within 10 minutes and after deciding he had to call someone to fix it the next morning, he offered the another room for the night. We slept well and our AC was up and running the next day. We look forward to staying at Luna Blue again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue - Our Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RodInLouisiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luna Blue for 7 nights, from June 9 through June 16. Prior to our making reservations at Luna Blue, I did extensive research on the hotel and the surrounding area, including reading every TripAdvisor review. In summary, we had a great time and the hotel was exactly what we expected. Before beginning this review, I again read every TripAdvisor review of the hotel with a Terrible (one star) or poor (two star) rating. With actual experience behind us, I wanted to attempt to understand why some reviewers would give the hotel such poor ratings. But, since our experience was unlike any of their stated experiences, my arriving at any definitive conclusions has proved to be difficult. My opinion (and it's only an opinion) is that they made assumptions because of a lack of research, and those assumptions proved to be incorrect. We were searching for a small, clean, reasonably quiet, reasonably priced hotel on or near 5th Avenue. Luna Blue met every one of these requirements and then some. We requested and received a Tropical Hideaway room and my wife's sister and her husband were in a Treetop Terrace room. Both rooms were exceptionally clean, with ceiling fans and air conditioners that cranked out COLD air, chests of drawers for our clothing, large bottles of purified water, and showers with ample hot water. We didn't have any odors or bugs in our rooms and each room had a balcony/terrace that overlooked the beautiful courtyard. When we arrived on a Tuesday, check-in was fast and efficient and the young man behind the desk was kind enough to carry our luggage up to our room, which was on the 2nd floor. I have some mobility issues and it would have been very difficult for me to get the luggage up there. We felt as if we had been there before because the photos on their web site are an exact match for the courtyard, bar, and rooms. After dropping our luggage in the rooms, we left the hotel to take a turn around the lively end of 5th Avenue. This took up most of the afternoon and, when we returned to the hotel, Jorge was already behind the bar. Of course, we had to stop and meet him and sample some of his too-strong (they really are) drinks. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation, he said that the little (and I do mean little) Spanish place across the street not only had very good food, they'd also deliver it to the bar. Jorge walked across the street and perused the menu, then came back and informed us of the specials, but he also said they'd cook anything we wanted. The meals averaged 75 pesos ($6 USD) and they were filling and delicious. In fact, the place made such a hit with us, we had our dinners at the Luna Blue bar 4 nights out of the 7 nights we were there. Jorge just added the cost of the meals to our bar tab and we'd pay him at the end of the night. Now, I know that some folks are probably wondering why we'd spend the majority of our evenings in Playa del Carmen at the hotel bar. We did our sightseeing and traveling during the day. A quiet evening at the bar, having a good meal and a few drinks, and conversing with Jorge, other hotel guests, and regulars who'd drop in for a drink, was an ideal way to spend our evenings. After eating our meal and after having a few more drinks, Jorge told us that Tuesdays and Fridays are music nights. So, we hung around the bar until Brad, Danny, and he-whose-name-I-can't-remember (two guitars and a sax) arrived and started playing. What a pleasant surprise! They were talented and they could play almost any type of music. Tony and Cheri showed up, so we had an opportunity to meet them. One of the things that impressed me about Tony was his concern for the noise level of the music. He went out in the street a number of times, to listen to the music out there and to insure that it wasn’t loud enough to disturb the neighbors. The restaurants and clubs down the block didn't seem to share his concern. We were tired from traveling all day, so we didn't make it to the end of the show. We headed up to our room about 9:30 or so and, after showering, we laid in bed and talked about how nice it was to be able to lie there and listen to the music as we drifted off to sleep. This was sort of a working vacation for me, and it was imperative that I be able to send and receive emails on my laptop. I had some difficulty in getting my laptop configured properly, so Cheri made a special trip from their home one evening, to assist me. With her help, I was able to get the job done and I was a happy camper. She also took care of renting a car for us on the day that we went to Akumal bay and arranged for the rental company to deliver the car to the hotel and to pick it up when we returned. She and Tony seemed to be available whenever we needed them and they were always cordial and willing to help. I don’t know what more could be expected of hotel owners. We spent one day at the Mamita Beach Club and one day at the Blue Cacao Beach Club. Neither was very crowded, but Blue Cacao was definitely our favorite. It's about 20 minutes away by taxi and well worth the 100 peso taxi ride. When we were there, all 10 guests (including the four of us) were staying at Luna Blue. It was peaceful and secluded, with an incredible beach. We thought it was a wonderful perk for such a small hotel. The hotel staff, including housekeeping, was friendly and efficient and was never intrusive. They were there when we needed them. Otherwise, they more or less stayed out of the way. So, let me see if I can sum it up……A lovely hotel with a great bar, located in a wonderful, quiet area just off 5th Avenue, with clean rooms that were an excellent value, a friendly staff, and friendly, helpful owners. Will we be back? Of course we will!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, centrally located hotel that's a great value”
Reviews.Author: Sweetwater
