Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Luna Blue before heading off to our Royal Haciendas timeshare, and were impressed with the value you get at Luna Blue. Room was extremely clean, great a/c, shower was great, everything functioned well. Front desk was extremely friendly, made a couple of restaurant recommendations, atm location (Scotiabank), got the taxis quickly. Best of all, Tony/Cheri's restaurant recommendations from their great blog were the best!! We tried a number of their recommendations and can say without a doubt, that the recommendations were excellent. We ate at Vagabonda for breakfast, Mamitas Beach Club--lunch, and dinners at El Fogon, La route des Vins, Antica, El 10, and El Cuevo del Chango. All worth the walk...when we're back in January we'll be trying others. Great job, well done, and thanks to a great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TNSmile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Luna Blue a couple of weeks ago. Cheri and Tony were very gracious hosts. They made several excellent recommendations for both outings and food. The staff was excellent and friendly. Our room was the tree top terrace. It was very secluded, very clean, and exactly what we wanted for our stay. The location of the hotel was right off Fifth Avenue and just a couple of blocks from Mamita's Beach Club. We enjoyed both Mamita's and the Blucacao beach clubs. We definitely recommend the Luna Blue and would absolutely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back next June!”
Reviews.Author: Chili5
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Luna. We stayed there from June 1st through June 11th and had the best time. We loved the easy access to the beach club and also to 5th Avenue. It was the perfect location and we felt like we were in a home away from home. Jorge was the best bartender. I told Tony that Jorge was trouble, but think that he had to laugh at us when he saw us perched at the bar a little later that night. We were lucky enough to be at the Luna when they hosted the benefit for the cat rescue. It was a great fundraiser, and you could see that they liked to host these events to help out their community. We asked Cheri for recommendations for our last night in Playa, and she suggested Babe's Noodle Bar. Awesome recommendation--we opted for her favorite dish--the red curry shrimp. We definitely loved it and wished we would have tried it sooner. (Thanks, Cheri!) We will definitely be back next June and will request our treetop room (#9). We celebrated our 5th anniversary, and it was the best place for this celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: Phillycouple2111
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had booked a trip to Playa for what turned out to be the first couple weeks of swine-flu hysteria. The owners, Tony and Cheri, went above-and-beyond in their reasonableness towards accommodating our back-and-forth, we're-coming-we're-not waffling. In the end, we decided to go, and we had a truly spectacular time. After our time in Playa, we headed to Tulum for a couple of nights, and our disappointing accommodations there threw in to sharp relief a reason we so enjoyed Luna Blue. When you go on vacation, you want value, sure, and cleanliness and service and the like. But more than anything, you want to be surrounded by beauty--to feel that you are someplace special. Luna Blue is certainly that. It is beautiful, but not in the antiseptic, overly-manicured, Stepford manner of the big resorts. It has much more character, much more soul. The love with which it was constructed by it's owners' is palpable. The owners, Tony and Cheri, are very much a presence. They were warm, friendly, and entirely forthcoming with great advice on matters practical and luxurious. Regarding the latter, if you happen to stay, do yourself a favor and ask Tony where he recommends eating. My girlfriend and I are unredeemable foodies, and he steered us to some truly extraordinary places. We had a wonderful, wonderful time at Luna Blue, and can't wait to return. Thank you Tony and Cheri!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for couples”
Reviews.Author: jmille6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights last week and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff was helpful, the grounds were kept in great shape the whole time, you're a only half block from 5th avenue, but still far enough away that you won't lose any sleep if you feel the need to call it an early night. Plus, the passes to Mamita's are excellent and really add flexibility to your schedule since you can just go whenever you like. The only down side was that they only have 2 of the top floor rooms and i think they fill up quickly, but what can you do?

Reviews.Title: “They handled my situation very well”
Reviews.Author: vballm22
Reviews.Content: I did not actually stay at Luna Blue this past weekend, but I was supposed to. United canceled my flight so I had to cancel my trip. This review is simply to point out that not only was Cheri awesome when I booked my reservation, but Luna Blue also graciously handled my need to cancel and offered a 6-month credit on my deposit. They did not necessarily need to do that, but that demonstrates that they care about their reputation and their future business and not just about turning a quick buck at someone's expense. For this reason, I'm posting a positive review and plan on booking with Cheri and Tony in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: NSW1
Reviews.Content: Friendly & very helpful owners and staff. Great room - i was on the top floor with a large room, kitchen & dining area, small terrace etc - drinking water is provided free and the room was full of light and very clean and comfortable. As a single female traveller I felt safe at this hotel, it had a great atmosphere and gardens full of beautiful flowers & trees.It was a super place to stay, I preferred it by far to a 5* hotel I'd stayed in at Chichen Itza and wouldnt hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “well, maybe a bit above average...”
Reviews.Author: blue000sky
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at Luna Blue at the start of our vacation in March. We had initially planned on a week there, but changed our plans at the last minute and went to Isla Holbox for 4 nights instead (a wise choice for us - we loved it). I'm finally getting around to reviewing this place - very clever of the management to send out an email saying thank you for your visit and asking you to do so! Luna Blue is a lovely hotel but I must agree with previous reviewers that for us, it was nothing overly special, especially when it came to the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. It was just, well, average. We also had a similar experience with the towels and beach club passes, and when we asked for a breakfast recommendation we were directed to one of the worst, cheeziest places for breakfasts we had on our entire trip (La Vagabunda?) Maybe we just ordered the wrong things! I also have to agree with the other reviewer about Mamita's, which was PACKED solid with no hope of an umbrella if you got there any time after 9 am, not to mention the grumpy wrist band dudes that sullenly took our passes as if we weren't really welcome there... We're glad we came to Playa del Carmen (although I doubt we would return) and I definitely recommend Luna Blue in terms of a clean, cute, funky little hotel. The beach club was an experience but in no way shape or form he kind of beach holiday that we were looking for! But isn't that why you go places, to check it out, and then learn what you enjoy and don't enjoy? Isla Holbox (Mawimbi Hotel to be exact) was definitely more like it for us, and the friendly, warm family-like atmosphere that I'd been expecting at Luna Blue was much more evident here.

Reviews.Title: “Really unreasonable!”
Reviews.Author: wakey90
Reviews.Content: Due to the flu swine were are unable to go to Mexico, this has come from the Foriegn Office and we have been advised to not fly and no travel insurance will cover us due to circumstances at the moment. We contacted all the hotels we had booked in Mexico in several areas and had given them 3 weeks notice to this. The only hotel that came back to us and said they couldn't do anything was the Luna Blue Hotel and we have to pay for all the nights we had booked even though we can not fly there from the UK. We asked if we could maybe change the date to next year due to the fact we wouldn't be able to go any other time this year and this was refused. We totally understand that the situation isn't their fault but it isn't our's either and we are paying for a service we will never have and every other hotel has been very accommodating due to the amount of notice we gave, so just be aware of the 30 day cancellation policy as most hotels do not have this. Can't really describe what the hotel is like as we can't go but when we do re-book to go to Mexico we will not be going to the Luna Blue in Playa Del Carmen

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Quaint, relaxing, one block from rip roaring fun!”
Reviews.Author: JuneauWhalestail
Reviews.Content: My wife said, " Take me on vacation, surprise me!" I could have opted for an all inclusive resort but instead found Luna Blue. With the money we saved we were able to experience all the area has to offer from the eco-parks to the ruins- to the adventure tours-to Cozumel fun-to all the restaurants on Fifth Avenue. Just one block from all the evening and night fun on Fifth, it was a great choice for a hotel. THe passes to Mamitas Beach club added to the deal! It is a very nice beach, and the food and service were perfect. We went to Xel-Ha, and Xcaret, and on an Alltournative tour, and on the ferry to Cozumel and went scootering, and when we returned, we had a quiet place to relax, get cleaned up, and even take a siesta before trying one of the myriad of restaurants on Fifth. We were so busy we missed the Thursday night bar party at Luna Blue. When we got back to the hotel at 10:30 things were hopping at the swing bar there. We have really no criticisms of the Hotel except our room, though clean and cool, had no chairs to sit on, only the bed. As in many other reviews for all hotels, it seems that firms beds are the norm in Playa, as is the low pressure of the shower head. My wife didn't like that - made it hard to wash out the hair care products. All in all we would choose Luna Blue again if returning- Tony was very helpful with suggesting activities and beautiful beaches. Also, while we were there we had the fun of playing with a new litter of hotel kittens! Very adorable!

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: caribbeach
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue is the best! We had a great time and everyone was helpful. I would recommend this hotel to my best friend and already have. No problems that I can think of the room was great (we had 31 & 32) and the hotel beautiful. Luna Blue is a "boutique" hotel and not an all inclusive. You get the best of both worlds at Luna Blue, personal service and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Going Back Again”
Reviews.Author: LaloinMexico
Reviews.Content: We've been to PDC several times and Luna Blue twice already. Just in the process of making reservations again. It's hard to improve upon the experience. Location is great. The beach club privledges invaluable. Service, Staff and Owners are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location, but not a Paradise”
Reviews.Author: smileyvtraveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at Luna Blue for over a week at the end of April. The location is pretty good, close to 5th Ave. and short walk to Mamita's beach (the nicest in Playa) and Mega (for groceries). The hotel has a nice, lush courtyard, but no swimming pool. Room we stayed in (Garden view Deluxe) is pretty big, but sparsely furnished and the balcony is adjacent to the stairwell, so not very private. We paid 112USD/pn which in our opinion was a bit much for the mentioned room. Our room was kept very clean all the time. The hotel would be pretty quiet, but the whole time we stayed there, there was construction going on from 8am to 6pm 6 days a week, right next to our room. The hotel bar has a pretty loud music starting around 7 pm until 11pm few times a week, so on many days there was no peace and quiet from 8am till 11pm. The hotel staff and the owners are nice and helpful, but I would expect that from anyone working in hospitality industry. We took the ADO bus from Cancun airport, very cheap and great way to get to PDC. When we got outside the arrivals, there are many taxi and shuttle drivers offering a ride for over 80USD. There were many buses parked there, but non of them ADO and there wasn't really anyone to ask, unless you wanted to get hassled. We waited about 20 minutes and ADO bus pulled in the first stall to our relief. The bus dropped us off at PDC bus station right downtown, from there we took taxi to the hotel. The same way we got to the airport on our way back. We went for few trips. Xcaret (basic admission). We had a big breakfast and bought a meal at the "beach" cafe with a pop for about 30usd for both of us. The snorkeling is not that great in Xcaret and none in the underground river, so we didn't bother renting snorkeling equipment. We seen many people with it in the underground river, which we thought was funny as there is nothing to see under water there. We paid extra for the Sea Trek, it was a bit scary, but exiting at the same time, we enjoyed it. The night show was great, really liked it. Coba, cenote, mayan village. Coba is very interesting, got to climb the pyramid (very exiting) but VERY hot! Loved the swim in the cenote afterward. Mayan village was a visit to one family dwelling (very humbling experience). Cozumel. The ferry ride was VERY rough, many people felt uneasy afterward. The dock is right downtown with lots of same souvenir stores as in Playa and there are no nice beaches within walking distance. You either rent a scooter for a day (25usd) or take a taxi to a beach. Tulum and Akumal. My favorite. Took colectivo from PDC to Tulum and a tram from the highway to the ruins. The ruins are more complete then Coba and in a beautiful spot right next to the Caribbean Sea. Then we took colectivo to Akumal. The walk from highway to the beach is about 5 min. The beach is beautiful and snorkeling is great. All in all we had a great time in PDC. We have been to PVR, Mazatlan and Acapulco and PDC is our favorite so far. PS: Didn't come back with the swine flu and we think it got blown way out of proportion in the media.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENTE”
Reviews.Author: Timoteos
Reviews.Content: Hola to our friends at Luna Blue My wife & I returned to Luna Blue for the 5th time or so( they cannot get rid of us), & as usual had a wonderful time. From Mr Excellente, Genero to Mr Chili Willy, Jaime, we were treated like royalty. Special thanks to Tony & Cheri for putting up with us again, we appreciate it. Always a pleasure to stay at the most comfortable hotel in town. We miss the kittens & hope they get a good home. See you all soon & that is a promise, Salud, Timoteo & Bridget

Reviews.Title: “Love the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Changoloco
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Luna Blue Hotel at the end of March and beginning of April. What a great little place. Cozy, peaceful, comfortable, great staff and a wonderful little bar. We and other guests would gather at the swing bar and recount our day's escapades. Great margies at the bar too. We shall return. Cheers, Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Wtrmlngurl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Luna Blue in April of 08 and had such a great time we came back again this year. As we had seen many of the sights the previous year, this trip was mainly for relaxation purposes and we spent 5 of 7 days at Mamitas. Instead of posting all the great things about Playa and Luna Blue again-which are many! (see my review in 4/08) I am mentioning only new things we saw or did. *Went to Blue Cacao beach club at Tony's recommendation. Roughly a 180 peso(with tip) trip each way. We got a cab from Genaro who was willing to come pick us up at a specified time as the beach club is not by a main road. The beach club was sparsely filled almost all day (we went on a Tuesday) but the food/drinks were excellent. A relaxing day but as twenty somethings we prefer the bustle of Mamitas. *Don't bring food to Mamitas-if you do be discreet as they have guards that will have you throw it away. Normally we would not bring food but several days we had trouble getting attentive service from the staff. *Again, Il Paraiso is the most beautiful beach we have ever gone to and every visitor should make the trip to Tulum to see it. Take the collectivos from 2nd and get off at the ruins. You can then find a cab on the road parallel to the beach to take you to Il paraiso (3 bucks). The collectivos are easy and super affordable (4 dollars each way or so) so don't be shy. *The Luna Blue Bar concerts with Mike were great, he is a great singer and it was nice to not have to venture far to receive some entertainment. *Check out Fusion (6th street and the beach). You can have the most amazing fish right on the beach and listen to a Bob Marley cover band while watching the sun set. We were there our last three nights. *Don't go to Hemingways-we went both years and have found it to be extremely overpriced. Also, they attach the tip to the bill and are very pushy about it. I have no problem tipping well but it was a huge turn off for it to be demanded (esp when the service/food was mediocre). *La Vagabunda is always a good choice for breakfast *Take the ADO bus from the airport-its under 10 dollars. Don't worry about all the people asking if you need help, just keep walking saying no thanks and don't let anyone take your bag (a needless tip) *Our room was #33 (I believe). Last year we stayed in a standard room and thought an upgrade would be a nice treat. The room was spacious and we had a nice tucked away deck. The only thing about the room I would change would be the bathroom door oddly enough. The slat design blocked absolutely no noise-since we are a very easy going and open couple this actually generated many laughs but a more reserved couple might find it a little less private then they'd like. Overall a great stay and we recommend this hotel and Playa to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: mansfiem
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Playa Del Carmen. The Luna Blue is a nice hotel - pretty basic you get what you paid for type of deal. We stayed in one of the treetop terrace's with a garden view. The room was pretty basic but nice. The bathroom - well the plumbing just sucks. For the toilet to flush at all you had to push down on the handle through the entire flushing process, there was no water pressure, and the water temp was very particular. We never complained about any of this, just took it with a grain of salt. At home we had crappy water pressure and bought this oxygenics shower head and oh my gosh it made a world of difference - so if Luna Blue is in the market for a little water pressure in the shower I'd recommend the oxygencis. Everyone at the hotel was helpful, we rarely ran into the owners, and the bar was a lot of fun. My only other comment about the hotel it self was that they have a lot of cats 3 big cats 5 kittens and I thought parts of the garden smelled like cat urine so we did not hang out in the garden area except coming and going. I'm not a cat urine expert but I grew up with cats and just think the cats are fine but the dirt should be changed in the garden area every so often with that many cats. We mostly hung out at Mamitas and went down one day to Blue Cocoa. They said at the desk it was a 5 mile walk along the beach, it's not. It took us an hour and we don't want on the beach at a 12 mph. Most the time we run at 10mph. But Blue Cocos is worth the walk. It's a little more expensive, but the service was 10x better than mamitas and there were fewer people. Our Favorite meal were the tacos at El Fogon and the Nachos at Carboncitos. 100% natural had great shakes but there other food was not wowing. We had a wonderful time and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: bensonmum
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue has it all (and then some). This was my 7th trip to PDC and our 2nd stay at Luna Blue. First, it's the location -- North PDC is a bit quieter than further south, but has a wide variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities. Seconds, it's the staff -- of course the owners (Tony and Cheri) see to your every need. But it is the people that are there every day -- Jaime and Genaro at the desk and Jarge manning the bar -- that make it very special. Third, it's the rooms -- the Tree Top Terrace rooms are super (couldn't get one this year) and the other rooms are very nice. Although I haven't been inside one, according to someone staying in a Garden Nook room, they are quite small (as stated on the website). What to do: * Spend time at the bar with Jorge and Jimmy Buffett on Radio Margaritaville * Spend time at the beach (Mamita's is good, but Blue Cacao is SO worth the $10 taxi fare) * Shop * Eat. HC Monterrey has the best steaks in town -- Arracharra Nationale; El Fagon has the biggest meal for 2 people I have ever seen (or tried to eat); Playasia has great asian fusion food and seating in what feels like treehouses in an inside garden; Los Amigos has super tortas, and Xache has authentic Mayan dishes. But best of all is right across the street from the Luna Blue -- I can't remember the name, but It has a awning with a picture of a stack of pots (which is the name of the restaurant). The owner, Miguel, is from Spain and serves the greatest dishes (including tapas) which you can have delivered to the Luna Blue bar so you won't miss any of the exciting goings on. In summary -- this is the one and only place we'll stay in PDC -- if they're full, we'll rearrange our trip to a time when they aren;t.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found - If you only stay in one place in Playa del Carmen, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: newfiegirl22
Reviews.Content: This amazing little hotel tucked on Calle 26 between Quinta and 10th Ave is in itself the definition of relaxation! We stayed in the Treetop Terrace room (a.k.a. the love nest) which is tucked up on the fourth floor all by itself...and while the climb was a challenge some nights (after a few drinks, lol) it kept us in shape and gave us ultimate privacy. We had a private bath with tub and shower, a private balcony with chairs and hammock (oh how I wish I could've taken this home), fridge, complimentary bottled water, and the comfiest bed I've had while on vacation! The rooms also have beautiful ornate tile floors and great a/c...and the maids keep them spotless everyday...what more can you ask for?! Also on the fourth floor is the rooftop deck which is available to all guests though I never saw one person up there other than us. The rest of the hotel and common areas are amazing as well. We loved the lush jungle garden in the center of the hotel and it proved a great place to just sit and relax and listen to the birds...you would never know you were in the city! The bar was one of our favourite places and we rarely went out elsewhere...why would we when Jorge and the staff kept the drinks flowing (and not sparing on the booze) and having fun on the 'swing' stools. We caught the live music twice while we were there and Mike Grabow was awesome! His laid back style was exactly our taste and made for the best entertainment we saw in Playa. We also caught Jimmy Buffett night and the 2 for 1 margaritas...be careful of these, as I said before Jorge doesn't spare on the tequila and these can creep up on you ;) I cannot say enough about the staff and the owners. Every single one of them (Tony & Cheri, the owners; Genero and Jaimie (sp?) on the front desk, Jorge at the bar, and all the maids and groundskeepers/security, etc.) went out of their way to make this the best stay possible. Genero got us great deals on taxis to Blue Cacao Beach Club (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED), Xpu Ha Beach (again, highly recommended) and to Coba for the day (since we didn't have time to catch a normal 'tour')...he saved us so much money and time and did it all with a smile. Tony & Cheri always said hello and asked how we were doing, giving us tips and ideas of things to do and see...priceless information. We cannot understand how anyone who stays here has anything negative to say...either they didn't actually stay here or they're used to staying at the Ritz! We WILL be going back to the Luna Blue and are already planning our next trip (and we only got back tonight!). If you can only stay in one place in Playa, and are sick of the all-inclusives like us, stay here! If you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask as I have no trouble wholeheartedly recommending this place to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, no more no less.”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in a Nook courtyard room. Luna Blue is a pretty unremarkable place in my opinion but does tick many boxes. My room was very simple, clean, a bit dark and cheap at $60 per night. I did really like its location at the quieter less touristy end of 5th avenue. I also really liked the arrangement that they have with the Marmita beach club. Staff seemed efficient if not particularly smiley (never saw or met the owners). The layout of the hotel is in a kind open courtyard setting which looks pretty enough with very uncomfortable chairs dotted around. The bar is open until 11pm but i only saw one customer the time i was there. No food, drink or internet facilites (wi-fi had broken when i was there apprarently) but there's plenty of good places for breakfast, food, internet cafes etc a minute's walk away. So yep pretty good all in all and certainly the price was right but i wasn't quite as awestruck as other reviewers here appear to have been.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service great location”
Reviews.Author: nbray
Reviews.Content: We chose to end our tour round the Yucatan by staying in this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. We had left it quite late to book and the only way to get the 3 nights we wanted was to change rooms after the first night, this was no problem at all and the staff kindly moved our bags while we were out for the day. I can highly recomend everything about this hotel the owners and staff couldn't have been any more friendly or helpful nothing seemed to be too much trouble. We asked for recomendations for places to eat and certainly weren't disapointed! The rooms we had were lovely, clean, basic, but had everything we needed. The location is excellant and there's plenty of free on street parking very near by. The hotel bar is fab and closes early enough not to be noisy. There are two beach clubs you can use for free with vouchers from reception both very nice, but the one at Coral Bay was very luxurious and quiet so you didn't feel like a sardine! You need a car/taxi to get there but it's worth the trip. All in all it was a brilliant place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: thejaysinminnesota
Reviews.Content: This was the second trip to Playa del Carmen for my wife and I and also the second time at the Luna Blue. We were there from March 27 to April 3 and stayed in a Tropical Hideaway Room, #33 which was great for us. This room has its own private stairway and has a private terrace that overlooks the garden and waterfall. The week we were there was the week the bar seating area was being expanded so there was quite a bit of construction noise and dust during the day. We plan to return next year at about the same time so look forward to the return to the quiet garden setting. We went to Mamita's the first day and last day of our trip. Mamita's is a very nice beach club but we were thrilled to have the option of going to the Blucacao. Same great sand and water with very few people. We took a taxi the first time and walked the rest of the time. It is about a 45 minute walk, but hey, isn't a walk along the beach what we were there for anyway? The joy is in the journey and the walks back and forth to the Blucacao were another very enjoyable part of our time in Playa. I can only agree with all that has been said in other reviews. Tony and Cheri are welcoming and warm and helpful hosts and the entire staff reflect the same caring. When we were saying goodbye and loading the car for the airport, I felt like I was saying goodbye to old friends, and of course that is really what they are becoming. When you see Jorge at the bar, tell him that Jeff from Minnesota is still working on recreating his Papa T's margarita (he tells me the secret is the fresh squeezed lime juice). We will be back in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but I wouldn't rave about it!”
Reviews.Author: ItchyfeetOxford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The atmosphere here is very laid back and relaxed, and the grounds are beautiful. (I'm a cat lover, so I enjoyed playing with 2 kittens in the grounds one night). The location is very close to 5th Avenue & to the beach. There is a huge choice of Restaurants, & it's great for people watching. We met Cheri & she was really helpful. The bar closes at 11pm, but if you want to stay out later than that you have your own key to get in, as the gates to the Hotel are locked. This gave us a nice feeling of being secure. We started in a smaller room to begin with, which was still very nice and cosy, but for the rest of our stay we upgraded to a bigger family room. . The larger room had a kitchem area, table, & free bottled water, which was a nice touch. Our only problem with this room was the noise. It overlooked the street, so if you like a quiet room, don't choose this one. Although the air con was noisy when on, we were woken in the middle of the night by people in the room below us moving furniture (on a tiled floor). As it contined, I went downstairs to complain, but the noise had now stopped, & all the lights were switched off. I mentioned it to the young guy on Reception the next day. Unfortunately, he didn't seem to understand English, so I suspect nothing was done. The next night, we were woken again. I complained again to the older man on Reception the next day (sorry didn't catch ether of the Reception guys names) Anyway, he understood, & on our last night all was quiet! On reflection, maybe we should of stayed in the smaller, quieter room. My only other gripe is there was no hairdryers, apart from that it's good value for money,

Reviews.Title: “Third times a Charm”
Reviews.Author: TJ22
Reviews.Content: This trip was my wife and I's third stay at Luna Blue. Everything went smoothly and the hotel just keeps getting better. This time due to my poor scheduling, I was unable to stay in the same room for the entire trip. They worked with me to come up with a solution that worked for me and the transition from one room to the other room went very smoothly and did not interfere with our plans in the slightest. They expanded the bar while I was there, man those laborers worked hard and quickly. The bar is nice and was very busy a few nights and is a great place to get a drink, but they close it up at 11pm and it never disturbed us at all. The staff was helpful as always and our trip went off without a hitch. I highly recommend this hotel. You can check out my other reviews of this establishment for more details.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and owners truly make this place great.”
Reviews.Author: maddymonkey
Reviews.Content: In July 2008, all my friends in a wedding party were staying at a Playa all-inclusive. By the end of the week, they were jealous of my tree-top digs at Luna Blue and hanging out in the swing bar with me instead of drinking free margaritas at their place. The hotel is downright gorgeous and perfectly situated to not only do the beach/shopping/tourist Playa stuff, but also to get out into Playa itself and discover something authentic. The staff and owners here are key. From the homey welcome to the complimentary room upgrade, the spot-on recommendations for restaurants the locals frequent to the tasty drinks and conversation on a sultry night in the swing bar, you just cannot ask for a nicer experience away from home. First-class all the way. And you can never go wrong with your own hammock!

Reviews.Title: “what a great place”
Reviews.Author: lmt_9
Reviews.Content: We spent nine days at Luna Blue and can't say enough good things about the location, the staff and the general overall ambience. The swing bar is fabulous and the drinks were some of the best we had in all of Playa. The rooms are cozy and there is a fabulous yoga studio right across the street as well as numerous incredible restaurants with in a block or two. We can hardly wait to go back next year. Thanks Tony and Cheri.

Reviews.Title: “Third trip to Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: gimli201Chicago
Reviews.Content: My body arrived home to Chicago two days ago; my heart and soul are still somewhere lost on the flight - lost baggage perhaps? We spent a too short but wonderful week in PDC. This was our third trip in 2 1/2 years to PDC and Luna Blue. This trip was even better than the first two because we knew where to stay, knew where to go, and got great advice (again) on new restaurants to try. We were initially curious because on previous trips we stayed in either the deluxe (with a mini kitchen) or treetop room. On this trip, due to the economy, we opted for a standard room on the main floor. People - this room was smaller, but still wonderful and only $78/night! We loved it! It IS only a five minute walk to the beach with free passes. Tony, Cheri, and the staff were as gracious as ever - offering advice on new restaurants and just being themselves. There is no pretentiousness here - probably why we love it so much. Feel free to email me with personal questions about restaurants/Akumal/PDC/general information. Thanks again to everyone at Lune Blue and hopefully we'll see you next winter when blizzards hit the midwest! :)

Reviews.Title: “great getaway”
Reviews.Author: recneps8
Reviews.Content: Spent the first two weeks in March and it was our first time in Playa del Carmen. The Luna Blue is first rate for price, services and location. The staff are great and very helpful, especially Genaro. He knows everything about the Playa. Aside from a noisy bar scene one night (no fault of the hotel) we really enjoyed everything and plan to return again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with attentive staff!”
Reviews.Author: beachwalker57
Reviews.Content: Centrally located with nice clean rooms and a wonderfully attentive staff. Close to lots of great resturants, shops and the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, tranquil, inviting and the perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mama924
Reviews.Content: There is so much I could say about this hotel. First, it was not like a hotel to me but more like a home. It is warm and inviting. We never felt uncomfortable walking the grounds but always welcome. The gardens are absolutely incredible! The stone work and landscaping is done and maintained so beautifully and zen like. The bar is quaint and fun and always clean. It is beyond tranquil here and you can even have a massage in the gardens under the trees! Our check in was effortless. Gennaro was so respectful and patient. He answered every question we had, and we had many! He walked us to our room and carried all of our luggage himself. Our room was SPOTLESS! It was the perfect size for my husband and and I loved the hand painted quote on the wall as well the painting above our bed. Linens were clean, soft and pretty. Our maid gave us towel art everyday and I was excited each day when we returned from the beach to see what she had done! We had the treetop terrace room (#36) and it had a very large balcony with a cocktail table, 4 chairs and a hammock. It was a perfect setting high above the trees with birds chirping and trees and flowers surrounding the balcony. We enjoyed this space every day after the beach for a snack and a few cocktails and every night after our return from an awesome night of dining and fun, for a night cap. The location of Luna Blue couldn't be in a more perfect spot. The upper 20's of Fifth Avenue is a little more quiet and less congested than the southern section and it was refreshing not to have to navigate through all the people in the streets. I do enough of that in NYC! It is also considered Little Italy and had a couple of wonderful restauants right around the corner from the hotel. We even ventured further north towards 40th and the peacefulness of the streets. There is a convenience store on the corner of 10th and 26th where you could buy everything your need for your stay including ice, alcohol, snacks, lotions or anything you may have forgot while packing. As for the owners, Tony & Cheri, they were professional, accommodating, sweet, friendly and compassionite. Our original date to visit the Luna Blue had to be changed because of a health issue with my husband which required surgery and recovery right at the time we were suppose to go to Playa. They did everything they could to accommodate our changes and we are most grateful for that alone. They are hands on with everything and do their best to socialize with their guests as if they are family and not guests at all. I love this about them. Finally, I was beyond sad to leave because I had never felt more comfortable in any other hotel. I felt like I was leaving home, which is why I will be returning, because we always find our way back home, don't we?

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: Kingpinmaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in a Deluxe room (#31). A/c worked Great! Room is plenty large inside. Comes with 5 gallon water in room. A nice feature is very fast Wi-Fi in the room! Only a few blocks from the beach. The owners are Great people as is their staff. We had them rent us a van/driver for a day trip to Coba/Cenotes (very good value). Our room was kept very clean every day. The staff and ambiance were both terrific! If you don't need a 200 room hotel with Ginormous fountains, beachfront, swimming pool and/or kids club, Luna Blue is a great value! We would send our most loved relatives there. Thanks T & C! Donny & Randa

Reviews.Title: “Stop this is the hotel your looking for!!!”
Reviews.Author: Playahangn
Reviews.Content: Never have I written a review for a hotel. Luna Blue changed everything. Just like you I read all the reviews most were great, a few were bad. But if your looking for old Playa in a great location, your not going to be let down. Luna Blue will probably surprise you more than you think. 1st: The location is perfect! No your not right on the beach, but you have access to 2 great beach clubs. Your between 5th and 10th in the quiet part of Playa. Your cares start to melt away once you step though the gate into the garden. You are going to get one great big Hug from this hotel. If your looking for a Big all inclusive hotel Luna Blue is not for you. If your looking for a small inviting hotel, one that the owners and staff have put a lot of work and great energy into welcome to Luna Blue. 2nd: I stayed in room #34. My room was clean with white walls and blue curtains. The balcony of this room is great for sitting with your coffee, or drink and minding everyones business below. While the bathroom was a little small, it had a great shower with even better big fluffy towels. 3rd: You will makes friends fast at the Luna Blue. Tony and Cheri are great people that are loved by the guest and the staff. By the way if your not sure what to see or do the staff will be more than glad to help. Your 1st night you should pull up to the swing bar for a great drink. You will get some great ideas from other travelers. By the end your your vacation you will be telling others what they need to check out in Playa. Playa has changed a lot over the years. It`s getting bigger every month. But it`s nice to know there are place like the Luna Blue to give you that big welcoming hug. I hope this review has help you with your choice. I`m sure you will be happy with the Luna Blue. Glenn Hess

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mushiquino
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were here for a week in August, '08. We based our decision to stay at the Luna Blue on previous reviews and we were not at all disappointed. We found the grounds of the hotel beautiful and well kept -- a tropical jungle with a bar. Our room was clean and more minimalist in its decoration -- white and blue with Spanish arches. We had an endless supply of water, as promised. We opted for a room with a small refrigerator; we filled it up a couple of times by walking fifteen minutes away from the touristy part of Playa through more authentically Mexican neighborhoods to -- ironically -- the Wallmart. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous in every possible way; they changed our bathroom towels each day (even twisting them up to look like swans, if you're into that kind of thing) and gave us beach towels whenever we needed them; they kept our room immaculate. We had one bump in our trip -- I got sick -- and the hotel staff immediately directed me to a doctor a few blocks away. (He saw me almost immediately and I was better by the evening). They followed up to see how I was doing as well. The hotel is in a quieter stretch of Playa, a bit removed from most of the bars, so we never had too much noise and had no problems sleeping at any point. This is important if you go during high season and want to find a stretch of beach that is not overcrowded -- Luna Blue gives you free passes to Mamita's Beach Resort -- a beautiful beach with turquoise water -- but you have to get there early for a spot (with the palapa covering to protect you from the sun, which can get brutal). This means, at least for us, getting to bed not too late, to be up and at the beach by 8. Maybe this isn't the case at other times of the year -- not sure. One small detail -- the VIP discount card the hotel gave us was not honored at all Playa restaurants, contrary to what the card itself says. This is not the hotel's fault, just an example of bad business on the part of some establishments. Luna Blue is great value and a fantastic place. We could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Stay at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: tabutne
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Luna Blue. The Hotel is relaxing, comfortable, fun, and beautiful and we felt very lucky to have found it! We really loved the St. Patrick's Day party at the Bar, and the evenings in the garden grotto were fantastic. Our room was clean, comfortable, and private. The only small issue we had was the wireless internet access did not reach up to our little nest so we had to go down a couple flights of stairs to use it, but hey, we were on vacation, what the heck did we need a computer for anyway! The location of Luna Blue is really perfect too, close to everything but away from the major hustle and noise that would keep you up at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... lives up to everything everyone is saying about it!”
Reviews.Author: Scooter1970
Reviews.Content: I meant to post this right after we got back from our holiday... must still be basking in the glow of how great it was! LOL We stayed at the Luna Blue from February 7th to February 21st, 2009 - and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This quaint 18 room hotel is situated on Calle 26 Norte between 5th and 10th Avenues. It's in a great location as it is close to the ever-popular 5th Avenue, but just enough off the beaten path to count as a quiet getaway. Although small in size, it has a fantastic range of room types to suit most travellers - everything from the basic right up to their treetop terrace rooms with large deck. We stayed in room 23, which was located on the 3rd floor of the hotel (see pictures for what it looked like). The staff was extremely friendly... and I must personally thank Genero (front desk mgr.) and Jorge (bartender) for making our stay extra special. Genero would help us with all the little daily things... and Jorge took care of making all of our fantastic drinks - including those great shots of tequila he'd pour up. Here's some of the things we really enjoyed about this hotel: 1) swing bar... perfect little getaway to meet people from all over the world in a relaxed setting - and with the best bartender around; 2) use of beach chairs and a palapa at Mamita's Beach Club - which was located only a couple of blocks away; 3) each room had a small fridge to store whatever food and beverages you'd have on hand, along with a water cooler so you'd always have water whenever you needed it. Although there was no restaurant at this hotel, there were many located within a short walking distance - so you didn't have to worry about going hungry. All in all... a great little hotel at a great price. Many thanks to Tony and Cheri for having one heck of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, rooms, location and staff couldn't be better.”
Reviews.Author: oldnorht2
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Luna Blue with family and friends. So we had 4 rooms all different types. Everyone was very happy with the value, clean rooms, location and staff. My husband and I had stayed the previous week in two different all inclusive's including one that was very high end. We enjoyed our stay at Luna Blue far more than either of the other stays. We had the kitchen room and it was so nice to have the ability to make a few meals. The staff was wonderful and both beaches were fun. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Delightful”
Reviews.Author: MarissaT
Reviews.Content: We found this little gem through a friend's recommendation. The setting is gorgeous, the rooms were sparkling clean, it's located 1/2 block off of 5th Avenue, and the staff were friendly and extra accomodating. Our first 5 nights, we stayed in a large room that included a kitchenette. It was very private and we had our own hammock outside our room. We loved that room. The last 2 nights, we moved to another room that was smaller and cheaper but still nice. My only caution would be to ask how close your room is to the bar. The bar itself is outside, and so much fun, BUT, if you're trying to turn in early, it doesn't close until 11 pm and can be very noisy. Also, they have live music in the bar every Tuesday night which was so enjoyable....but just keep it in mind

Reviews.Title: “8 nights in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: leftlanne
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Luna Blue and intend to return again next year. Check in was quick and easy, the room was clean and comfortable, the location the best! We love the bar which was a great addition. Also, the maid service was so great. They were in and out while we were out for breakfast, and did a really nice job. The only thing that could have improved our stay would be a coffee maker in the room. Great vacation---great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I stay at Luna Blue every time I visit Playa because of the owners and staff...”
Reviews.Author: rcurle
Reviews.Content: ...I love Luna Blue because the staff are so friendly, the owners are really involved with the hotel. I get great recommendations on the local activities and parties. The hotel has some simple accomadations. The location is great if you love beautiful beaches. Playa is getting a bit crowded but it offers so many near by beaches that aren't crowded if you want to get away.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: roadagent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I both enjoyed our trip to Playa and especially our stay at the Luna Blue Hotel. After two stay's in Cancun we wanted to try something a little more laid back,we found that at the Luna Blue. The owner's Tony&Cheri,as well as all of the staff,did all they could to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Playa is more urban than I thought it would be,that's cool,it just means more places to eat and party if you care to. Although, Jorge makes some pretty good drinks at the Hotel bar so it also is a fun place to hang out and get to know some of the other guest's. The central garden is the greatest place to chill,smoke a cigar,chat or nap. Tony tells me these types of gardens are sort of going by the wayside with newer hotels,just another reason this place is so unique. If your after glitz and all the frills this isn't it. But if you want a comfortable,clean and friendly place with a good value,that it is.

Reviews.Title: “Another Year, Another Stay at Luna Blue.”
Reviews.Author: MisterMetalDetector
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Luna Blue for the past 3 or possibly 4 years now, every January, for 2 or 3 weeks. They continue to offer excellent value for their location compared to most neighboring hotels....trust me, I compare prices and have stayed at many other hotels in Playa previous years. They also retain excellent, long term staff which is a plus in the hospitality industry. They were also very responsive in having the AC repaired in my unit in a timely manner when the compressor went out. The courtyard "forest/garden" area is in my opinion one of their biggest assets. It is an area of sanctuary and serenity outside of the usual street commotion. It can be a little warm due to the ocean breeze being cut off by a neighboring hotel, but it is very peaceful sitting in the dry cenote area watching the waterfall. You may also see at night, a family of oppossums which live in the garden. The small bar with swinging seats is a new addition the past year and is a nice place to wind down an evening and chat with fellow hotel room neighbors or others who live nearby and are having a drink. The bar closes for the night at 23:00. On Tuesday evenings there is an acoustic guitar player (with speakers) who plays at the bar and who attracts a fairly large crowd so there is a noise issue until 23:15 but if you bring earplugs like I do when visiting Mexico and drink enough Tequila, you should have no problem :) Hope this helps anyone thinking of visiting a wonderful part of Mexico. See you next January.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast at the Blue!!”
Reviews.Author: Phillyfaninga
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Luna Blue for ten days in November so I apologize to T&C for the tardiness of the review. This was our third straight November trip back to Playa after we honeymooned there. The previous two years we had stayed in the same condo on Calle 24 and 1st. We decided to switch to Luna Blue after not being as happy with the condo the 2nd time around. We chose it for the look of the hotel and lobby area, its location in Playa Norte, and the dead-on advice of the owners on their own blog, TA, and playa.info . In the interest of full disclosure, we had also met Tony and Cheri on our trip last year at a PeepMeet and thought they were great people whom we would want to give both our business and our company. Reviews of the Luna Blue tend to be overwhelmingly positive, with some "I dont get the hype, " and of course as with any place "The worst experience we've ever had." I think it is key that travelers have realistic expectations and realize that what makes this place special is not for everybody. This is not an AI. The rooms are basic and there are no TV's. As a TV addict, I was surprised to find that this was a great thing for us. It was invigorating to break some entrenched habits! For you sports junkies, there are numerous restaurants and bars literally footsteps away for your NFL, soccer, college, hockey, basketball, etc. Plus, this is what DVR is for. If you need a hair dryer, bring it. My wife adjusted rapidly and my long flowing locks (haha) did not suffer. We had one of the rooftop terrace rooms with our own little patio/seating area as well as hammock. It was immaculate and cleaned on a daily basis with a different piece of towel art every day. There were no bugs in excess of what could be expected outside in Mexico. Our shower could have had a smidge more pressure, but not a big deal in the scheme of things especially since we were used to our Monstrostream shower head at home that takes a few layers of skin off each day. We had a minifridge and huge filtered water dispenser that is absolutely crucial to any Mexico trip. There was not a microwave in our room, but I believe they have some in their kitchen suite rooms. We didnt miss it. We tend to be out of the room for the most part on our vacations, so it perfectly fit our needs. It was nice to wake up each morning and sit on our patio. Wireless internet on the hotel's secured network is available, but remember you need to get the code so you can use it. We found it helpful to bring our laptop and would suggest it. If you are still awake (ZZZZZ boring), on to the fun stuff. In our opinion the lobby, seating areas, and Tiki bar really made our stay wonderful. Pretty much every night from 5pm onward you get an assortment of hotel guests and other travelers bellying up to grab a good swing. And I mean a REAL swing so get your mind out of the gutter. We met great folks from all over the US, Canada, Norway, Finland, and as far away as Israel. My wife still communicates with them frequently through Facebook, but I have yet to make the plunge as MySpace is offering a free bubba keg. It provided a comforting and fun place to start every night. You never knew who you would meet, but you could always have a good time. It was almost like being at the bar at a European Hostel mixed with Cheers. If you are an "early to bed" person, please be aware the bar closes promptly at 11pm. If you go to sleep earlier, there will be some noise from the bar, but the staff goes to lengths to keep the volume acceptable. If you need absolute silence at 9pm, this might not be the place for you. After 11pm, there are metal gates slid in to close off the Tiki and lobby area. To leave and return you are given a key for a door to the left. You are not "locked in" and it is a good security measure. I can not understate what a great location it is. It is a short half block to 5th and a 5 minute walk if that to some of the major beach clubs like Mamitas. You do get a coupon for Mamitas so use it. It is also a short walk to numerous excellent restaurants with more of a local flavor on Constituyeuntes and 30th not to mention the Walmart and Mega. It is in the trendier and less touristy Playa Norte where new places are always springing up. The "Cruise Crowd" does not make it up this far and if they did, they would not want to get back on the boat! Last but not at all least, the owners and staff were absolutely fantastic. The owners go out of their way to take care of their staff in numerous ways we witnessed first hand. This translates into the staff being incredibly responsive and invested in making a good experience for travelers. Jorge was the bartender and did an awesome job with giving advice, entertaining us, and helping our Spanglish. As an added bonus, if you like some volunteer/charity thrown in to your vacation, Luna Blue will from time to time host benefits for local causes. When we were there they had an art exhbition and sale to benefit the Peanut Pet Shelter, a no-kill shelter in Playa started by two great people from the UK. I would be happy to answer any and all questions you would have about Luna Blue. The strongest compliment I can give is that Lord willing we will be going back to stay there this coming November. Muchos gracias Tony, Cheri, Genaro, Mario and of course Jorge!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: BigMexicofan
Reviews.Content: I have visited Playa del Carmen for several years. I usually stay at the same hotel which is located on the beach and near the center of town. This time, I really didn't want to deal with holiday crowds and decided to spend my time in the northern part of Playa. I selected the Luna Blue because its location and because some of my friends who stay here recommended it very highly. I have no complaints but only high praises for this hotel. I booked a standard room that was located on the first floor next to the side gate. This is the entrance that is used when the main gate is closed. When I saw this, I was a bit worried because I thought there would be a lot of traffic late at night. It was not bad at all. Another plus about this room is that you can get a strong signal for your wireless connection. I could stay in my room while I used my laptop. I just loved this! I think I got an excellent deal for the price I paid which was $70.00 USD for four nights. The room was cleaned on a daily basis, and the bed was comfortable. I also liked that there was a large dispenser of purified water in my room. I have to add that the room is very nicely decorated with Mexican rustic pine furniture, beautiful art, and fixtures. Another nice detail of the Luna Blue is that there is a small bar on the property. The prices of drinks are very reasonable, and Jorge makes some very tasty mixed drinks. It's nice to have a chance to have a drink before going out, or a nightcap after returning from dinner. The staff at the Luna Blue is excellent and they went out of their way to make my stay a very pleasant one. It is noteworthy to add that Jorge and Genaro are very patient because I always asking them a bunch of questions. On the second to the last day of my stay, I asked Genaro about a shop that sells silver. Instead of just giving me the name of a business, he walked me to the shop and introduced me to the owner. I thought this was very nice of him. The location is something else that I think makes the Luna Blue a great place. Nearby are several restaurants, coffee shops, and small bars. Across the street is a laundromat and a small store. If you need a larger selection of snacks, beer, and other things, around the corner is an OXXO convenience store. The hotel provides free passes to Mamitas which is a short walk away. Mil Gracias Tony and Cheri.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: absnyd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Luna Blue from January 12-16th. We had a very relaxing stay. Unfortunately it rained the whole time we were there, but since we were there on a romantic getaway, it didn't bother us too much;) We stayed in room #35, it was always kept very clean and the bed was firm, but comfortable. We enjoyed our balcony that overlooked the beautiful courtyard, although it would have been nicer to have a true partition from the next room, we had no problems with this. The staff was very polite and always greeted us with a warm, "Hola". The bar was a nice touch and we liked that it did not stay open too late. There is construction noise around playa during the day, but the air conditioner hum drowns it out. We loved being able to walk around 5th avenue and explore. Our favorite find was a "El Asador de Manolo", right around the corner on 10th between 24-26th streets. We ate there twice it was so wonderful. Fabulous steaks! We would definitely stay at the Luna Blue again, and hope to do so in the future. Pros-good price, adults only, tropical feel, nice location cons-no phones in room to reach the front desk when someone was loudly singing the theme song to Titanic in Spanish at 2:30am in the lobby one night.

Reviews.Title: “Our Return to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jswcruise
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Luna Blue in the past 12 months. Last February we stayed in Room 36 , one of the Treetop Terrace rooms!! What a fabulous view from the balcony!! This year was a last minute booking (and the most wonderful unexpected Christmas gift from my husband!!) so he booked what was available - a kitchen room 5 nights and a supreme room the other 2 nights. Missed Room 36, but just glad to be back! Really enjoyed the Luna Blue Bar. Tuesday nights are loads of fun and the margaritas are "potent"!! The Luna Blue staff are the greatest. "G" is the man and goes above and beyond to take care of his customers! The housekeeping staff work hard and do an outstanding job. We are frequent travelers and have always enjoyed cruising. No trip has been as wonderful as our our trips to Playa and the Luna Blue Hotel. It's taken relaxation to the next level! Already planning our next trip! Thanks again Luna Blue! Jamie and Jeff Walker Farmville, NC

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: rbrophy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were bypassing the "Resortiness" of Cancun, having experienced it in a more innocent time 30 years ago, and wanted a more down-to-earth stay in Playa. Luna Blue came through on everything we wanted. We didn't want to pay for a pool, elevators, a massive buffet or golf, but the basics from which you can build your trip: a spacious clean room, central location, convenient street parking, a homey friendly bar, passes and towels for the local beach club, and all at very reasonable prices. The owners and staff were very friendly, the rooms and property quite secure, and the setting was tropical and romantic not plastic and tacky. We started out in a budget room which was adequate and the only one available the first night, then upgraded to a deluxe for a few more dollars - best value and huge amount of space. The accommodation is on a one-way side street at the northen end of the main tourist strip so if your room faces the street it won't be the quietest, but most rooms are internal-facing. The Tuesday night bar party was unexpected fun and it shuts down at a reasonable hour if you want to sleep...wish we were there for the Parrothead nights as Jimmy Buffett's a legend!

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blues”
Reviews.Author: Whitecat11
Reviews.Content: I have a hard time understanding how this is rated so high. Yes, it is a nice hotel and it is certainly worth a visit but the prices range from 70-100 dollars for a room that is worth 35. Rooms are generic with a loud refrigerator which I had to unplug every night in order to sleep. If you get up early in the morning and want to go get a cup of coffee, you are actually locked in the place. The bar is nice but definetly overpriced. Going to Mexico and paying 7 dollars for a drink is not my idea of a good time. The highlight was the little restaurant across the street which had daily specials.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: LauritaUk
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay at the Luna Blue, it is very well situated just off the main road where all the restaurants and bars are, and not far from the beach. We had a very nice room, although our air con didn't work properly! I loved that the maid made our towels into the shape of different animals every day! Very cute! The gardens were very pretty. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place and probably stay here again. Laura

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: slickvick
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue is the perfect retreat away from the crazyness that is Quinta Ave. We had spent the majority of our trip in Tulum and Akumal, so coming to Playa del Carmen took some getting used to! We were happy that Luna Blue could provide such a relaxing environment. I'm not sure if there are any other places in town like Luna Blue! Don't get me wrong, we enjoyed are time on Quinta Ave but it was sooo nice to be able to ditch the techno music and come back to a nice quiet refuge. You could hear some street noise and some chatter from the downstairs bar, but by 10pm it was usually quiet. We just turned on the AC anyway and any noise was drowned out. We stayed in room #35 which had a large shared balcony which overlooked the courtyard. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of hot water in the bathroom. Its a short 3 block walk to the beach - if you want to use your free passes to Mamitas Beach club be sure to get there early since only a small portion of their beach chairs (the ones that are convieniently located closest to the speakers that blare techno music basically all day long) are alloted as 'free' to guests who recieve the same passes from other hotels. We just ended up walking a ways north on the beach and found our own (waaay less crowded) spot for the day. Overall we had a great stay at Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “OK but I'm not going to rave about it...”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBabe
Reviews.Content: I am slightly confused at the over-the-top enthusiasm of other reviewers for the Luna Blue. Yes, it is well located and the staff are very friendly and helpful (no sign of the owners when we were there though). The free passes to Mamitas are also welcome although we only went there a few days during our two week stay. The room is clean, basic and much the same as those we have stayed in in other countries. The garden is nice although a haven for mossies. We were in a superior room which was at the top back of the hotel and unfortunately you could hear noise from the main road nearby all night. Plus on two nights we were disturbed by a bleeping from outside which sounded every minute or so - all night! Wasn't sure if it was something to do with cruise ships or what but the ear plugs I used to kill the road noise didn't help. What would be nice is windows that shut properly and cut out the noise but unfortunately a lot of the windows in the room were louvred and useless for this. So it was OK and serviceable but nothing to get so excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue was just great!”
Reviews.Author: alexandraMapleRidge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Luna Blue Hotel in Playa Del Carmen for one week. Tony and Sherry were very helpful helping us arrange transportation from the airport and making us feel welcome on arrival. The hotel itself is simple, yet quaint, and is situated close to the main 5th street but just enough off the street to give one a sense of privacy and peace. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a nice getaway that offers a romantic, easy-going, and safe environment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: The_Destroyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Luna Blue for our honeymoon the last days of December and first days of January. We booked the hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and I must say that we were not disappointed with our stay. The hotel is located in the quieter part of town, but still very close to good restaurants, shopping, and the beach. We walked everywhere we needed to go in town without any problems. The hotel is about two blocks from the beach, but it's not a bad walk at all and you avoid being situated near some loud clubs. The atmosphere in the hotel is very pleasant. Being built around a lush garden area, we enjoyed sitting in the lounge area and reading and relaxing when we didn't feel like heading out. The bar is also very nice and the atmosphere there is very pleasant. The bartender was friendly and locals and visitors to the town both enjoy the swing chairs and the Jimmy Buffet tunes. Very cool atmosphere. My husband and I are both 24 and while most of the guests at the Luna were older than us, I would recommend the hotel to anyone, the atmosphere is very chill for anyone looking to relax and enjoy town. We stayed in room 22, one of the "tropical hideaway" rooms. The room was very comfortable for two people with only a couple of exceptions. The bed could have been a little softer, it was pretty firm, but didn't kill us. Our only other complaint with the hotel at all is that the door to the bathroom is very thin and offers very little privacy. Otherwise, the multiple windows offered a beautiful view, the air conditioning worked great, we loved the layout of the bathroom and main room and the hotel staff was very quick to replace the fresh water they provide when we ran out. We also really enjoyed the beautiful towel displays the maids left every day! The Luna Blue "isn't the ritz" as one other guest so eloquently put it, there is no pool, no room service, but if you want a quiet place to stay that is clean, safe, comfortable, and friendly look no further! Let me also say a little bit about the concierge service. Genaro, who works during the day at the front desk, was absolutely invaluable to us during our stay. He helped us book tours, find restaurants, navigate in and out of town, and got us off the beaten path, something we really enjoyed! He was absolutely the best thing about the great experience we had at Luna. If we return to Playa del Carmen we have plans to stay at La Luna Blue, in fact we have already recommended it to my mother and father-in-law and my parents! We really had a spectacular honeymoon in Playa and at the Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but strange things happened”
Reviews.Author: CCF_love2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel alot and have stayed at many hotels in many cities/towns/villages across the world - from the dodgy backpacker ones to 5-star hotels. We have never experienced something like this before. I was spooked out a little and was glad to leave the hotel at the end of the stay. We stayed at PDC for 5 nights in total, but only in Luna Blue for 3 nights as there weren't vacancies for other nights (it was the peak tourist season in PDC and most hotels only had the off day or two available). We wanted the standard room but unfortunately there weren't any available so we got room number 9 (I believe it is the treetop terrace a.k.a. the love nest). The room is all the way up on the top floor (4 flights of stairs) and is quite a big room with a terrace. As the room was above the trees on the hotel grounds, we could get enough sunlight in the room. To be fair to the owners, I'll start off with the good points - the location is good - it's on the quiet end of 5th Avenue, with walking distance to the nicer part of the beach. When we checked in, Cheri was there and she was happy to offer any advice on travelling to cenotes and other activities. The room itself, room number 9, was quite good sized with a big bathroom. There was a stair going down, but obviously this is not in use. I also liked the fact that water is provided in the room. All deco is blue (curtains, bedding) but hey, that is the name of the hotel. What I didn't fancy much was that the hotel grounds is generally quite dark as it has loads of trees and foliage. I couldn't see most of the hotel building, but i think that was the idea of the owners. If you want some sunlight then the rooms on higher floors is probably better. The rooms were just OK and I wouldn't regard them as being one of the nicer ones I've stayed in. Everything went ok for us until strange things happened at night. On the first night we were there, we slept very soundly as we travelled from Palenque by an overnight bus. On the second night, the alarm clock in the room went off at 12 midnight. Now this may sound minor and silly to complain about, and that there's nothing wrong with this, but the point is that we both made sure that the alarm clock was switched off from the night we arrived. It didn't ring the first night, and we thought maybe the cleaner might have accidentally switched it on. However, the bedside table (which the alarm clock was on) was not touched by the cleaner as we noticed our things strewn on it remained unmoved. Anyway, we could deal with an alarm clock going off - it's no big deal and we didn't think much of it later. On the third and final night, I was totally spooked out. We were both very tired and called it a night at around 1am. We were sleeping soundly when a light in the room switched on by itself. This was the light closest to the air-con, ie, the far left of the room, and the switch was on the same wall. My husband claimed that as he stirred from his sleep, he actually saw the lights came on and heard the switch click. He was pretty groggy at that point and didn't realise I was next to him, so he thought I had gone up to turn on the lights and asked me if I did so. I was next to him, of course, still fast asleep and when he asked me, I opened my eyes to see the lights on. Of course I didn't switch on the lights, and neither do we both sleepwalk! We kept asking each other if we actually switched off the lights before we went to bed, but of course we did - it was a bright wall light and we both cannot sleep with lights on, and have never left lights on at night. I have to admit I was pretty spooked out - I couldn't go back to sleep for the next hour and we tried to think of a logical explanation for this - we thought it might be an electrical fault, but I've never heard of an electrical fault causing lights to switch ON - it is more possible for an electrical fault to cause lights to go off (i'm happy for anyone to correct me on this, I'm no electrical guru!) I then recounted our first night and thought to myself that I was never comfortable from the time we went to sleep in the room. There were a number of noises in the room at night that just made me feel uncomfortable generally - fair enough there were the usual noises such as the expansion/contraction of furniture due to heat, the aircon and the fridge radiator. But then again I am just finding a logical explanation for everything. It's not just the noises that made me uncomfortable, it's just the general feeling and ambiant of the room (I have to say that the huge picture on the wall of a fierce-looking long-haired woman wasn't very calming). On check out, i informed the front desk staff about this - he seemed surprised and I asked him to check the room for any electrical fault, which he said he would. What I would like is an explanation - is there an electrical fault in the room? If not, how do you explain the lights switching on, on its own, in the middle of the night? My husband is a real cynic when it comes to certain matters, but even he could not think of a logical explanation. I read some of the reviews on tripadvisor, but could not, so far, find a comment on this. So what I'd say about the hotel is - yes, it is located in a good place, but having stayed at two other hotels in PDC, I preferred the Hotel Villa Del Mar, which was cheaper and had much nicer rooms (and bright and airy grounds).

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: grandmarnia
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay and the friendly staff were more than willing to help in any way possible. the rooms were clean and cheerful. desk personal arranged trransportation for any outside trips as well as to the airport when leaving....always with a smile. the bar is a drawing card for everyone and all are made to feel part of a larger family while enjoying a friendly sip. a great beach is close by and the water inviting. the temps even in november are beach worthy. would recommend this hotel and Playa del Carmen without reservation. walks down 5th avenue each evening to find a great place to eat and then to help walk off the extra pounds are a great way to end each day. as one couple had a room with a kitchen unit, we ate breakfast and lunch on site but went out each evening for dinner.....best of both worlds!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: cavermotif
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luna Blue just before Christmas. The hotel was beautiful, clean and the service was awesome! It is a great location because everything is walking distance, but at night it is quiet! The bar with the swinging seats is fun and a great place to meet the other guests. Cheers to the bartender and the hotel concierge!

Reviews.Title: “I'm so blue since leaving Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegZigg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fantastic week-long stay at the Luna Blue. The room was clean and comfortable, although the bed a bit hard and the shower too weak by North American standards. The hospitality of the staff, the great price, and the proximity to all things great in Playa del Carmen, is what would bring me back again and again. It was my first time abroad, and I am more than delighted with our choice to stay here. (We first heard of this hotel right here on TripAdvisor.) Kim From Winnipeg, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Luna for you”
Reviews.Author: MurManPhoenix
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd year staying at Luna Blue and we love it. It is conveniently located from the beach and 5th Ave which is the main pedestrian walkway. The staff are very nice and the addition of the small bar makes it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: marmaladeo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Luna Blue over Christmas. Our first night was in a Standard Room which was fine. The second night we moved to the Treetop Terrace Room which was fabulous! The location of the hotel is perfect. The rooms were very clean and the garden area is lovely. Holiday season the rates were high (but it seems they are everywhere during that time) but the price overall is very reasonable. We arrived late in the evening and because we advised them in advance there was no trouble with late check-in. The staff was very helpful in terms of suggesting restaurants, etc. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabel80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue for 4 nights at the end of a long trip round Mexico. It was the perfect end to our holiday and had everything we needed. Great location - close to beach and 5th Ave, very friendly staff, room spacious and clean, shower hot and powerful, good bar. The main thing we liked was that this place had character and wasn't a faceless bland 4/5 star resort like a lot of the other places in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Holidays in Playa”
Reviews.Author: tandtNj
Reviews.Content: We were able to spend the holidays in Playa and Luna Blue this year. We had a fantastic time! This is our third year in a row at Luna Blue..we enjoy the location, the rooms, the gardens, (now the swing bar), and the employees and owners are the best! On our second night, the owners, Cheri and Tony hosted a holiday party for guests of the hotel. We had a wonderful time enjoying the new swing bar and having a toast with all. In previous years we have done many of the local activities, this year we decided to take it easy and enjoy the beach. We loved the one tour we did, the Mayan Adventure with Alltournative Tours. We went to Coba and Mayan villages, along with other adventures, it was a whole day of fun! This trip, we visted many local great eateries, our favorite this time was La Caprichoza on 5th. We enjoyed the wonderful ceaser salad, flambee and Mayan coffee for dessert, yummy. Another favorite is the "lava bowl" at La Passion next store to Luna Blue. For drinks, we loved the new swing bar and bartender at Luna Blue, another fun place was the "Bad Boys Beach Club" on 4th and the beach. A great band plays on Thursday and Saturdays' at 5PM....Rock n' Roll, lots of fun! We finished our trip on New Years' Eve at the Luna Blue swing bar celebrating with new friends and Cheri and Tony...we will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue Hotel...our favorite getaway!”
Reviews.Author: BarryRemax
Reviews.Content: As repeat visitors to the Luna Blue we are always pleased with everything they have to offer.
