The lush cool courtyard is a welcome relief after a hot day at the beach.We visited with 4 other couples so the courtyard also served as a great place to gather for happy hour...love the bar (great margaritas too!) It is conveniently located near 5th Ave for restaurants ,cafes ,sportsbars,banks etc. We tell everyone about this place and can't wait to go back! Barry & Cari Chreptyk Vancouver,B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue gives a personal touch!”
Reviews.Author: Alytes
Reviews.Content: One of my friends that I was traveling with found the Luna Blue on Tripadvisor and booked us a room. We had three women in the room and each of us had our own bed. The air conditioning was a lifesavor! We actually cooked in the kitchen to save a few dollars and hung out on our porch and the roof. The beach was nearby and we had access to a great section as guests at the Luna Blue. While we didn't get to meet the owners, who were traveling, we recieved amazing attention and service from the manager, Genarro. He helped us figure out where to go, when to do it, and how to get there. He helped us find a taxi for a day that took us all over the nearby ruins - and the taxi driver was delightful too. Anytime we needed anything, Genarro took care of it imediately and with a great attitude. He also helped us practice our spanish, though he spoke excellent english. I would recommend this place to anyone trying to travel on a similar budget - great service, great location, and great people.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Des949
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Luna Blue based on reviews from Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. We were looking for a smaller hotel with great service and that's what we found at the Luna Blue Hotel. Our trip started with renting a car in Cancun and driving to Playa Del Carmen. This was an adventure all on it's own. Before we even got to the hotel we got lost and then stuck in a trench on the side of the road. Ok, so we got an early education in driving the streets of Playa del Carmen. Thank goodness for us the police and people are so friendly in Playa. We were ultimately pushed out of the trench by a police officer and two people off the street. After that ordeal we finally arrived at the Luna Blue....exhausted and hungry. As soon as we arrived Maurice saw the look on our face and said it looked like we needed an upgrade. This was unexpected and very nice after a very long travel day. From that moment forward we continued to experience the same great, friendly service during our entire stay. The hotel doesn't look like much from the street.....it is fairly decieving. Inside the gates though is a tropical oasis....pictures do not do it justice at all. The swing bar that's at the entrance is one of the best bars in Playa. Jorge is a riot and definitely made our stay memorable. We had a blast meeting other hotel guests and all the locals that frequent the bar. Overall, the Luna Blue is a great hotel for the money. The service and staff are outstanding....I must admit the staff there are far better than many 5 star hotels I have ever stayed at. If you are looking for a great budget hotel....this one can't be beat. Although we had a great time at the Luna, I must be fair and point out the negatives. There were very few. The Luna Blue is at the far end of 5th Ave. It is close to the beach, however, if you like to go dancing or to many of the hot spots...it's a bit of a walk. We found ourselves walking back and forth quite a bit between hanging out at the swing bar and going to some late night bars since Luna Blue closes it's gates at 11pm. This was not a huge deal, but it might be to some so I thought I would mention it. The rooms at this hotel were nice, but the beds were very firm and made sleeping difficult and uncomfortable. Another thing about the rooms....there was no hair dryer or extra pillows kept in the room. I'm not sure if it was just our room, but I found it strange. If you ask at the front desk they are more than happy to supply these items for you. I just found it strange that they wouldn't already be in the rooms. Other than the very minor room issues I mentioned....the hotel is wonderful and it is the fun, friendly atmosphere at this hotel that made our stay so great.

Reviews.Title: “Done searching for the perfect hotel in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: PlayaOrBust0
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our best vacation yet in Playa del Carmen. It was our second time there and I spent A TON of time online trying to find the perfect hotel for us on a budget. Lucky for us, I stumbled across the Luna Blue! I almost didn't want to write a review about it because it's one of those things that's so amazing, you just want to keep to yourself! 2 blocks from the best beach in Playa and right of Quinta (5th Avenue - the hotspot for locals and tourists alike), this hotel was in a word - PERFECT! We booked a "standard" room off of their website. It included a full bed and a twin, along with a bathroom, air conditioner, AND a water cooler - which saved us a ton of money on purified water! The hotel is clean, friendly, charming, beautiful, wonderful... it was an all around perfect stay! Notice that there aren't any TV's in ANY of the rooms but my theory is, if you want to watch TV on your vacation, just stay home! The hotel also has the best bar in Playa, in our opinion, with a fantastic bartender named Jorge who provided laughs, songs, and the best margarita's you'll ever find. We spend almost every night here because the bar itself attracts the "right" people: locals, foreign locals, and everyone else at the hotel. Of all the people we met, one absolutely LOVED "all-inclusive" hotels and had stated after staying here, she would never go back! The owners: well I can't say enough about them! Toni is probably the nicest guy you'll ever meet! Both him and Cheri give you the insider's tips on where to go, what to see, how to get there and anything else you want to know about Playa, Mexico, you name it! A few tips on travelling to Playa on a budget: 1.) From the airport, don't take a taxi or a tourist bus. The ADO (city bus) takes travelers and locals alike to and from the airport. It only costs $8, it's just as nice as the $20 buses to Playa and makes less stops! We even bought our return ticket ahead of time when we arrived in Playa at the station. 2.) Don't eat on Quinta! It's pretty much "American" prices everywhere on 5th. Check out 30th which is a few blocks North of 5th and runs parallel to it. Our favorite was "Los Amigos" which was never busy and super cheap! Try the "Tacos al Pastor" - it's a local tradition, so cheap (Less than $2 American for 5 tacos), and is sooooo good! They also have beers for $1.80; it's hard to beat these prices! Plus, the owners of Los Amigos were always there so even if you don't speak Spanish, this is a great place to go! 3.) Take the collectivos to Akumal Bay. Collectivos are basically vans on 2nd and 20th that leave when they're full to a destination. It costs less than $3 dollars to go to Akumal where you can bring your own snorkel gear or rent it and see real, live sea turtles! This was the highlight of our trip and cost practically nothing! We swam out by ourselves and got to experience these awesome turtles. If you can't find them, there will be groups in the bay populating around the turtles. 4.) To save money on the beach, we'd bring our own chips and salsa in a bag and just order beers. We also went to a supermarket to get pre-toasted toast for breakfast and other snacks so we only ate one real meal a day which saved us a ton of money and we never went hungry! Overall, the Luna Blue made our entire trip because we could afford everything else while staying in what felt like a 5-star hotel with built in neighbors and friends. The day we left, we felt like we were leaving home! So give the Luna Blue a try your next time around... you will love it! Thanks Toni and Cheri and Jorge! Lauren

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel, staff, owners, atmosphere, service in Playa”
Reviews.Author: CarribeanGirl82
Reviews.Content: The best smallest hotel i have ever stayed at. The best staff, owners, service, atmosphere. This is from someone who only stay s at all inclusive resorts. I am so done with all inclusive resorts. The feeling i got from staying at Cheri and Tony's hotel was like being a true paradis. Himi, Junero, Jore the maids they are sooooooooooooo awesome. i cant wait to go back. i have been to Playa De Carmen 6 times and this was the best vacation i ever had. i experienced the real culture and people in Playa I was not sad when i left. Because i know I will soon return to the la Luna Bleu hotel to the beautiful and relaxing atmosphere of the Luna Blue

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Blue”
Reviews.Author: sweenz7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue Nov. 6th - 10th......what a great time! Check in was a breeze, the hotel itself was full of character. We stayed in a treetop terrace room(this one was dubbed the Love Nest). It had a private balcony, water cooler, safe, and a bath tub(for when you're dirty and too drunk to stand). The drinks at the new Luna Blue bar were delicious(thanks to jorge).....the owners, Tony and Cheri were a delight to be around, and really made you feel at home. You got free passes to Mamita's beach club w/ a chair and a palapa.....the room was clean and tastefully decorated.....we would definitely not hesitate to stay there again, and would recommend it to ANYBODY! The only suggestion I can think of is maybe a bookshelf somewhere so people can do a book exchange when they are done with their books?.?. We loved the Luna Blue!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: olney3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights at Luna Blue and had a wonderful experience! From first stepping into the quiet garden lobby to the minute we checked out we had nothing but a positive experience. The staff is really the highlight of this quaint little hotel. They go above and beyond to make sure you are taken care of. From Jimmy to Gorge to Doris to Carmine they were all wonderful, bending over backwards to accommodate! The location is not to be beat, either; just a step away from the Fifth Avenue pedestrian street with every kind of restaurant, bar and boutique, but a world away from noise and bustle. We felt safe and secure the whole time. The other asset was the very clean rooms; our kitchenette was spotless; when we needed more bottled water, it was there in minutes! We loved being able to cook simple meals when we wanted to and the maids kept us very clean and neat. The rooms themselves encourage you to explore the area or read a good book; with no TV, radio or phone you are forced to find other entertainment options, which is not a bad thing!! It is a simple, quiet property, so if you're looking for lots of nightlife, you can walk to where ever you want to go out on 5th Ave. But, this is a great place to enjoy a drink while making new friends at the cozy swing bar at the hotel. We loved the easy access to the beach and walking the shore as the sun set was a favorite pastime. We would use our car to explore the area one day and then relax on the beach the next; towels provided by Luna Blue. This was a wonderful, relaxing, enjoyable vacation and we will return as well as recommend this place to The rooms themselves encourage you to explore the area or read a good book; with no TV, radio or phone you are forced to find other entertainment options, which is not a bad thing!! It is a simple, quiet property, so if you're looking for lots of nightlife, you can walk to where ever you want to go out on 5th Ave. But, this is a great place to enjoy a drink while making new friends at the cozy swing bar at the hotel. We loved the easy access to the beach and walking the shore as the sun set was a favorite passtime. We would use our car to explore the area one day and then relax on the beach the next; towels provided by Luna Blue. This was a wonderful, relaxing, enjoyable vacation and we will return as well as recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnaCumbria
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 11 nights at the Luna Blue. This hotel was chosen purely from the reviews on Tripadvisor and I totally agree with all the other comments. I would especially lie to mention Genaro on the front desk. He was most helpful advising us of the best way to get to places. He was very friendly and made us feel very welcome. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel itself is in an excellent location just off 5th Avenue, and a short walk to the beach ! would deffinately recommend Luna Blue to anyone going to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: RojEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Playa del Carmen for two weeks; one week at the Hotel Cielo (see separate review) and one week at the Luna Blue. I made my choices wholly as a result of reading all the TripAdvisor reviews. I would recommend the Luna Blue unreservedly to anyone seeking comfortable and modest accommodation in Playa. The bedrooms are spacious, airy, spotlessly clean and comfortable with both ceiling fan and air conditioning. The beds have high quality mattresses, pillows and linen and my room also had a fridge, purified water dispenser and safe deposit box. The en suite bathroom and shower were also excellent. The gardens, which all the rooms overlook, offered a tranquil and shady alternative to the useful rooftop sun terrace. I was travelling alone and the Luna Blue Bar was the perfect place to meet fellow guests at the hotel. I made several great friendships during my short stay there and the owners, Tony and Cheri are the most hospitable hosts one could ever wish to meet, introducing guests to each other and sharing their vast local knowledge of where to eat and what to see in Playa and beyond. If you are an independent traveller(s) who wants to take part in the lively and sometimes frenetic Playa del Carmen/Mexican/Mayan experience, but at the same time have a peaceful and chilled out refuge (and a good night's sleep - the Bar closes at 11.00pm sharp!) before venturing forth again the next day, I would uge you reserve your room at the Luna Blue without delay. You simply will not find a nicer place to stay. Thank you to everyone at the Luna Blue who made my holiday so memorable and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue made for a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa-ashburn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just took our very first trip to Mexico. I read lots of reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to stay at Luna Blue. We are so glad we did! The location is perfect - walk right out your door to 5th avenue where all the shops and bars are. Two blocks down and you are at the beach club - Luna blue supplies you with beach towels and a pass for chairs and an umbrella at the beach club. The garden in the middle of the hotel is beautiful. The staff gave us wonderful recomendations for restaurants, places to go, and called cabs when we needed them. We met the owners, Tony and Cheri at the hotel outside bar one evening and they are a blast. We also ended up meeting lots of other couples from all around the world as we sat (or rather swang on the bar swings) that night. Had so much fun that we all met back at the bar the next evening. Luna Blue is PERFECT for those that don't need the frilly extras of a large hotel, but are looking for a warm experience right in the heart of Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: PaintSlingerIowa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Luna Blue Hotel in Playa Del Carmen. We were there in the rain season but because of the excellent service from the staff and the new hotel bar our spirits never dampened. We have stayed in Mexico at two other locations and three other hotels. Some all-inclusive and some not. The service at the Luna Blue was the best we have ever recieved at any hotel in the States or International. The size is perfect for the staff to get to know you on a personal level. Every time you enter or exit the lobby you are greeted by name with a smile. The Bar and bartender wernt out of his way to make sure you have a good time. The staff helped with ordering food, letting us know were to go for this and that and were the best deals and funest places are. My wife and I have always stayed in larger hotels thinking we get the best of everything from them, no longer. The Luna Blue proved to us that thier size lets thier staff give personal attention to every guest. If you stay at the Luna Blue you will have no regrets! Bob & Holly Frary Stayed Oct. 9th - Oct. 15th

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' the Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: planevents77
Reviews.Content: After visiting Playa del Carmen two other times, I had passed by nd stopped by the Luna Blue and was immediately thrilled with what a beautiful property it was! The natural beauty of the plants, trees and waterfalls provides such a serene experience that you completely forget the street is just a few steps away! My husband and I stayed there for 5 nights for a wedding taking place and we could not have been more impressed! From the hospitable and friendly owners and staff...to the clean, comfortable room settings this is THE place to stay when in Playa and looking for something other than a stuffy all-inclusive. The room was a great size, the price just right, the AC felt great and the Luna Blue bar was the perfect gathering place each evening...we are in love and can't wait to go back to visit everyone there!!! Thank you so much Tony, Cheri, Jorge and everyone else...we miss you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luna Blue Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: SKSchicago
Reviews.Content: I decided on Luna Blue for my solo travel because of the terrific reviews on Trip Advisor. Luna Blue did not disappoint! It was a wonderful experience! Tony provided me with all the guidance and advice i needed--he, along with the staff, was very helpful and friendly. i got great restaurant recommendations and advice on how to travel to Tulum for a day trip. The rooms are quant and the hotel is quiet. I had a nice patio with lots of trees surrounding it. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. I wish for a similar hotel for all my travels! Thanks Luna! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: rubberarm21
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue is a wonderful hotel from the top to bottom. The owners Tony and Cheri are incredibly friendly and their hospitality is evident in all of the workers at their hotel. Whether it is Jorge making the tropical drinks at the bar or Mario helping to lug your 50lb bag up the stairs, the Luna Blue is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: leonaree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luna Blue for two nights on my way to Mahajual in July, i was immediately upgraded upon arrival to a lovely treetop room and would like to thank the owners for their hospitality. It was a real treat to stay at this beautiful and comfortable hotel, a much more authentic place than a resource -consuming resort. Please keep in mind when you travel that the resources used by big hotels and the development of endless waterfront properties is in my opinion not necessary and is wasteful. Luna Blue is an intimate place and tucked away amidst a quiet natural garden off the main street in Playa. Book at the Luna Blue and Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful R & R experience”
Reviews.Author: flying_peaches
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a relaxing, getaway. The Luna Blue Hotel & Garden exceeded our expectations. As soon as you walk thru the entryway its like stepping into another world. The atomosphere was quiet and peaceful. The hotel was staff was helpful. We really appreciated the water in the rooms. The rooms themselves were nicely done with character. The hotel is situated away from the main tourists hangouts, so you can set of the pace of your vacation. My husband and I would highly recommend the Luna Blue!!! We are looking forward going back

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and good location”
Reviews.Author: budget_traveler_75
Reviews.Content: Owners were very pleasant and helpful. Tony recommended snorkeling in Akumal Bay, which was a great experience. Didn't use the Mamita's Beach Club pass as I was only there for 2 days. I was in room #31, which had a locking sliding glass door. Rooms were comfortable with AC and clean. No TV in the room, but it's the beach, so wouldn't anticipate watching much TV anyway. Rented a car, which had very high mileage and probably hit too many topes (speed bumps) in its lifetime . Would probably use a major rental car company next time instead of the one used by Luna Blue. One other thing to note - good location. It's several blocks north of the Zocalo, and it's a pretty quiet neighborhood, yet convenient. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to restaurants on Calle 30 (streets increment by 5) and is one block from the north end of Calle 5 (the main avenue).

Reviews.Title: “We're looney for the Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: maliasma
Reviews.Content: Another trip around the sun and my husband and I found ourselves back in Playa del Carmen and back for another week-long stay at the Luna Blue. We have been home only one day and I'm already wondering when we can get back. From the very moment of our arrival until our last good-byes, we were treated like royalty and -- without a doubt -- thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Playa del Carmen's most charming boutique hotel. Unlike last year when we stayed in the Treetop Terrace, we opted for a Superior room and spent seven lovely nights in room #35. There is no phone and no television, but there is plenty of cool air, hot water and one heck of a view. The number one goal of our vacation was not only to celebrate my birthday, but it was also to relax, to reconnect and to simply spend a romantic week together. Room #35 is on the second floor of the hotel with a lovely garden view. Upon entering the room you immediately feel as if you are at home. There is a ceiling fan, an A/C, a mini-fridge and bottled water. The room's shower offered plenty of hot water and there never was an issue with water pressure. The maids came daily to clean -- always leaving behind towel art creations. There is no pool, but the beautiful beach is just a couple blocks away and hotel guests receive free passes for Mamitas Beach Club. We spent a lot of time on our patio...we had two chairs and a small table and our patio was actually connected to the room next door (it was separated by a small, wooden wall). From our patio we could hear the water splashing around in the hotel's water feature and we could also see the hotel's new swing bar. While we could still hear some light construction noise during the day, the sounds of the birds and the chirps of the geckos immediately transported you away from the hustle and bustle. At night, the hotel grounds were quiet and peaceful. Like I stated earlier, the hotel has a new swing bar and we enjoyed many nights at the bar. It was quite nice being able to enjoy cold beers & Micheladas, Sarita B Careful's, Beso Cubano's, Cheri's Favorite Margarita's and different tequilas just steps away from our hotel room. The company at the bar was always good and Jorge took great care of us from the very moment we sat down at the bar until our very last drink at the bar before our trip home. Immediately at 11pm, Mario, the night watchman made sure the hotel was safe & secure. Genaro and Jaime made sure that we had anything we needed and helped us with getting a rental car and also arranging for transportation to the airport on our last day. The Luna Blue is truly a gem hidden in Playa del Carmen. My husband and I cannot picture ourselves staying anywhere else simply because we adore the hotel and we adore Tony & Cheri, Genaro, Jaime, Mario, Jorge and all of the hotel staff. The hotel is clean, safe, quiet and offers it's guests such a relaxing and stress-free vacation. And, on a side note, if you're staying at the Luna Blue it is a MUST that you pay a visit to Miguel and his lovely wife at Las Cazuelas which is right across the street from the hotel. My husband and I enjoyed many breakfasts there as well as some fabulous tapas and also the most wonderful birthday dinner I have ever had. You will not be disappointed. So, if you're looking for a romatic getaway or if you just need to unwind and de-stress, be sure to give Tony & Cheri a call or send them an email and book your stay at the Luna Blue. You will never want to stay anywhere else in Playa del Carmen again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mmiller001
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research on hotels in Playa del Carmen. We had considered all inclusives but my wife really pushed to stay in town and I'm really glad we did. The room was basic but impeccably clean, We spent so little time in the room that they were fine. There was not a TV in the room or on the property, but we did not really miss it. Tony, Cheri, Jorge, Genaro and every one else bent over backwards to make sure our stay was great. They recommended day trips, restaurants, things to do, and introduced us to Pomegranate tequila (YUM!). Overall we had a wonderful time and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, beautiful and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RaederleSwanson
Reviews.Content: We came to Playa Del Carmen on our honeymoon and had absolutely an awesome time. Luna Blue hotel was the perfect spot. Just far enough away from the hustle of 5th ave. but close enough to have some fun too! The hotel grounds are so quiet and relaxing and the rooms perfect for the price and enough amenities for the relaxed non-resort traveler. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and we will for sure be back! Cant wait and wish it was next week!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean spot at north end of Playa”
Reviews.Author: marktEnfield
Reviews.Content: A nice place at the expanding north end of Playa. The American owners are helpful and the hotel has a pleasant bar. The gardens are looked after and the rooms are very clean and tastefully decorated. It is about a five minute walk to the busier end of Fifth Avenue. There are a reasonable selection of restaurants within a few metres of the hotel. This end of Fifth Avenue is quieter and cleaner than the main drag with less vendors plying their trade, which is another selling point!.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ccga
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night. There was three people in our party that REQUIRED us to get their biggest room. It has a little kitchen with it. During our stay at the Mexico we transferred to three different hotels and this was the most comfortable one. The owner whom was an american understood the necessities of a relaxing vacation. The room had a refrigerator, a stove and water dispenser that has purified water. It also has a working air conditioner and hot water in its bathroom. My husband like this hotel the most because he was able to get a good night rest at their clean comfortable bed and cooled room. I cant stay the same for the two other hotel and cabana that we booked for our stay at the yucatan peninsula. It was also nicely situated. Not exactly in the middle of downtown but very accessible to it. It is at 5th avenue only at the end corners of it. And the view is just of the garden, which is fine with us since all we wanted was a good night rest after all those walking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: LeanHeart
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Small, boutique hotel with charm, ambience and super friendly owners, staff, and guests. Close in to everything, yet just far enough away to provide quiet nights. The place is really pretty, with the outdoor lobby, gardens and, of course, the small outdoor bar attracting the other guests as well as many others.

Reviews.Title: “All so Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Barbie36
Reviews.Content: This is was our second summer staying at the wonderful and relaxing Luna Blue Hotel. We stayed really enjoyed our three nights. It is a small hotel located in a central location to everything: the shops, restuarants, and the best beach in Playa---Mamitas Beach . The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is very helpful and always pleasant. The owners are usually on site, they welcome you at your arrival and recommend great The hotel gives their guest daily coupons for free use of Mamitas Beach Club that includes an umbrella and chair(s) which we enjoyed the whole day there! We plan to return to Luna Blue next summer.

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever”
Reviews.Author: golfizlyf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Luna Blue in 2006 which was a great experience. I try to stay somewhere different each time I visit Playa. This was my 11th trip to the area. I had booked a room at another hotel for this trip which turned out less than expected on arrival. I visited Luna Blue's great new bar my first night there and new I had to change hotels. Tony and Cheri are great. They greeted me by name, which is incredible! It had been 2 years since I had seen them. The place is better than ever. I think I'm tired of trying new places. :)

Reviews.Title: “An amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: alanchrissie
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Luna Blue Hotel in Playa Del Carmen was a fantastic experience. If you are looking for a great vacation at a great destination we highly suggest Playa Del Carmen and the Luna Blue Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: BurtonSNol3order
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue is a wonderful little hotel in the heart of Playa. It is only a few steps from 5th Ave where all the excitement is and only a 5 min walk to the beach club. For the price, there is nothing better in playa.

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Reali5tic
Reviews.Content: Great location away from all the noise, but close enough to enjoy the action with a short walk. Its true, Toni and Cherri are great. They were very responsive to our emails and are very knowledgeable with the area. Our short anniversary getaway included many excursions and tours. It was our first time in Playa Del Carmen so we spent most of our time on the road, beaches, excursions, etc. Most, if not all the tours include meals. Therefore, we felt that spending the extra money for luxury and meals in an all inclusive does not make sense and staying in a non all inclusive hotel gives you the freedom of enjoying the local cuisine. Although, we did enjoy our stay at Luna Blue, there were a few dislikes. The shower head worked very poorly. It may have been the water pressure but the water stream was very separated making it very difficult to shower or wash your hair. We regret not saying something while we were there, im sure it could have been easily corrected. Also, the beds as some other reviewers have mentioned are very hard. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cdanell
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue is the perfect place to stay in the exciting town of Playa Del Carmen. They are located in the quiet zone of this town away from the extremely loud club scene ( just a few easily walked blocks away). The Hotel is clean and the owners and staff are more than accomodating. They gave us great direction in finding economical and safe means of travel. They were able to provide excellent input into the sites and helped us to prioritize the places to see. Allot of our friends paid much more money traveling to these sites and only saved 15 minutes time to do so. When our camera was left in a friendly locals car, and we only had her first name and town of residence, Cheri the owner put out the word via the local internet community, and we were able to retrieve it in one days time. The staff at the desk saved us on our last day when we missed our bus to the airport and would have had to pay $100.00 in Taxi fees, vs the 16.00 we had already paid for the bus ticket. He hailed a taxi and gave him the location of the one stop the bus would make prior to leaving town. We pulled up to the bus stop just seconds in front of the bus right behind us. When we asked the taxi guy about the bus stops he had no ideal of there locations but promised to take us to the one the desk staff had directed him too. Thank god for great staff. :-), and many thanks to Tony and Cheri for all they did to make our vacation perfect. PS, the only mosquito repellant that works if deep woods off or cutters.

Reviews.Title: “Come with a big smile and a bathing suit..”
Reviews.Author: morrofun
Reviews.Content: leave with a bigger smile, a suntan, and great memories. The Luna Blue is the perfect location to relax and meet new friends. The owners are exceptionally hospitable and helpful. The staff is incredible--great bar, clean rooms, and excellent advice on where to eat and what to see and do. We have always stayed at all-inclusives but didn't like the crowds or the food choices. Here at the Luna Blue you can relax, eat and drink and go where you want, when you want, and meet people from all over the world in a more intimate setting. We'll spread the good news in North Carolina!

Reviews.Title: “New to boutique-ing...”
Reviews.Author: Two4Aruba
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at the Luna Blue. I will recommend it to friends and I am likely to stay there on sebsequent trips to Mexico. This was my first stay at the Luna Blue, first time to Playa del Carmen and first trip to Mexico. This was a 8-day scuba diving vacation with my 16 year old son. I selected Luna Blue after reading favorable reviews on Trip Advisor and because it was in close proximity to 5th Avenue and the dive shop. I visited the Luna Blue website several times. It is well written and informative although in hindsight, I was unfamiliar with boutique hotels. The Luna Blue was just as advertised. My expectations and the website ad-speak proved to be a little different. The rooms are very clean but a little small with one double bed. Twin beds are only available in their larger, more expensive rooms. Each room has a dorm-sized frig, room-temp water dispenser separate bath with shower. No telephone. No TV. Rooms have two chairs and a table outside each room, I'd call it a small porch more than a balcony. The property has a sunken courtyard and in-house bar. The owners are personable and very helpful. The staff is friendly, functional in english and eager to please. It is located at the North end of 5th Avenue and close to several good restaurants, and cafes for internet and international calling.

Reviews.Title: “Outside Magazine was Right on the Money”
Reviews.Author: lsu1282
Reviews.Content: Just a wonderful experience all the way around. The room was very clean and comfortable. I cannot say enough about the staff. Very courteous and professional. They really care about making your stay memorable and enjoyable. Really enjoyed socializing with the other guests at the bar every afternoon while enjoying Jose's "Mas Mojito's". This was our first visit to the property, but will not be our last.

Reviews.Title: “if only i coulda stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: ShandyASJM
Reviews.Content: I have only positive things to say about Luna. The owners are friendly and helpful...the rooms v.nice, clean and comfortable...and the property itself quite attractive. all in all, a great bargain, and a place i hope to return to...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Lizard28
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Luna Blue was as good or better than we expected. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were very comfortable and clean, the courtyard was beautiful and the location was great. Our favorite part was sitting around the bar at happy hour each night talking to the other visitors and getting fantastic mojitos thanks to Jose. Having free chairs and umbrellas at Mamitas is great...the beach is gorgeous and they bring drinks and food to you as you lounge. I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JRAusten
Reviews.Content: I am so happy that I found this great, little hotel! Only 18 rooms, but the prices are right! The people that work there are such a great help - especially to someone who had never before been to Playa del Carmen! It's right off of La Quinta which is the pedestrian street filled with restaurants and stores. AND...it is about 2 blocks from the beach! What a great find! I'll be back - hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: legallyred
Reviews.Content: The Good 1. Friendly service. The owners were gone much of our visit but the desk staff was very helpful in suggesting restaurants & telling us about the area. 2. Great location. It is close to the beach – about 2-3 blocks away. (The beach is gorgeous in Playa.) The hotel is located on the end 5th Avenue so it was not loud but still within walking distance to everything. 3. Large room (we were in a Superior Room) with a strong air conditioner (a must in June). 4. Beautiful garden area. The Bad I have only two complaints and both are fairly minor overall. First, the room could have been cleaner. We had some bugs and even a wayward lizard that we had to escort out the door. Second, the bed was uncomfortable for us. We like a softer bed. Other Notes *The rooms don’t have telephones or televisions. We wanted this type of seclusion so that was great for us. * I want to mention that though the owners were gone during the majority of our stay, they were very responsive to emails before our travel and were very helpful in planning the trip and making suggestions as well. Overall, we would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. Luna Blue is small and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: smoock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Luna Blue for 10 days for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. The first thing that was a pleasant surprise was when I contacted the hotel to make our reservations based upon reviews we had read on tripadvisor.com. In my correspondence I had mentioned this trip was our honeymoon and the same day we received an email from the owners because they wanted to make sure we were aware that while they would love to have us stay, this was not a 5-star all-inclusive hotel which many newlyweds may prefer. I was impressed by their willingness to potentially lose a booking because they wanted to clarify everyone's expectations. When we arrived we were so pleased by the staff's friendliness and suggestions about local places to eat, tours to take, etc. We had not booked a single excursion prior to our arrival and the front desk staff was always helpful in booking day trips to Mayan Ruins, snorkeling, or whatever else we may have asked for. They had wonderful ideas of local restaurants further away from the more touristy parts of the city and we felt very taken care of throughout our stay. The rooms are fairly sparse, but are very clean, spacious and have all the necessities. The kitchenette was handy to have because we were there for so long. We LOVED the hammock on the balcony of our room and spent lots of time there in the mornings. The Mamita's Beach Club passes are a great asset. The Beach Club was very well appointed and was within 3-blocks of the hotel. We also loved the close proximity the all of the restaurants, shopping, etc on Avenida 5 and were so happy we were on the north end of the Avenue as it seemed to have a more laid-back, local feel to it. All in all, it was a great trip and we are so thankful to have stayed with Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: harpplaya
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Luna Blue and loved it. It is a small hotel with lots of charm. The bar was fabulous and Jose was so much fun. Rooms were clean and staff was awesome. There was construction next door but that is to be expected in Playa. (nothing our IPODS couldn't drowned out :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Location, and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: C-monkey
Reviews.Content: Our group of 7 stayed at Luna Blue for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We are all divers and knew we would be too busy to need tv's. We were booked in 3 different classes of room available and all were great value. Plenty of space, good a/c, lots of warm water and towels, bottled water in all except the lowest priced room (add that please!), comfy beds. I would have liked to have more space to hang wet bathing suits, wetsuits, and towels but we just ended up using the balcony areas. It felt very safe and secure, the front desk was helpful in answering our questions. There is a small store for basic needs directly across the street and also a laundry service for those that like to pack light. Having stayed at several other hotels in Playa ove the years, we were very pleased with the value of Luna Blue and will be staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Justin6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 6 nights here based on the good reviews on tripadvisor, and we weren't dissappointed. Nice, clean, quiet, & chilled retreat from the buzz (& humidity) of Playa. Nothing luxurious, but well presented & excellent value. The management and staff were very helpful with local info, and Tony pointed us in the direction of some great restaurants (better prices and often better food away from 5th avenue). The hotel is at the northern end of town but everything is within walking distance. Playa has certainly developed over the last 4 years. But it still has great nightlife (live music, low key beach bars, high end bars and nightclubs also), a variety of tasty restaurants at all price levels, boutique low key hotels and brilliant beaches that would keep me coming back. cheers

Reviews.Title: “A true getaway”
Reviews.Author: Homeward08
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is well secluded from street noise. And with no phone or television in the room, you really get a restful break from the hectic pace back home. With air-conditioning, an overhead fan, small fridge, bottled drinking water, and balcony, the rooms have everything we wanted. The central garden is extremely pretty and creates a restful and atmospheric mood.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: BSG_801
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying at the Luna Blue Hotel and Garden in Playa. We had an excellent stay. The staff was warm and accommodating, which made our trip to Mexico even better. They have a new bar on site that we went to every night for drinks before dinner. The hotel is charming and very clean. I now prefer this intimate atmosphere over an all-inclusive. With such great prices, I plan on going back later this year! Bev. Sugar Land,TX

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but definately not great.”
Reviews.Author: EK1Toronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: After reading this hotels glowing reviews I was disappointed Luna couldn’t accommodate my 4 night stay. My first night I had to stay around the corner at the Aventura Mexicana. Day 2 I moved to the Luna Blue for 3 nights in one of the 2 kitchen units. The room was very spacious and clean, a little rustic. You could easily sleep 3 people in that room. Benefits included the passes to Mamitas beach club, which offer you free chairs and umbrellas. Otherwise the hotel had no amenities to speak of. Staff were friendly and accomodating, maids lovely and location good proximity to everything including the beach. I wasn't overly impressed with the kitchen contents. No kettle and the utensils looked like they had been pieced together from a garage sale for lack of a better word. It felt a bit poorly outfitted. Only one frying pan,2 pots, nothing to use for the oven. One cloth, one sponge. At close to $100 per night, I expected a little bit more. My challenge was with the cockroaches. Woke up in the middle of the night to see one crawling across the kitchen counter. The next day the staff sprayed my room. That day I found 3 dead cockroaches in various places around the room. Someone who was in my room that day actually left the door unlocked. When I mentioned this out to the front desk they said it was probably the maid. Don't think that was true. This is something that I think the staff should be very careful with –no questions asked. I couldn’t stomach a 4th day thinking about the roaches, so I asked for my money to be returned for the last night that I had to pre-pay when I arrived. The manager called the owners who did refund it in a very timely fashion. I noticed a lot of spraying after I reported the roaches. They were spraying the 2 kitchens and also the foliage around the property. I was a little disappointed that although the manager insisted he wanted me to be happy, I felt that he found the situation a little humorous. The reason I say this is; I was clearly not happy, wanted to leave and when I came to see if the owners had agreed to give me my money back if I checked out 1 day early he wanted me to “guess what they said”. Not in good taste considering the situation. I want to be clear that this is my 11th trip to a southern destination, and I am very well traveled -from Australia to Morocco- staying everywhere from hostels to pensions 2 star to 5 star. I know what I am signing up for and what I am getting for my money. I believe that small changes can make this property worth the money you spend for it but no one will truly know that unless they have seen what else there is in the area at the same price range. I will return to Playa because I loved the town and therefore I popped into half a dozen similar small hotels all roughly around the same price ( including the fact that I stayed at the Aventura Mexicana for 2 nights). Only then did I realize that although the Luna is comfortable enough and in a good location with friendly staff, there are many many hotels, which are exactly the same and offer many more amenities for exactly the same price. Almost all of them served a continental breakfast, had refrigerators, tv’s, internet, beach towels, and free or discount passes to beach clubs. ( all things that the Luna already had, and many more that the luna didn’t offer.)

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: shibagirl
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue was everything that was promised. The staff were all warm, friendly, and helpful. We tried not to be overly needy, but we did get help booking one of our excursions, and it definitely made it easy! The bar is adorable and Jose is a great bartender. I also booked our ride to and from the airport through the hotel. I would do this again. It would have been fine to take the public bus, and a lot cheaper, but the bus station is probably 13 blocks away. It was nice to get dropped off and picked up right at the hotel, and to have everything arranged before hand. The room itself was just what I wanted. It was one of the two treetop terrace rooms (#9). It is on the fourth floor, which might be a bummer for some, but I thought that I needed the stairs after all of the extra calories that a vacation tends to bring :) A previous reviewer said that the rooms were too warm- I did not find this to be true. I was very impressed at how well the seemingly small air conditioner worked, and how fast. The room was always comfortable, even though we left the unti off when we were out to save electricity. It took less than five minutes to cool the room. The drinking water was convenient, and the mini fridge had an ice cube tray! So we could make ice with the purified water to make drinks to enjoy on our fun balcony, which was complete with a hammock, two chairs, and a small table. There is also a large patio outside of the room (this room is the only one on the top floor). That patio has four lounge chairs and a hammock that two can fit in comfortably. I think this is for the whole hotel, but we were the only ones that used it the whole time we were there. I couldn't believe how nice everything was for the price that we paid. Luna Blue was awesome, and I will definitely stay there again if I go back. It was also conveniently located, and the housekeeping did an amazing job. One thing I might change would be having do not disturb / cleaning signs on the doors, but maybe this is not something that is done in Mexico? It wasn't a a big deal, but we had some awkward moments with the maids! You might want to learn how to ask them to come back in a few minutes and such in Spanish...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: Lee_Bu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in 2 different rooms at the Luna Blue in early April. We stayed in a kitchenette room and one of the terrace rooms. Both rooms were really nice. Clean, light and airy. Never met Cheri but Tony was quite helpful. Jaime was also tremendously helpful. The gardens were really nice as well. We took the Chichen Itza tour and enjoyed it as well. If I had it to do over again, I think I'd pass on the terrace room. Being on the top floor it did get a bit warm.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: JoyCornwall
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue has beautiful gardens and is located in such a handy location but far enough away from the hustle and bustle. The room was clean and modern and we really enjoyed having a balcony to relax on after a day in the sun. If you stay here ask about Akumal Beach - this was a highlight of our trip! Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Super Retreat!”
Reviews.Author: CampClark
Reviews.Content: What a perfect vacation!! It was our anniversary and our first trip away from our 3 yr old triplets so we were looking for a nice retreat. We had heard about Luna Blue through TripAdvisor and were looking for a hotel that was not only afforadable but also clean, near the action, and comfortable. Luna Blue and Tony & Cheri (owners), and their entire staff exceeded our wildest expectations! Not only did we receive a very warm welcome, but the grounds are absolutely gorgeous and our room was nice, clean and cool (thanks to air conditioning). We got there early our first day (check in wasn't until about 2 or 3) so we took advantage of relaxing in their courtyard garden and hammock (snored rather loudly after a few margaritas) and it was so peaceful. They have a fun bar with swings that was a huge highlight every day after being out in the sun. You have to try the "Sarita Be Careful" margarita - outstanding!! Tony and Cheri made us feel right at home and introduced us to a lot of friends that travel to Playa annually (or more) and we made so many new friends from all over the world thanks to them. They also gave us excellent recommendations on restaurants, night life, excursions, etc. and we were always very pleased!! This hotel is perfect for people who are adventurous, a little more budget oriented, but still expect excellent service and a nice, comfortable, clean room with beautiful grounds in the heart of Playa. It truly is a gem of a property. We have stayed at all-inclusive mega resorts before but prefer to experience the true personality of Mexico and being able to try out all the different restaurants that all-inclusives fall extremely short on. After all, you shouldn't have to worry about dinner reservations and proper attire when on vacation in Mexico! We will definitely go back again next year and will highly recommend this hotel to all our friends and business associates. Dave & Tina (from MN)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: yfandcb
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at the Luna Blue Hotel in mid-March, just before Spring Break (a great time to go if you want to avoid some of the drunk college kids). We had a Superior room for four nights and a Deluxe Kitchen Studio for three nights. We absolutely loved the hotel! The rooms are lovely, and the balcony decks are really nice to chill out on. Given how hot and humid it gets during the day, it was real relief to come back to a room with a ceiling fan and AC. The entire staff was extremely helpful and pleasant too. They had really great advice and help for arranging trips to Mayan ruins. The hotel's location is fantastic as well - virtually on La Quinta but without the noise and within a very short walk of (the beautiful) beaches. In terms of food, we loved the restaurant just opposite the hotel - Los Cazuelos - fantastic and very reasonably priced, and the owner is great. In general, Playa has really great food, especially when you get away from the many overpriced tourist traps on La Quinta. We also loved La Tarraya (a local seafood place with tables on the beach), the great breakfasts at La Cuevo del Chango, the phenomenal shrimp tacos at La Floresta, and the more upscale local Ycatan food at Yaxche. In short: The Luna Blue is a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Playa favorite”
Reviews.Author: wembley
Reviews.Content: I've travelled to Playa several times, but the last time I went was in 2001. The town has changed quite a bit -- some good, some not so good. One of the best changes is the transformation of the old Zanzibar Hotel into the Luna Blue. Tony and Cheri (the owners) have done an amazing job of creating what must be the most friendly hotel in Playa (as well as being beautiful and a great value!). We just returned from spending a week there for our daughter's birthday. We stayed in rooms 35 and 36 (a treetop terrace room). The rooms are quite attractive and have plenty of space. Each room has a refrigerator and bottled water, but no radio or TV (a plus for us). The people who work at the hotel are so helpful and generous with their advice. Jaime and Generro (sp?) at the desk are now our good friends and we will never forget "Jose Cuervo" who taught us a lot of Spanish that you won't get out of a guidebook while creating the great alcoholic concoctions at the "swing bar" -- you absolutely must try the Besa Cubano and Serena Take Care. We would not think of staying anywhere else in Playa when we return. John, Mary and Courtney

Reviews.Title: “This is a great little place with a big heart.”
Reviews.Author: kitsapkat
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews and seeing the room rates in our price range we decided to take a plunge into the Luna Blue. The garden area, water effect, and bar are all wonderful. Loved the bar. The hotel is north enough and off of 5th enough to be absolutly quiet at night. Room viente y dos: The room was very clean. I don't know how the cleaning staff get all that sand out that we brought in from the beach, but they do. With enough room to stow our clothes and enough room not to feel couped up small refrigerator to keep beverages cold and good working AC unit this room rocked. We even threw a Tequila party with Crazy Eddie one night on our patio. This room doesn't receive the Wifi very well, if at all. We would just go down to the lobby and plug-in there. So it was an issue but it wasn't an issue. The gang at the Luna Blue were sooo very helpful in directing us to various beaches, restaurants, bars, and activities. They were very patient with our not so good spanish. The directors of this lovely local are Tony & Cheri who make you feel like you're staying with good friends. They take care of you as you would for the people you love. Thanks again for helping make our 5th anniversary as memorable as the original event. Encantado, Tony & Sally

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue is home in Playa”
Reviews.Author: MJJWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time at the Luna Blue. Tony & Cheri Head are the most wonderful hosts. Every year it's amazing what changes they do for the rooms, the garden, and the little touches for the guests. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. We loved sitting out on our deck with the hammock and all the birds singing. The garden area is amazing with tropical plants everywhere. They just opened up their new bar called "Blue". That was a hit every evening before guests went out to eat. We will come back year after year and always call The Luna Blue "Home". MJ, Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “It was that good!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: playadude
Reviews.Content: Well Folks its that good!!!!!!! First off i am one of those folks that believes nothing i hear and only about half of what i see. I am one of those show me kind of guys. If u are looking for one of those fancy high priced places The Luna Blue is not for u. But if u love great service a clean nice room friendly staff at a good price the Luna Blue is the ticket. The garden setting was beautiful. Well lets see we had a nice little room#31 basic and cute and very clean. The maids were very friendly always with a greeting and a big smile they keep our room spotless. The towel art the maids created was very cute and different every day. I am not good with names but that front desk guy was great. He went out of his way to answer any questions we had from where to eat too the best and cheapest way to get from here to there and always with a smile what a nice guy. I forgot to mention i like to save a buck when i can so i like to eat where the locals eat and use the same trasportion they do. That means i eat off of 5th and use the colectivios or small vans. The new bar was very nice swings in stead of bar stools. The bartender Jose is great lots of fun and makes some fantastic drinks. Well i saved the best for last The Owners of the Luna Blue Tony and his lovely wife Cheri wow I was very impressed with these two folks. Folks from the time we checked in till the time we left they were very very gracious hosts. When we checked in it was very hot and we were thirsty Tony and Cheri introduced them selfs with big smiles and kind words. Then Tony asked if we would like something cold to drink of course we said yes and the cold drinks were great. Tony then carried everyone bags to their rooms and showed us how every thing worked in the rooms Tony was great. Folks they treated us better than family. Always asking how we doing where we were going if we needed any suggestions on where eat or how to get some where. Well folks lets put it this way there might be nicer hosts out there that run a hotel but i have never meet them. Tony and Cheri really care about their guests and go out of there way to make your stay the best. Like i said i am one of those show me kind of guys. Tony and Cheri are the real deal and so is the Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Destination Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: VoyageursToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue in mid-March for one week. We booked a superior room. We were enchanted by the atmosphere, the cenote and the blissful quiet. The location, just off the Quinta could not have been better. Everything is so close by! Mamita's Beach Club is just a five minute walk away and the daily passes were easy to use. The room was very clean and private. We had room 33 with our very own balcony and palapa. We have no complaints (though the bed was a bit hard, you get used to it after a couple of nights). We will definitely come back here again next year and would highly recommend the Luna to like-minded travelers, not resort types! Thanks for a wonderful week.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, this is the place to stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best small hotel in Playa. We booked Luna Blue for 5 nights based on tripadvisor reviews - and we were not disappointed. We were on our honeymoon and wanted a smaller boutique type hotel. We had a superior room which featured fantastic private balcony, fridge, unlimited purified drinking water, and a large bed. The staff were fantastic and assisted us with every need. My husband was sick whilst staying here and reception organised a doctor immediately on request - we really appreciated all the help and concern given. location of this hotel is great, its on the main avenue of playa, yet a few blocks from the "centre". There are fabulous cafe's just outside the door of this hotel and we preferred this to the over touristy restaurants closer to the central area. Thank you for a wonderful stay Luna Blue - we will definitely be returning for a visit!

Reviews.Title: “What a great time at a wonderful place, and at a super price!”
Reviews.Author: jwinks85
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent during our 5 night stay at the hotel. The staff was courteous and fun, our room was kept clean every day, the hotel's atrium does not dissapoint. We saw other hotels inside the rooms and surrounding at the same price we piad (got the kitchen eqipped room) and the others just didn't seem to compare. Thanks so much for a wonderful stay Tony and Cheri! We will hopefully see you again soon, Jeff and Kris

Reviews.Title: “Moonlight Serenity”
Reviews.Author: hoku7
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel to the main activity was perfect. Gardens provided a natural calming ambience during our stay, and the swing bar was a plus. The staff went out of their way to take care of our requests and the rooms were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “hooked on the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: smartin49
Reviews.Content: This was my second year at the Luna Blue, and it was even better than the first. After spending a day at the beach or on an excursion of one sort or another, we were always happy to walk through the gates of the Luna Blue late afternoons, and we were always welcomed with a friendly "Hola" by either Juanaro or Himmie (sp.?) It was our "home away from home." The small bar that's recently opened on the property is a great addition. It was nice to reconnect with other guests at the end of a long day and find out what adventures they'd been on, where they'd eaten, etc., and we always looked forward to going there for our first drink. Player has changed in the year since I went, there are more college students around as well as families with small children and more Americans. Fortunately, for those of us who don't have small children, you will not find under 14 year olds there. The person that stays there during the nightime is "on the ball"--one night we were returning to the hotel after several drinks and we were being a little louder than we normally would have been, and he came out immediately and just asked us nicely to keep it down; I appreciate that. And when we left at 4 a.m. on the day of our departure, he came out as he'd heard voices again just to make sure that things were okay at the Luna. As far as the beach club, well, Mamamita's is getting more and more crowded but as several guests have commented, if you get up and walk, you'll be able to find a quiet secluded beach. There's a lot of confusion when you first arrive at the beach club because you just don't know how they operate and there's no signage. And there are more and more people that are showing up earlier and earlier to stake their umbrellas and chairs, so good luck! One day, after my sister and I had walked the beach for hours on end, we were able to each find a lounge chair, but when the beach guy came around asking for our slips from the Luna, I was only able to find one slip, and so he told one of us that we had to give up our chair. It was 3:30 in the afternoon at that point, my sister and I had just received our drinks, and if I could have spoken Spanish I would have had a few things to say to him. You should try to venture out on Route 307 and check out all of the cenotes, they're all different, and cost around $5 or so to get into. There you'll find beautiful crystal clear waters to go snorkelling in and lots of shaded areas. And make sure to go to Hidden Worlds, it's quite an experience you'll love if you have any sense of adventure. Just make sure that you watch your money when you and if you stop for gas; my sister and I were distracted by all of the young lads winking at us, washing each and every windown, and it was only once we'd driven off, we realized that they'd ripped us off. We'd given them two 200 peso bills, and the attendant quickly told us that we'd given him only one 200 peso, that the other was a 20 dollar peso....just beware. Take Toni and Cherri's advice as far as restaurants, they're right on target.... And so, although Player has changed a lot and is getting busy, the Luna Blue is like a cocoon where you feel safe and you always feel welcomed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hailie55
Reviews.Content: We returned for the fourth time to Playa del Carmen, and stayed for the first time at Luna Blue in February 2008. We really loved the hotel. It was perfect for us. It's small, very quiet, clean, pretty and friendly, but not invasive in any way. The rooms were reasonably-priced and attractive. We stayed in a kitchen suite and we were delighted with the accommodations. We were only a few minutes from the beach (3 easy-walking blocks), and the hotel owners and staff were very helpful in regards to trips, taxis, etc. If you are looking for a large, North-American-style hotel, this place is not for you. There are no televisions or telephones in the rooms (it does have internet access outside, though). There is no restaurant or entertainment. If you are looking, as we were, for a more laid-back experience, then you will certainly be pleased. One warning, though. We booked this hotel five months in advance and we were not able to get a continuous stay in one room - so book ahead! We are definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “This is how a mid-range small hotel should be.”
Reviews.Author: MyScreenName2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eights nights in early February as part of a longer trip. So much has already been posted I would just add a few semi-random notes. The rooms and hotel are very nice, but don’t mistake it for a high-end boutique hotel. It is sort of hard to rate since the amenities of the hotel would make it a three or at maybe a four-star hotel, but the quality of execution is much higher. There is a drop off laundry across the street(closed Sunday) where we were able to drop off our dirty laundry and pick it up the next morning for just a few dollars. Probably best for fairly sturdy stuff but ours came back just fine. The location is perfect, quite but in the middle of things. Because of scheduling we stayed in both one of the tree-top rooms and a kitchen unit. They were both large and very nice. As previously mentioned, the rooms don’t have TV’s (Yea!!! please don’t ever add them!!!) This helps get people out of their rooms and socializing with other people and we went out to dinner one night with another couple we meet. We didn’t realize that there were no telephones in the rooms. One day my wife and I went to do different things and she was having such a good time that she was going to be a couple of hours late. She called and left a message for me at the front desk but I never got the message. Later on I happened to think that if we had an emergency in the room that it would have been difficult to get help without a phone. Eventually it would be good to add phones. They don’t have an ice machine, which makes sense since the tap water is not purified enough to drink. Large bags of ices are available inexpensively at the store across the street. We had had read so much about the owners we were a bit disappointed that we only saw Tony twice while we were there. The umbrellas at the beach club are in short supply and at this time of the year they were all taken by about 9:30 am. There were other beach clubs nearby with umbrellas available, but I didn’t check to see how much they would have cost to rent. The beach is a great walking beach and you can walk for miles in either direction. There is a lot of construction in the area and the lot next to the hotel has a basement excavated, but there was absolutely no construction the week we were there. During the day you could hear a bit of hammering down the block but it wasn’t bad. The reservation system was odd in that it wanted to get your credit card number before you know if there is actually a room available. Greg

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue = Magic”
Reviews.Author: dorlee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Playa del Carmen 4 times. This trip was the best so far. I believe the Luna Blue was a large part of the positive experience. First of all, the Luna Blue is a very, very nice hotel. It is very clean, well run, comfortable, close to 5th Avenue yet far enough away to feel like you are not inundated with "touristy" encounters. I loved it. We were in room 8. I highly recommend it. We booked a kitchen suite and it was perfect. To be honest, we never used the stove, but having the dishes, glasses, fridge, coffee maker was perfect. We purchased coffee, pastries, fruit from Mega and enjoyed simple yet delicious breakfasts on our more than ample balcony most mornings. Our room was kept very clean and it was so delightful to return to that haven after a day at the beach. The shower was fine - lots of hot water. I have no complaints at all. The hotel is especially beautiful at night. There are lots of lovely lights hanging amongst the coconut trees and other foliage. It is truly magical. So magical that one night we put Frank Sinatra on the ipod and danced ourselves into a stupor on the balcony. Gee, hope we didn't disturb anyone - but we sure had fun. The only complaint that I had (and it is no fault of the Luna Blue Hotel) is that while on vacation I do not want to be on any schedule and if you want to get an umbrella at Mamita's you'd better get there by 9:00 or 9:30 or you are out of luck. Twice we ended up at "Kool". We had a better time there - it has a nicer vibe, but cost extra - not a big deal though. The towel game is really annoying and sometimes it is allowed, sometimes not. I do like Mamitas though - nice waiters, good food, beautiful beach. I just wish they didn't let people put their towels down and then leave. Well, they do sometimes and sometimes they don't. Genaro was very helpful and kind. He always greeted us with a friendly 'good morning" or "buenos dias". He is a very nice man. This was the best vacation ever and we will return to the Luna Blue. Tony and Cheri have created an oasis! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: coldlady
Reviews.Content: We had a good vacation and staying at the Luna Blue was the perfect choice for our visit to Playa Del Carmen. For the past 16 years we have stayed at mostly large resorts. We weren't sure what to expect with a small hotel. After reading the reviews on TA we thought LB has to be a great place or somehow uses TA to make it look good. But there is no question, what the reviews say is what you get. Luna Blue is doing all the right things to keep people coming back. The room (#33, superior room) suited us perfectly. The room is nestled right in the middle of the garden setting with the waterfall. It was very peaceful and relaxing. Exactly what we had requested. We spent every morning and evening (and a rainy afternoon) enjoying the balcony overlooking the garden. The attention to details they have put into the hotel shows.All of the reviews describe it quite accurately. Some of the details we appreciated were: brighter than usual lighting, a full length mirror, accessible outlets, nicely tiled floors, clean paint, very adequate water pressure and hot water, nice thick large bath towels fresh each day, a quiet ceiling fan, nice sized balcony, a full water jug, a clean frig that kept beer cold and worked well enough to actually make ice, an extra soft mattress pad cushion that made the bed more comfortable than most Mexican hotels, pillows I could sleep on without getting a stiff neck, wonderful staff and the owner's availability when we needed assistance. Best of luck to them and all they continue to do to make LB what people are looking for. As for Playa Del Carmen it is a very busy tourist town that has lost most of the laid back Mexican charm. The service in restaurants was fast. So fast they were bringing the food before we finished a drink and ready to clear the table before we were done eating. The ambience of the small restaurants was often spoiled by loud booming music from a bar next door virtually sharing the same space except for a little divider between. It was not relaxing. If you are there to party hardy I'm sure this will be a great location. The first time we were in Playa was for an afternoon 8 years ago. The beach just south of the ferry peer was so gorgeous, we knew we had to come back to spend time in this area. Today there is no beach in front of the hotels south of the peer. But if you walk north and keep walking past all of the hotels, restaurants and beach clubs you will finally come to the kind of beach we were hoping for. There are long wide stretches of soft white sand. You can walk for hours and we did. We walked to Punta Bete which must be 5 miles one way. You will pass a few AI resorts and finally come to a pink place with a palapa roof called Los Pinos. That is where we had the best, coldest beer, a big plate full of nachos and frios served with wonderful Pico de Gallo and more cold beer. It was the Mexico we were looking for. The nice lady running the place that day waited on us and made our food. There was no rush. The only sound was the surf. We shared the place with two locals and a couple getting massages. Relaxing! Well worth the walk. We went back again a couple of days later.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: SirLoin
Reviews.Content: You don’t get much better than this when it comes to quality and value. It has a great location very close to the beach and near lots of shops and restaurants. My room was clean comfortable and had everything I needed including WIFI. The owners and staff were awesome! About the only thing I could complain about was the water pressure in the shower. It was weak, but it really wasn’t that bad. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: yolant
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Luna Blue. Loved Playa del Carmen which has a wonderful vibe. The hotel was fine and I stayed in the standard room which was a bit dark and then moved to a Superior Room on the last night as I was advised the Standard was booked. Staff were pleasant and the location is great for accessing the beach. It is basic, but after talking to a few people found out that there were cheaper accomodations to be had with views of the beach from their balconies. I would recommend you do some more research as you can probably pay the same price but get a few more amenities. Water cooler in room is a great idea and the room was clean. Tips: You can get coffee from corner store OXXO on 10th street which is open 24hrs. Get to Mamita's beach by aro9und 9:00am to get an umbrella, but don't wander off for too long. While I was there the guard also decided to remove towels/clothing left as placeholders by people who wanted to reserve their chairs but went off to breakfast and were gone too long.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: NoirNurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue Hotel and Garden for our most recent trip in January. We keep coming back because this hotel just keeps getting better and better. This is my first time to post a review on Tripadvisor, and I wish I had done so earlier. The staff has been with this hotel for some time, and are among the best we've ever encountered anywhere. We've always been treated with nothing but the utmost respect and our questions are always answered thoroughly and whatever our needs, they are met with promptness and a good natured response. Each time we return we see improvements in the rooms with new A/C units, a fresh coat of paint, new furniture, fixtures, and this time with new "in room quotes" which, in our room at least, really captured our hearts. This was our 4th stay at the Luna Blue. We stayed in a Kitchen suite and enjoyed the fridge, the coffee maker, blender and stove daily. I think this category room is perhaps the best value in Playa Del Carmen. Check-in was easy and Genaro and Jaime were incredibly courteous and helpful, as always. One of my favorite things on this trip, with our Kitchen room, was to make our morning pot(s) of coffee, decaf for me, and regular Chiapas for my husband, fix a bowl of yogurt/fruit/granola, pour a glass of fresh orange juice and complete a crossword puzzle or read a chapter or two. Either sitting at the lovely kitchen table in our room, or on the balcony listening to the sounds of the water fall and swaying palm fronds. Our balcony was always quiet, and the WiFi always welcome and working. At the end of our day, a nicely made margarita (or two) was a perfect cap to a great day (Which is ANY day at the Luna Blue in Playa!) I must say I love the insulated feeling I get with the lushness of the garden and many trees. The hotel keeps them cut back and thick and never over-grown. The grounds are just perfect, colorful and I loved hearing the rustling of the tree limbs and leaves. My goodness, I miss it so much already. Our bathroom had plenty of shelving, a large shower and good lighting, we had a nice sized dresser, 2 nightstands, and our in-room safe was digital so we could use our own code and not worry about losing a key! I won't repeat all the lovely things others say about The Luna Blue except to say the location of the hotel in the north end is perfect for us, being north end people away from the hustle and bustle of the hotel properties nearer the action of the southern end of 5th Avenue. The beach passes work smoothly, the towels are always fresh and soft, our rooms are always superbly cleaned and ready for us on arrival/check-in, and after a day at the beach or out and about. A couple of parting things of note. We appreciate the hotel's close relationship with Dr. Eduardo Rovirosa, who is the family physician of the owners as well. His office and clinic is actually located on 10th Avenue, directly behind the hotel. He is always available to the Luna Blue and it's guests and is a true gentleman and physician of note, and was of great service to us on one occasion. It's nice to know that if we should ever have need of him, he is always available to the hotel's guests. The second thing is the availability of water which is provided to guests in most room categories above a standard room, I believe. We buy a few of the larger water bottles and save them, filling them with water and placing them each evening in the refrigerator. The next day we have all the cold water we'll need for the day. Can't tell you how nice it is to just grab your water and go, or have water available for a pitcher of lemonade, or for the coffee maker! I highly recommend the Luna Blue Hotel and Garden, its staff and owners for your consideration as a base for a wonderful Playa Del Carmen experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Kontje
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue Hotel Their web site is www.lunabluehotel.com. What a gem. Luna Blue Hotel is in a great location in the “Italian” section of Playa, yet tucked away in its own little oasis of palm trees, rocks and a manmade waterfall. Really wonderful. I paid $78.40 USD per night. The owners live part time in San Francisco and part time in Playa and are great resources of what to do in and around Playa. Don´t miss going to the Cacao Cafe on La Quinta (5th Ave. and Constituyentes). It´s fantastic. Do not leave Playa without trying their chocolate milk (fria) and the chocolate mouse.
