Playa’s growing in leaps and bounds but it still has its charms, and is a great place to make daytrips from to see some ruins and do some snorkeling and diving, especially in the cenotes. (But to really see, taste and feel the Yucatan, head west to Merida.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Caroline S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights at the end of a wonderful tour of Mexico. Perfect way to end a hectic holiday. The room was spotless, with a hammock on the balcony and drinking water provided free of charge. Use of the beach club was very useful and the location was excellent. The only problem is that Playa del Carmen is rapidly being overtaken by tourists. Therefore, whilst the hotel was faultless, I wouldn't necessarily go back to the same resort again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like dirty bathrooms and horrible service, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Sara H
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experience from beginning to end! Emails from the hotel's management prior to our stay were rude and not at all helpful. Upon check-in, we noticed that the bathroom in our room carried a horrible stench of urine. When we went to the front desk to complain, we were told, "Well, the room has already been cleaned." There was no apology or attempt to rectify the situation. The next day (after cleaning), the smell was better, but not gone. This was not a good start to our trip, and clearly, the bathroom had not been cleaned prior to our arrival. Disgusting. The hosts that everyone speaks so highly of in other reviews were nowhere to be found while we were in Playa, and we couldn't find anyone in charge who could give us recommendations or help us find activities in the area. And, we were there during a very busy time and needed to get to the beach early in order to secure a spot. Although someone was supposed to be staffing the front desk starting at 8:00 a.m., there was nobody to be found anywhere in the hotel at the designated time who could give us our beach towels and passes. The wireless internet the hotel promises only worked for the first two days of our trip. When we inquired about this, we were told that we should just restart our computer, which we had of course already tried. Again, no effort was made to fix the problem. Finally, when we e-mailed our not-so-gracious hosts after our stay to ask about these problems before writing this review, we received no response at all, an oversight which by this point seemed typical of the overall service level and quality of this property. One more thing - the beds are very hard and uncomfortable. I've been to Playa before and stayed at the Hotel Quinto del Sol. It's a similar property and is MUCH better in both quality and service. We would highly recommend that you stay there and skip the highly-overrated Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel beside all the action.”
Reviews.Author: BeachinBum
Reviews.Content: This place is peaceful with the waterfall and tropical jungle courtyard for the balcony view and all. Hanging out at the room on the balcony is nice in this environment, which we did during a rain day. We had a room with a kitchen, #6, and I would highly recommend this kind of room. Very spacious for the price and we did enjoy cooking breakfast in the room while having our coffee, and blending drinks after sunning at Mamita’s all day. I also found the layout interesting in that there was no other room “butted” up against ours. We had windows on three sides of the room and the outside staircase against the fourth wall. It just seemed more secluded than you really were. The hotel room is the last place to be while in Playa! Luna Blue is perfectly situated toward the north end of 5th Ave. For people who like to walk, it’s wonderful. Playa is a fun town full of bars, restaurants, café’s and shops and this hotel location is ideal. Try Quinta Passion a few doors down from Luna Blue for fish taco’s and marguerita’s. We also liked Fusion on the south end of the beach for eating and partying after sunning all day and one night we caught some good live music there. The half time show was three bongo drummers with a fire dancer – what an act! Bip Bip restauraunt/bar is also on my “A” list. Check out Louise Miguel the bartender at the small bar in the back of this place for some laughs. We’re beach bums and we did spend a lot of time at Mamita’s. For a Gringo like me with a fifty word Spanish vocabulary, this place is a little tough to figure out at first. We arrived there a little late in the morning, and getting situated with a beach chair was somehow more difficult than it should be. It seemed all of the palapa’s were taken. The workers you’ll see first and ask for help are waiters only, and they’ll just point you in the direction of a stack of unused chaise lounge chairs. Finally …after looking confused for a while like the newbie that I was… I grabbed a chair and picked a spot, but of course then the guy who became known as the “palapa police” showed up immediately to tell me I was in the wrong spot. “Donde?” I asked sheepishly, so he pulled the chair over 10 feet and that was O.K. Really though after we got used to it, Mamita’s is cool, the wait service is excellent , and the food is good. Just get there early enough to grab a palapa, and you won’t have to tangle with the palapa police. A couple of last words about the Luna Blue hotel. Genaro is the man. His English is good enough, and anything you need, he’ll make sure you have it. Service with a smile. Enjoyed meeting Tony & Cheri (thanks guys!) and they too asked what we needed if anything at all. They’ve created a positive environment at this place and it feels good. We’ll definitely be back. Soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue-Excellent experience in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: anybodys
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a wonderful and relaxing stay in Playa from January 21-28th. We decided that we wanted an inexpensive vacation and although I have traveled extensively in Mexico, we have never been to Playa. After doing tons of reading on Tripadvisor, we decided to try out Luna Blue. I was impressed at the excellent reviews and very modest price. That being said, I have to say the glowing reviews for this little gem of a hotel couldn't be more accurate. We checked in and I was amazed at the beautiful gardens of the hotel! We were unable to book the Treetop suite (next time!) but we were very pleased with the Superior suite. It was clean and simple and we appreciated the fresh drinking water in the room and the excellent maid service and friendly staff. We also LOVED the terrace/balcony, which was surrounded by beautiful plants that gave a great sense of privacy. If I would give prospective guests any advice, I would say book EARLY! The word is out on this great place and the prices are rock bottom..we checked around! This really isn't the place for the resort crowd, but if you want a beautiful hotel that is centrally located, clean and quiet...you cant go wrong with Luna Blue. On the way home my husband assured me that he wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Playa and I couldn't agree more! I did get the pleasure to meet one of the owners very briefly upon checking out. Thank you so much for giving us a budget vacation that felt like a five star resort! Keep up the great work. See you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edmanz1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a week at the Luna Blue. We absolutely loved the layout of the hotel grounds and the room was extremely clean and well appointed. The hotel is also in a great location extremely close to the beach and 5th avenue. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance and the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful with planning excursions and recommending restaurants. We definitely plan on going back at some point in the near future. Thanks very much for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: brownbuttergirl
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth trip to Playa del Carmen and our second stay at the Luna Blue. Before Luna Blue, I was really ready to go home by the end of our vacation. Now, it gets harder and harder for me to leave! Our friends Trent and Tracy Anderson found LB last year for our joint vacations. It has everything that I need to be comfortable away from home, including a KITCHEN! The staff is helpful, friendly and thank goodness, they all have a sense of humor, a must when dealing with my husband! I loved meeting Tony and Cheri this year and hope that Tony's rattlesnake brew is ready for consumption by January of '09. I am ready to do shots with you! (Well, maybe one or two) The lobby is amazing and becomes more beautiful with each return. The gardens are coming along and the waterfall is perfect, especially with the hamock right there for our use. The rooms are clean and bright, and cleaned again everyday! I loved knowing there would be no sand on my bare feet from the previous day's excursions! Thanks Laura! I also loved the hand painted quotations on the walls. Very transporting... All in all, this was our best vacation ever and it was mainly your fault! Cheers! Kacey Bostrom

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rephello
Reviews.Content: I stayed here mid December and due to a change in my itinerary had to extend my stay and include others in the room. The front deskman was very accomodating with all of our needs. The room was very clean, and pretty nice if not a bit spartan. The kitchen area was nice and useful. I like that everyone has balcony seating and hammocks. The courtyard is gorgeous. The guests this place attracts are friendly and good neighbors. There is a little store across the street that sells basic food but mostly processed junk. You'll have to go to a larger market if you want real food to cook. There is also a laundry next door that is very nice, does a great job and is really cheap. Parking is along the street and is rarely a problem. Though the owner of the hotel was rather curt with me after I parked in front of the hotel while checking in which apparently I wasn't supposed to do. She assured me of her generosity in not having to call the police to have my car towed. Gee thanks for the sugar coated threat. I didn't really care for her energy. I met her and her husband briefly when I checked in and though friendly on the surface I could sense some discontent if not outright resentment for their guests. Maybe they had a bad day. Whatever. There was also some construction work going on... which went on and on day in and day out well into the evening.... saw and hammer.... it was a bit maddening.I came down with the flu after my first day so perhaps my judgement was off. I spent almost 3 solid sick days in my room, so the noise bothered me quite a bit. This colored my attitude and opinion of Playa Del Carmen a lot.... that and the three times I was pulled over by the police for nothing... except to extort money off of me which they didn't get. The locals seem tolerant of this behavior which I think is inexcusable and disgusting. Police corruption lowers the bar for any society and I will likely never return to the Yucatan for this reason. Why should anyone pay extra to be exploited and resented, I visited the Yucatan two years ago and had a wonderful trip. Things have changed. There is always some resentment to tourists in tourist areas, but I found the level really high and really uncomfortable in Playa Del Carmen. It's going to look like Southern Florida in a couple years time which wouldn't be all that terrible if the Maya were in agreement to this.... which I don't think they are. So I'm done with the Yucatan for a while. We scuba dived using Diversity Divers which is one street over. They were wonderful, tolerant, intelligent and fun and very understanding and flexible with needing to reschedule due to us having the flu. Definitely do the cenote dives.

Reviews.Title: “The cure for the common vacation!”
Reviews.Author: robalesi
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I just got back from spending a week at the Luna Blue. I can honestly say that we were incredibly satisfied by all aspects of our lodging. While we didn't meet Tony and Cheri in person, their style of management and philosophy on travel was very apparent in their hotel. Their staff was incredibly friendly and informed. We found many little out-of-the-way places that we definitely would have missed without the wonderful recommendations from the front of house staff. What you will get at Luna Blue: Friendly Knowledgeable Staff Free Chairs and Palapas at Mamita's Beach Club Clean Rooms Perfect, I repeat, Perfect location for getting the full Playa experience. Wireless internet in the common areas and on the balconies What you will not get at Luna Blue: Your vacation spoon fed to you. High pressure time-share presentations Television Stress I really can't tell you how perfect this place was for my wife and I. We really love to explore places on our own, and Luna gave us the perfect home base for all of our explorations. We will most certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: KyleA123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luna Blue a couple of months ago and it was wonderful. The room and hotel were very clean, the staff was so friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect. It's located right off of 5th Ave., the main area for tourist shops and restaurants, yet when you are in the hotel it is quiet and peaceful. Also, the cost can't be beat! Tony and Cheri are a delight to talk with and amazing people. They said they are opening the hotel bar soon, so that's just one more reason to return to the Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “good value in playa del carmen”
Reviews.Author: mugsyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an extraordinary value. The room was huge, and beautifully decorated. Bathroom was huge and well appointed. We had quite a climb to our room on the 3rd floor, no elevators, so be aware if you choose the treetop rooms. The night attendant was lacking in good service but daytime desk attendants were fine. For the price, the hotel is outstanding. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: bitaNyc
Reviews.Content: We stayted here in late october. Had an amazing time. The hotel's location is absolutely perfect. Close to the beach, about 2 blocks away. You get free beach passes for umbrellas, chairs and towels. One block away from 5th ave. But totally away from the noise!! 5th ave is great- shopping, dining, dancing. You will love this place. We're coming back in march!!

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue Rocks...AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: mayalovesplaya
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I stayed at the Luna Blue this past October for 7 nights and I must say, this place just keeps getting better and better! We have stayed there several times over the past two years and have had the opportunity to stay in several of the rooms. They have all been spotless, the AC and fridges have always worked, and most of the all the staff has been nothing short of GENIUS. It has been a pleasure to watch this hotel grown and flourish (literally) over the years. I have never had a bad meal in Playa after a place has been recommended by Tony or Cheri, who seem to know all that we tourists may ever need to know about Playa. It doesn't hurt that Tony and Cheri hired such great help, Jamie and Genaro have been so helpful. The cool thing about this place is that you feel like a rockstar staying there. They get to know you, they help you, they hang out with you, make you feel as if you belong there. Making our stay all that much better and that much tougher to leave. For the price, the quiet location, and the amenities, I couldn't even begin to suggest a better place to stay. You have a customer for life and I will sing the praises of your little oasis to any and all that will listen. Thanks so much Tony and Cheri!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price + Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: pbekas23
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue the a great hotel. It was relaxing and had a great location in Playa. I used [-] to get a lot of more info on Playa. They focus on the local market of Playa del Carmen and have tons of info about Playa. It was very helpful when picking where to go for dinner too. Would highly recommend Luna Blue for the service that the staff offered along with how clean the rooms were kept. I would track sand all over the place and when i would come back from lunch or dinner it was gone! If I remember the owners were from the states and had a guest book to sign.

Reviews.Title: “Love Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerIV
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Luna Blue and was a girlfriend's getaway. The hotel was more beautiful than I remembered and this time we met Tony & his wife and the charming Carlos. Tony gave us awesome advice on traveling to Tulum by car and my god, he turned me on to Havana Club! I will never be the same! Encouraged by Tony's advice, my friend and I drove to Tulum and drank the day away at the most beautiful beach I have ever seen. We drove down as far as Amansala - we just had to see where Bikini Boot Camp actually takes place. The hotel was fabulous (clean and comfy beds) and the hospitality even better. Tony - see ya soon we cannot wait to return and walk over to 30th for some carnitas & chiladas. We love PDC and Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rtsuser
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and reasonably priced. The garden/jungle lobby is shaded, very pretty and provides a great view from patios and balconies while enjoying a glass of wine and a snack. The owners, Cherie and Tony, are on-site frequently and always ready to help with suggestions, a reservation, or just a great story about operating a business in Mexico. The location is on Calle 26 just one-half block north of 5th - central to the newer and more upscale portion of la quinta and very safe and secure. It's just a 5 minute walk to Mamita's Beach Club and your room rate includes chairs and umbrella. If you look to enjoy everything PDC offers but don't want the mega-AI experience, you will do very well at Luna Blue. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: Kate_and_Martin
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Luna Blue in a Treetop Terrace room for 8 nights and also had two nights in one of the standard rooms here earlier this month. Both rooms are spacious and spotlessly cleaned every day. The air conditioning units are very efficient (if a little noisy) and having a fridge in the room to store cold drinks/beer was a bonus. All the staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is located at the northerly end of 5th Avenue and it is about a 20-25 minute walk to the bus station/ferry pier in the centre of town. Loads of great bars and restaurants are in the immediate vicinity though. Free use of the Mamitas beach club about 5mins walk away was very good too. Overall, a lovely, relaxing and quiet place to stay, with the benefit of it being excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: WestparkGardens
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Playa del Carmen (first in Mexico even!) and the Luna Blue hotel was just perfect. The rooms were immaculately clean, Quinta Avenida with all the shops, bars and restaurants was round the corner and the beach club was a couple of blocks away and was lovely. The staff were all very friendly and more than happy to make reccomendations about where to eat and what to do. I have no interest in staying in a huge impersonal resort with buffet meals and Luna Blue was just what I was looking for - clean, comfortable, friendly and central and with the freedom to explore Playa. Thank you Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything”
Reviews.Author: evoff
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Luna Blue with Tony and Cheri. This is one of our favorite hotels in the world. Tony and Cheri make you feel confortable and welcome. If you're looking for a 5 star resort, you should look elsewhere. As far as I know, none of the units have television. It was very refreshing to talk with my husband without waiting for a commercial. I myself prefer a slower pace. The rooms are comfortable and inviting. The housekeeping is immaculate. Each unit has their own patio or balcony and I can't even begin to describe their beautiful garden.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure in Playa”
Reviews.Author: CaptTripsAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great vacation! We booked a week for our 5th anniversary at Luna Blue after reading the positive reviews here on tripadvisor. We were a little worried because it was hurricane season. We lucked out hurricane-wise, with a couple of storms leaving the the town without noticeable damage before we arrived, and it was clear the week we were here. This hotel is really a hidden jewel. It's only got a few rooms, so it's quiet, and it's only a half a block off Quinta, the main pedestrian street through Playa, so it's very accessible to most of the places tourists would want to go. It's also only a couple of blocks to the beach, and "blocks" here are much smaller than big-city blocks. The location really can't be beat. The northern half of Playa, where Luna Blue is, is more European and less-crowded than the southern half. We rarely overheard English. The northern (and newer) section is also mercifully devoid of local shopowners assailing pedestrians with sales pitches, which is the norm in the southern part of town. And there are plenty of nice restaurants, bars, and shops nearby, even a laundry service across the street. We were able to walk to breakfast at Il Baretto a couple doors down, listen to the Italian customers, and enjoy excellent food. (Try the ravioli!) Oops, I'm not really reviewing the hotel... The hotel served as a great launchpad from which to explore the Yucatan. The staff was there when we needed them and not intrusive when we didn't. They brought our delayed luggage to our room while we were at the beach, arranged for a snorkeling trip, got us a rental car so we could drive down to Coba, and recommended restaurants. Always polite and helpful but never hovering. It was still pretty hot and humid in Sept so the air-conditioned room was a godsend. Not many restaurants or clubs are air-conditioned, so it was great to get back to the room after a day of tromping around in the heat. The bed was firm, but comfy, the room was clean, there were no insects and only one lizard (that we would like to have seen more of). The Mamasita's beach club, for which the hotel issues free passes, is very nice but closed early, around 5:00, which is too bad because we would have spent much more time there if it was open late. Luna Blue is not all-inclusive, which in my opinion is the only way to go in a town filled with excellent restaurants. It's not actually on the beach, which may be a put-off for some, but it's so close we were never wishing we had stayed at a hotel on the beach. If you're looking to stay in your hotel for most of your time, this probably isn't the best choice. But if you're looking for a comfortable, affordable base of operations, look no further. Our only regret was that we didn't take a few more days off work so we could stay in Playa longer. We'll be back. Highly recommended! Michael & Karen

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanColts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue from Oct. 1st through the 13th, and had a great time. The staff was very nice and helpful and the rooms were always clean. We usually stay at th AI's in PDC, but we probably won't after this trip. It was so nice to be able to choose when and where we wanted to eat. The hotel itself was very simple and that's that's the way we like it. If your looking for a simple, quiet, no hassle hotel setting then this is the place for you. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay for few days”
Reviews.Author: lexa
Reviews.Content: my daughter (8) and myself stayed for 3 nights... there were american owners, helpful - my daughter got ear infection and they refered us to a doctor office (right after the corner). Booking , check-in/out - no problems at all. room was basic but clean, toilet and shower, small yard/garden... maid made swans on the beds on day of arrival. close walk (5-10 min) to the (Mamita?) beach, hotel provides passes to, otherwise it is ~ $2-3 per adult. the hotel is less than block away from 5th Ave (main pedestrian touristy street) albeit close to northern end of it... there are many places to eat around hotel, mostly on 5th ave..also, banks farmacies, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: spary5108
Reviews.Content: I would have to say Luna Blue is not a bad place to stay while in Playa. I wouldn’t consider it exceptional, it was clean and the staff was helpful. For the price I found many other properties as nice or nicer. Playa is a great place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dickerd
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stepped off of the hot street into the mini oasis of Luna Blue. Their "lobby" is a beautiful, tree filled courtyard w/ a waterfall. It seemed to be 20 degrees cooler there, even though we were still outdoors. We stayed in a room w/ a kitchenette. It was perfect for us. Very clean and cool. We made our own breakfasts and afternoon snacks and toured Avenida Quinta for dinners. Be sure to enjoy the grocery store. The whole family makes the trip (locals) and it's interesting to see the fresh, local produce. They also had some good tequila at a great price (compared to the tequila stores on La Avenida). We found the beach and Avenida Quinta to be lots of fun and very safe. Intercity buses were clean, cool and priced right and were convenient for day trips to Tuluum and the Cenotes. Everyone at Luna Blue was very friendly and professional. We'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the mega resorts”
Reviews.Author: NycNYtourist
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Luna Blue. It is a small hotel in the town of Playa built in the classic Hacienda style with central enclosed courtyard and garden. Each room is different from the others. The staff was friendly and happy to share advice. This is a lovely place to stay if you are trying to avoid the standardized industrial tourist experience. The rooms are clean and rather spartan with a nice shower, A/C, and (in our superior class room) a small refrigerator. This is handy for storing small food items for breakfast and lunch, so that one is not dependent on the restaurants for all meals. Location is terrific. This is not the place if you want the resort life. But vacationers interested in seeing the town, meeting people who are not mirror reflections of themselves, and traveling along the coast will be well positioned here. We also saved money by avoiding any "official" tours. We rented a car and drove to several archeological sites, snorkeled in Akumal and Yalku, and drove into the Biological reserve park south of Tulum. For us, the experience could not have been better. The accommodations could only have been improved by adding a small dresser, perhaps a table and chairs, and extra towels. Still, I'd happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ams777
Reviews.Content: As everyone has mentioned this is a beautiful hotel. My company had a trip to Playa and stayed in a very nice all inclusive hotel and I moved to Luna Blue for the second (vacation) week of my visit. Right away I felt at home. The location is great and the staff is very helpful. It will make planning my next visit so much easier because i would not want to stay any where else!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: Laura_DC
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, small hotel around a nice garden. It is a 3 block walk to the beach and a within one block of the main drag in Playa. although far enough away from the most touristy part that it's not too loud at night. The room was simple and on the small side but very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was again small but clean. No restaurant or bar. The hotel will give you beach passes to Mamita's beach club, which is well located - not in the busiest part but on a nice stretch of beach. It can get crowded so best to get there early if you want a chair and umbrella. We enjoyed our stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back !!”
Reviews.Author: DawnErica
Reviews.Content: As all of the other guests have mentioned - the Luna Blue Hotel & Gardens is beautiful place to stay and the location could not be better. When we checked in we were suprised to learn that Tony & Cheri gave us a room up grade at no charge - nice way to start a 4 night visit. We went to Mamita's on the beach, shopped and tried new places to eat everyday.. You can be as busy or relaxed as you choose in this wonderful town. We went snorkeling with the Geo-Fish comany - it was very nice and very convenient (remember to put sun screen on the back of your leggs- ouch !!!!) A ticket for the ferry over to Cozumel can be purchased for as little as $11.00 per person -the companies like to compete against each other. We took a taxi to one of the local Cenotes (fresh water ponds) it was about 15 miles away but worth the taxi fee - the fresh water was a nice change from the salty Caribbean plus there is a cliff that you can jump off of if you choose to, it was beautiful. Our taxi driver waited for us while we visited the Cenote which was really nice of him. You will find that when you visit Playa Del Carmen everyone is very nice, friendly and helpful we felt at ease and comfortable our entire visit. Then the new bar at the Luna Blue is finished I think that it will add a special touch - and it will be a great place for the guests to gather and visit...hopefull they will have Blue Berry Margaritia's. We did not get to have one when we came to town this time so we have that to look forward to. Happy travels, DAwn & Erica, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “second trip even better than the first”
Reviews.Author: Gimli201
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Luna Blue, July 13-22, was even better than the first visit last October. We stayed in the Kitchen deluxe room (#7) for 9 nights. Loved having the option to cook once in awhile - even if it was just heating up the left overs from Babes or El Fagon or having coffee brewing right away in the morning. :) You really couldn't beat the value for $100/night. We had a great time eating at La Pesca, snorkeling at Hidden Worlds, and taking a day trip to Chichen Itza (warning: REALLY long day) Already thinking about our next trip. Thanks to everyone at Luna Blue for the awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: azwarnke
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet and romantic little getaway in the heart of Playa, this is the place!! Toni and Cheri are awesome!! Their hospitality is top notch!! Toni's restaurant recs were superb!! The blueberry margs (Cheri Size) at Babes were muy delicioso. My fiance and I stayed at an all inclusive the first 5 nights and wanted stay in the heart of Playa for the rest of our trip and found Luna Blue on the Internet. We stayed their with some friends of ours and we all had a great experience. My only complaint (no offense Toni and Cheri :) was the new bar they are putting in wasn't finished yet. Just kidding...we didn't even know they were doing that until we arrived. We can't wait until it is finished!! We will be back for our honeymoon!! Thanks again, Toni and Cheri! Matt and Kim...your AZ friends!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Brina_t4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luna Blue for 5 nights, it was so quiet, clean, and relaxing! It was our 3rd stop in our 2 week stay in Mexico & when we saw how busy Playa del Carmen was I was a bit nervous that our hotel would be too. NOT the case at all!! The Luna Blue has it all. It's close to all the shopping and dinning on 5th ave. and the beach but once you pass through the gate into the garden all that disappears and it's cool and quiet. The staff is so friendly and helpful. There is even a landry mat across the street, so if you are like us and run out of clean clothes from that hot mexican sun before the end of your vacation you can just walk across the street and drop them offf. They will wash them for you and you can pick them up that evening. We could not have picked a better place to stay in Playa del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: briefcaseandsandals
Reviews.Content: 2 weeks ago was my 4th stay at Luna Blue within the past two years. The standard rooms are clean, well kept and exceptional value. The last two trips I've chosen the kitchen deluxe rooms and will ocassionaly cook breakfast (these rooms are equipped with coffee makers, pots, plates, utensils). The hotel staff is personable and will go out of their way to accommodate special requests. The location is ideal if you are seeking a quieter atmosphere - there's a small tienda across the street which is convenient and carries common sundries. The restaurants next door are convenient and good quality, two internet cafe's within a block. If you're new to smaller, boutique-like hotels, don't expect the property to have a pool, TV's, room service, elevators, etc. If on vacation, come prepared to relax. I've been travelling to Playa on a regular basis for the past 5 years primarily on business and through the years have stayed at various hotels - through experience I've narrowed my choices exclusively between Luna Blue and the Alhambra.

Reviews.Title: “They made my wedding week!”
Reviews.Author: luckygirl777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get married in Playa del Carmen, and I spent a lot of time deciding where to have my friends and family stay. The reviews of Luna Blue were great, and I liked the idea of a cozy, garden hotel located just outside of the big downtown area, but close enough to walk everywhere. We had a group of 11 at the hotel, and everyone loved it. It is very cute, and the various levels of rooms were very reasonably priced and comfortable. We only wish we had thought to reserve a family suite early enough! If you are booking with them, just remember to read through the rules and policies carefully, and that it sometimes takes a while for them to respond to emails (welcome to life in Playa!) But the best thing about the Luna Blue is the people. Before we had even arrived, my husband and I had missed our flight and lost a wallet, and we were in a panic about how to manage hosting a large group for a wedding week. However, right away Tony started giving me ideas, and he, Cheri and Genero who works at the front desk, all pulled together to help me find genuine and exciting plans for my whole group. They had excellent advice for restaurants, helped me with arrangements, even found a French translator for my husband´s family, and were very patient in the face of my own bridal crises. Thanks to everyone at Luna Blue, our two families had a magical week in Playa del Carmen. Thank you Luna Blue!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: jentifer
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed @ the Luna Blue for my 31st birthday - we were there for 5 nights and it was just lovely! The jungle-y courtyard area is a literal oasis when you come in from the heat of the dusty sidewalks. I loved the hammock down near the waterfall - a perfect place for reading or lying about after a big dinner. The cleaning lady was meticulous - not only did she do the usual in terms of upkeeping the room, but she would fold our things for us - do leave a very generous tip for her if you stay! We loved having the kitchenette - it allowed for coffee and fruit in the morning which always makes me feel more at home while traveling. Mamitas was great! Cherie and Tony were both very friendly and gave great eating advice :)

Reviews.Title: “Second time there”
Reviews.Author: ktkonrad22
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at Luna Blue 7 years ago during our senior year of high school ( when it was called Hotel Zanzibar). When we decided to get together this year for a "Mexico Reunion," we knew we wanted to stay at the same place! Luna Blue is laid back, beautiful, friendly, comfortable, and not at all shi-shi. Highlights: -Our rooms were beautifully cleaned every day -Our rooms (we stayed in the treetop deluxe terrace) came with a big water dispenser-- that saved us a ton of money on bottled water) -Genaro, the manager, was fantastic. -We got free passes to the beach club down the street-- so instead of having to stake out a spot on the sand, we got nice chairs and umbrellas It was the perfect place for our reunion and we couldn't have had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “I Do Get It”
Reviews.Author: t4steel
Reviews.Content: Well, like the previous reviewer my wife and I are from Houston,Tx But, unlike the previous reviewer we disagree on a few things. My wife and I were looking for peace and quiet, which is just what the Luna is. No thrills just relaxing. I read a book from cover to end. haven't done that in a couple of years. when we came back to room we missed tv just little for news and weather, but realize we really didn't miss it at all. The luna's website gave all the info you needed. Info on each room and what was included. We had a great time at the beach and walking 5th avenue. All of the resturants that Tony and Sheri recommended were great, we espicially like the steak place. H.C. Monterrey. Go to there their blog for the resturaunt info.The only thing we needed was a place to maybe put clothes, when mention to Tony and Sheri, they were already in the process of getting chest of drawers for rooms .

Reviews.Title: “A lush garden paradise”
Reviews.Author: brokenchinadol
Reviews.Content: Just to add to the chorus of people who have heralded the beauty of Luna Blue - I recently stayed there with a girlfriend for five magical days, and loved every moment of my time in Tony and Cheri's care. The entire staff was friendly, helpful, chatty and perfected the balance of familiarity and respectful distance. Our room was a perfect size with a fully functioning kitchen where we made coffee and enjoyed conchas in the morning, and our balcony with hammock was out of a dream. The location (on Calle 26 between Avenidas 5 y 10) was perfect as it was only a couple of blocks from the beach, and on the calmer, more neighborhood-like section of Avenida 5. Everywhere we went, people were warm and charming, and it was incredibly hard to say goodbye to Playa Del Carmen and come home to California. I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, inexpensive - just our style”
Reviews.Author: SeattleHelix
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week, and the Luna Blue was a great fit for us. Inexpensive, no serious frills, clean, quiet, and great staff! The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful, and our housekeeper was wonderful. I liked the Beach Club, too - a short walk and the beach and water were gorgeous. My only complaint is the water splashing out of the shower - not a huge issue, but we always ended up with a big puddle leading into the bedroom. Next time, I would rent the high end room, mostly for the hammock, the extra space and the view ( we were in the mid-range - Superior? I think), but our room and little deck area were nice. Thanks, Luna Blue, for the friendly peace and quiet :)

Reviews.Title: “We would go back to the Luna Blue in a NY minute!”
Reviews.Author: thebarbaras
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue in Playa from April 5th to the 13th. The first night we had to stay in a smaller room on the first floor which was fine but we loved the tree top room we had for the rest of the stay. It was nice to have water and a fridge available to us in the room. The room was spacious and the balcony was wonderful. It was close to the beach and with beach chair passes and towels we were good to go. The owners were very helpful in all aspects of our trip. Our flight leavinggot changed and Cherrie was great she got right on the phone and our car came 45 minutes early and got us to the airport on time. So my advice is to check at least 24 hours earlier to make sure all is ok. We plan on going back next year during our april break and bringing some friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “I Just Don't Get It??”
Reviews.Author: lmw48
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to my stay at this little hotel from all the reviews. Maybe I expected too much. I knew there was no pool & was OK with that as well as no TV. My experience with this hotel was that it's just OK. It should never be rated in the top 10 on this site as it misleads in my opinion. The tiny room we stayed in didn't have the bottled water that everyone mentioned (had to pay $10/day extra for it) & I found it to be somewhat dirty as well as the bathroom door had a broken vent slat. When you used the shower water went all over the floor therefore you had standing water to add to the humidity. The only highlight was the man at the front desk. He was a delight but we never saw the owners. I also want to mention that I booked a 4 night stay in Jan. & decided we could only stay 3 & when I emailed to cancel approx. 3 months in advance I was charged $25 to do so even though it states on their cancellation policy that you "may" be charged a fee. I can see if I cancelled closer to the time we were to arrive but I gave plenty of notice. I was also told when we arrived & saw how tiny the room was that it was the only room with 2 beds except for the penthouse or whatever he called it that was occupied. I find that hard to believe since I would assume there are times when a family or friends would need more than one bed. Anyway, my review of this hotel would be neutral or rating of "2". I don't need luxury but I do need & expect clean & comfortable. Sorry but I'd never stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great time at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: evetrippinagain
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend scored a week free from husbands and kids to have a girls week away. We chose Mexico because she is West Coast and I am East Coast so it was an easy flight for both of us. I had manically inhaled reviews of different hotels to find one we would both like. In January my family stayed at one of the big AI's and didn't like the property at all (to say the least), so I wanted to get a small hotel in town. Luna Blue fit the bill. We were in room 7 with a kitchen as I thought we may cook some meals in. Well, we didn't, but the fridge and water came in handy. We loved the property. It was beautiful and Cheri and Tony were great hosts. I agree with all positives listed in previous posts (location, ect). The only negative things that I can come up with is unfortunately why we probably wouldn't stay again. And it is no fault of the hotel. While we were there it POURED rain (buckets and buckets) day and night the first 2 to 3 days. Cheri and Tony were in the states then, and once they came back it stopped raining (they must have taken the sun with them:) ). Any way, I didn't realize how much a tv would have come in handy. I booked knowing they didn't have TV in the rooms. We both brought books to read instead. But being kinda stuck inside (the rain was crazy), we wished we had a tv. For the most part I would be able to do without it for a couple days, but it is a nice diversion to have. Also - I would never get my husband to agree to no tv for a week. The only other 2 things that were the AC is quite loud and was right above my bed. I thought earplugs would drown out the noise - but it was still kinda loud. We tried to sleep with just the fan blowing out of ac machine and we both woke in the middle of the night to an incredible hot,humid room. I think the AC machine would have been better in Kitchen. Also, it would have been nice to have another mirror in the room. The only mirror was a very small mirror over the bath sink, that we had to take turns using as it was too small to look into together. A full legnth would have been nice. So it took longer to get ready. We were 2 girls hitting the town - mirrors are a must. The positives are a long list here: comfortable beds, large rooms,bottled water,nice owners and a great price too. I know Tony and Cheri read this - so please, please let me know if you put in tvs (for rainy days and late nights) then I will be able to talk my clan into staying!!! Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Truely A Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Rico_Sauve
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and it was fantastic. My wife and I debated whether we should experience the "All Inclusive" Mexico or the down in the streets with the people Mexico. Now I must say that we are rather high maintenance people and have grown to expect a certain comfort level in our lives. I'm sure that we would have enjoyed staying at an AI resort and I'm sure that some day we will (when were older and less adventurous). Now having said that, the most memorable experiences we've ever had have come from exiting the rat race of commercialism and the luxuries we take for granted and immersing ourselves in the real world culture. By not allowing ourselves to get caught up in the resort mentality and the tour bus craziness, we were able to experience the Mexican people and their culture in far more fulfilling ways than you can behind the walls of a resort or the windows of a tour bus. The Luna Blue Hotel is a gem in the heart of Playa Del Carmen. There are no distractions like satellite TV, telephones, and yes - there is no coffee pot either (we knew this before we stayed there). There are excellent restaurants all over the place and the staff were extremely helpful in directing us to local (and cheap) establishments that did not fail to satisfy. Everything you need is within steps of the hotel. They provided us with tips on where to shop for the best bargains, how much to pay the cab drivers (they'll burn you if you don't know), and so on - they were very helpful to us "Mexico rookies". I could not write a review without mentioning Mamita's Beach Club - simply put - the best damn beach in town. Get there before 9:00 am to secure a palapa. Part of our adventure was to rent a Harley Davidson from a local company - now thats the way to tour the ruins in Tulum and Coba (and everywhere else for that matter!). For you who are going to rent transportation and tour around just a word of caution - there are speed bumps on the highways in the craziest places and they are not marked very well - good thing the bike had excellent brakes! The drivers are insane but it doesn't take long to get with the flow - there is order to the chaos! By going on our own we were able to enjoy things at our own pace and go where we wanted, when we wanted. Definitely check out the snorkeling at Yal-Ku - awesome! Tulum has some excellent restaurants and beaches. Snorkeling in the underground Cenotes is also a must do. The bottom line is that the Luna Blue was our "base camp" and sanctuary while there. We were always made to feel welcome and were greeted with a smile. It is our new home away from home and we are already booked for next year. Can't wait to get back on Mexico time!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in bustling Playa”
Reviews.Author: planandgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue for 4 nights in March and had a wonderful time. We booked the treetop unit so had lots of privacy. We enjoyed the feeling of stepping in off of the hot streets into the quiet and solitude of the garden. We used our balcony extensively - fruit and pastries for breakfast, fresh fruit late afternoon and a beer or wine for a nightcap. The manager was able to provide us with good restaurant recommendations. The ablity to use the beach club was very handy for us. And we felt very comfortable with the street parking for our rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: pdmoran
Reviews.Content: Our family (husband, wife, and two daughters 17 and 14) stayed at the Luna Blue in March 2007 - would not change a thing: An excellent relaxed atmosphere (this is not a "luxury hotel" and I like it that way. Lots of character- great clean comfy rooms; great location with walking acess to beach and downtown- exceptionally friendly inn-keepers - and a fabulous hammock on the balcony overlooking the beautiful walled garden that I can't wait to settle back into on my next trip to Playa - I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: cptthermo
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the RIU Palace River Maya with the company I work for. My wife and I along with another couple who were staying with us at the RIU looked into extending our stay. My friend came across the Luna Blue web site. We looked at it and decided to book it. Honestly the reason we decided on the Luna was based on the price and the reviews we had read made it look good. We thought what the heck lets give it a try. Well we could not have been more pleasantly surprised. The Hotel setting in the heart of Playa Del Carmen is serene and peaceful. The online pictures we had seen do not do it justice. The grounds were picture perfect. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was better then expected, all new plumbing and up to date . The A/C was a Carrier and coming from Syracuse, New York, the home of Carrier I was happy to see that. The staff was charming, accommodating and knowledgeable on what to do in Playa. The Grounds and rooms were very clean. The Mimitas Beach Club is a short and pleasant walk from the hotel. It is by far the best beach in Playa Tony & Cheri were warm and wonderful and very accommodating. When you meet them you can sense how much they love what they are doing. We wish them the best for years to come. The RIU was great, if your looking for an elegant all inclusive.We had a great time there, however if you want a wonderful in town, earthy experience with great value, the Luna Blue is the place to be. We will most definitely recommend the Luna Blue and we will some day, hopefully soon return to enjoy the newest addition to the Luna Blue, the swing bar. Thank you, Tony and Cheri for a wonderful place to stay. Bob and Peggy Russo Syracuse, NY

Reviews.Title: “Our little holiday at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: playasuzi
Reviews.Content: Playa is our place we love to visit lately. We just got back from our 2nd trip in 2 months. We've been to Playa at least 6 times and now I can honestly say what our happy little medium is. We stayed at ritzy resorts both located at the North end of Playa and the very South, being Playacar (the hotel zone). We decided that the best place to be located at all times is around Calle 26 and 5th Avenue. Luna Blue is located right there and its very easy to get to the beach from there. Mamitas Beach Club is a blast. This hotel includes beach passes for chairs and umbrellas for free. The owners of Luna Blue, Cheri and Tony, were very pleasant. We had a few conversations with them and they were very helpful and nice that it fealt like we were hanging out with our friends. We stayed in room number 7 which was large and gracious. The A/C worked wonderfully and there were no problems with the water. Speaking of water, the hotel provides bottled water so it was perfect for making coffee every morning with the provided coffee maker. The little rain forrest in the middle of the hotel is very quaint and relaxing. Its nice staying at a boutique hotel as this one instead of a big all inclusive hotel where you are just a number and feel like you are walking the march. March up to the room, march up to the wall of food, march to the bar, etc. Playa has so much to discover on and around 5th Avenue, like the little restaurants and shops, and its only a hop, skip and a jump away. I would stay at Luna Blue again. Maybe sooner than I think.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: pamstravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our second stay at the Luna Blue on May 2. We stayed 5 nights.I must say it was a long awaited moment to see the Luna Blue again. We were so happy with our first stay a year earlier that we knew this was the place for us. We requested a room close to our friends that were newlyweds and Cheri put us in room 23 which was perfect. We love the charm of this small tropical hotel. We looked forward to not having phones and TV's and for the hotels calm quiet peaceful garden feeling. Our room was very clean and everything worked very well. Our maid cleaned daily and was very respectful when we slept in several mornings. The location is perfect just a short walk to Mammitas and Kool beach which we visited both. We love the walk up 5th ave and our favorite place to eat taco's and have mango margaritas is right next door to the hotel "La quinta pasion" a small outdoor place that is truely the best taco's we have ever had. The luna blue is a place to go and relax and unwind and get away from all of the stress and noise in our daily lives. It is not for those who want all inclusive and huge high rise hotels. There are many modern pricey highrise and all inclusive hotels and resorts in the Mayan Riveria if that is the vacation you are looking for. We hope that The Luna Blue keeps its charm and unique Mexico getaway feeling. We will return again and stay at the Luna blue. Thanks Luna BLue for another great relaxing trip and all your advise on places to visit in the Tulum Area. We had a amazing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and cozy”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteV
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Luna Blue and can highly recommend it! The hotel itself and our room specifically were both very nice. We really appreciated the friendly and helpful staff. Tony made some fantastic restaurant recommendations. I liked being at that end of the pedestrian walkway...it is quieter and more laid back. The hotel gives you passes to a beach club and it was a very nice club. We will definitley return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Anthony323
Reviews.Content: Location is close to beach and right off avenue 5 were all the restaurants and shops are located. Good value for the money. I highly recommend the Treetop Terrace. We stayed for 4 days in Playa and had a very memorable time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place near most everything”
Reviews.Author: StSebastian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend in February 2007 and had a very nice time. Property is convenient to all of the major areas of Playa del Carmen and the ferry to Cozumel. If you are driving, just go ahead and plan to park at the 24 hour pay lot at the down at the corner with 10th ave. Parking rates were 100 pesos per day when we were there and we had no problems. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing tropical oasis”
Reviews.Author: Tropicalbreeze12
Reviews.Content: My husband and our family booked three days at Luna Blue and then moved to an all-inclusive to meet more family for a wedding. We really enjoyed our time at Luna Blue the best, and were reluctant to change hotels. Cheri and Tony and their staff were always ready with a recommendation and a friendly smile. The rooms were clean and simple. The grounds are spectacular and you feel as if you are in the rain forest. Lots of birds and small animals. The location is just right. Not half a block from Fifth Street, where you could go for a meal, drink or to shop. It was far enough not to be noisy at night though. It is a very short walk to the beach, that was much better than the larger resort. We are ready to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Room 1,”
Reviews.Author: mslacool
Reviews.Content: I would recommend staying away from Room 1 which is ground floor next to the street and has a broken towel rack and no curtain on the outside window. and the standard bed seems a bit too small for a big person like me 6.2. It was clean and all but we were not comfortable with the room and upgraded. I would suggest the Mayan Bric as a better alternative for the value minded shopper. It has a nice pool. We are changing rooms and they were pretty accommodating, and we enjoyed the upgraded room. It is a nice garden area. The plumbing was functional but the shower head was whacky in our upgraded room. The AC worked fine. Its a decent place to stay but nothing special for the price and area.

Reviews.Title: “Garden Oasis!!!”
Reviews.Author: MX_Beach_Lover_KC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a week long driving trip of the Yucatan peninsula. We spent the last three days and nights of our trip at the Luna Blue Hotel, and found it to be a wonderful retreat! The gardens are beautiful and peaceful, and the room was a great find! We had a kitchenette, and it gave us so much space and an area to sit in the room, without sitting on the bed. I loved the window seat, and the fact that the windows could open to allow the breeze to blow through! We loved our balcony, which was above the gardens where you could see all of the plants and hear the sounds of the birds and fountain! It also had a hammock, which my husband and I both enjoyed during our stay! The hotel was about two blocks from the beach, and included chairs and an umbrella at Mamita's Beach Club. This was a true plus, although we found that you should get there pretty early (by 10:00a.m.), if you want the chairs with umbrellas. We found some good restaurants close to the hotel, although we did walk to the center of town on Avenida 5 every evening. It's great that this walkway exists this far north, to allow you to walk without having to dodge all of the traffic in town. The owners, Tony and Cheri, were extremely nice and gave us great suggestions for dining options that you might not otherwise hear about. La Pesca was a wonderful find! We would definitely stay here again, and would stay in the kitchenette room again. Having the refrigerator and coffee maker gave us the opportunity to save some money we would have otherwise spent at a restaurant, just to have pop, juice and coffee. Although we did not need the extra beds, the room was a great size for a family with children, with the extra twin bed and the trundle bed that rolled out from under the twin. We found the shelving and closet space to be more than ample for the amount of clothing and accessories needed for a beach vacation. We loved this place and hope your experience is as good as ours was!

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue - A Charming Lush Garden Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Gottagetouttahere23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this charming little getwaway just off the main strip of Playa Del Carmen for 3 nights in March. Reservations via e-mail went flawlessly and the room was just what we were looking for - reasonable, quiet, comfy and clean. The bed was fine and water pressure more than adequate. Remote control air, bottled water and an in-room safe all were nice perks. The lush garden grounds and waterfall made for a peaceful respite away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The location was a perfect beginning and ending point for our daily adventures and the free pass for the beach chairs and umbrella at Mamitas was a nice bonus for our day at the beach. Tony and Cheri were out of town so we weren't able to tap into their local knowledge, but between the helpful desk staff and prior reviews we had plenty of restaurant recommendations. All in all, our stay at Luna Blue was more like staying at someone's charming unique home - in a jungle - in the city. Thanks Luna Blue - hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: chloenavasmommie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I, along with a group of friends, stayed at the Luna Blue the beginning of March. I decided on this place after reading all the amazing reviews and doing a LOT of research. The owners Tony & Cheri are indeed very friendly & accomodating, and are very happy to point you in the right direction when it comes to everything Playa. The location is fabulous, right in the middle of all the great shops & restaurants, and a 2 block stroll to the beach, however the grounds themselves are very quiet & peaceful. My husband & I stayed in the Treetop Terrace, and our friends were in a superior room & kitchen suite. Our Treetop room was so adorable, clean & comfortable. The tile work on the floor was beautiful, as was the tile in the bathroom. However as cute as the bathtub tile is, it was looking pretty tired & needs to be redone, as does the bathtub itself. The bed was fine, I had heard they were very hard but I had no trouble sleeping. We had a really nice large balcony with our own hammock and a couple chairs. There were only a few minor issues such as some of the lightbulbs being burned out, and the fact that our room had a connecting door to the one below it, and one night we were woken at 3am when the people below us came back from partying and continued to do so in their room...we could have sworn they were right on our room! However to the credit of the hotel staff, the night guard was knocking on their door within 10 minutes, and came back again 5 minutes later when they still hadn't quieted down...you would never see prompt attention to a noise issue like that in any hotel!!! The grounds at the Luna Blue were absolutely beautiful, very lush with a cute waterfall in the courtyard. Also the newly built bar is gorgeous. Overall the Luna Blue is a really great little place. If you are not into the big overcrowded, overexpensive resorts, and are more into making new friends & having a good time then this is the place for you. The service you get is personal & outstanding. The rooms are charming and you can't beat the price. I would highly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: skinnybirch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a couple of nights at Luna Blue during the Easter/Semana Santa high season and had a great time! Luna Blue is a small hotel just off the main walking street in Playa. It is quiet and convenient and only a 4 block walk to the beach. If you are looking for reasonable rates, a comfy place to sleep, and a nice calm beach (as opposed to Cancun's waves and riptides) this is the place for you. Plus, you can do it for less than $100 a night. As we booked only a week before our trip the hotel had a standard room available the first night and a room with a kitchen for the second night so I can comment on both types of rooms. The standard room we stayed in was perfectly fine and cost 60$ -cheap for Playa. The room had a double bed and a single bed. The bath was large an water pressure was great. The water doesn;t smell like salt water. There was no view but lots of windows. The hotel does not have the musty smell many places in the tropics have. If you need a comfy mattress - stay here. These mattresses are more comfortable than my bed at home! The room with a kitchenette was fine for us but we didn't use the appliances. The room is a bit bigger with a dining table for 4 without the single bed. Again, lots of windows with garden views. There is a fridge, stove, plates, pots, etc (see photos). The bath is large and there are 2 chairs just outside. The staff is helpful and polite and we felt perfectly safe staying at the hotel. The only downfalls to the hotel are there are no elevators (though I'm sure the staff would help you with your luggage - we just had one bag) and the walkways are stone - i.e. not condusive to rolling luggage, again that didn't affect us. Also, there is no pool at the hotel, but the beach is nice and the waves are not overbearing. As we walked around Playa (it was our first time) we were so glad we booked here. It was between this place and one called Posada Mariposa and when we walked by Mariposa we both said, I'm glad Luna Blue had space. It was much quieter at Luna Blue! Well, I booked at this hotel because it was the highest rated hotel at Playa for less than $100 a night and I hope to stay there again very soon! Hope you try it! The first 4 photos are of the kitchenette room (sorry I don't have any of the standard) the beach photos are taken from Mamitas Beach Club (free to Luna Blue hotel guests). It is a busy part of the beach although the photos don't show that but it is a very nice place and swimming is great. We really enjoyed ourselves at Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Odd booking policy”
Reviews.Author: dhelihiker
Reviews.Content: We tried to book 3 night with this hotel in August Sat/Sun/Mon but our reservation was denied because you have to book Friday and Saturday nights together. So basically if I was to book 2 nights Fri/Sat, no problem but 3 nights Sat-Mon cant be done?? Cheri was very polite and suggested I just pay for the extra night even though I would not be there or I could wait and If no one wanted the room then possibly at the last minute I could stay there. Seems silly to me, I guess I will have to pay a bit more for a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “lovely luna”
Reviews.Author: travelbugbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: we stayed at luna in march. we had a slightly complicated reservation since we were 4 people in 2 rooms with slightly different dates - but all was very smooth through email reservations. the hotel is everything the other reviews state. it has a beautiful garden, each room has a cute outdoor area, there is bottled water in each room. it was really lovely. we had a kitchen room and it was equiped enough for us to do what we wanted and also had a table with chairs - which was great to have. the shower had pretty good water pressure and was really cute. the only - and i mean - only thing that was slight negative was that the room smelled a little musty. we told the front desk and he said that he's see what the maid could do - and also that it would clear up after we ran the A/C or fan for a little. well, we were there for a week and while it did get a little better, it was always there. that being said, i don't believe there was actually any mold because then my allergies would have been bad and they weren't. so all in all we loved luna and would absolutely stay there again if we are back in playa.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: jchutton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luna Blue 03/24 – 03/31. The moment we stepped through the gate we felt at home. Such a fabulous location, so quiet and peaceful, beautiful lush colorful garden, soothing waterfall, cool room, friendly front desk staff. It was just wonderful! We felt very secure in this hotel, actually more so then at an AI last year. We stayed in superior room #33 with a wonderful patio space overlooking the waterfall area. The room was very sparsely furnished. However, we found there was plenty of space to unpack our belongings. We loved the safe with the keypad access rather then key….and we didn’t have to pay an $80 deposit as a previous reviewer mentioned. The shower was great, we loved the remote control to operate the air conditioning, the bed was really perfect, the housecleaning staff had the room in immaculate condition when we returned from the beach each day, the water bottle was awesome and we appreciated the use of the mini fridge. We also appreciated the wireless internet connection that we had on our patio. We were not able to access it inside our room, but that was okay with us. We loved the free passes to Mamitas. Great location on the beach and such a nice short walk there. We were disappointed to not have been able to meet Toni and Cheri as they were traveling to the U.S. We are very curious if it would have been a very different experience. We were quite surprised by the number of mosquitoes on the property. We think the waterfall may contribute to the increased # of mosquitoes. Nowhere else did we encounter mosquitoes. We were glad we packed the mosquito repellant. One thing that concerned us a little was that there appeared to be no smoke detector in the room….still not sure if we just missed that. We would add that as a suggestion to the management for the safety of their guests. The plumbing was certainly different then in Canada….however we could tell it was an issue at most establishments we visited on our trip…so no complaints in that regard. Just a heads up. We were glad to have a laptop along with us along with a few DVDs and we really would have missed those unwinding moments with the lack of TV in the rooms. We feel a TV would enhance the value of this hotel to more customers. Overall, we think this hotel is amazing! And we would certainly recommend it to others and consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, but a few things to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: Tinabean
Reviews.Content: I booked the Luna Blue based on the raving reviews from various websites. We had a Superior room, which ran us about $80/night. Overall, the property is lovely, the gardens are lush and full. However, the grounds always seemed to be damp, with puddles to avoid and slippery stairs to watch out for. One day we had gone down to view the waterfall area and I slipped on the wooden platform. It is extremely slick when wet. Granted, I tend to be a bit of a clutz, but perhaps some kind of rubber mat or something would prevent accidents like that in the future. Also, the stairs leading up towards our room were borderline rickety. The banister wobbled and a few stairs were actually loose. I took them very slowly and was fine, there was a 'caution' sign at the base of the stairs to warn people, so I assume management was aware of the issue. The room had everything we needed, but not much else. The biggest saving grace was the bottled water, which was very convenient. Honestly, my husband was not thrilled about the room. He's not picky, but he hated the bed and did not look forward to going to sleep. I had to agree with him. It was incredibly hard, not just firm, but rock, solid hard. The owners and management were very good, though. They did everything possible to make us comfortable. One thing to be aware of is that the in room safe is available with an $80 cash deposit. This was something we didn't realize until we got there. I'm glad we had the cash! It's one of those little details I didn't read anywhere ... just an FYI. Also, there are a plethora of switches all over the room, it took us a while to figure out what switch worked what. We assumed that we must have had some burned-out bulbs, because certain switches did nothing. Perhaps a quick tour of all the gadgets when we arrived would've solved this problem. We did spent a few evenings on our little patio area, which was very quaint and quiet. It's a good place to catch up on conversation and have a few laughs. But beware the biting insects! I got bit up on both legs causing huge, red, itchy welts. Part of the fun of being in the tropics! The A/C in the room worked well, but again, we weren't really sure how to use the remote. It was difficult to maintain the temperature in the room, it was either freezing cold or blazing hot. There is a timer feature on the A/C, but we couldn't figure it out. Not a big deal, but again, perhaps a brief explanation when we arrived would have been helpful. Personally, I enjoyed the quiet and simplicity of the Luna Blue. I like not having any distractions. I brought my ipod and portable speakers, so we had music, and for me, that's all I need. I would have preferred a bit more comfort. For example, in the room there is no other place to sit except the bed. Also, I noticed the maid didn't change the sheets every day. So, not only was the bed hard, but the sheets were sandy. Not a good combo. We did make a point to tip the maid generously, but to no avail. We had considered other small hotels in the area for about the same price. We've decided that we missed certain luxuries that we'd like to have when we return to PDC. A pool and TV are two things that we could've had at a hotel a few blocks away. The Luna Blue is an evolving property that is well run by fantastic people. I'm glad we stayed there and were able to experience it for ourselves. The hotel is safe, clean and in a good location. I think however, that on our next trip to Playa we will seek out a room with a few more creature comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Great liitle place”
Reviews.Author: gingmeister
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights at the Luna Blue in early March. I was not excited to stay in Playa since we haven't been back in a few years and it has gotten so big and crowded, but we needed a place for a few nights and found the Luna on trip advisor. Needless to say we just loved it, it is tucked away from all the noise and the crowds, the garden is very peaceful, the rooms very clean ( which is a must for me), we will for sure be back now that we know about this charming little place.

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd stay at Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: billsuesob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue for 7 days in Feb. (the best time to be out of the Chicago area). Since this was our third stay at LB in the last year, you know we must like it. It's nice to see the improvements that have made at each visit. The waterfall in the cenote is so relaxing and beautiful. Lush gardens make the courtyard 10 degrees cooler than the street. We always enjoy our private patio area to read, relax and visit with our fellow guests. The LB location is perfect. Short walk to beautful beach, many good restaurants (we like walking north for more local fare and better prices) and ample shopping. Our room was a Superior with a fridge and water. Nice size and always clean. We had plenty of hot water. The staff is very helpful.......extra pillow and more drinking water were delivered within minutes of request. We plan our 4th visit to Playa in Nov. and you know we'll be staying at Luna Blue. Thanks again to owners Tony & Cheri for providing us with such a delightful and relaxing visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VillageTraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Luna Blue are clean and comfortable. Access to the beach and shopping was a short walk away. We enjoyed relaxing on our private little patio, looking at the garden and visiting with the other guests. Our hosts were gracious and it was helpful to be able to converse with them in English. We would definitely stay at the Luna Blue again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rachelme6685
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Luna Blue Hotel was fantastic. The hotel was located two blocks from the nicest beach in Playa del Carmen and we were given free access to chairs and umbrellas thanks to the hotel. In addition, the hotel was clean and the rooms were spacious. The owners, Tony and Cheri, are incredibly friendly and accommodating. They gave us great advice on restaurants and bars. We had an unbelievable time!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - highly recommended for quality and value!!!”
Reviews.Author: biznkitty
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue Hotel is a garden hotel just off of Fifth Avenue and Calle 26th in Playa Del Carmen. While many, if not most, of the garden hotels in Playa have been replaced by new retail, hotel, or condominium projects, owners Tony and Cheri Head have preserved the old Zanzabar Hotel and restored the garden into a tropical oasis. Tony and Cheri are wonderful hosts, the staff is friendly and professional, and the service is excellent. Our room was spacious with a nice kitchen (stove with oven, refrigerator, dishes, toaster, and coffee maker included), comfortable beds with soft pillows, big fluffy towels and plenty of hot water in the shower. The hotel is well maintained, very clean and daily maid service was provided. One of our favorite evenings on our trip was having a drink on the balcony of our second floor room, enjoying the evening breeze blowing through the lush gardens below while listening to the trickle of the waterfall. The garden is beautifully accented with lights after sundown. The Luna Blue is just three blocks from one of the most fantastic beaches in the world. The north beach is wide, the turquoise water is gorgeous, and the Luna Blue provides free Mamitas Beach Club beach chairs with every room. Towels are available at the Luna Blue with only a modest deposit. We really enjoy the food in Mexico, and the selection of restaurants within easy walking distance from the Luna is considerable. A short walk further down Fifth Avenue brings you into the heart of the Playa Del Carmen entertainment district with choices of more restaurants, lounges, bars, nightclubs and European style discos. Getting up and down Fifth Avenue on foot is easy, and we only used a taxi when we were moving to and from the hotel with our luggage. We had the pleasure to be invited to a private party hosted by the owners. It is our understanding that this gathering of locals and tourists is a seasonal event that occurs only a few times a year. The party was a delight with burgers catered by locals, and self serve blender drinks mixed by the guests. A local band played a nice selection of soft rock and latin music - great dance music. We had the opportunity to meet several expats living in the Playa area and to spend a few minutes talking to the owners, Tony and Cheri Head. The party broke around 9:30 or 10:00. It was a very enjoyable evening and our total cost was a contribution of $10.00 towards the catering. It was a classy event and great fun! We will be returning to the Luna Blue on our next trip in June and consider it absolutely the best value in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Playa First Timers!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andy&Liza
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Playa and we loved it! This hotel was a big part of that. We were here for a friend’s wedding, and most of our friends stayed at a nearby all inclusive resort. When they came to visit us in town, they were very impressed with Luna Blue. The hotel is quiet, clean and 5-10 minutes from great restaurants, shopping (WALMART), the beach. You don’t need a car if you stay here. People who stay here should not luxury accommodations, think “An Exotic B&B” The rooms are cleaned everyday and the service staff are very helpful and nice. The best way to book this hotel is through their website. This way, you can choose your room. The owners, Cheri and Toni are American, so communication with them is very easy. They are great at giving recommendations, which they give with much enthusiasm. We stayed in the Treetop room, which was about $95.00/night. It had our own veranda with a hammock, which we often fell asleep on during the afternoons. From our room we could see the courtyard, which is very tropical. We even saw someone getting a massage out in the courtyard. There are tons of restaurants nearby. However, since we had a fridge, we also would go to Walmart or Mega grocery store to buy fruits and other local foods to eat. If you wanted to go on the beach, you can get a pass to the beach, 3 minutes away. If you wanted to go on excursions, you can walk into town and book them there at a good rate. We went on a snorkeling tour of the reefs for $35.00. Overall I would say this is probably our best vacation so far and Luna Blue help set the mood. Thanks Toni and Cheri!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Aliflower
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 fabulous nights at the Luna Blue. I had high expectations after hearing so much about the hotel and I can honestly say I was not disappointed.
