We had Room 6 which is one of those with a kitchenette – the room is spacious, very clean (maid visits daily) and has a double bed plus a single with a trundle bed so could sleep four, there is also a dining table and chairs, full size refrigerator and oven/hob with a variety of pots and pans, crockery and cutlery. A large bottle of purified water was also supplied which was a great help! Oh yes, and a nice balcony space with two chairs which gave us a great view of the tropical garden that surrounds the hotel. Our bathroom was quite small (although I was amazed at the large shelf I had for toiletries – I’m not really that easily pleased, it just made a nice change!) but given that I don’t spend all day in there it doesn’t matter. The room also had a fan, air-con and a safety deposit box. Beach towels are available (10USD refundable deposit on arrival) and changeable daily, plus you get a voucher for beach chairs and a palapa at Mamitas though we preferred to spend time at Kool beach club as it just felt like a much more comfortable surrounding and you can usually get a bed most days (except maybe at the weekends when everywhere is much busier). The beach is less than five minutes walk away! Location wise Luna Blue is at the north end of town which is somewhat quieter than the southern end but is developing nicely and has a good selection of bars and restaurants nearby should you be too exhausted to take yourself to the ‘main drag’ (there is even a Babe’s just around the corner). Across the road you will find a laundry (about 6USD for a 5kg load) and a little shop selling drinks/snacks etc. The owners have worked really hard to update the hotel and make it a welcoming and comfortable place to be, and I have to say from my point of view they’ve got it spot on. I will definitely be staying there again, I just wish it was some time soon!

Reviews.Title: “liked the place”
Reviews.Author: Maja80
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff!!! We felt very welcome when we came to Luna Blue. We stayed 2 nights in a standard room, and 2 in a superior. The superior was bigger, had a fridge and water and a nicer place to sit outside the room. However the shower and AC was worse than the standard room... The next time I would probably stay in a standardroom all the time and save a little money. Great beachclub, but be there early. Good restaurants close by. (BABE'S and Quinta Pasion)...The Luna Blue is situated in the north part of Playa, which is a little less crowded (still crowdy though) and in my taste, the best part! I can definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Party in courtyard was very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Vacation_Boi
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me start off by saying that overall we were very happy with the hotel. The location was perfect, the rooms were very nice and the staff was excellent. There were a couple of problems getting water and there was a sewer smell coming from our bathroom, but for $70.00 a night we could put up with those minor issues. However our main concern we had was with the party that Sherri and Tony threw in the courtyard on our last night. We were aware that there was going to be a party several days in advance and we were assured that it was only going to be from 5-8pm. We also assumed that it was going to be more of a cocktail party, rather then the big drunk fest it turned out to be! The courtyard was so packed, we could barely get to our room and when we did get to it, our patio was full of people and we could hardly get inside, let alone hear ourselves inside the room. At that point we were not overly concerned, as it was only 7pm and we were going out for supper with some friends. When we returned at 10pm, there was no sign that the party was going to end anytime soon, even though we were assured it would be done at 8pm. We still were unable to hear ourselves talk in our room, not to mention the fact that it was our last night and we needed to catch a flight in the morning. All we wanted to do was enjoy our last night on our patio with a final drink, but that was impossible. Meantime, as we were trying to pack and get ready for bed, there was so much hollering and screaming outside that I finally went out to tell them to please be quite. I was quite shocked to see that it was Sherri and three of her friends outside my door. I was completely surprised at how intoxicated she was. I told them it was 10pm, and that they needed to move. However they only moved away a couple of feet and the party continued. I would also like to mention that Tony seemed to be much more intoxicated at that party then Sherri, as he was slurring his words halfway through the party. I never spoke to Tony directly, but the microphone he was speaking into made that quite evident. We decided that there was no way we were going to be able to sleep, so we went for a walk. When we got back around 11pm, most of the party was done and the noise was finally bearable. Another guest mentioned in a previous post that they had concerns about a bar being built in the courtyard, well those concerns are certainly valid. Tony mentioned that they plan on keeping the par open until around 10pm. The courtyard is not very big, so the bar will totally ruin any peaceful relaxation anyone might want during the evenings. The best part of this experience, was when were checking out. We looked at the bar and there were several bras hanging from the rafters. At that point I decided I would never go back to this hotel again. I think that Sherri and Tony owe and apology to all the guests who were staying at their hotel during this party. Don’t get me wrong, I love a good party like anyone else, but these types of parties should be held at your private residence, not your place of business. By paying to stay at Luna Blue, we were making it our home for a week. However Tony and Sheri ruined that by throwing a private party in our back yard. Btw the photo at [--] that shows Sherri with her shirt off goes to show the true level of professionalism you will find at Luna Blue. Very classy!!

Reviews.Title: “It's great”
Reviews.Author: evilwebqueen
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason I don't give them an excellent was that, through no fault of the establishment, we stayed three nights in a fabulous room and 4 nights in a standard room with no balcony/patio (room #1). As long as you don't stay in that room, it's great. Although room #1 was comfy, had two beds which we required and was immaculately clean. I feel that other less favorable reviews are by people who are expecting to go to Playa and stay in something akin to a US Holiday Inn. Get over it. It's a few short blocks from the beach, but from the best beach in Playa. Trust me, it's my sixth year there. We scoped out many other rooms while we there, anticipating our return trip, for which we will book well in advance, which was not the case on this stay. The neighborhood is excellent. It's not the Disneyworld that Fifth Ave. and say, 10th St., is. It's within walking distance of everything in Playa and has its own restaurants and bars that are charming. The garden provides a soothing atmosphere for hanging out on your patio/balcony in the evenings after you've worn yourself out on the beach. Free passes to Mamita's Beach Club are a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Once in a Blue Moon - and there will be another!”
Reviews.Author: DanishAce
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first ever week at LB and Playa. Like everyone else's reviews: owners, staff, location, value, peace n' quiet, etc. - all wonderful. If you want to escape reality, this is the place: no TV, phone, or papers. Just beautiful gardens and R&R. Kudos to the owners: They went above and beyond one morning as the water was out (pre-shower and post morning coffee), and Tony went around telling guests about the issue and that it would be back in 10 min - it was! Getting there: Wife and I added some extra adventure to our trip and took the ADO/ Riviera bus from the airport and back. Would recommend it: cheap ($8 pp each way) plus the $3 for the taxi from bus station to LB - still better cost (and comfort) than a small taxi. Leaves every hour. Beach club: Great! But if you want shade/umbrella, get there early. We got there around 9am after learning the laws of supply and demand. Were told Sundays are "Family Day" for locals, so they add to the beach demand - ergo, get there really early then. Rooms: We stayed in a superior level room, and would suggest at least that since the fridge and water bottle are a nice touch. Electric is same as US, so my wife brought her hair dryer. LB will be opening their bar in the next week or so (If there's one negative, it's our bad timing). It has swings as seats and a nice palapa overhead. It will be nice to relax with a cerveza after a long day at the beach, but hopefully allows guests to share more feedback and PdC secrets. Food: As other rookies will learn, this end of 5th Av is less crowded and less expensive than the other end, but those willing to venture beyond the tourist zone/traps will be pleasantly surprised. With LB's help we enjoyed the wonders of Mexican cuisine at better values: ask them about La Pesca and El Fogon. Several restaurants nearby too: Vagabunda and Mystic Cafe for breakfast, Fe and Quinta Pasion for cheap Mexican eats, and Babe's for your eclectic meal fix. Ah Cacao satisfies your choco cravings. As for supply and demand, LB is no longer a hidden gem, and we can imagine it will only get tougher to book our return trip(s) - a small price to pay for the perfect escape. Enjoy your stay. As for us, it's back to reality.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: CanadaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We will never recommend the Luna Blue Hotel. We stayed ther from February 8 to February 15. Let me make one thing clear from the start. The initial problem we had was my mistake. Twenty-four days before our arrival at the Luna Blue I emailed Sheri to cancel the last two days of our reservation. She said that was not possible because I missed the 30 cancellation deadline. I asked if she could make an exception. She said that was not possible “We simply have to abide by the policies we have established in order to make our business run efficiently.” I asked if she could rent the room for the two nights: “Frankly, it’s doubtful. We will try, of course, but our hotel is not a “walk in” type of hotel.” I asked if I could try and find some guests on tripadvisor and she said: “we would ask that you don’t place your own ad on tripadvisor .We have a very specific arrangement for specific bookings of the hotel with another company through the internet, and that might cause us some problems.” That same day, to my relief, I got a new reservation for 7 days. I emailed back saying: “Hi, I am very thankful and relieved that you have chosen not to penalize me for my mistake. I was hoping that you would be able to rent the room but I see that your have gone one step further and have updated my reservation. I was feeling terrible about my mistake which was obviously affecting our excitement about our trip. Now that has changed. Thank you for your flexibility.” That relief and gratitude dissolved when we got to Luna Blue and were still charged for 9 nights. When I mentioned to Sheri there must be a misunderstanding, she said no, there was no misunderstanding. When I referred her to my email in which I thanked her for not charging us, she said she was “too busy” that day to answer me to clarify the situation and was “sorry”. I was dumfounded, I was speechless, at this flagrant lack of straightforwardness. Since our arrival back in Canada, I have emailed to ask if she has been able to rent the room. That email too has gone unanswered. I guess she has been “too busy” to answer. I prefaced my comments by saying this problem was my mistake. Yes it was. My husband and I have travelled extensively and do not have lofty expectations. We are respectful and we expect to be treated with respect and forthrightness. So, a note of caution, at the Luna Blue, they simply have to abide by policies they have established to make their business run efficiently. Make sure you are aware of the "policies".

Reviews.Title: “Great little Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: maryhochda
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a short but great trip to the Luna Blue. We stayed there from Feb. 12-14. We are more the AI type but since it was such a short, last minute trip we decided to try the Luna Blue because of the high ratings on TripAdvisor. We were lucky enough to get the last room when we booked five weeks ago. Our room was the standard room, very small but still great. When we entered there was a slight musty smell that went away as soon as we ran the air, it is near the beach afterall. The room looked like it was recently renovated with a new, quiet air conditioner, new rustic furniture, paint, bathroom countertops, and alarm clock. Our room didn't have a kitchenette like the higher priced rooms but we didn't need one either. Posters are right about the soap not lathering well, but honestly the only reason I tried it is because of the posts I've read. I always bring my own stuff from home and never like hotel soap, even the best stuff at the Four Seasons and the Wynn! The room was very clean and had a nice charm to it. I have to disagree with one of the earlier posts on the statement that the hotel was like a motel 6 or something to that affect. The room was great and the grounds were beautiful. The bar and spa were still under construction but I'm sure they are going to be awesome when finished. Just like everyone has said, the owners were very friendly and helpful. They reccommended a seafood restaurant called La Pesca? that was awesome, same for a breakfast place that is called something Chuenga? Ask for the breakfast place that has Monkey in the name. They had the best fresh squeezed watermelon juice! same for the yogurt with fruit and granola! Needless to say we had a great time in Playa and slept great at the little Luna Blue hotel. If you want a nice, clean place to sleep that's close to the beach then this is the place for you. If you want to be waited on hand and foot it's probably not the place to go. But then again, we were waited on hand and foot at the Mamitas beach club, part of what comes with your room price at the Luna Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Economical & Convienent”
Reviews.Author: Snetz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue Feb 3rd thru Feb 9th in a tree top terrace room and found the owners & staff very helpful and knowledgeable. The other guests were extremely friendly and fun to visit with. The room itself was very nice, the grounds very tropical and extremely private. We have stayed at an all inclusive the past few years (at 3 to 4 times the cost) and after staying here, wished we would have tried this before. Everything is so close and within easy walking distance, most folks couldnt ask for more. While Tony & Cheri went out of their way to provide suggestions as to restaurants, we found that most restaurants close to the Luna Blue were very satisfactory. We really enjoyed the short walk each day to Mamitas beach club and the complimentary chairs and umbrella there (provided by Luna Blue) We also took advantage of the little laundry and mini mart across from the Luna Blue which was very cheap and handy. My wife had the need to see a doctor during our visit, and wouldnt you know it ........there was an american speaking doctor right around the corner from the hotel. Toni & Cheri are in the process of building a small bar and hopefully this wont distract from the quiet special type of ambience of their hotel. Unless you were born with a silver spoon in your mouth, you will be very satisfied (as we were) staying at this nice little hotel. Jim/Lynn, Appleton, WI

Reviews.Title: “Hola, Luna Blue; we'll be back; gracias!”
Reviews.Author: jkish
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Luna Blue before moving to the Fairmount Mayakoba to attend a company-sponsored trip. We loved both hotels. The Luna Blue is a small, garden hotel with very comfortable accommodations. It's a place to slow down and enjoy the surroundings--beautiful, lush garden--greenery everywhere. No TV or fancy electronics; the Luna Blue is a very quiet, extremely clean, cozy hotel. Listen to early morning rain drops as you rest in a hammock on the private porch outside your room--heavenly! We loved the Luna Blue and will return. It's in the north part of Playa Del Carmen--quieter, more upscale with many great restaurantas and shops. Our only regret is that we didn't get a chance to spend time with the owners. We've read so many nice comments about them; and being Americans ourselves, it would have been nice to chat. However, we packed so much into our days/evenings that our schedules didn't connect. So, of course, we'll have to return to do just that. What's not to love about Playa Del Carmen and the Luna Blue?

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay - Objective Review”
Reviews.Author: ghdame
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luna Blue from 1/16/06 - 1/23/07 after reading numerous positive and glowing reviews on Trip Advisor. After staying for a week, I would like to relay my experience as objectively as possible, and let you, the reader decide whether it will be a positive experience for you. I rated this as "Okay, but some problems" for the reasons discussed below. Of course, if you do not see the answer to your question here, please email me at work and I will most likely be able to respond immediately if not by the next day (gdame@deflaw.com). 1) Cost of the Room: This hotel seems reasonably priced compared to other similar hotels if you are staying in a deluxe suite. I stayed in a standard room for $72 per night including taxes/fees/refrigerator, and note that it had the same amenities as another hotel we stayed at for $40 total (posada d’Margo). The hot water did not work unless we turned on the sink and then it only worked sporadically, it had A/C, a clock radio, safe, and a ceiling fan. The only thing that stands out is the fact that it had scented toilet paper. The room was, however, located in a safe, secure location with a tropical setting. You could barely hear the traffic or the other residents. The bottom line is this: if you are willing to pay a bit more to feel safe and secure, you should consider this hotel. If you have been to Playa before and are more willing to experiment for a better deal, try the Posada D’Margo or some place else (I have a few more suggestions if you are interested in apartment/condos with full kitchenettes). 2) Location: The hotel is 5 blocks from the beach and about a mile from where you can catch the collectivos and buses for traveling around. If you plan on taking day trips, and do not rent a car, this hotel may not be for you as it is quite a hassle traveling to the other end of town. I have more on this depending on your situation. The bottom line: It is not an ideal location for either beach or traveling, as it is far enough away from both to be a bit of a pain. 3) Service: The owners of this hotel are American and were able to direct us to a beautiful beach in Tulum, as well as some great, and cheap, Mexican restaurants. Their suggestion for car rental, however, left me paying too much, with back strain from having to lift the car to replace a tire, and unsatisfied. In fact, I strongly suggested that they re-evaluate their referral to CP Rentals, but doubt that they will despite the fact that they owner said he would "seriously look into it." I say that I doubt they will because I was also told that a plumber would be out to my room, which never happened, and I was told $45/day for a car was a fabulous deal until I complained, and then was given a look front desk receptionist like I had paid too much (which was the truth). Regardless, just in case they are still referring CP Rentals, please save yourself time and money and go to ---.com (there is an internet café 1 block away that will let you get on for $.60 for 15 minutes), get a brand new car for $11/day, and save yourself from having to drive a 1970s Beetle with no AC, power steering, radio, and side view mirror. Better yet, get a car from the airport. If you plan on traveling, a car is necessary and is just as expensive as picking up the collectivo when it is all said and done. Parking is not an issue. My review would have been neutral had my hot water worked, or had a plumber actually come out, and had the hotel either not referred CP rentals, or agreed not to refer them again in the future. They also did not offer to pay for all or a portion of the rental (which would have been going above and beyond, but for $45 would have said a lot about their service - however, they did not make that effort).

Reviews.Title: “incredibly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: JackiMaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Luna Blue for 11 nights and we loved it. The room had a kitchen and a balcony and was quiet, clean and very livable. The staff was extremely helpful in finding great restaurants and tips for sightseeing. The hotel is a few blocks from the beach and we spent many hours at the beachclub enjoying the included chairs and palapa. The owners are American and obviously love being in Playa and sharing their knowledge of the area with guests. They are adding a bar and a sitting area and it should add to the ambiance. We really needed a break from home and the Luna Blue was just perfect for us. If you want a small hotel that is well located, quiet, pretty setting and friendly, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “We love Luna Blue!!”
Reviews.Author: T0mmygurl
Reviews.Content: My family & I spent a week at The Luna Blue over Christmas. This was our first stay at a non-AI hotel....& it was incredible! We now cannot imagine staying anywhere else! The hotel is absolutely charming. The front desk & housekeeping staff are by far the most helpful & friendly staff we have met in all our travels. We had a kitchenette room that was fully equipped with everything we needed.....even a blender!:) The A/C is remote controlled & keeps the room nice & cool...Our room was quiet & very clean & the bed was the most comfortable we have slept on. We had a very nice sitting area with a hammock & we spent many evenings relaxing out there....They also have wireless internet which is great. The gates are locked at 10pm (don't worry you get a key) & there is a night watchman on all night....very safe! The gardens are absolutely beautiful....you have to see them to appreciate their beauty..... The Luna Blue is just a minute walk to 5th Avenue & many many restaurants, shopping & bars. As well it is a short walk to the beach....Mamitas Beach Club passes are included so you get a complimentary palapa & lounge chairs! The North End of Playa where the hotel is located is our favorite part of town. The main thing that sets Luna Blue apart from the rest are the owners Tony & Cheri. They are the nicest people you could meet! They are so genuinely concerned with making your visit to Luna Blue special. This was our first Christmas away from home & I have to say that the warmth & hospitality we felt at Luna Blue made us feel right at home! Thank you Tony & Cheri & staff at Luna Blue!! We cannot wait to see you again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ken1912
Reviews.Content: From Dec 1 to Dec 10 we enjoyed our stay at this wonderful hotel. After years of staying at large all inclusive hotels in this area, we felt it was time to branch out and try something different and more exciting. The Luna Blue proved to be the perfect place to make this change. The room wasn't fancy or deluxe but we immediatly felt right at home. Our room was on the ground floor tucked away in the corner of their large tropical garden. The room was spotless. No TV and we never missed it. We had a kitchenette which we used every day for breakfast and lunch. We'd go to Mamita's beach Club in the morning, it's about 3 blocks away, and return when we were hungry for lunch. Loved the croissants and the avacados that we bought locally. Mamita's was fun too and the best part is that the Luna Blue provides daily passes for the sun chairs and a palapa. In the evening we would walk down the street and have dinner at one of the many retaurants in the area. Our favorites, Babes Noodle House and El Baretto just steps away. Try the shrimp!! Our room had 2 ceiling fans which seemed to do the job well. We seldom turned the air conditioning on. The room was cleaned daily and we never had a complaint. We made a few trips to Tulum to visit the wonderful, less crowded beaches there. The drive was about an hour long but it's worth the trip. This hotel is a lot more reasonable than the hotels on the beach in Tulum. The Luna Blue is owned by Tony and Cherie and they also make the experience enjoyable. Whenever we saw them they would stop and chat like we had been their best friends forever! This genuine, warm way of treating their customers was really appreciated and is also why we can hardly wait to go back next December.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: CNorman
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Luna Blue. Tony was very helpful with suggestions for places to eat, get coffee, whatever. If you like steak, ask him about the butcher place where all the locals go. He mentioned this to us, but we had a couple of vegetarians in the group - blah, but it sounded great - a nice steak, baked potato, and either soda or beer for around $7. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were always clean and really enjoyed the towel art. I'd give it 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jimmyjazz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over new year and the hotel is great. The rooms are a good size with big balconies, and all the staff are really friendly. If I had to say something negative I would say that the water pressure is quite poor. However, it's still a great place to stay and the location is excellent, I would recommend people to go.

Reviews.Title: “Love this quaint hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AmyWestHollywood
Reviews.Content: I have been to Playa del Carmen on three occasions, always staying at various places. I will now stay only at Luna Blue Hotel (in this price category), which serves not only as a place to rest your head, but a home away from home. The entire hotel is very clean, simple, organized and the staff is very helpful. The hotel is at close proximity to the beach, and we loved going to the Mamitas beach club every day. It is located in a very safe neighborhood, with wonderful shops and restaurants nearby. Mostly, I appreciated the friendly staff - the owners are WONDERFUL, Jaime, and even the housekeeping, they make you feel at home. The owners also have great suggestions of restaurants to try, and even helped us book a car. I will certainly return to this cozy, beautiful, lush hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get enough of you LUNA BLUE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mand06
Reviews.Content: A FANTASTIC little gem in an amazing place.. although initially hesitant about a standard room in a hotel that seemed to be charging half the price of all others in Playa over the New Years period, we shouldn't have been concerned. When we first arrived and saw no TV there were raised eyebrows but to be honest you don't need it as there is just so much to do in Playa that by the time you get back to the room you just want to go to bed! The hotel is pretty much bare bones. Just 18 rooms, no bar (though one is coming in 2007 we were told), no restaurant (but plenty a few metres away!) but what makes it so wonderful is that it is small (it doesn't take 10 mins to walk from your room to the main lobby like in most resorts), Gennaro and Jimmy at the front desk are extremely helpful and the towel animals from the maids are WOW WOW WOW but the best part of the hotel are the owners Tony and Cherie. Staying at Luna Blue is like staying at their house. They create a laid back welcoming feeling as soon as you arrive, which lasts throughout your stay. They take the time to find out how your day was and are full bottle on all to do and see. Ask Tony to point out the best beach in the Caribbean (it is amazing)! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rebalou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Blue for one week, 12-22 - 12/29, and we had a great time! The superior room was clean and cozy. The staff was friendly, the location was perfect (not too close to any loud nightclubs) but right off of 5th Ave. where there are many restaurants to choose from for breakfast , lunch, or dinner. The complimentary use of the Mamitas Beach Club was also nice, otherwise, the only way to get the use of an actual beach chair in Playa is by paying to use one at a beach club. Mamitas was only a 5 minute walk away. We will definately stay here again on any future trips to Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep and more!!”
Reviews.Author: carlos4040
Reviews.Content: After spending several months in Playa del Carmen and in various hotels there -- I can comfortably say that I need to look no further for hotel accommodations when in Playa Del Carmen. This place is it!! Every room I have stayed in (I've been a guest a few times) was very well presented, clean and with a very comfortable bed & pillows. The bath towels smelled fresh and were soft (unlike many old, 'sand-paper' like towels i've had in other hotels). the sundeck (upstairs; available to all guests) is a wonderful retreat from the crowded beaches and an ideal place to lounge with a great book. Beach chairs, shade and hammock provided. I also enjoyed that all rooms look onto a open-aired central garden area--offering a tropical array of plants and allowed for pleasant interactions with other hotel guests (great not to have your typical stale hotel hallways). the location of the hotel is well situated away from the noise on popular 5th AVE (half block away) yet still conveniently located near many great restaurants (Quinta Passion), coffee shop (Cafe Corazon) and bars (all in a 3 block radius of hotel). its proximity to Mamitas Beach club (5 min walk) is also a great advantage. The Staff....WOW!! They were all extremely friendly and full of advice on where to eat, shop or where to go on day trips (Tulum and playa El Paraiso). i was very impressed with their knowledge of the region. Furthermore I appreciated that they didn't steer me towards the "touristy" restaurants; instead towards smaller establishments that offer a delicous meal and a more unique dining experience. all in all - a very HIGHLY RECOMMENDED hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Cosy during Rain”
Reviews.Author: Biorntraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luna Blue for one week. Unfortunately, it rained heavily for over half this time. However, we had lots of books and were comfy in the large room which had complete cooking facilities and purified water. We enjoyed the small balcony and hammock. The hotel is very close to a huge Mexican supermercado. The noise on Saturday night from a nearby party was pretty bad but that's to be expected. Tony and Cheri patiently gave us great restaurant suggestions and answered all questions. The only improvement I can suggest is for another mirror in the room, as with several females staying together, the bathroom mirror is not enough. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and would certainly stay there again. Also, Tony arranged our transportation from and to the airport. Thanks Cheri and Tony for being informative hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place Revisited”
Reviews.Author: AlandLouann
Reviews.Content: This review is long over due. My wife and I stayed at the Luna Blue for the first time last May and what a difference a hotel can make when it is run by such wonderful and friendly people like Tony and Cheri. That trip was about our 20th visit to Playa so we feel we can speak from experience. In fact, we enjoyed our stay at the Luna Blue so much we took a chance and booked the entire hotel in October. We went home and told our friends about this little gem in paradise and in no time we had 34 travelers to fill all the rooms.. This group was a mixed bunch of people, some had been to Playa before but stayed at All Inclusives, some had stayed at big resorts as well as small hotels and for some it was their first time to Mexico. It came as no surprise to us that everyone of our group was smitten with the Luna Blue, Tony and Cheri and the entire staff. They bent over backwards to accomodate our group's every need. They even tried to build a palapa bar and get a provisional liquor license so our group would have a place sit and visit and enjoy a cocktail or two. They worked very hard on this but due to local red tape they were not allowed the provisional license. What other hotel would actually try to build a bar for a group of guests? This is what is so amazing about this friendly place. Without a doubt all of our friends who stayed that week with us will be return guests. We will be returning for our 3rd visit along with two other couples in a few weeks (Jan28th) who will be staying here for their first time but I am sure not their last. Haveing traveled extensively in Mexico I do not rate a hotel a 5 Star because the water pressure in the shower is amazing or that your shoes are polished for you each day or someone fetches you a drink with a flower in it. I consider a hotel to be a 5 Star when you are greeted and treated as long time friends, when your room is clean, when the atmosphere provided by your hosts takes you away from the real world and enables you to truely live the Mexican and Caribbean way of life for a few short days. For the same price as a dingy budget hotel in the States you will be enjoying what a true 5 Star experience should be. So put on your flip flops and flowered shirt and let Tony and Cheri and the good folks at the Luna Blue show you the real Playa del Carmen. The best part is that with all the money you save not going to an All Inclusive you can stay an extra week at the Luna Blue, eat and drink at all the cool places Tony recommends and still have money left over to put on your next trip to the Luna Blue. Take my word for it , once you stay at the Luna Blue you will be back. Thank you Tony and Cheri for all the hard work getting ready for our group. See you in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Woo Hoo Luna Blue (Times Two!)”
Reviews.Author: Cuffedlinks
Reviews.Content: We stayed once again at the Luna Blue December 1st through the 11th, and the Luna Blue - in our opinion - only keeps getting better and better. On our previous stay, it was just a few months post-Wilma when we stayed in Playa Del Carmen last January. I'm happy to say that the lushness of the Riviera Maya area is back, and the Luna Blue is no exception. The Garden Courtyard area looks fabulous. The new waterfall area adds a nice touch to the look and sound of the hotel. The finishing touches and improvements to this 18-room hotel continue. We stayed in an upper balcony room, #34 and the new remotely controlled AC unit was nearly noiseless, you could set the degree temperature you would like plus it has a timer. Nice touch. And, once again our rooms were kept spotless the entire stay. The staff of the Luna Blue is incredibly friendly, helpful and capable. As the weather did not exactly cooperate with our plans, we ended up spending quite a bit of time relaxing on our balcony listening to the rain, reading (my wife read 7 books in 10 days), doing crossword puzzles and surfing the Internet. To this - I would like to say "Thank You" to the Luna Blue for making WiFi access available. Both in our room and on the balcony the signal was more than capable to keep a steady connection - good for checking your Fantasy Football scores, e-mails, catching up on the news of the world or back home etc. There is a new addition to the hotel's amenities coming soon, an on-site palapa bar complete with the most beautiful hardwood bar and soon-to-be installed (if not already) swing seats. The owner, Tony, said his desire is for this to be a nice romantic retreat on-site for an evening's nitecap, or whatever. It SURE would have come in handy on some of those rainy days and nights so that we wouldn't have had to make our way out in the driving rain for a quick adult beverage. And with the lighting of the Courtyard and the sounds and lighting of the waterfall - we can imagine how perfect this place will be on our next visit. Again - passes to the nearby beach club were available and the hotel was gated and guarded and locked tight each night at 10 if that sort of thing is an important thing to note (A key is provided for entry and egress by the wooden gate at night). Playa Del Carmen is a growing, vibrant community that has both an exciting and relaxing vibe to it co-existing simultaneously - and the north end of Playa is our favorite. Thanks once again to the Luna Blue! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue Yahoo!”
Reviews.Author: lakd
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) stayed at Luna Blue for three nights starting Dec 1 2006. What a great hotel. Our rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff and management were terrific. Their dinner suggestions were terrific too. They wen't the extra mile to make our stay enjoyable. It's a short walk to the ocean, but the hotel has made arrangements to include chairs and umbrella in their daily rate with a beach club that's right on one of the nicest stretches of beach in the area. We woul d certainly love to return to Luna Blue in the future and highky recommmend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but noisy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Tartanhabit
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of nights and it is a lovely place but the experience was a bit of a mixed bag for us. We stayed in the treetop room and it was spotlessly clean and a great size. The shower has a major problem in that it was a mere dribble. Worst shower I've ever experienced and a really long wait for any hot water to come through. (That part wasn't the problem, the dribble was though). The garden is really attractive and there's a nice atmosphere there. As quiet as the hotel is though, the close by neighborhood is not. It's just a half block to 5th Avenue and although there were fewer people out and about in this area, the bars/restaurants still play really loud music that does reach the hotel. Even my husband asked for ear plugs. A great place, near a nice beach and the fun of 5th Avenue, but not for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “The Charming Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: vashon76
Reviews.Content: The Luna Blue exceeded our expectations. What a great value in the "up and coming" Playa Del Carmen. Beautiful setting, clean, simple rooms, great downtown location, and the use of the beautiful beach club "Mamita's". The owners, and staff are personable and will give you the best tips for dining, day trips or for whatever else suits your fancy. We plan on another vacation there very soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Beachluver2
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great little place to stay in the "Little Italy" part of Playa Del Carmen, then this is the place for you. It's not on the beach, as others have stated, but this really was not a problem. We had the Treetop tarrace with the big patio and enjoyed our time out and in the room very much. The freedom to try different restrants in the area was a major plus. We will never go to an A.I. again. The owners wil make you feel at home, and the rooms are just right for the price. You really can't go wrong with this little gem in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy garden hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichiruK
Reviews.Content: We stayed Luna Blue from 21st to 27th Sep. Other reviewers says how wonderful this hotel is, I couldn't agree more. So I'll just show you the details of the room we stayed. Our room(superior) which is on the 2nd floor and is in front of the garden, is very clean and has enough space to put our baggage. Inside this room, there was a double bed, a small refrigerator, a water tank and a safety-deposit box. In addtion, there's a confortable balcony which is facing their garden! I really enjoyed reading a book at this balcony, when I wake up too early. Because of the jet lag, I wake up at 5 or 6 a.m. And maybe because of this garden, we were never bothered from the noise from the street. There's a small store and laundry in front of the hotel, large super market (10 minutes walk) and many restaurants on 5th ave. The hotel is not located on the beach front, but don't worry. There's a beach club where you can get 5 minutes walk and you can use their palapa and beach chairs free! We spend a great vacation at this hotel, we really thank Toni, Cheri, and especially the man who stays at daytime at the front desk. He gave me some useful information and explained in plain language (we're not fluent in English). One regrettable thing is that a half of the garden is under the construction. (but we were never bothered from the construction noise) I think this construction is to make a garden patio or something like the place where the guests can share their experiences of travel and useful information. If I stayed after this was finished, I could enjoy a chat with other guests/staffs in a relaxing atmosphere... If you're looking for an inexpensive hotel where you can really relax, Luna Blue is the best place to choose.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: bunnnitos
Reviews.Content: We loved Luna Blue and we loved Playa! We had an excellent experience with our stay at the hotel, received wonderful suggestions from the concierge for places to eat (the authentic stuff!), and the facilities at Mamitas Beach Club were perfect. Not to be confused with a 5 star hotel, Luna Blue is a great "Mom and Pop" type place that is just the ticket. If you want to be pampered and are persnickity and high maintenance, you may want to consider one of those soul-less, all inclusive resorts, which also carry a pricetag twice the one at Luna Blue. This is the kind of place that has a kitten that hangs out near the front desk, is all smiles, with fresh towels laid out in interesting shapes every day. We reserved room #7, one of the recently renovated deluxe rooms equipped with a full kitchen, pots and pans, a coffee machine (even though we brought our own stove-top one just in case), dining area, a double bed and a twin bed (with a trundle second twin beneath). We used the extra twin as a couch and bought supplies across the street at the little market, milk for our coffee and cereal, etc. There was also a big jug of filtered water in the room, and I was happy not to have a television, vacations are intended to be just that! We used our FM transmitter on our Ipods to use the little clock radio as a stereo, perfect! The decor was simple, relaxed, and comfortable. I sleep on a 4" memory foam mattress topper at home so of course the beds were a bit firm for me, but I was not uncomfortable one bit. Slept like a baby. We didn't have any problems with the noise our AC made at all, either. We were glad to have it. We also loved the porches each unit has, an area with two chairs and a table in the veranda outside their front door, as well as a hammock. And it made me feel safe having gated entry at night, definitely a thoughtful bonus, though I don't consider Playa dangerous. We did not have a hair dryer in the room (which some reviewers have griped about), and as a daily user of one at home, with that heat, seriously, who wants to use a hair dryer? We didn't have any insect problems to speak of, either. People on this site complain about lizards and ants and stuff like that, and it's like, have you never gone to a tropical climate before? These things come with the territory of travel. They're expected. We did not have any of these things in our room, but we were so happy to see them in the wild. A nice change from the cement and roaches of NYC. :) The food in Playa is very affordable. We loved the places the people at the desk suggested. We did not love the touristy places listed in Fodors, they were twice as expensive and often not as good. There's this teeny tiny bar on 5th ave right around the corner to the left with four tables outside that is amazing. We hung there with the locals at night, the type of place that encourages strangers to sit together and talk. And breakfast there, I got two ham and cheese croissants, fresh squeezed honeydew juice, and an americano coffee for about $3.50 total. And it was delicious. Definitely our favorite place, young and hip. Also, ask concierge about the restaurant north on 5th ave (you turn right at this rotary, it's a bit desolate up there), this place was magical, dogs and cats meandering through, a central pond and a waterfall in the bathroom. The peanut chicken was to die for. Mamitas Beach Club was perfect. We loved having their restaurant right on the beach so we could have lunch without much effort. It was definitely affordable, though slightly more expensive, think $1.50 for a coke, maybe $6 or $7 for burger and fries. The setup Luna Blue has with them is great. You get an "umbrella" which is a cool thatched permanent umbrella, and enough beach chairs for your party, every day. We would make our way to the beach about 10AM daily and we always found a good spot. We would stay on the beach after lunch until about 4 when we would head back to the hotel for siesta, then after dusk head out for dinner when it was starting to cool. After that, drinks and shopping. Most of the shops on 5th Ave (which btw was way longer and cooler than I expected) stay open really late. It's much nicer shopping in the night air than midday. Sadly Tony and Cheri were out of town while we were staying there, but they were so great and helpful in the process of us choosing a room and making reservations and even followed up on email after we got home to the states and they were back in Mexico. My amazingly handsome and all around awesome boyfriend and I had the most wonderful trip to Playa, thanks in part to Luna Blue. Oh and P.S., we went over Labor Day and it was very, very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: LASeekingSunshine
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue is a charming little cluster of rooms (separated in three buildings which have two to three levels) surrounding a beautiful, lush green garden. The rooms have character but are simple -- no TVs, no minifridge, no radios -- but that's the whole point of this little getaway. Don't expect roomservice, although the staff are extremely helpful and attentive -- Carlos even will take you around town to his favorite spots! All the rooms have balconies or patios. We stayed there for 8 days from the end of August through the beginning of September 2006 and couldn't have stayed at a better place for the price. Remember, this is not the Ritz but there is real value. You get daily passes for umbrellas and lunge chairs at Mamitas beach club -- a few block drive -- which is in a great part of the beach. The evening we arrived, Tony and Cheri were on their way out of the country for a week yet they managed to spend over a half hour with us sharing info about what to do, places to snorkle and restaurants to try. Tony was RIGHT ON about the butcher shop that serves the best steaks you've ever had for lunch although a a few other places he suggested were a little to touristy for us -- of course we just left --however, I'm sure they would be great places for others. The snorkeling spots were jewels and we probably wouldn't have ended up there without his direction. Overall we found experience peaceful and well worth it -- we hope to go back yearly. Playa itself is amazing and Luna Blue is located in a great part of the tourist sector.

Reviews.Title: “Great owners, great value”
Reviews.Author: Julie A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel from Sep. 21-24. The owners were at the front desk when we arrived (late evening), and as this was our fourth trip to PDC in 4 years, it was refreshing to have American owners greet us. They gave us several restaurant recommendations, which we asked for. We stayed in the treetop room, which was very basic in appearance inside. Only suggested improvement would be the mattress pads (which a previous response says they are acquiring), and perhaps some nicer bed linens, but that is just personal (and somewhat nit-picky) preference. The room had a mini fridge, which is great for beer, wine, etc. The outside patio with palapa roof and chairs was AWESOME. Every night, my husband and I would have a nightcap out there, and it was our favorite part of our room. The rest of the hotel grounds/garden were very nice. They had just finished the waterfall feature on the lower level where a Jacuzzi is going to go. The 'hole' referred to in the previous review is not actually a hole. It is the way the grounds are shaped - kind of cut deeply into the rock, which slopes below street level. There is a wooden platform down there for the upcoming Jacuzzi (lack of appropriate workmen/installers have apparently delayed this project, but it is just THAT way in Mexico), and near the check-in area, they were finishing what looked like a plumbing installation for a bar they are installing. But that is the only area that is 'under construction' and that term barely even applies. We never had any bug problems while we were there, and it rained several times. All in all, this is a GREAT value. It is not an ideal choice for someone who is expecting fancy room service or chocolates on their pillows, but personally, we don't go PDC to hang out in our room - we go for the beach, restaurants and beautiful outdoor environment. If you want a hotel that includes nice, basic accommodations, owners who speak your language and can send you in the right directions, and free day passes for the beach club ALL for under $80 a night, this is the place for you. Places we have stayed before: Iberstar Quetzal, Mosquito Blue, Villas Sacbe Condominiums.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Luna Blue”
Reviews.Author: presidiobabe
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about what a wonderful time I had in Playa Del Carmen at the Luna Blue Hotel. The hotel was in an excellent location within a very short walk to the best beach in town and close to countless great places to eat. The room I stayed in was very clean, spacious, and comfortable and the attached kitchen was a nice bonus. The most exceptional part of my stay was the extremely helpful and accomodating staff. The owners Tony and Cheri were so welcoming and helpful in giving tips to the best places to visit in Playa. Overall I had an incredible time in Playa Del Carmen largely due to my stay at Luna Blue and the incredible customer service from the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: IAH
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Luna Blue in May of 2006 with several friends. This was my second stay (first one in Feb 2006) and like the first time I found Luna Blue is consistent in cleanliness, comfort and charm! The owners Tony and Cheri make you feel welcome from the minute you check in! The rooms are very spacious (several different types and sizes depending on your needs). I found the beds to be very comfortable, as most beds in mexico can be on the hard side, these were not! The rooms are ALWAYS clean and the air con works great! My room in May was a kitchen suite with a huge table and 4 chairs, fridge, bottled water and a coffee maker. A nice feature when you want to have your morning coffee outside of your room sitting on your patio contemplating your day! the grounds at Luna Blue are probably the best I have seen in Playa for a samll hotel. Plam trees, banana plants, flowers....beautiful! Another bonus with staying at Luna blue is that you get beach passes to Mamitas Beach club for use of lounge chairs and palapas. Luna blue also provides beach towels for your use which is a major plus so you don't have to bring your own from home or buy one. Location, location, location! Luna Blue is located on the north part of 5th Ave. in the very charming part of town called "Little Italy" where you will find several lovely cafes and resturants, all within a few minutes walking distance. I would not hesitate recommending Luna Blue to anyone who is looking for a very affordable, clean, comfortable, charming, well run hotel in Playa whos owners will stop at nothing to make your stay the best part of your Playa experience!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line”
Reviews.Author: Popeyeiam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lil place in June-just a long weekend away. We are no newcomers to Playa del Carmen, been visiting several times a year since 1987. I'd watched as the old place took on a new character and had read some fabulous things about new owners and thought I'd give them a try. Reasonable rates and we lucked out getting the roof-top terrace room #9. The "love -nest" they call it. Had all the help we needed with our luggage to the top too! Beautiful, clean, a view to "die-for" and privacy. The owners were away that particular weekend so I don't know if the staff was on their "better than average" behavior but if that kind of treatment is the norm, you'll not only be treated like royalty but most likely make a friend for life as we did with Genaro, the day-time desk clerk. We now will be booking all our trips to Playa at the Luna Blue, we've found a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great charming hotel with awesome owners!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelhouston
Reviews.Content: I had spent some time at Luna Blue during February 2006 as I had friends that were staying there. So, when I returned in June this year we booked the Love Nest and one of the kitchenette rooms. Both rooms were great!!! This hotel is set in a beautiful garden area and close to the north beaches (which are my favorite). Tony and Cheri are awesome owners. They really seem to care about their guests. They made us feel very welcome. They have done a fabulous job with this charming smaller property. I highly recommend staying at Luna Blue!!! Matter of fact, I already am booked for another stay in November there.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue is great!”
Reviews.Author: schpidah
Reviews.Content: This is the cutest hotel! It's a beautiful jungle oasis on the northern end of PDC. The hotel is right off 5th Avenue (so it's nice and quiet) but extremely close to the action...it's an easy walk to all of the shops and restaurants, and the beach. Staying at the hotel gives you access to the beach club's chairs and umbrellas. (Though the club advertises that there's a pool, be aware that it's pretty much just a small kiddy pool.) Tony and Cheri were wonderful and took care of every detail personally. They had excellent recommendations on where to eat (HC Monteray has the best steak I've ever tasted - we went 2 days in a row!), things to do, and how to get there. Everyone on the staff is lovely and helpful. My husband and I stayed in a Superior room...all rooms had a little patio out front, great for sipping wine and reading in the afternoon/evening (but bring bug spray!) The beds were firmer than I thought I'd like, but I slept great! I wish we had more time there! A great find! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Bug Infested and Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: TuckerFamily
Reviews.Content: 1. This hotel has a bad problem with biting insects. We are guessing this is because they have dug a big hole in their grounds in preparation for a swimming pool. Unfortunately we think this big hole is collecting standing water and acting as a breeding ground for insects. Depending on weather conditions these insects are affecting some of the rooms quite badly. 2. The hotel owners are very defensive about their problem with biting insects and if you complain you are treated unprofessionally. Here is a detailed timeline of our short and unhappy stay at the Luna Blue. We booked online for 4 nights at the Luna Blue to celebrate our fourth year anniversary after reading the glowing reviews on tripadvisor. Afternoon 7/6: We arrived and had a pleasant and speedy check-in. The room we had, number 21, was dark, but otherwise OK. It was a Kitchenette suite. The main improvements I would suggest would be some draws to store clothes. We were hungry and headed out to find some lunch. We asked Cheri for some suggestions which she kindly gave us and for which we thanked her. Early Evening 7/6: I was using my laptop out in the lobby (the wireless didn't work in our room) and was struck by just how many insects there were. As a result my husband and I took great care to shut the door quickly when coming in and out our room because we were scared of the insects getting in. I was perturbed that I was catching mosquitos in the bathroom but I congratulated myself after killing the visible ones. We headed out for dinner and drinks. Nightime 7/6: After dinner we returned to the hotel and found the nighttime hotel attendant dealing with irate guests who were complaining about a mosquito explosion in their room. We went to sleep or at least tried to but it was very hard as we kept on being bitten. We didn't sleep much sadly. Morning 7/7: We awoke to find insect sized blood marks on the sheet. I told my husband that I didn't think I could stay in our room any longer. We made a plan whereby he would find out if we could swop to a higher-up room away from the standing water or get a refund for our prepaid nights, while I scoped out the area to find out if there were alternative hotels where the insect problem was less severe. The owners arrived after my husband had waited for an hour in the lobby, being told that they were "just coming" and were "two blocks away". They were scornful and dismissive, and attributed our problems to our not understanding the nature of a rainy season. Tony initially offered to move us to a higher-up room, and told us that no other guests had had problems. My husband mentioned the other guests we had heard complaining, and Tony told him that, as the other guests had not checked out, there was no evidence of there being a problem. My husband suggested that this might not be conclusive evidence that there was not a problem. Tony then withdrew the offer of an alternate room in pique, and said that we could either remain where we were or leave without being refunded for our remaining nights' stay that we had prepaid. (My husband also mentioned that I was out looking at other hotels to evaluate whether they had such bad insect problems. The owners of the Luna Blue disliked this as evidence of customer disloyalty. My husband also mentioned that he thought the hotels near the beach might have less of a problem with insects because of the ocean breezes. At no point did he say that we wanted a room on the beach as the management (may) claim below, only that we wanted a room free of a biting insect problem. We had afterall happily booked into a hotel which we knew was not on the beach and paid for four nights - hardly the actions of people who did not know their own minds about the location they wanted in Playa.) We left the hotel feeling very upset. Both that we had inadvertently booked into a place which treated their guests with such scorn and also a little upset that we lost \$270 in this manner for our prepaid but unused nights. I personally find it an unacceptable management action to make an offer of an alternate room and then capriciously withdraw it because they took a dislike to the guests. We checked into the Alhambra which was a lovely hotel. I don't know if it was the Ocean breezes or the lack of a breeding grounds for insects but I didn't see a single insect in my time there and I certainly didn't get bitten again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted and loved it”
Reviews.Author: #1seadawg
Reviews.Content: After 4 trips to Mexico and staying in AI's we decided to stay in town instead of catching a taxi every time we wanted to escape from the AI. Not to say that they are bad, just after a while you want to see what Mexico is really like. Luna Blue was just what we wanted in this adventure. Just off the main "drag" in PDC it is quite, but not boring, and secure! Any time we came and went there was allways some one to greet you (speaking english) and answer any question you may have...from food, beach, tour and even some shopping ideals. And at night access was thru a massive wooden door, which the key was suppiled at check in, along with your room key on a key chain that clipped on to a belt loop or whatever. The room was simple but covered everything we needed, a great bed (not the brick like AI's), ice box, bottled water, good A/C , fan and a view of the grounds from the patio to die for! Add on the free access to the beach club, towels and some beach toy's (boogie board, etc) it was great!!! Will be back as soon as we reload vacation time....back in Austin, TX for now.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic place”
Reviews.Author: ricciola
Reviews.Content: We came from Italy and stayed ten days (Aug 9th to 18th) at Luna Blue. Everything fullfilled our expectation. A very charming and quiet place, rooms well furnished, mattress comfortable (only item to note the AC too noisy). Very professional staff :both chamber maid,(room is perfectly cleaned up every morning )and door men( very nice guys too). Tony and Cherie ready to intervene for any minor trouble you should get (also for just a clarification with car rental dealer). Strongly suggestable also for very good ratio between quality and price. Giancarlo and Bruna

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks”
Reviews.Author: clkeating23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I headed down to Playa del Carmen based on a friend's recommendation. I came to trip advisor to find a place to stay, and after seeing the reviews on Luna Blue i thought this place must be too good to be true. Nope. The place rocks. It was so secluded. Each room has a private entrance. We stayed in one of the treetop terrace rooms (room #36) and the balcony was so great. It's super clean. It has a fridge/bottled water, great fans, wonderful air conditioning. My boyfriend's parents had a room with a kitchenette, which was great, as i was able to make tea at night if i wanted. Tony and Cheri were wonderful, as were all the staff. Friendly, but not overyly friendly to be phony or annoying. Helpful. All of that. We arranged car pick up to and from the airport through them, which was great. The location is great, too. I can't wait to go back. I look forward to enjoying the new bar when i return! I really can't say i've had a better vacation than this one. The town, the location, all so beautiful. The hotel just blended in so well with the feel of the town, that you really feel you are on vacation. I've been back for 5 days now, and i'm still on that vacation high. :) Highly Recommend! Christine & Rafael

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and the most amazing recommendations!!!”
Reviews.Author: ronan_sf
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a short (4 nights) but completely amazing stay at the Luna Blue Hotel. It was definetely one of the highlights of my trip around the Mexican Riveria. It was perfectly located just off the pedistrian heart of Playa del Carmen (where all the best bars and restaurants are located). We had a room on the first floor which was perfect, beautfully decorated and clean with all the amenities, such as AC and a perfect outdoor balcony for sipping cervazes and enjoying the garden courtyard. Of course the highlight for us was the people. Tony has to have been one of the most helpful hotel owner come concierge i have ever come across. His knowledge of the local restaurants and recommendations for things to do in the area, where the best....and really added to making this one awesome vacation. As a side note my girlfriend stayed at one of the 4-star inclusive hotels in Cancun the week before, and thought her stay at the Luna Hotel and Playa del Carmen was so much better! The only downside was no pool, but with free passes to the beach club which is very close by, that totally made up for it. Hope your stay is as awesome as ours was. Can't wait to go back!!! Ronan

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: happydally
Reviews.Content: I am writing this to say that I think some of the posts about Luna Blue are fabricated. My fiance and I went to Luna Blue to see if it would be a good place for people in our wedding party to stay this fall. Since it had such a high rating on tripadvisor I had high expectations, and was shocked to find that the location and hotel itself are nothing noteworthy and there are great places nearby that are just as good, for less. Don't think you are going to have the best stay of your life here. This is more on backpacker level than anything else. Wouldn't trust most of these posts.

Reviews.Title: “Not to clean”
Reviews.Author: july1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a budget hotel but I still expected it to be clean and free of bugs. We booked two rooms and in both there were little red ants in the bathrooms. Our room had a blood stain on the bed cover and when I asked for a new one. I was informed that they only had one per room? The air condiditoner controls were located above the rack to hang your close on. Which meant that you had to climb on something to adjust the controls. The refrigerator did not get very cold at all. So dont spend extra for that it is not worth it. The passes that they give you for the chairs and umbrella give you a discount and the service was ok but slow on getting you what you ordered. They offer beach towels for a deposit of $10.00 each which you get back when you check out. I would recommend buying one from the market at a cheaper rate. The owners are nice but I suggest that they put a little more money in additional sheets and comforters and some bug spray, and some more remote controls for the air conditioners or relocating them so you do not have to climb on something to adjust them. The maid service was very poor. Only thing I think was done was putting clean towls out and changing the trash. The sheets were not changed because my nephew left me a note on top of his bed and I did not find it till the bedspread was pulled back. I would not recommend this place to anyone, unless they don't mind these things. There are other nice budget hotels in the same area and alot cleaner if not for the same price or a few dollars higher.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful jungle setting in the midst of too trendy PDC”
Reviews.Author: GiaNYC
Reviews.Content: Overall, I really was not a big fan of PDC. Coming from Manhattan, I found it too trendy, too crowded, and too expensive----it was all things I was trying to take a vacation from!! Additionally, it was not typical of Mexico and Mexican culture, which is what we had wanted. Additiionally, I cannot help but notice the very exxagerated and obvious socioeconomic (and ethnic) divide in this town; something that left me very disconcerted. That being said, it was still a beautiful place. The beach was beautiful. Hated Mamita's beach club, but the beaches are beautiful and the waters are so blue and so warm! And Luna Blue was a quiet little piece of heaven. Had we stayed elsewhere, I may have written this trip off all together. Coming back to Luna Blue every nite was great. It's very rustic and you have to deal with things like ants in the room and tons of bug bites so this may not be for everyone. But for us, it was fine and just a very very beautiful place for a very affordable price. I had also arranged for a little engagement celebration suprise for my fiancee of chocolate and champagn, which Tony and Cheri happily set up for about $70. The room was waiting for us on our arrival and my fiancee was sooo suprised! It was great. By our 4th day in Luna Blue, we had walked the town a hundred times, eaten ourselves and drinken ourselves full and I was sick of PDC! Luckily, the next day we discovered collectivo trips to other places (went back to Akumal twice!!!) and this helped this to be a great trip. Had we been isolated to only PDC, I would have lost my mind, but seeing the ruins, meeting and talking with locals on teh collectivos and visiting Akumal (beautiful, quiet, serene), and yes even PDC in moderation, made this a pretty good trip. Not the best I've had, but still a fun time. I would love to stay in Luna Blue again, but I don't think I'll ever come back to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Yaxpac
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful week at the Luna Blue Hotel. We stayed in the Kitchenette suite, room # 5 and it was great. The room was bigger than I expected, with plenty of living space. We ended up spending most of our time on our little front porch/patio...a great place to enjoy a Cuban cigar and a beverage. The location is great, just far enough down 5th ave to be away from the loud partying yet close enough to everything as well. Mamita's beach was a nice beach to go to for the day. If you walk a little further north though, it is much less crowded and the water is perfectly clear. Decent snorkeling was possible from the shore...nothing spectacular, but worth the effort. What I liked about Luna Blue was the fact that it was immaculately clean. The entire staff was ultra-friendly and not the "holding the hand out" friendly you encounter at many places, if you know what I mean. Both Tony and Cheri offered us fantastic restaurant recommendations. They are wonderful hosts as many have mentioned. Tony suggested a local place away from the main tourist zone and he was on the money. I believe it was called "El Fogon". Tony told us to bring the card of the hotel. I was a little hesitant to flash the card but let me just say this...when we initially arrived the place was completely full (with all locals, no tourists). They originally told us they did not have any tables...which they didn't. Then I showed him the Luna Blue card and the waiter/host's eyes lit up and said, "Oh, Tony sent you? He is my friend." A table appeared out of nowhere and he took some unused seats from other tables. We sat down immediately. The meal was fantastic as Tony said it would be, but mostly I was just impressed at how well-received we were after mentioning Tony. Luna Blue is a great hotel and totally reasonable. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. I am looking forward to the completion of the bar and cenote. I think those additions will make it even more of a perfect little paradise. I highly recommend this hotel. Oh...and the AC unit is incredibly powerful...almost too cold, which is nice. Scott

Reviews.Title: “Great Owners but Rooms are Lacking...”
Reviews.Author: TipTucker
Reviews.Content: Okay first off, yes the owners (we only met one of them) were really nice and helpful. However, there are many other components to a great hotel, which Luna Blue lacks. I am just trying to offer HONEST criticism of the hotel so that visitors are not disappointed like we were. First, some of the standard rooms, including the one we stayed in, have obnoxious sliding patio doors for entrances, making it feel like you are sneaking into someone's back door to stay the night. Second, the room decor is non-existent, just bare walls. A simple painting or wall hanging would do wonders. My wife is a professional design consultant for bathrooms and kitchens and couldn't understand the unfinished nature of the bathroom area. Our friend staying in another room is in the construction business and was equally amazed at the same "design" in their bathroom, strange nook's that only serve to collect dust and wood boxes on the walls near the ceiling in the shower are just a couple of examples. What this hotel lacks above everything else is attention to the little things (this is design and aesthetic related not service related). For instance, the soap holder in the shower was on a slant (same for our friends' room) which obviously means that the soap falls off when wet. Also, the soap itself has a ZERO amount of lather-ability. And there was only one mirror in the whole hotel room, nice if you are by yourself, annoying if you are with someone else. All these things could just be written off as minor things noted by picky people but when you are on a vacation these are the things that add up to be uncomfortable nuisances and make a hotel superb versus sub-par. There was, however, always an adequate amount of hot water and the garden area was quite nice. My point is this: For the price, Luna Blue is a reasonable choice, but there are definitely other hotels in Playa that offer similar prices with better aesthetics and detail. Just search the list on TripAdvisor and compare, we've stayed at about a dozen hotels in Playa over the years and most of them are in the "under $100/night" range and all of them had nicer rooms. Do not be misled about what this hotel is, it is a budget hotel with merely average accomodations in a good location with really nice American owners that are hands on and can assist you in English (which most hotel employers can do anyway). Service/Owners: 9/10 Rooms: 4/10 I think potential customers should know what they are getting into and that they should know that the high TripAdvisor ranking reflects the owners and not the rooms. Hopefully this will help others make a more informed decision.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite sure what to think....”
Reviews.Author: travelerpowers
Reviews.Content: OK. I booked this hotel after reading the wonderful reviews here which may have set an unexpectedly high bar for this place. In sum, here are my 2 cents: PROS: Staff, location, cute and clean rooms and a great price. CONS: Creatures (ants all over and several small lizards running around on the ceiling in the room), the bed was like a rock and comparable to sleeping on the floor, the 2 pillows were terrible, the bathroom stunk like rotten eggs throughout my entire stay (even after cleaning and without any personal contributsions to the smell!), no TV or phone (only a big deal on rainy days), I was woken up several times at 4 in the morning by drunk neighbors hanging out in the common areas outside the rooms AND in the room next door. In all, I would not stay here again and was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but over priced for tree top room”
Reviews.Author: Chile_Travelers
Reviews.Content: I definitely agree with the other reviews that this is a very pleasant, nice hotel with a beautiful garden and good location. Also Cheri and Tony were very nice and we especially appreciated Cheri's tips for things to do and places to eat. Unfortunately, we do have one complaint which is the price of our room. We stayed in the "tree top terrace" room with a private terrace which was $80 per night. The room is very basic, clean with air conditioning but nothing else. Once we got there, it seemed like our room really wasn't any different than the other cheaper rooms and we wished we were only paying $55 rather than $80 as we didn't really see what we were getting for $25 more a night. As I said, overall it was a great experience but I recommend the "standard" room as you really would be getting a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue - Great Value in Playa! :-)”
Reviews.Author: JessicaInOhio
Reviews.Content: After reading fantastic reviews for Luna Blue on this site and a well-known Playa forum, we decided to book it for our August 10-15 visit to PdC. We are very happy that we made that decision! This was our 9th trip to Playa, and we were looking for a clean hotel that provided wireless internet access and friendly customer service. That is exactly what we received at Luna Blue! Tony, Cheri, and the rest of their staff go out of their way to make you feel at home. They are knowledgeable about Playa and Riviera Maya as a whole, and gave us some great recommendations on places that we hadn't yet visited in the area. Our room was always very clean. No problems with water pressure or temp. The bed was comfortable, which is not very common in Mexico. The kitchenette room that we stayed in worked out nicely for having breakfast in the room, and drinks / snacks for later in the day. The location was great - just a few minutes walk from the big beach clubs and nightlife, but still quiet enough to sleep when we wanted. Overall, we consider the hotel to be a great value. Will we return to Luna Blue? We don't usually return to hotels that we've vacationed at, but we definitely wouldn't rule it out for this one. Thanks for the great stay, Toni and Cheri!

Reviews.Title: “Treetop Terrace was great”
Reviews.Author: SagarMung
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the treetop terrace for two nights. The terrace comes with its own private covered patio with tables and chairs. The room is large with a double-sized bed. The air conditioning and ceiling fan are more than adequate to cool the space. There is also a small fridge and an (uncooled) purified water dispenser. The bathroom included a shower with modest water pressure, which was a trend in Mexico. There were plenty of outlets available. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. Most of the staff speaks mostly Spanish, but communication is possible if each know a little of the other's language. Beach towels are offered with a deposit of US$10. The lock and key for the safe was free with an US$80 deposit. Also free were vouchers for beach chairs and umbrellas courtesy of Mamita's Beach club, only a couple of blocks away. The beach was very close and not too crowded. The hotel is located on Calle 26 with no private parking, but spots were available on the street. Most of the time, we were able to park directly in front of the hotel. Security was very good, as police circled the area frequently. The hotel was locked after 10:30 p.m., but guests were given a key to a gate. There were numerous restaurants right next to the hotel. All of the establishments seemed to be directed toward tourists, but the food still tasted authentic. On the whole, the room was very comfortable and romantic. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to live the Luna Blue life again!”
Reviews.Author: PuffHair
Reviews.Content: Let me just say, as a picky Manhattanite, that, unless you plan on frolicking in your hotel room with fluffy towels, downing bottles of scotch from a mini-bar during your vacation, you owe it to yourself to stay at the adorable Luna Blue Hotel & Garden in Playa del Carmen! The owners, Tony & Cheri Head, and their awesome staff (Hi Carlos & Gennaro!), could not have been more warm and welcoming, and were always on the mark when it came to their recommendations on everything! Go to La Quinta Pasion for a quick (or not so quick) lunch or dinner - Babe's Noodle Bar is fantastic for dinner and for blueberry margaritas, and Cafe Corazon for breakfast (and they even have iced coffee, which is rare there) - And, on the suggestion of and assistance from the Luna Blue Crew, my friend and I rented a car and took a day trip to Tulum, which had a spectacular beach (more secluded than Mamitas, which can be a scene) and was just sooooooo relaxing! Playa is so cute, with everything in walking distance (like a mini-mexican-manhattan) - Luna provides free beach towels and passes to Mamitas Beach, which is a short walk from the hotel - After a sweaty day at the beach (I know, it's August, what do I expect!), the cranking air-conditioning in the room was exactly what I needed!
