Plus, I got about 9-10 hours of sleep per night, because the room was like a cool cocoon! I loved Luna so much, I think I'll be bringing a pack of my friends back there for my 29th, er 40th b-day extravaganza in December! Thanks again Luna Blue for a truly wonderful stay! Gillian & Lori

Reviews.Title: “All the good reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: garrettww
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and were pleased in every way by Luna Blue. The owners answered every question we had about where to eat, what to do, and what not to do. They helped set up excursions and auto rentals for us and were always available. The rooms were updated, clean, and relaxing. A/C was super cold - a necessity in Playa in July. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay in Playa near 5th Ave. HOWEVER - we really did not enjoy Playa all that much as a city. If we could do it again we would probably stay somewhere outside of the city on a much quieter beach, but that is just our personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic,Romantic, Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: jodiSuarez
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue was amazing! It was quiet,clean, and beautiful. Cherrie and Tony were awesome like everyone said in all the reviews. I couldn't even wait to chat with Cherrie and feel like i made a friend. We really did feel like we were just staying in their home! It is important to stay somewhere that has english speaking owners and staff! They had so many great suggestions on where to go to eat and even a a secluded amazing beach in tulum called playa paraiso. OMG it was the best beach I have ever been to! The sand was like powdered sugar. The restaraunt next door, La quinta passion, was amazing. We ate breaksfast there every morning. It was a small but fresh buffett,, which includes eggs anyway you want them and juice and coffee for 6 dollars! There shrimp cocktail was really yummy too! Cherrie and Tony are really good people, and you know they really love what there doing. They spent time talking with every guest and would have done anything we wanted. They treat there staff great and it shows! The small staff was honest and friendly. We left things out cameras, i pod, and never any doubt that it would be unsafe. The lavanderia across the street was cheap and your close are done in about 2 hours. For a tip they even bring it to the hotel and lunas staff put it in your room. I recommend having them wash your clothes before you go home. There folded and sealed in a plastic bag making it easy to pack and no work when u get home. Plus the clothes smell amazing! I can not wait to go back to Luna and even though they are open to children , I loved the lack of children there at the time we were there! Our last night there a family arrived and it changes the atmosphere. This is an amazing,romantic and quiet ,almost bed a breakfast type hotel! I don't think I would bring my kids there, not because they wouldn't love it, but I wouldn't want the noise of kids crying and screaming in this lovely garden hotel. I almost wish they would make it adults only! I think the lack of a pool, would be a bad choice anyhow at least for my kids , they would be bored out of their minds. I would be more than happy to talk to anyone who had questions about Luna Blue! Thanks Everyone at Luna Blue! Jodi And PACO pacopacool@yahoo.com P.S. For a great shop And really good deals go to Curiosidades Maya It is on 6 nte, between 5th and 10th avenue. Willing to bargain and really sweet owner. Margarita was her name!

Reviews.Title: “Too Good and True”
Reviews.Author: lindsaylenn
Reviews.Content: When reviewing the comments of past visitors who stayed at the Luna Blue, this hotel sounded too good to be true at the price charged; it just didn't make sense that this small hotel could be amongst the rest of the high-end hotels in PDC. I had to do some serious convincing to my best friend to come here as she has had positive experiences at all-inclusives at other vacation spots, so staying at a different type of hotel was a bit of a risk. After staying at the LB, I could never desire to eat at the same place in Playa (an all inclusive) when there are a million excellent choices of cuisine in PDC, restaurants that were recommended and others stumbled upon. Ok, so it must be too good to be true if most people don't have one complaint. Really the only subltely we had is that for two chicas in their early 20's, having a full length mirror is definitely nice to have, and we didn't have one in the 2nd room in which we stayed. However, we verbalized that comment at the end of our stay; the owners willingly reminded themselves of something they had on their to-do list. With as hard-working and responsive as the owners are, I don't know that this issue will exist anymore. This was the only minor setback we had, and QUITE MINOR it was. Despite any skepticism we may have had before booking our reservations, the Luna Blue still exceeded our expectations. While in Playa, we actually visited some other hotels to see how they stacked up to Luna, but did not get the same positive vibe from them. For Luna, the key here is QUALITY, SAFETY, TRUST, CLEANLINESS, BEAUTY, & FRIENDLINESS. The rest of the reviews illustrate why these descriptors are true. Muchisimas gracias Tony, Cheri, Jenaro, and the rest!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything”
Reviews.Author: nnkd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Luna Blue from July 16-26 in the treetop terrace room 36 and we absolutely loved everything about this place. Tony & Cheri and all of the staff at the Luna Blue are awesome. The pictures on the internet do not do the hotel any justice the garden area is so beautiful and full of small lizards and we even had a large iguana sitting outside our door one morning when we left our room! Our deck area was wonderful. Our beds were great. The showers perfect. Our air conditioning was fabulous. And most of all the staff is friendly (I know everyone says that but it is the truth) The people make this place so nice. Thank you Toni and Cheri and everyone at the Luna Blue for being a huge part of making our trip so wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Ballston
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we wanted: a small place, with two rooms (one for parents, one for kids), clean, not an all-inclusive, near the beach and Quinta. The hosts and hotel desk staff were very helpful and pleasant to deal with. They say they are going to add a small jacuzzi, and a bar. Offering a small continental breakfast would be a nice touch! Great pasta: Pasta Luego (and I mean great, handmade and outstanding quality) We ate at La Quinta Pasion several times: right next door, great food and margaritas, nice people. Avoid: Zasil photomart (I think that's the name, but if you spend time on the beach, you'll find out). The owner sends out young photographers to snap folks on the beach, and you get a card to go to the shop and see the results. The prices for prints are high ($50 a piece for the large size!), but the worst part is that the owner, after agreeing to a price with us for a CD of several photos, reneged on the deal the next day and tried to charge us considerably more. When I confronted him, he admitted he had agreed to the lower price, but had later changed his mind, and said "if you don't like the new price, you are free to leave." I've never dealt with a ruder nor more dishonest merchant in all my travels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Luna Blue!”
Reviews.Author: LoveUnlimited
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Luna Blue from July 17 to 24. We had a wonderful time. The hotel is quaint and quiet. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Tony and Cheri were very friendly and accomodating. Also, the hotel was very clean, which is really important to me. Everything was spotless. It was a very comfortable and relaxing stay. We wished we had booked a longer stay. We hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great hosts”
Reviews.Author: Ibbo
Reviews.Content: This place was great for us. Tony greeted us warmly when we arrived and made us feel genuinely welcome from the word go. You could never get this at a larger resort. The location is great and allows you to stroll into the heart of town to get the lively nightlife, then retire to the peace and quiet of the hotel when you have had enough for the night. The Marmitas beach club vouchers are a REAL BONUS not only cos these are FREE but also because this is the best end of the beach. We left with a real warm feeling about this place - both Tony and Cheri are charming and that extends to the rest of the staff who were helpful and friendly. Basically - great value, genuine hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: LoniG
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Playa del Carmen. I chose to stay at Luna Blue because of their excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. I'm happy to say that I was not disappointed. I stayed at the Luna Blue for 7 nights (July 11-18) and enjoyed every one of them! My friend and I stayed in the room with a kitchen, #8. we enjoyed being able to make food in our room and not have to eat out for every meal, which can get expensive. I would recommend it, especially if you are there with a family. Being that we are two girls in our twenties, safety was a concern for me. Luna Blue is very safe! They have locked gates at night, and someone is always there. Also, they have safes in the room for your belongings. Tony and Cheri are the best hotel owners I have ever met. They consistenly were happy and helpful, and would do anything to make their guests stay a pleasant one. They are familiar with the area and can tell you lots of great advice, just ask! On several occasions we saw Tony and Cheri out around town and they always stopped to ask how our day was going, and hear about what we did that day. I was sad to see a customer write a bad review of them. [-------------------] They truly care about their customers! It was hard to say goodbye, I felt like I was leaving a friends house! I did not want a big all inclusive type of place...so Luna Blue had everything I was looking for...safety, charm, cleanliness, friendly staff, beach access, and lots of peace and quiet! I miss it already, but I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & Exciting all at the same time!”
Reviews.Author: garridos
Reviews.Content: Hi everybody: My husband, 2 sons 13 & 19 and I just got back from Playa del Carmen and the Luna Blue Hotel. It was the perfect combination of peace & tranquility and the hustle bustle of an up & coming resort city. By this I mean, the hotel is just 2 short blocks to the beautiful Caribbean Sea (beach club membership is included with hotel!!), a 1/2 a block to 5th Ave which is packed with restaurants & artsy boutiques (not just the same touristy stores you see everywhere) and when you return to the Luna Blue, the gardens envelope you in a sense of peace & beauty! We loved it! Also, and importantly because we took our children with us, 5th Ave is a safe place for the kids to walk around at night. There are police on the streets and all the owners seem to keep an eye out for any problems. The hotel & it's gardens are locked up after 10:00pm so when the kids return, they simply unlock the gate & can hang around in the beautiful gardens or their private veranda. Lastly, but most importantly, the hotel is very charming, the rooms are clean, air conditioned & decorated with a sense of the country we were visiting. The owners, Cheri & Tony were there all the time to help with reservations and suggestions for places to visit that aren't just the same place everyone goes to! We loved the ruins that are still in the jungle & you need a guide to get to them, the lagoon for snorkeling that is a national park, & the ATVing in the jungle that was so much fun, etc. etc. So, the combination of where the Luna Blue Hotel is situated, the beauty & peacefulness of it's gardens & rooms along with the Best Owners a boutique hotel can have, will have us returning very very soon. Make your reservations at the Luna Blue & have a Great Vacation! Kay & Leo Garrido and Leo jr. & Albert, too

Reviews.Title: “Nice time”
Reviews.Author: Tripzilla
Reviews.Content: Good convenient location. Good value. Roomy kitchenette. No unresolved issues (no issues at all really). COLD A/C. !!! Needs? a dresser, or someplace to put clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Like being home in paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had met the owner's on a previous stay in PDC. I took a tour of the hotel and decided it was definitely the place I would stay when I returned. This was a rather unusual trip for my son's graduation present. It was myself, my son and my ex-wife. The Luna Blue has a set of rooms that connect by an interior staircase (rooms 8 and 9), one has a kitchenette. While I was a little wary of traveling with a 15 year old to a hotel that has no TV, my son never missed it. The rooms were clean, quiet and very comfortable. The area that the hotel is in is known as Little Italy. We were there on the day that Italy won the World Cup and if you went in the room, you could hardly hear any noise from the celebrations (and they were celebrating!). There was a hammock on the patio along with a table and chairs. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The passes for the beach club are a nice touch. We spent a whole day at the club and enjoyed it very much. As for bugs, yes there are mosquitoes and biting flies but it is the tropics and the start of the rainy season. Every time I have gone to PDC, I have been bitten (if I don't protect myself) and seen a bug or two in my room. When I mentioned that I had a couple of bugs, they re-sprayed the room right away. Tony and Cheri made me and my family feel very welcome in their "home" and took care of any issues that came up quickly and courteously. I will definitely stay at this hotel again! The hotel constantly improves and I can't wait until next time! I have stayed at other comparably priced hotels in the area and the Luna Blue wins hands down in all categories.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewl of Playa Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Toni and Cheri and the Staff are the bomb..We love them and the hotel...the location and the vibe...I have stayed there more than once and have sent friends there and we have all had a great stay...I love room # 9 !!! Love nest...great for couples...I hate that some people are so up tight and dont understand the pace and way of Playa...This is a small Place...That has been rescued from what it used to be...It has been saved and is one of the many Jewls of Playa...I have stayed At Don Emiliones, Posada Mariposa, Maya Bric, Panchos, Posad Freud, La Rana, and A few Condos this is by far on the top of the list....Great Place, Great Staff, Great owners...Thanks for the great memories....tommy

Reviews.Title: “Great for Getting Away from it all!”
Reviews.Author: treyleah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Luna Blue during the first week of July 2006. Here's the bottom line: it was great for us, but not for everyone. What makes it great? Location, the american owners, and the value. The location was GREAT. It is located a half block from 5th Avenidas, which is THE main tourist, pedestian area. It is also just north of the more developed and more tourist stores and shops. In this area of Playa, many new and arguably better restaurants and condos are locating here. Overall, it was very quiet, despite sounds from nearby construction. Across the street is a mexican laundry and a small store. This store turned out to be very handy, and has a great mexican beer selection. The hotel is also conveniently located to Mamita's Beach Club, which is the best non-resort beach area in the entire PDC area. Lot's of beautiful young people (many from europe) hit the beach at Mamitas. Daily access to Mamita's is provided free by the hotel, using coupons for umbrella and beach chairs. For a small deposit, the hotel will provide daily beach towels, too. This is a european-style hotel, so it is not your typical american hotel or resort. The bed is very firm, but we didn't have any problem sleeping. Other than bedside tables and lamps, there was no other furniture. We stayed in room 36, which had an outdoor patio and chairs. Our room also had a refrigerator and water cooler, with water bottle (this is particulalry nice, since you need to avoid ingesting tap water). The bathroom is small and functional. It has very simple furnishings (e.g., the toilet paper roll was a piece of bamboo on string). The shower works at one fine, medium strengh, medium temp stream, but it does work. No bathtub. Our toilet sometimes required holding the handle to ensure that it worked, though a minor inconvenience. Be warned though...if you want a nice bathroom with privacy, this ain't it. The bathroom "door" was a partial door that was open 15 inches or so at bottom and again at top. While one could not see into the bathroom, you could HEAR what was going on in the bathroom. Thank God no one got traveler's diarrea on this journey with that door! We were looking to escape and re-connect as a couple for a few days, so the lack of phone and TV helped in that regard. However, our pre-teen children would NOT have survived, easily. I'd go for a bigger resort if we went with smaller children. High school or college-age children will do fine here. Presently, there is no pool or other amenities at the hotel. However, the owners are building a 10-person hot tub on the ground level, as well as a bar. The owners are from San Francisco, and were very welcoming and helpful. This was our first time to Playa, so we welcomed their learned advice on several occassions. They really made our trip better and cheaper. Considering the hefty price for the all-inclusives, Luna Blue is a good value, particularly when you include the free beach rentals. We'll probably stay there on our next journey to PDC. If you stay at Luna Blue, I highly recommend a restaurant located on the same street (26 Calle), just before 5th Avenida: La Quinta Pasion. (It's about 40 feet from Luna Blue.) This is a quaint street patio restaurant that is run by a recently arrived family from Mexico City. They are very nice, speak decent english, and serve excellent mexican food and cocktails. Best part: it is inexpensive, even for PDC. This was the only place we ate twice during our stay. It is THAT good, and I particularly recommend the tacos de pescado (fish tacos, though the shrimp are also very good). Being from San Antonio, we eat mexican food four times a week, but this is exceptional food. In the afternoons, Quinta Pasion often has drink specials on margaritas and beers that are also hard to beat. They also serve breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at three different hotels, and Luna Blue isn't "all that"...”
Reviews.Author: wlittleman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Playa Del Carmen for the second time in 2 years. We love this beach community. Prior to staying at Luna Blue, we stayed at one of the Tucan Group Hotels, and found it pretty good for $55/night (low season). A couple days later, we decided to stay a bit north of the Ave. 5 strip, and get away from the hustle and bustle of cheesy souvenir shops and aggressive restaurant hosts. We found Luna Blue at the northern end of the strip. We got one of their standard rooms for $50/night, and it was a slightly nicer than the other hotel. It only lacked cable TV (we weren’t concerned about that since we didn’t have any children with us). We booked the room for two days starting on the morning of June 29th, and by the end of the day, we decided that we wanted to stay in the area two additional days. I promptly notified the staff that we would like to extend our stay to include July 1 and 2 as well. They told me I could pay the next morning if I wanted to. So the next morning, I paid for the additional nights. We enjoy the day, went to bed, and on the morning of July 1st, there’s a note requesting my attention at the front desk. Apparently, the owners, Tony and Cheri have set a “high season” date starting on July 1, and that they undercharged us for the room that we had already paid for. They requested that we pay the difference if we intend to stay over the weekend. Well, I just didn’t feel that it was right to change the rate on us during a 4 night stay. In fact, I found it petty, so we decided to look elsewhere, and ended up finding another wonderful hotel just around the corner. It was called Fiesta Banana (yeah, I know...dumb name). The room was smaller than Luna Blue’s but there was better lighting and a large shared patio for socializing. In addition, our room included a private balcony and continental breakfast for $50/night. 90% of hotels in the area during the month of June and July have vacancies, so I don’t see why July 1st would be considered “high season” for Luna Blue. I’ve never stayed at a hotel that raised their rates in the middle of my stay. Luna Blue’s policies posed unacceptable inconvenience to us, and we will not stay there again. It’s not a bad hotel, but it's not awesome either (there was a cockroach in our room (#4)! Other reviewers seem to rave about this hotel, but I find their reviews suspiciously similar?!?!? We stayed at two other hotels and they were equally decent. I just found their policies to be more appropriate for large hoteliers than a mom-n-pop operation. We wished that we left Luna Blue with more fond memories. Unfortunately, that wasn’t the case.

Reviews.Title: “There's A Reason They Rank So High!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaAdGuy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an eight-day, seven-night stay at by far the BEST hotel we have stayed at in Mexico. We have travelled to several areas in the Yucatan Peninsula (Isla Mujeres, Majahual, Tulum, Cancun) and found Luna Blue to be both an incredible oasis and an excellent value! As mentioned, what makes this hotel so wonderful are owners, Tony and Cheri. Within minutes you feel like you've known these two great people your entire life and are drawn in by their great stories, helpful tips, and caring nature. They (and their staff) are truly interested in making sure you have everything you need to make your time at their hotel special. We reserved a Superior Bedroom during low season ($55/night). The room was on the third floor (with a balcony) and had a Queen bed, AC and fan, small fridge, 5 liter water cooler, and in-room safe. Free passes to Mamitas Beach Club and fresh towels were provided any time we wanted. By booking through a popular Playa message board website, we also received a PDC card which provided substantial discounts to several area bars, restaurants, shops, and sporting activities. The gardens are peaceful and beautiful. We did notice some bugs while we spent time on our relaxing terrace. As we realize from living in Florida, the bugs you CAN see are just part of the problem (they don't call 'em "no-see-ums" for nothing), so definitely bring bug spray. This is also true if you venture to the ruins, the cenotes, or even out for the evening in town. Stepping outside the gates, you'll find several great restaurants, shops, and conveniences (laundry, food stores, etc.). The area is VERY safe and the hotel is locked up tight each night to provide guests with an additional feeling of security. Don't worry if you're staying out late...you'll receive a key for all-hour access! On-street parking can usually be found within a few yards of the entrance and cabs can be hailed around the corner (though walking down 5th Avenue and the local neighborhoods is a wonderful experience). We HIGHLY recommend Luna Blue to anyone who's considering staying at a boutique hotel and is looking for safe, friendly, clean accomodations (and at a GREAT value). Plans are in place for a small bar and the jacuzzi should be ready in the next couple of months. Though hard to believe, enhancements continue to make the place better and better. Thanks Tony and Cheri (plus staff) for such a wonderful time! Lee (AdGuy) & Jennifer Jacksonville, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Playa del Carmen First Timers”
Reviews.Author: jercha
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue is perfect for first timers in Playa del Carmen. The heart and soul of this hotel is truly Toni and Cheri. They have wonderful advice for first timers. The others at the frontdesk were also helpful but Toni and Cheri know Americans best. From affordable gourmet, tasty drinks, cheapo transpo, lagoons, ruins, etc etc We had to take a later flight and frontdesk Genaro promptly got us shuttle service to Luna Blue. Avoid the airport booths (timeshare sales). We stayed in a standard room. The paint was fresh. Tiles look recently remodeled. Bed was firm. Great value. Not having a TV was a plus. Water pressure acceptable. Clean. Our door was a sliding door. It was strange having to use keys on both sides of the lock. I would prefer to use keys on the outside and a lever on the inside. Luna is located midblock so sound is filtered by other buildings.The standard had a door connecting to another standard room that needs more sound insulation unless you are with the people next door. We thought about moving up to get a better view but the hotel was full at the time. The rooftop terrace had nice views of the town and an awesome hammock for napping. Landscaping was jungle style. Lots of trees and birds singing. Full Service Laundry across from Luna cost about $4 for a load perfectly folded and bagged. Convenience store was also across from Luna.. Overall, great value. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue Wins, Hands Down.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day stay at Luna Blue, and we had a really great vacation. This hotel has so many things going for it. It is at the quieter end of the Quinta Avenida strip, which we appreciated every time we ambled closer to the action towards town. Too many people, too noisy, a completely different feel to the shops and restaurants. At the northern end, the shops, restaurants, the merchants, the locals, are all so much more relaxed. We enjoyed being so close to dining and shopping. The hotel is 1/2 a block from Quinta Avenida. We had a room with a kitchenette, which worked our nicely. Our two teenagers, my wife and I all had comfortable beds, too (One queen, one single, one roll-out trundle bed). The room was impeccably clean, with fine tile floors. A spacious fridge, well stocked kitchen, and small stove was all we needed. The bathroom was comfortable, clean, and had a spacious etagere for storage. We enjoyed our own personal patio, and only saw 2 mosquitos in all the time we were there. The staff was very responsive, very helpful, and honestly, they are all high-quality people. The owners were everything we were led to believe, having read these reviews before we booked. Tony and Cheri were like our personal tour guides, as well as friends. We eliminated lots of trial and error with the renting of a car, with restaurant choices, with choices for recreation. Our gracious hosts helped us every step of the way. We don't really care for the All-Inclusives, as our experience has been that the food is usually mediocre at best, and choosing restaurants to try helps us feel more acclimated and adventurous. With Mamita's Beach so close, we feel we had the very best of everything. We will definitely return to Playa and to the Luna Blue

Reviews.Title: “What A Find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tony and Sherri and the LB Hotel Team rock! Our stay at the Luna Blue was wonderful. Close to Mamitas Beach Club and all key attractions, yet, off the main drag so that you can get a good night's rest. The rooms were very comfortable, safe and clean. Toni and Sherri made us feel at home from the moment we arrived. The property is very quaint and has a very nice feel to it. I will be back as soon as I have the opprotunity. I have traveled extensively over the last 30 years and can say that this hidden find is so worth it's value. - Mark

Reviews.Title: “Luna Blue is A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Luna Blue is a lush little oasis of a hotel in the heart of beautiful Playa Del Carmen. Tony and Cheri are wonderful people who welcome you like old friends. Their staff is attentive and kind. My fiancé, my friend, and myself were given excellent advice upon arrival for places to eat and have fun. Luna Blue, although not right on the beach, has an affiliation with a beach resort down the block, which makes it easy to get a good lounge on the beach. That is just one example of a great host. They really want you to enjoy their town as they do. I stayed in one of the smaller rooms, which was simple yet cozy. The hotel is quiet and clean and so close to the fun of Playa del Carmen you'll be amazed how peaceful it is. I would love to try the Tree Top rooms because I hear they're great. Next time I'm there I will reserve Luna Blue in advance. It's worth it. Thanks again Tony & Cheri for a wonderful time. -Chris P

Reviews.Title: “Beats all the big resorts, hands down!!!”
Reviews.Author: lulu17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week in Playa Del Carmen and the Luna Blue. I have stayed in the biggy all inclusive resorts before and this is the first time I stayed in a hotel. Let's just say I will never do the resort thing again. The Luna Blue has wonderful rooms overlooking a beautiful garden. Tony and Cheri (the owners) are awesome. They actually made the hotel feel like a home away from home. They had wonderful suggestions ranging from where to eat to things to do that most tourists wouldnt even know about. The Luna Blue is clean, beautiful, close to one of the nicest beaches in the area and you get all the excitement of 5th ave. without being on top of it. I would highly recommend this to anyone and everyone. We are already planning are next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Great Location + Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Playa del Carmen for the first time a couple weeks ago and stayed at the Luna Blue Hotel. Not only is this hotel very quaint and charming, but the friendly (and helpful) owners Tony and Cheri are icing on the cake. They made our trip so warm and memorable. Luna Blue is just a couple blocks from the beach and walking distance to all the action. It's a perfect location -- situated in a more quiet area which made for good sleep and relaxation after a fun night of dinner and dancing (just blocks away). It's a GREAT deal and I highly recommend it! I plan on going back to Playa in a couple months and will most certainly return to this little gem of a hotel! Thanks Tony & Cheri!

Reviews.Title: “More thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: blossom
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of excellent reviews here already about the Luna Blue, and just wanted to add my thanks to Toni and Cheri for being wonderful hosts. I stayed here with 3 of my buddies the last week of May 2006, and we had a good time. We stayed in a kitchen suite, which was roomy and clean. The free passes to Mamitas beach were a great bonus. The hotel is nice and clean, the owners are super great; the location is good. You just can't beat this hotel if you're on a budget and don't want to stay in a big impersonal all-inclusive hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Jeffski
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week's stay at the Luna Blue, and want to add our comments to the accolades for this truly "magical and intimate" hotel. From the moment your feet step onto their property, the staff of this charming place goes out of its way to make your stay with them a memorable one. It was our first stay in Mexico, too, and even though we're relatively seasoned travelers, receiving a warm welcome and a friendly smile goes a long way to relieve the stress of arriving in an unfamiliar place. Tony's gardens are full of tropical beauties that we only see in hothouses where we come from, and we began each morning and unwound every night sitting out on our little terrace enjoying the scenery. All of the staff was extremely helpful, from planning our day trips to just finding a great dinner spot. Do take their recommendations; they know what they are talking about! Tony steered us to his favorite snorkeling spot (a protected lagoon in Akumel, and the bay just south of there where my husband got to see a big reef shark up close), and they both gave well-deserved praise for some great restaurants. Check out their listings on the forum, you won't be disappointed. Having knowledgeable hosts that treat you like family is practically unheard of; Tony and Cheri and their staff are the main reason people will return to Luna Blue as many times as they can. Add to this the immaculate rooms with fresh linens replaced daily, purified drinking water, a frig and a safe for your valuables, and you've got home away from home. We LOVED the location, a block off the best people watching street in town filled with every type of restaurant and shop you can imagine. You can't go wrong in checking out this little gem of a hotel. Tony and Cheri, you've justly earned the praise of all your guests! If you'd like any more tips, feel free to email us, we'd love to share our experience in Playa.

HotelInfo.Name: Luna Blue Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 26 Norte, between 5th & 10th Ave, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
